Reviews.Title: “Wow, Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: ricshi
Reviews.Content: This place was GREAT!!! I was a bit reluctant, since it sounded a bit dated and small but I trusted trip advisor. Wow this place was great!!! Tripadvisor was right again!!!! Along with the partial oceanfront room that I had right ON THE BEACH, the pool was HUMONGOUS and great for kids!!! I was soooo surprised. It has an indoor pool enclosed in glass with vaulted ceilings with a view of the beach. The game room for kids was also on the same floor. The kids could play games and win tickets and then cash them for prizes. You could step out of the pool and right on to the beach. The rooms were extremely spacious with a separate "living room" The place was clean and most importantly very kid friendly. We really enjoyed our time there and would be back in a heartbeat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Personel were very nice”
Reviews.Author: AnnSnyder02501
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay.We had an oceanfront room. The service was great from registration to departure.All staff were very friendly. Rooms were clean.Two outside hot tubs that had an age limit on it which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda rude, Not to clean”
Reviews.Author: Danny W
Reviews.Content: When we got there, the parking area is kinda cramped and a lil bit dangerous if you have a big vehicle. The bell hops were nice and helped out alot. When we got to the room it looked nice, but then we found dirty dishes in the dishwasher and the internet wifi was terrible. When i went to tell the front desk girl she wa pretty rude. they have a lil convience store but of course it was expensive. They were pretty bad at giving directions. The first day full day we were there My son hit his head on the coffee table and needed medical help. I wouldnt use the urgent care places on coastal highway, go the extra 5-10 miles and go to atlantic regional in berlin, MD, They were super fast and took his insurance. Some of the games in the arcade were broke, the change machines had no change and neither did the store. Check out was fairly easy, the bill was under the door. One night we came back and there was no parking and they did give us free valet. I dont think i would stay there again, But i would let other people make there own opinions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean,clean clean!”
Reviews.Author: roxanne c
Reviews.Content: We had planned on staying in Rehobeth at the Henolopen. When we arrived the room wasn't clean. We than called Princess Royal and went there to stay. This wasn't our first time staying here so we knew what to expect. Nothing is worse than feeling like you have bugs crawling on you for your vacation. So much for trying something new! Princess has friendly staff, cleaning crew is awesome, not bugs here! Totally going back.....I'll drive to different beaches!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne S
Reviews.Content: We booked the Princess Royale through a third-party booking site on fairly short notice and we chose this hotel based on it's ranking on Trip Advisor. After booking it, I went on to read some rather unfavorable reviews, so I was a little skeptical. Let me just say this hotel was a great find! The rooms were immaculate, the bedding was extremely comfortable and the amenites were very nice. As for comments that the hotel is "outdated", I find that absurd. Not having giant flat-screen TVs in every room does not make a hotel outdated. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating. There was a minor problem with the shower head and it was fixed immediately. The outside grounds, restaurant and bar were fantastic and the views were beautiful. With the palm trees swaying and the sound of the ocean I felt like I was in the Caribbean! The only constructive thing I might offer is to add some nicer outdoor furniture to the balconies. Other than that, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Princess Royale and plan to return this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: cocolove78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. I was a little skeptical about this place as the photos on the website looked dated. The hotel needs a little updating. But, it is very clean. The staff is very friendly. Our room overlooked the atrium and we were concerned that it would get too loud at night. But, everything in the atrium shuts down at 10pm, leaving it pretty quiet. This hotel is right on the beach, which we enjoyed. And, it has a large pool and three hot tubs, which we also enjoyed. It's a good location and very close to two restaurants which we love.We are planning our next trip to OC and are going to stay at Princess Royale again!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Days”
Reviews.Author: G D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Tues-Thurs., 2 nights beginning the day after Labor Day. We had never stayed here although we have been to OC many times. We loved our stay here.It is the best hotel we have stayed in, in OC. The price was more than reasonable. There was a convenient parking garage or street parking. We did not eat at the restaurant or use any of the hotels facilities other than the pool and the convenience store. The pool was great. My only unlike at the pool was having to go in and out at 1 gate, because they wanted to be sure you did not leave with pool towels, which were free, but had to be signed in and out. The room was very spacious with a small kitchen, full sized fridge and 2 queen beds, air conditioning worked well. There was a separate living room w/tv and a flat screen in the bedroom. Internet was slow and I had to keep logging into different wifi depending on where I was in the room. Loved that the room had a balcony and we could see the ocean thru the large glass wall. A path thru the dune leads to the beach, not too far to walk at all. Overall it was a very good hotel with friendly staff, and we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: Struther W
Reviews.Content: we recently stay at the princess royale for a getaway weekend. The reason we stayed here is because it was the only hotel that we could find in the area with an in-suite jacuzzi and a balcony facing ocean side. We booked our room about three weeks prior though what we thought was the hotel (turning out to be a sort of expedia company) with the promise that our room would inquire all of or wanted specifications- mind you it was off season. when we check in, we give our reference code and just touch base on what our room includes. It turned out that we did not have a jacuzzi, we did not get a discounted rate, no free breakfast, not even and ocean front. The woman behind the counter even went on by saying 'you're lucky you get a king size bed'. so at $250 a night, all we get is a view of an inclosed pool and a king size bed? you would be better off staying at a hole in the wall motel, their staff would at least treat you with some respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great, Clean and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: douger67
Reviews.Content: This is our second labor day weekend staying at this property. The setup of the hotel is a little odd-a maze of rooms and exits. But quite frankly-parking is good and the rooms are nice. We stayed in the OF Cabana Suites-walk out the sliding door right to the beach. Nice clean off areas for the sand filled chairs and umbrellas. Pool is nice-very clean. Nothing really bad to say-great people great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort even in the off season”
Reviews.Author: Clo4yanks
Reviews.Content: I've never said here during the prime season, but have stayed here in January 2012. Excellent resort, the beds are wonderful to sleep on. Very spacious rooms with a kitchen and living room too. Friendly staff and the rooms were cleaned daily as were the linens changed.

Reviews.Title: “Funfilled Holiday Weekend @ Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: Angel B
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel to stay on any occassion. Friendly staff and most of all cater to your needs. The view was beautiful and enjoyed the pool view balcony that overlooked the pool and atrium. Really enjoyed that our room was cleaned daily and linens changed as well. The rooms were very spacious and nice size kitchen for the whole family. Remarkable hotel included an all you can eat buffet restaurant, gift shops, room service,excercise room and more for guests. Overall, great hotel to visit for your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: Nancy R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, staff is very friendly and offers a variety of activities for the whole family. It has fantastically comfortable beds, nice kitchenette, clear TV reception and cable channels, very little noise, great view of the Ocean. I would recommend this hotel to enjoy a wonderful stay at Ocean City. Buffet was good, music directly outside was fantasitc as well as the bars and outside eating area. As a non-smoker, it was a joy not to run into smokers anywhere in the hotel or have to put up with the smell of smoke. I think this is a big plus. But if you do smoke, it can be done right outside the hotel. Staff was very friendly, we had one small problem with the bathroom door but it was immediately fixed. GREAT PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Kteltraveler
Reviews.Content: Like many hotels on the beach, it was outdated but the rooms were very clean with super-comfotable beds, a kitchenette, and we had a beautiful view. The parking lot was a hassle and we did not care for the indoor pool. BUT...the customer service was 4-star and made all the difference in our visit. Loved walking right out to the beach, having lunch under swaying palm trees, and going to sleep to the sound of the ocean. My husband had a conference in Ocean City and I tagged along. We had a wonderful time & will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the most luxurious Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: CostasDaGreek
Reviews.Content: While my friends and I tend to alternate between the Carousel Resort and this Hotel, I cannot go without stating how wonderful the Princess Royale truly is. Check in is great, the rooms are wonderful, especially with the Oceanfront rooms, but Atrium rooms are worth it as well. The Hotel is awkwardly laid out, and the very first time we were in the Hotel years ago, we actually got lost because only some elevators take you to the higher floors. Elevators are somewhat outdated, but that is the least of anyones problems. The Princess has the feeling that your on a cruise ship when your walking around in the hallways, and the Indoor Oceanfront Pool is spectacular. My friends and I enjoyed the Hot tubes, which are inside and outside, but they offer limited space, and most of the time they are full so you usually end up waiting. The PoolBar is nice as well. For the price it is definitely worth it, and it is a family friendly resort which nicely avoids the large crowds that bustle around the Boardwalk. Overall we will return here for years to come, and might have to plan a Birthday party weekend say for my friends and I in November!

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Resort Rocks”
Reviews.Author: travelerHV
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-night stay at Princess Royale Resort. The resort is a beach front property with an indoor pool. The resort is located not too far from the boardwalk, but far enough to be in a quiet family oriented area. This was our first time at OC, MD and this resort. The whole familty absolutely loved both and are looking forward to come back next season, or perhaps for a short getaway before it gets cold. The staff was VERY friendly and accomodating throughout the property. At the first sign of difficulty with the luggage I immediately got help from the bell staff without even asking. Upon the checkout, I called front desk for help from bell staff. The guy was at our door within a few minutes ready with a cart. He loaded everything onto the cart and helped with loading everything back into the car. The room was big enough to accomodate 2 adults and 3 children. An added amenity was a kitchen (plates, silverware, dishwasher, microwave and fridge included) separating a living room from bedroom. We brought some food - so it was nice to snack inside and not waste time during the day on eating out. There are plenty of restaurants around (walking and driving distance) The beds are VERY comfortable; the suite was clean throughout with daily service. We used a restuarant for breakfast. Menu selection not the greatest, but more than enough to recharge for the day (delicious). There is a bar on the outside patio and inside the pool area. To conclude - great place at a great location / destination with friendly / inviting staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh, that smell, can’t you smell that smell?”
Reviews.Author: ReviewableName
Reviews.Content: It’s not easy to give a hotel only one star. It’s actually quite difficult. It’s not enough to be paying a fee for the in-room safe and have it break. Twice. It’s not enough to have to waste beach time waiting for the repairs. Twice. It’s not enough to have the room key stop working mid-vacation and have to get it reprogrammed while your family waits in the hallway wet from the pool. It’s not enough to be searching around the hotel for the Thursday “Family Night” buffet because none of the staff knows where it is, including the woman behind the sign advertising it at the front desk. It’s not enough to have the elevator fell a couple of inches to the first floor causing you to jam your knee and back. It’s not enough to find the hotel store doesn’t stock Tylenol afterwards. It’s not enough that that elevator is subsequently out of service well into the next morning delaying everybody’s check out. It’s not enough that the bell desk forgets to come up and help you with your bags, compelling you to make three trips down yourself. It’s not even enough to have the maid service neglect to clean your room midweek and have to negotiate with them a time that is convenient for them to do the job afterwards. No, what puts the hotel over the top (or beneath the bottom) is what was in the room when we returned from the Boardwalk that evening. "The smell". A cross between garlic and rotten cabbage. We don’t know where it came from; whether it was the ancient in wall air conditioner, or someone cooking in another suite, we just didn’t know. We thought it would dissipate. It didn’t. We thought that maid staff would do something about it the next day. They didn’t. The next night I spoke to the front desk about it. They offered to change our room, but by that time my son was asleep and we didn’t want to wake him. They did send up an air purifier, but it was no match for "the smell". I was told the manager would be notified when he/she came in in the morning and he/she would talk to us. He/she didn’t. It’s not easy to give a hotel only one star; especially one who’s rooms have just been renovated with granite surfaces (albeit atop chipped furniture), one with Tempurpedic mattresses, one with a large pool inside a four story atrium, and one on such a nice stretch of Ocean City beach. It could have been just a bad couple of days. Then again, I am still waiting for the manager’s phone call.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: Karen534
Reviews.Content: The view from our suite was gorgeous - blue ocean, blue sky, sandy beach! The king size bed was very, very comfortable and the lay-out of the suite was great. Staff were very helpful and you can't beat the location. Good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful 2nd Honeymoon"”
Reviews.Author: Janice G
Reviews.Content: 43yrs. together and finally had a vacation. My husband and I had a wonderful time in Ocean City, Md. The Princess Royale was perfect. Very clean. (important). The staff was friendly, pleasant and very helpful. We have no complaints at all and would highly recommend it. There is no need to go anywhere else if you don't want. Everything, restaurant, beautiful pool, beauty parlor, gym etc. is in this resort. Food was excellent also. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Veronika8206
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Princess Royale for 2 nights. I was actually very pleased with the room and the hotel, it was more of a resort. Very nice pool, beautiful beach. Rooms are very clean. Although they could put up a new shower head in the bathroom. Overall, nice stay. During our stay there, it was raining pretty much the full day and if it was not for the pool, I dont know what we would do. I read negative reviews about sheets being dirty, room dirty - I found none of that to be true. Maybe because I travel with my own pillow cases :) Their bed is amazing and although the rooms face the pool, the pool does not open until 10AM and closes at 10PM, so there is no noise of any kind. The hotel definitely caters to families with kids. The bar at the beach is very nice, and the staff are all pleasant and friendly. If you're staying at Royale, you must go to Layton's for breakfast. They have the BEST banana/blueberry pancakes! out of this world. Also, try the Crab Bag - THE BEST for lunch or dinner! Fager's Island was beautiful although the night we went there, it was a hurricane like weather, so unfortunately we did not enjoy the views. Dinner was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Beach Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jolin0612
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our long weekend getaway. The room was very comfortable for my 4 year old and the two of us. Our room overlooked the Atrium pool and the beach. Actually watched a group of dolphins one morning. Everything in OCMD was very convenient and the main reasons for our trip (beach and pool) were right outside our door. Perfect. I had read some of the reviews that actually scared me into almost changing my mind because I am "grossed out" easily. I can tell you that the room we were in was "dated" but clean. The beds were new and there were no bugs (I checked thoroughly). We watched them clean the pool and area daily and there is a hose/shower to clean sand off when coming from the beach. Our service experience was top notch. I was not impressed at all with the buffet, but there are so many options for eating in OC - why stay in?? We really loved the location - and will plan a return trip soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel which caters to families”
Reviews.Author: idanaLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: This is a good three star hotel with some good amenities such as a beachfront location, indoor atrium pool with a game room, and large size suites with comfortable tempur-pedic beds which are wide enough to comfortably sleep two adults. While the hotel may have some faults, its positive features outweigh the negative ones. In reading other reviews I feel that too much attention is placed on irrelevant issues such as friendliness of the hotel staff and room decor. Honestly, although the furniture may be dated, that ought not affect your stay at the hotel. My biggest complaint is the lack of lighting in the room which is an issue prevalent to many hotels. The layout of the room in which the kitchen area separates the living room portion with the bedroom part of the room was convenient as it permitted adults and children to have their own television sets and sleeping/quiet areas. The hotel is especially appealing to families with toddlers through pre-teens. We were at the beach for only one hour and we noticed that most families brought their own beach chairs and umbrellas ostensibly as other reviewers noted the cost of renting a chair was $7.00 and an umbrella was $14.00. There was a bar at the beach which was a covenient amenity as well as a gazebo bar which served light snacks and some food in the edge of the atrium. When traveling to Ocean City, the first decision you need to make is whether to stay on or off the boardwalk. While the boardwalk location is convenient, the noise and crowds makes it more advantageous for adults traveling without children. There also is a plethora of restaurants and activities within several miles of the hotel in either direction which cater to families without the constant barrage of people and noise endemic to the boardwalk. Traveling to the boardwalk area from the hotel was only about a ten to fifteen minute ride. For restaurants we ate one night at an all you can eat restaurant and a la carte restaurant where several of us ordered all you can eat crabs for twenty five dollars. The restaurant was called On the Bay and was located on Coastal Highway in the 40's. This was a casual place where you ordered and paid at the cashier and the food was then delievered to one of the outdoor benches. The crabs were tasty and opening the crabs with a mallot was half the fun. We also ordered a large bucket of french fries from Thrasher's while on the boardwalk for ten dollars which was a great mini-lunch. Jolly Roger's Amusement Park on the pier was okay for the money. Old Pro Golf was a good after dinner event. They have three locations, and we ended up going to the 136th Street location when the one in the 60's was overly crowded. In general, the Royal Princess is an above average hotel which caters to families. If you are expecting services and amenities comparable to five star hotels such as the Ritz Carlton you will be disapponted. Similarly, if you expect fashionable and chic accomodations, crystal clear blue water and fine dining you will also be disappointed. If you want a family vacation at a beachfront location with family style restaurants and entertainment similar to the Jersey Shore then you should be able to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Howard W
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room/beds. Nice oceanfront view. Staff very accommodating. Buffet dinner good, nothing exceptional. Very nice stay and look forward to going back. Only caution to people is that we went to their comedy club and did not enjoy either comedian (so just don't go to the comedy club - but we DO like the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Stay of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: susanMorrisville_pa
Reviews.Content: The stay was a great time had by all!!! Great food at the breakfast buffet everyday, beds were fantastic, beaches were clean and seeing the dolphins again were fantastic including being able to get pictures this time with my camera. The boys even had fun bodysurfing and covering my feet with the soft sand.....Thanks Diane!!

Reviews.Title: “Great beachfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie104
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Princess Royale for three nights. The reservation was made months ago. As our trip approached, and we read comments on TripAdvisor, we became concerned. We take a trip to Ocean City on a yealy basis and were looking for a new place to stay. Prior to our trip, we contacted the Princess Royale regarding the reviews. We travel a few times a year and understand that each person visits with their own perspective and expectations. We wanted to be assured that our room was clean and well maintained. Ms. Diane Anderson assured us that that would be the case. We were not disappointed. We arrived at the hotel about 4 hours before check-in. The front desk staff was cheerful and friendly. Our room was not ready, but we were issued a parking pass and were permitted to use the hotel facilities. After enjoying the beach, the pool, and lunch, we called and our room was ready. The bell-hop quickly and efficiently unloaded our car (which was already in the parking garage), showed us to our room, turned on the ice maker in the refrig., and answered any questions. We had a room overlooking the pool/atrium. Our daughter loved the balcony and enjoyed watching people in the pool. The pool closes at 10pm, so there was no issue with noise. The room was larger than others we had stayed at in OC. The room was clean, and maintained. We had no issues with anything in the room. Having a full size refrig. was great for storing our food. The bed was comfortable, and after long days, our daughter had no issues sleeping on the pull-out sofabed. The pool was clean, as was the beach. We had no issues with the elevators, although we heard others complaining about the wait when it was check-in time. Breakfast was included as part of our package. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and the food was hot. There was a variety to suit everyone's taste. We did get hot dogs and fries from the "food court" near the beach. It was okay. We ate at the dinner buffet one evening. There was a large variety of food ---plenty to satisfy the seafood lover, the meat eater, and children. The food was hot and continuously refilled. The only complaint we would have about the buffet was the milkshake machine----wasn't working properly---very thin---but all of the children appeared to enjoy adding the toppings to their "milk". One day we ordered lunch from the retaurant "to-go" so we could eat on the beach. There was no problem getting the food to go, and the wait time was minimal. All staff members that we came into contact with seemed friendly and were working hard. We loved having a beachfront hotel with an indoor pool! It was a nice reprieve from the hot sun! Each day, our room was cleaned while we were at breakfast. Towels and amenities were restocked. We enjoyed our stay and plan to return. This is a great beachfront hotel that met all of our expectations. We look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Kiesha W
Reviews.Content: If you like to bring home with you , come stay. A very family oriented hotel. Perfect location for all day n evening activities. Free parking a plus. Tons of coupons and the area is affordable for all your wants n needs. The hotel have everything you need and most of all VERY CLEAN!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “1st time Stay it was nice!!”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel only a few minor things I find myself that can be fixed to make it more fun. First thing the rooms do need up dated like walls and bathroom and new sofa bed I tried to have my children sleep on iit and you could feel ever spring/support bars. Also the price for a night stay you pay for like a 4 star room but you get 3 star. But all the stuff I have read below is crazy the rooms are clean the carpet was clean didnt have a smell at all. All the staff was very very well. Besides the rooms needing a little bit the rest is very nice. Parking Deck alittle tight!!!I do wish this place had outside pool but it was not a real big deal when you have the big ocean. Also maybe a outside play area for kids. Now all the goods the pool was always clean when i was in it same with the hot tubs. The bar inside and outside are nice and bartenders know there drinks. Arcades was nice but some didnt work but expected. Front desk and staff and maid very nice well manored. Over all i rate this hotel a 3 star not a 4 becasue of price and rooms needing a little updateing. I will more then likely go back!!!!! Also dont wear good sunglasses in the ocean which a wave ate mine so if anyone finds a pair of oakleys let me know lol intill next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AMC201241070
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at Princess Royale. Based on the reviews we had hopeful expectations. We are seasoned travelers and have stayed at a variety of beach resorts and have become accustomed to a Marriott or Hilton level experience. We were very disappointed. This is an old hotel in a state of decay. Everything looked worn and in need of repair. Peeling paint; molding rotting and falling off. Generally cheap feel. Hotel pool atrium has real potential but falls shorts. The elevators are dangerous and the doors will quickly slam on you or your 4 year old child like a hammer so beware. The staff was neither excellent or poor. No major complaints or praises there. Our rooms was very disappointing. The flooring was down right gross. Sticky old/worn carpet, and old stained tile. The bathroom ceiling was stained and falling apart. Bathroom fixtures were somewhat functional and cheap. Kitchen appliances were several decades old. Some of our unit's counter tops were upgraded to granite and we had one flat screen TV so it appears the hotel is trying. The beach is wonderful and the only reason to even look at this place. The beach front restaurant was a lovely space lined by palm trees overlooking the ocean, but once again marred by cheap furniture, peeling paint, and overall cheap feel. The burgers were very good though. The management will have to put a lot of capital into this place to bring it up to par with what most people expect nowadays from a premium beach resort. Unless there is a MAJOR renovation we will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: Jodi28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a honeymoon in driving distance and found Princess Royale online and was excited about the jacuzzi tub room. Despite the reviews, we booked it. I am happy to say we were more than pleased. We had room 307 with an amazing view. After 2 hours of being there we watched dolphins from the balcony and saw a double rainbow over the ocean. Our room was clean, and had a nice flat screen tv. We loved that the hotel was right on the beach and in a location away from the hub bub of the boardwalk night life. The only thing we would change is the wall paper was peeling off in spots...but other than that the counter tops were new and the view was amazing! We will totally go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop for a brief Get-away”
Reviews.Author: Pride01
Reviews.Content: Last week, a few friends and I decided to take a day trip to Delaware's Shore. We spent the day in Rehoboth and then ventured down to Ocean City, Maryland. As it was around 6pm and I had been driving all day, I suggested we stop and find a place to stay. After visiting several hotels and hearing over and over again that there were either no rooms available or not enough to handle our group, I stopped by the Princess Royale Hotel. Not only did they have a few rooms, though they had a convention there, we were able to get one of the three bedroom condos - which was perfect for our group. I must say that out of all the people we talked to trying to find a place to stay, I for one was thankful for Olga at the Front Desk of the Royale. When we explained our situation, she was quick to recommend the condo instead of having us in several rooms. Orginally, we were only going to stay one night. We ended staying three!!!. The condo was spacious, great views and was the perfect fit for us all. The first morning of the trip, I sat on the balcony and watched the sun rise. Something I haven't done in at least 20 years. This was an awesome trip and I will be heading back to the Princess Royale when we take our annual holiday shopping spree. I just hope Olga and the rest of the staff at the Front Desk are there. With their knowledge of the hotel and the surrounding areas, they were the second best part of the trip. My friends are still talking about our trip and even suggesting we take another one soon. At least we know where we will be staying!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Princess on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Ed W
Reviews.Content: My team and I were visiting Ocean Beach for the first time for a tournament. I contacted the hotel prior to booking to express our teams preferences concerning the vicinity of all rooms to one another in addition to some other matters. Diane was extremely helpful and seemed sincerely supportive of our needs and came through for us in all matters. When it was all over, the tournament was a great success and my team mates couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. From the friendliness of all staff members to the very comfortable beds and beach front location, I can't say enough about the Princess Royale. We are already looking forward to next year's tournament and another stay with this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favorite OC Hotel after 20 years!”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Princess Royale since it opened about 20 years ago. We have stayed there twice in one Summer several times over the years. We have tried other OC hotels a few times and the Princess Royale is still our favorite beach hotel in OC. The rooms are perfect for a small family group since there is a full size fridge, stove and microwave in the kitchen area which allows the option of preparing a meal in the room at least once during your stay. The rooms are very spacious and well laid out. The kids can sleep on the sofa bed in the living room/kitchen area and parents have a large bedroom suite to themselves. One minor negative comment - the sofa beds seem to be pretty old and probably should be replaced. We always reserve a pool level room since they have the best access to the beach. Even when the pool and atrium level are crowded, shuttting the door to the atrium keeps the noise out of the room. The pool is great for bad weather days - it's one of the largest indoor pools in OC. It's great to be able to let the kids play in the pool on rainy days or when they just want to get out of the sun for a while. The beach in front of the hotel is always clean and never overcrowded. The landscaping between the beach and the hotel is very attractive - the palm trees planted there create a "tropical" feeling in the beach bar area. The rooms are always clean and the staff always friendly and helpful. Not sure why some other reviewers have had problems in those two areas - in 20 years' time we have not had bad experiences with room cleanliness or rude staff. And then there's the parking - other OC Hotels that provide free parking often don't have enough spaces for all the guests and some have to find parking spaces wherever they can. There are always enough parking spaces at the Princess Royale AND all parking is inside a garage which keeps your car out of the hot sun all day. We have a lot of favorite restaurants in OC so we have not eaten in the hotel restaurant very often. The few times we have eaten there, the food and service has been OK. The hotel has recently renovated and updated some aspects of the rooms - the tempurpedic matresses in the bedroom suites are especially nice! Overall, we are convinced that the Princess Royale is the best value in OC and plan to keep staying there for future vacations. Bottom line is that our family has nothing but happy memories of the many times we've stayed there! Steve P.

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectations to have a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of the reviews, I noticed a few themes from the negative ones. Here's my take on those themes: - This is not a business hotel This is 100% true. I do a lot of business travel, and would have been horrified if I had to stay here, as, well, it's a beach hotel teeming with families and kids. Fortunately, we were there for vacation, and this did not detract from out stay, but rather added to it, as the kids got to meet other kids, etc. - The WiFi is bad This depends on where you are. If you're closer to the halls, it was fine for hotel WiFi. As you got closer to the patio and outdoors, the signal did drop significantly. So, my first-world problem was that if I wanted to browse the internet, I had to do it inside vs. outside. Thus, I opted to just relax and enjoy the view on the patio vs. use the internet. - The decor in the rooms are dated 100% true. But - it's a hotel room, not an audition for Better Homes & Gardens magazine. We spent very little time in the room, as we were there for the beach and other activities, so the decor did not detract at all from our stay. There is a flat screen TV in the bedroom and an old school tube TV in the living room of the suite that we had. Our kids don't care. They watched either and didn't complain. - There are several bad smells I don't know if I'd call them bad, but the smell of cleaning supplies is obvious in many places. This would be one of the things that I'd like to see changed, as some of them are stronger than others. Also, the indoor pool did have a strong smell of chlorine for most of the duration that we were there. That could also be toned down a bit as well. - The restaurant was awful I read a LOT of reviews that said this, so rather than try to confirm it, we just avoided it. There are WAY too many better places in OC to have dinner, so this was not an inconvenience at all. We also did breakfast in the suite and had most lunches there, too. We did have one lunch in the restaurant, and while it was not the best meal ever, it also wasn't the worst. - The service is awful This was something that I did not run into. Yes, the staff is largely students from Europe on work-study visas, but you know what? If you talk to them and are actually nice, they are nice in return, too! Not all of them speak English, but all of their English is way better than any second language that I speak. We did have a couple of issues with the room - all of which were resolved quickly. For example, the dishwasher broke on the 2nd day and flooded over onto the floor. I called the front desk, and within a couple of hours, we had a brand new dishwasher installed. The ice maker also didn't work; same resolution within just a few hours as well. And lastly, the microwave broke on the last day, and we saw them replacing it as we were checking out. Was this a hassle? Nah. I didn't care. We were able to get all of the ice we needed from the bar at no charge, and after all, we were on vacation, and I wasn't going to let a faulty appliance or two spoil the fun. They also said that this winter, many of the rooms will be completely renovated, which will be great. I was initially worried that being up on 91st Street would put us too far from where all of the activities were, but that is 100% not the case. The location was awesome, as everything in OC is just a few minute drive away. There is also no shortage of restaurants, shops & mini golfs up where the hotel is. I'll be honest: this was not the best hotel that I have ever stayed at. But you know what? It was a clean place to sleep with plenty of room for a family of 4, an awesome location with a great beach, and we had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is disgusting. 4 star more like negative -4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Jayneil C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a 4 star it's negative 4 stars because the front desk employees are rude, and they don't know how to act professional. The rooms smell like mildew and we had a lot of rooms booked due to a family event. The carpet stank and was dirty I walked around in my socks I have pictures of how dirty they were after walking around in my room. The parking garage is a dangerous maze where people crashed trying to get out of it. The food at the restaurant wasn't edible, they didn't change the linen, and wanted us to reuse our towels and washcloths. The hotel had they nastiest smell throughout the entire place, their were holes in one of the room in the sink. Some of my relative complained about their clothes smelling rank and mildew from being in their rooms. From the time we pulled up to the time we left I felt like I had wasted my money a raggedy nasty mildew smelling, roach motel. I was norman bates to come out of the closet. This hotel is horrible and they should stop misrepresenting themselves as any star rated hotel because this is a motel. I will be putting up photo of hair and lint behind nightstand, made a pin mark on sheets they didn't change them for two days I had to ask them to change the linen. Sign in elevator cracked about ready to fall, rooms in the garage, scary and dangerous when walking to my car. Hole in room 243 in bathroom where sink is, mildew smell in all the rooms. Carpet dirty, and stink throughout the entire motel. The managers was unprofessional, rude, and dumb. The beach is dirty, the pool is nasty, the games in the game room barely always have to request assistance for change return. The food was edible laxative material yuk. The bed were not comfortable with dirty linen, the sleeper in the living room was horrible, and it stank. Dishwasher was mildew, plates were stained and dirty in shelves. Hot tub had white frost in it looked like clam chowder. This motel was a raggedy maze when I left my room I had to walk damn near the entire hotel to find my way to an elevator that took me closer to my room sign and elevator travels could of been less confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Has to be taken in context of summer destinations”
Reviews.Author: needcleansheets
Reviews.Content: Just left the hotel. What I mean by title is that summer east coast destination hotels on the ocean tend to be exorbitant and this one is not totally crazy priced for being right on the water. That being said, the hotel is more than a little tired and the beds/linens are below what you would expect at this price level. I had two blankets with big stains on them and at this price point, that is a no-no. In addition, the cooling system in the room was noisy and kept me up. The staff was friendly on the whole and the pool/atrium is very nice; my kids loved it! Being on the beach is great, but you cannot bring hotel towels out, and so you are stuck paying for towel rental...pretty crazy. The boardwalk is great and I think families will enjoy it; just understand that you are paying to be on the water in the summer. Oh...and the room IS very big with whole kitchen, fridge...very nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Summerfun69
Reviews.Content: Always a great stay at Princess Royale! We are going back for the 6th year in a row in September, always stayed in a side-oceanview. Looking forward this year to an oceanfront suite this year!. We go in September, less crowds, parking issues, AND GREAT weather! Also looking forward to the renovations they did this year. :o) Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Harry007-11
Reviews.Content: Our family of four visited from 08/07 through 08/10. Pool had an accident and was shut down for the entire day on Thursday. Thursday night movie on the beach was very enjoyable. Our suite on the fifth floor had an odor to it and was never corrected-we never spent much time in the room except to sleep. We asked for extra towels each morning and request was never filled.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place!”
Reviews.Author: Mcgrimm
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great location for family. Rooms were spacious and quiet at night. Atrium is a great place to entertain kids if its raining at tge beach. Only negative is no way to control a/c in room other than on/off so we were a little chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: food9128
Reviews.Content: Dont eat the food here! The breakfast Buffett is horrible. They leave the food there for hours, it's cold and the French toast sticks were hard. The rooms are so outdated, that the dishwasher leaked all over the floor and the ice machine didn't work. Worse is that the managers have a "I don't give a crap attitude". That's why the place is run the way it is. When we were there the hotel was sold out, maybe they should put some of that money back into renovations. Then They should fire all their managers and actually take some pride in the hotel and it's services!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place for the family”
Reviews.Author: karenlvs
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful time at the Princess Royale! We had an ocean front room and it was amazing. Can't wait to go back next year. Ask for Willie he was wonderful! Be sure to check out the buffet and children's movie night. We also loved the bus transportation to the boardwalk and outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: flipflopgirl
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City, Maryland. The hotel was clean and right on the beach. The kids (ages 5 and 3) loved the indoor pool. The Tempurpedic beds were nice. We enjoyed our vacation despite a few wrinkles. This hotel is too far from the boardwalk -like more than 100 streets too far!!! Even though the boardwalk is only a handful of miles away, it can take 20 minutes to get there with traffic and all the lights on Coastal Highway. Then you need to search for parking. We prefer the convenience of being within walking distance of the action. DO NOT EAT at this hotel. The Seafood Buffet is lacking much seafood and the quality of the food is quite poor, bordering on not edible. The ice cream machine is not working properly, so they have a sign on it saying "milkshakes". The "ice cream" is too soft to be called "ice cream" but too hard to really be a "milkshake". We had lunch at Schooner's Oceanfront Restaurant. The setting (right on the beach) was nice, but the service was slower than molasses. There was one girl who was so overwhelmed. I ordered the Fajita salad, which came with some fake "cheese". My husband ordered the grilled chicken and it was dry as a bone. Parking seems to be a problem. We could never find a spot and always had to park on the roof of the parking deck.

Reviews.Title: “One week visit”
Reviews.Author: Ed Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice with a few minor inconviences. Has an indoor pool, great beach front, okay restaurants (lots of other places within walking distance) and a clean facility. Minor problems with very slow elevators and parking. One big draw back was the slow to non-existent free internet. Didn't work half the time. But, what the heck, you should be on the beach, not checking email! AAA discount saved a lot! Pillows and sheets need to be updated but all in all a very nice place for a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Ocean City!!”
Reviews.Author: Malynda1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princess Royale along with my husband and 2 kids ages 10 & 5 in July 2010. The hotel was nice and the rooms were spacious and clean. We booked a one bedroom efficiency, with a pull out sofa. I chose this hotel because it was a smoke-free hotel that was kid-friendly and somewhat away from the hustle and bustle of the boardwalk. We had a side view of the ocean, which was also a view directly over the indoor pool. It was nice to at least see the ocean from the room; however, I would have loved to hear the waves as well. The way the hotel is set up, you can see the ocean through a large glass wall that’s positioned in front of the indoor pool area. While there we enjoyed the breakfast buffet that was part of our package. The food was good and the service was great. You also have a wonderful view of the ocean from the buffet dining room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy Ocean City and not be subjected to the massive crowds of the boardwalk 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Good family resort, busy season.”
Reviews.Author: Missyjf
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 stayed end of July. Kids had fun! We have stayed here before in October and was much quieter. Prefer the condos over the suites. A lot more room. But too expensive in the summer. Clean but dated rooms. Nice beach and pool. Housekeeping and staff were always busy and helpful. Wifi did not work most of the time in our room. Called desk but what ever they did still not working. Don't bring work to do online at beach! Forgot cooler under sink, called few hours after, left a message at lost and found, never got a call back. So check room before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: jmad42
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my husband and toddler and we wanted to be on the beach and quiet. This was perfect. The suite was very clean and spacious. The decor and colors are a little outdated but still very well maintained. Very clean. Breakfast was included but we only ate there once because breakfast wasn't great. Lunch was definitely the best of all the meals because we also had dinner there and no good. The in house pizza was very good better than the Italian restaurant across the street. We never used the pool. It didn't seem that great. The beach was great. You can rent umbrella for the day for $15 and chairs Upto$7 per day. Driving distance to boardwalk 10min. Very quiet. The supermarket was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: brgerflipr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at PR from 7/31 - 8/2. Overall the stay was pleasant, but I wanted to bring a few things to everyone's attention. At roughly $300 / night, it was a little pricey for, at best, a mediocre hotel. This hotel was probably very nice 20 years ago, but aside from basic maintenance, it still seems stuck in the 90's. We had a DECENT stay and the following review may seem a little nit-picky, but these are the things that just didn't sit well with us. First, the GOOD: excellent customer service, everyone we spoke to from bell-hop to maid to receptionist to restaurant hostess/waitress were all excellent and very very nice. The walk to the beach was very short and beach itself was very nice and clean. Parking was also very easy and just a short walk away from the lobby. Tempur-pedic mattress was very comfortable. Also w/ a family of 4, the kitchen came in very useful. Utensils and dishes were supplied and very clean. All appliances worked properly, but were probably 10+ yrs old. No stainless steel. BAD: the elevators are VERY slow. You also have to take another elevator in the parking garage and that one is even slower than the ones in the hotel. Perhaps this was because we went during busy season, so take it w/ a grain of salt, but it was an average wait of about 45secs to 2 mins for every elevator. To access the beach, you have to go through the atrium and down a flight of stairs. And although this isn't a big deal, if you have a beach cart, it's impossible. Therefore, you have to go all the way around the building or cut through the restaurant on the side. Perhaps I missed something in the navigation, but these were the directions given to me by the staff. Seemed kind of inconvenient. The "heated" pool was pretty cold and the game room seemed old. The business center consisted of one single computer. As for the room itself, aside from the tempur-pedic mattress, everything was mediocre (at best). One flat screen in the bedroom and an old TV in the living room. No HD programming or guide. And even though no one really comes to the beach to watch TV, it would've been nice to be able to find one or two channels in the morning without having to scroll through 60+ channels. And again, it's 2012, who doesn't have HD programming? Or who has a box TV for that matter? The sofa-bed is........well how I can put this delicately........disgusting. The cushions looked and felt like they haven't been changed in 30 years and the mattress that flipped out had stains and was very uncomfortable. I know that it is a sofabed and it can't ever be as comfortable as a real bed, but that cannot be an excuse for the condition of this piece of furniture. There is one air conditioning unit that cools both sides of the suite (the bedroom and living room). However in the bedroom, it blew a lot harder than the living room, so it was freezing in one room and much warmer in the other room. The unit is also right next to the bed, so it's pretty loud at night if you're a light sleeper. The front door is also very thin and when sleeping in the sofa-bed, you can hear EVERYTHING in the hallway. And while most fellow patrons were quiet and courteous, we could still hear people walking, kids running and screaming occasionally. Again, if you're a light sleeper, the comfort (or lack thereof) of the sofa-bed and noise from the hall make sleeping in the living room quite difficult. On a side note, we have a toddler and an infant. Both take naps. We made the mistake of getting a room w/ an atrium/pool view. The noise from the atrium makes it pretty hard for naps. This is no fault of the hotel's. Just a tip for anyone w/ kids that nap, perhaps an oceanview / oceanfront room would be a little more quiet. In summary, would we stay at PR again? If the price were lower, yes. After all, this is simply a hotel at a beach and not the Ritz Carlton. But at the price that we paid, it did not seem worth it to us. Again, let me say that the staff could not have been nicer and service could not have been better. BOTH WERE FANTASTIC. Perhaps we expected too much from all the positive reviews here or perhaps we're just anal, difficult customers. But while PR provided us w/ a pleasant stay, the resort itself just didn't quite live up to expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: Angela R
Reviews.Content: I booked my last summer vacation at the Princess Royale in Ocean City, MD in March, as I have for over 15 years. I feel I must communicate to other travelers as well as the Owners and Management my experiences and treatment at the hands of the night manager - Mark Anderson. After settling into room 523 and preparing for bed, I noticed stained/soiled sheets which further revealed enormous feces and urine stains. After calling management and being shuffled around I insisted he (the manager) see for himself the condition of the room I had prepaid in excess of $300.00 per night. His response was complete and utter silence. After some very uncomfortable time had passed, he had the audacity to suggest that we leave the facility (mind you it’s very close to midnight) and he would only charge me for 1 night. His disdain for the predicament of my family makes me wonder if racism played any role here. He never offered a solution to our problem in which he was ultimately responsible. Not even an apology did he offer. Left with no choice but to leave in the middle of the night, (repack, clothes/food/kids) thank GOD for smart phones. The service we received here was appalling. I suggest a basic management 101 course for Mr. Anderson. Thanks to him, you have lost a loyal customer. Rest assured, I will be writing a letter directly to the owners as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !!”
Reviews.Author: JimK523
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, in a great location. Close to shops and restaurants and a wonderful beach. Schooners restaurant at the hotel was a very nice place as well. This was a combination business and pleasure trip. I'm very gald we had decided to stay the extra time - it was very relaxing. Best beach vacation in a while. Can't wait to go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Resort Review”
Reviews.Author: Beachvacationer445
Reviews.Content: Overall, the resort was very pleasurable during the busy summer season. There were a few points that I believe readers need to read and determine if it matters to them. We were not allowed to use the luggage carts for personal use in assisting us take our own luggage to the room. The luggage carts were for the bellman only. We had the oceanview room, it is my opinon that the majority of oceanview rooms at the Royale do not meet my expectations for viewing the ocean. What you see is mostly other hotels. The first room we had, we had to go out on the balcony and lean over to see any ocean, very disappointing. We found that housekeeping conveniently failed to leave certain necessities when servicing the room. We had to call each day and ask for additional towels or wash cloths, we felt this was to encourage additional tipping. The value of the room for the Ocean City area was very good. The sitting area with the pull out bed was a plus for our family. They had all the extras, pool, hot tubs, and lots of games for the children. The frozen drinks were $9.00, which we felt were steep even for a resort. All in all, it was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking customer service”
Reviews.Author: debbie r
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights. The price was steep for this hotel but we stayed knowing it is the busy season. The location is great. The room was very clean. The ocean view was spectacular. I do think that this hotel is definitly overpriced though. We had a few issues with the room. On the first night, we noticed the alarm clock and bedside lamp did not work and that there was an electrical box behind the nightstand that was opened, brokenand with wires hanging out. We left a note and nothing was done. The next day, we also noticed that the tv did not work at all in the bedroom. We called down and told of all of our concerns. They sent someone up who did replace the tv and who fixed the light and the clock. Also, the box was somewhat closed and duct taped. We returned to the room later and the clock and light did not work again. We decided to live with it. The next day, we returned to our room and the room key did not work. We went down and complained to a manager about everything that had happened and all he had to say is "Let me know if there is anything I can do for you." What was that supposed to mean? He did not offer anything. I would have taken a free breakfast-though the restaurant gets some bad reviews, a free drink or even a comp on the ridiculous charge to use the safe. The everyday workers at the hotel were great. On the other hand, we found the management totally lacking! They really need some additional training in customer service. I have never had such an experience in a hotel when I needed to speak to management. I also found the elevator system bizarre and the recorded ads in the elevator were very cheesy. The hotel definitely has much more potential. I agree with every review on the lack of customer service and managements lack of concern for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: SWEECIE
Reviews.Content: My family and I wanted to take another trip to Ocean City and wanted to be closer to the beach. After researching we stumbled upon the Princess Royale Hotel, which was the best choice for the money we spent. The hotel was nice and clean. The staff was accommodating and it offered lots of amenities for families. The rooms supposedly were recently remodeled; however, the only thing that I noticed may have been updated was the granite counter tops in the kitchen area. Outside of that the hotel rooms are still dated as some described but always clean. In fact we would get up for breakfast and the cleaning lady would jump in our room and it would be clean when we returned; very fast and great service. The rooms do have a slight mildew smell; however, the value of the property definitely outweighed any minor defects. If you book directly on the hotels website try to get the room special that includes breakfast. The breakfast buffet was redundant and basic; however, it served its purpose with my 8 year old twins. I would come here again because I was all around a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Condo in a hotel setting on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: If you like the beach and need something a little bigger than your average hotel room look no futher. The Princess Royal has two and three bedroom condos that have plenty of room to enjoy yourself with your family and friends after a long day at the beach. The suites are just as nice with a seperate living room so you can put the kids to bed and still enjoy privacy in the same hotel room. I had a great time at the Princess Royale Hotel and already plan on returning next summer. The new mattresses were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation, all 5 of us enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alan c
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel for families. the indoor pool and game room for the kids and the beach is right out the back door. 3 hot tubs and a sauna. Beds were very comfortable. I have a family of 5. my wife and I shared a bed, my 15yr old share with the 6 yr old and the 11 year old stayed in the tv room on the pull out coach. he acually never even pulled out the bed. he just wanted to sleep on top of the coach. we all really had plenty of room. we stayed four days in Dc then came here to relax. We now wish we would have spent more time here. Had a great time at the princess royale,

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RHEDDS
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend of July-28th-29th..And like many i did my research..Working in reservations/front desk at a hotel myself, i knew it was always better to book direct with a hotel.I booked the king size bed with the ocean side view.And i have to say i was pleasantly surprised.The room had a living room area and kitchen.Tho we didn't use it,it was still a plus to have just in case.The hotel is located across from the beach and that's where we spent most of the day.We ate at Schooners which had a bar right next to the beach.All and all we had a great time,might even make a trip back up for labor day ..Keeping my fingers cross to get a great rate..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great room views but service could be better”
Reviews.Author: mpierry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in one of the suite rooms with jacuzzi. Great views from our room but overall service could have been better. Very nice indoor pool. Expected more with the prices they charge for the rooms. Would consider coming back if I know they made some changes/improvements to their customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay in Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: gkoinski
Reviews.Content: Out of the ten shore trips we've made to Ocean City, MD, the last five were spent at Princess Royale (91st & Coastal Highway). The service was great, our rooms (condos) were awesome, and we fully enjoyed the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation 2012”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!! WONDERFUL!!! This was our first time staying at this establishment and we liked it so much that from now on we will be vacationing here instead of in another state. We had rented the 2 b/r OF condo - UNBELIEVEABLE!!! It was so spacious it felt like we were in a large apartment with PLENTY of space and the view was amazing! Beds were oh so cozy and rooms and hallways were very clean. Staff was wonderful. Our washing machine stopped working on our second day and it was replaced with a brand new washer within an hour, plus our wet clothes were taken to housekeeping to finish being washed, dried, folded and brought back up to us - thank you Shawn! It was such a FANTASTIC stay! There was plenty of parking - never had an issue, plus parking spaces were larger than the normal beach spots. I could have stayed for the rest of the summer!! We will DEFINITELY be back! Loving my new vaca spot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsMot615
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale for three days last month and was impressed. The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly. Our room was an ocean view corner, which was wonderful. Each morning I got up early and sat on the balcony to watch the sun rise. We didn't utilize the kitchen, but it was stocked with dishes, pots and it had a dishwasher. The beach area was great and the grandson enjoyed the pool very much. We usually stay at the Clarion, but will definitely stay at the Princess Royale our next OC trip. We went to their seafood buffet, which was a big mistake. The food was awful! I noticed on our bill there was a daily charge for the room safe. I have never seen that, but I suppose hotels are taking a que from the airlines to nickle and dime their guests.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen M
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this hotel! We starting coming a few years back when the kids were younger and started with a Queen suite which is plenty big enough. Now that they are older, we let them each bring a friend and stay in a two bedroom condo that we love! This hotel has everything....pool, outdoor cabana and grill, live music, hot tubs, restaurant, comedy club. The staff is always friendly and rooms are clean. We live in Philadelphia and stopped going to the Jersey shore because we feel these beaches are cleaner and not as crowed and the prices for the condo are better. We love coming and always hate to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Time for the Princess to abdicate her throne!”
Reviews.Author: DRNJ1960
Reviews.Content: Oh where to start....chose Ocean City as our summer vacation following a hockey tournament in Delaware the weekend before. The Hilton was sold out so I reluctantly chose the Princess Royale. Made the reservation over the phone speaking with one of their sales reps. Most of her advice was wrong! She recommended a king bed room and that the kids would be fine taking the pullout sofa bed. The next morning they both woke complaining of aching backs. The mattress was so thin and lumpy that we ended up changing to a room with 2 queens. Hotel rep also suggested taking a room overlooking the indoor pool so we could see the boys swimming and not have to walk downstairs to call them. No need for this as the pool is so over-chlorinated that the water is white! The fumes rise up to the roof and since we were on the top floor (5th) the smell was beyond toxic. Any thought of sitting on the tiny balcony is quickly erased due to a fear of passing out from the fumes and falling over the side. The other advantage of taking a room overlooking the courtyard/indoor pool is that you can listen to people playing air-hockey and other arcade-like games at 11:00pm without having to open your balcony door or incurring a further cost. This hotel was built in the early 80's and to my knowledge appears to not have done anything since. Gaudy pink walls in the bathroom with matching pink shower curtain. The shower actually has a seperate hot and cold water tap. Dark green carpets and purple drapes. Is this supposed to be beach-like? Sure the rooms have a large fridge and microwave etc. but it all feels like a cheap motel with old furniture. The hotel is decorated in mirrors on the ceilings by the elevators with small decorative light bulbs alongside. Tacky, tacky, tacky. Everywhere you go are advertisement for some sort of activity - all at an extra cost. While the pool provides free towels to use, the beach does not (and you are not allowed to take pool towels to the beach). No worries however as there is someone set up to rent you towels, chairs and umbrellas at an extra cost. Breakfast is next door in the Schooner restaurant and was included in the room rate. It is basic and not that hygienic looking. Upon completion of the free buffet meal we were presented with a bill for service. Actually a suggestion for gratuity within a range of 15 - 20% based upon the actual cost of the meal were we to purchase this separately. Basically they 'advised' us to pay $18.00 in gratuities for eating at the free buffet. I quickly asked around to the staff in the hotel and found out that most of them are paid a lot less than minimum wage (around $2.50 per hour I was told). They rely on guests to augment their salary through tips. This hotel does have 2 and only 2 features. 1. it sits directly on a wonderful beach with a great surf for the kids and adults alike to play and swim in. and 2. they have surprisingly brought tempur-pedic beds into each room (why I do not know). We have the same bed at home and were amazed at this upgrade. Everything else however is awful. We tried to depart early and were curly told by the less than charming Olga at reception "No. No refund!" If this is your first time leaving home or first time to the beach then you may be more impressed than we were but for the price of almost $300.00 per night we expected a lot more. This hotel is a 2 star at best and must be in some sort of violation of Maryland state laws for even calling itself a resort! Please go elsewhere - and then maybe they will renovate this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawkfans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Atlantic ocean. The view and beach is awesome. It is not located on the boardwalk which we preferred. There is a cheap shuttle that will take you to the boardwalk. We had a two bedroom suite with a lithe. I highly recommend this room if you have kids. The Hotel needs updating but so does 90% Of the hotels in the area. I guess it adds to the charm of the seaboard vacation!

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tioty86
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale proved to be a comfortable place to stay for my family's first trip to O.C. The main lobby and grounds seemed to be very well redone, with new decor that attempts a higher end hotel. Expect your car to be loaded and unloaded by the hotel staff, who “insist” on seeing your luggage safely from your car and into your room. The suite we had was a side ocean view, with a triangle balcony that overlooked parking on the side of the building and the ocean at a distance. Being on the third floor and closer to the front of the hotel, one could still glance a nice view of waves crashing on the beach. The suite itself was overall comfortable, if not maybe a bit cramped compared to other suites we’ve stayed in. The granite countertops, tempurpedic mattresses, garbage disposal, and flat screen tv were all welcome amenities. I would not advise trying to sleep on the pullout sleeper sofa though, as the mattress was quite old and provided no cushioning whatsoever. This appears to be one of the few things they have left to overhaul in the guest suites. ((Along with a safe that didn’t seem to work properly.)) The pool and atrium area were nice and often quite busy. We never experienced any problems with excessive noise or crowding at the times we went (mid-afternoon). Be expected to sign out towels though, if you didn’t pack your own to tote to the beach. Hot tubs are available both inside the atrium and outside on the sundeck. The beach itself is accessible off of the atrium’s sun deck, on the second floor. Otherwise you can walk through one of the dune walks outside, on either side of the property. We found the easy accessibility to the beach to be a wonderful plus for our stay. As far as other conveniences go, the hotel could improve a bit on some things. The snack bars by the pool and outside are a bit pricey, as to be expected for the convenience of having snacks on hand. The convenience store is not worth any guest’s time. We attempted to buy a pint of ice cream from the store, but discovered that all of them were partially melted. With plenty of places to eat and buy groceries along the main drag, a person can easily obtain necessities somewhere else. We also did take a glance at “Schooners,” the onsite restaurant, which one can easily pass on for other restaurant’s close by. I recommend Lombardi’s or Bull on the Beach. Overall, as far as what we wanted from our stay (a nice room, pool, and beach access), the Princess Royale proved to be a good place to stay. As long as you don’t put much stock into onsite conveniences and actually venture up and down the Coastal Highway of O.C., you should have a pleasant stay in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Everything in one place”
Reviews.Author: Mikeytheg22
Reviews.Content: Have vacationed in OC all my life it is a true tradition. Although we love Dunes Manor for its all ocean front and it's proximity to boardwalk, the Princess Royale has grown to. E our go to as our family has grown.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel in OC”
Reviews.Author: leesey30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Princess Royale during the week of July 15. We had a suite on the fifth floor, which was fine. Rooms were quiet, where you could not hear a lot of noise from other rooms. The Temperpedic beds were great, but the pillows were a little bit too soft. I was not crazy about our balcony, as it was very small and a triangular shape. We had a side oceanview, which was nice. I stood inside by the sliding door a lot just to watch the ocean. Overall, the room was very clean and well kept. The water pressure of the shower was more like a mist. The indoor pool/atrium area was great, as well as the outdoor entertainment and easy access to the beach. The staff were great and very attentive. We had a problem with the safe in our room and they responded immediately. So basically, both good and bad, just like any hotel. I would stay here again, but was disappointed that they have no continental breakfast. For the price, that should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great but Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Thebean28
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here last weekend for a "girls" weekend. I definitely wanted an ocean front room, since I haven't stayed in Ocean City before. Pros: - Ocean Front, good view - Nice balcony - Rooms are nice size with small kitchen area and living area - Beds are Tempur pedic and comfortable Cons: - Room service forgot things the two times I used them - Trying to figure your way out to the beach is not straight forward, and often had us walking through the restaurant - A map of the hotel or information about the "snack bars" would have been most useful - the weather was bad and the outside snack bar was rolled inside and closed. No one told us that there was one at the pool. - The environment at the pool felt like a college frat party with lots of noise and people crowded around the bar drinking. I think the atrium just amplifies the noise when everyone goes inside on a rainy day. - The convenience store had an okay selection of items, but it seemed that most times I wanted to get a bottle of water (since I couldn't find a snack bar, and the vending machine wasn't working on my floor), they were away on break. Overall - the beach was really nice and if you don't bring your own chairs, the chair rental guy was super nice and set them up quickly and wherever we wanted. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean, but felt a bit old (more noticeable in the bathrooms). For almost $350/night, I didn't think it was a great deal. I almost always stay in Myrtle Beach, at the number one hotel down there, and it is less expensive and offers much better everything all around, plus a great outdoor pool for kids and families. Would I stay here again? Not likely. I live close enough that we could make a long day of it, which I think would be better. If I do come overnight again, I think I'll try a hotel closer to the boardwalk or on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, reasonable pricing and phenomenal staff!”
Reviews.Author: AdamSteelerFan
Reviews.Content: We typically stay at the Hilton, but do to an impromptu vacation, it was booked. We were encouraged by friends to try the Princess Royale and we were not disappointed. The hotel was clean and service was prompt. The one caveat to our experience was dining in the all you can eat seafood and prime rib buffet. While it was appropriately priced, there was minimal variety, and we were poorly disappointed. We could add crab legs to our meal for $12 additional per person, and we did, but they failed to bring us our order. We weren't charged, obviously, but it further aggravated us, since we were already dealing with minimal selection. This is really a non issue, however, as the strip has several all you can eat seafood buffets. It is far from the boardwalk, being on 91st street, but this was actually a perk for us, as the beaches were less crowded and driving to the boardwalk was hardly an inconvenience, compared to the privacy we received on the beach. I wish it had an outdoor pool, but the indoor pool had all the luxuries of an outdoor pool with the bonus of being able to use it during inclimate weather, which actually impacted three of our days.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HearnHaley
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Princess Royale. I reserved a 2 bedroom condo for 4 nights and saw that we could only have the side balconies if staying less than a week. Well, to our surprise, we were upgraded to an oceanfront balcony! The view is fantastic and the condo itself was very nice! We will definitely stay at the Princess on all of our Ocean City visits.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Rachael S
Reviews.Content: Great, family friendly place to stay! Love the access to the beach! Our boys loved staying on the same floor with the pool and it was super convenient for the adults being so close to pool and beach. My only complaint is the elevators are extremely slow. Might want to work on that. Otherwise we really enjoy staying there. This was our 2nd family vacation at the Princess!

Reviews.Title: “Room 369”
Reviews.Author: dewey.nikhu
Reviews.Content: We booked this oceanfront room one week in advance. Got a good deal online through the hotel website and a AAA rate. Room was cramped and showing its age. We could barely use the living room area as the furniture was not set up correctly and everything was too tight. TV took up a ton of space. It was an old non-flat panel model. The kitchen was cramp but usable. All the appliances are showing their age and wear and tear. Good size fridge. The beds were comfortable. Loved view of the ocean. Decent sized deck. The bathroom aside from age was a good size. Good water pressure. The A/C unit needs to be updated. A better placed thermostat with a numeric temp control would be a huge improvement. The hotel itself is getting older despite updates/upgrades. The pool is large. Plenty of towels. My son complained to me that the water was too cold for it to be enjoyed. He had a point as it is an indoor pool. I would recommend staying here but with lower expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tom1945
Reviews.Content: This trip to the Princess Royale was the first time we encountered any problems.We had a 2 bedroom condo and the 1st problem was a door knob to the master bedroom which was on the floor when we checked in.We reported it but it was never taken care of while we were there.The 2nd problem was the icemaker in the refigerator.It didn't work unless you consider 2 cubes every couple of hours a working icemaker.We made 2 calls to have it fixed and each time the repair person said "It's working now",but it never did.However,the front desk had someone bring us a large bag of ice which of course became one large solid lump of ice the next day.Other than those 2 minor problems,we will continue to stay here unless things keep going downhill.I read reports of bedbugs but I think they are false.Never saw any signs of them.

Reviews.Title: “255”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and offered everything needed in the room. The indoor pool was great for evening relaxation! The bed was great..not soft/lumpy like other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a relief!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy F
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite July 13-15 2012. After making the reservations, I started seeing comments and reviews about bedbugs. We were very upset and I emailed the hotel. I was reassured by Diane Anderson that there were no bedbugs at this hotel. She responded to my concerns right away and even emailed me in the middle of the night. When we got to the room we checked it thoroughly and found no sign of any type of bug. We had a Tempurpedic King size bed and it was very comfortable. The room was clean and the service was excellent. Our main complaint about our stay would have to be with the parking setup. There was a parking garage where you parked and then had to wait for the one elevator in the garage to take you to the ground floor. Then you had to walk across the driveway to the hotel and go to the elevators in the hotel to get to your room.This was a lot to go through, especially with small children.
