The bellhops were very helpful in assisting us with getting back and forth. Overall, it was a very nice weekend thanks to the staff at Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Condo 706 Beds Were Awful”
Reviews.Author: Deana R
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 7 - 14th, 2012, in a 3 bedroom Condo, room 706. The master suite bed was perfect, but the other two rooms were horrible. The mattresses were a double, which was way too small for two adults, but not only were they small they were totally worn out. When we spoke to management (Mark), he did absolutely nothing about it and didn't seem to care. We had to go to Walmart to purchase mattress toppers, just so we could sleep on the beds. I asked Mark if he would purchase the toppers and he said he isn't authorized to do so. We asked him to get in touch with the owners of the condo, and he said he would try on Monday, but never did. Needless to say our situation was never rectified by management! After spending over $6,000, we had two rooms there that week, but they did not care in the least. I have to say we stayed here two years ago, in a 3 bedroom condo on the 10th floor and we had no problems. So with that said, we will never go back here again, due to the fact if you have a problem they don't do a thing about it and have an attitude that they don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Always go back”
Reviews.Author: faircritic55
Reviews.Content: Have been going to Princess Royale for about 7 years now, both with family and alone with husband. We find this hotel a great value, well kept, great location. We like not being near the Boardwalk. Beach is gorgeous. Staff is very accomodating. Suites are pretty clean. We notice the hotel does update things every year. One year new tempurpedic beds, one year new furniture. This year we noticed the halls had new carpeting and wallpaper. We love that the SuperFresh market is right across the street. That's always the first stop upon arriving for breakfast and lunch goods. Always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Shady Staff...”
Reviews.Author: Jamie C
Reviews.Content: As we were about 2 hours into our trip back home, my 8 year old remember she left her ipod touch laying on the bed. I immediately called the hotel and was told that someone would look into it and call me back. About 2 hours later, I got a call back and she stated that security could not open up the safe and only the head of security was able to do so and that they would not be in until the following day. She reapetedly told me she would call me back first thing the next day and let me know if the ipod touch had been placed in the safe for safe keeping. Well, no phone call was ever recieved so I called again. I was put through to security where I left a message about my missing item and was told my this message that after 72 hours if there was no call that they did not find my missing item. About 2 days later, I called back being I knew right where the ipod touch was left. And once again, I will call you back with no return phone calls. Called a few more times requesting a supervisor/manager and was once even told that they must be running late because he was not in yet. Even left my name and number for someone to call me back. No return calls once again. I called again and asked for a manager/supervisor and spoke with Cathy. She stated that the staff is very honest and she just doesn't know where the ipod touch could be. She reassured me she would talk with security and that either she or someone from security would be calling me back that day by 5pm. Well, what do you know, never a return call (by now I had been dealing with this for over a week). After the 4th of July holiday, I called her back and she acted surpirsed that I never got a call back!? Just said, no, nothing was found. I find that rather odd. Never once did anyone say, well we checked with the housekeeper and she found nothing. NEVER! All I wanted was my daughers Christmas gift back. I know, shame on her for forgetting it but we did everything we could as soon as she remembered she had left it behind. For what you pay to stay here, you would think they would have honest people working there. I would NEVER recommend anyone to stay here and we will NEVER be back to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: Doreen D
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 9th to the 13th and this was our 1st time staying at this hotel. This was the best hotel I ever stayed at in Ocean City MD (and we've been coming here for over 25 years)! It was very clean (and I am very fussy). The bathroom was clean, the bed was comfortable and the corian counter tops were a nice feature. We enjoyed our stay and will recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Cassie G
Reviews.Content: My family truly enjoyed our long weekend in Ocean City at the Princess Royale. The beds were comfortable. The poolside suite was great. We could walk right out to the pool and game area and right out to the deck and beach. We all enjoyed our stay and will stay again. The prime rib and seafood buffet was superb.

Reviews.Title: “very nice for family”
Reviews.Author: pkcalderone
Reviews.Content: We had a walk out room to the pool, which was very nice. We left another hotel that was over priced, at a higher price, and 2 star quality. We had king bed w/ memory foam mattress. There was a pull out in the sitting area, and a kitchenette, with a full size fridge. There are cooking pans and dishes and a dishwasher. Decor was inviting, room was roomy. I very much enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a better time at Princess Royale July 2012”
Reviews.Author: Chris_From_Mich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 2-5th, 2012. When I made the reservation for a king sized bed ocean view suite, I called up the hotel and prepaid for the reservation. I was asked if there was "anything else they could do for me?". I replied that it was my daughters first time at the ocean and a room with a nice ocean view would be greatly appreciated if they could work that out. They said they would make a note of it. We arrived a couple of hour prior to official check in time, and was given a parking pass and told we could enjoy all of the hotels ammenities immediatly and to check back periodically to see if a room was available. No problem.....we're on vacation and enjoyed the access to the beach and pool. I did check back a few times at the front desk, and was told, based on our request for a room with a nice view of the ocean, that they didn't have a room that offered that view cleaned yet, and would i mind stopping back by in a little while. No problem. The staff at check in really worked to get us set up in a nice room with a good view of the ocean, just as we requested, and our daughter was tickled pink with the room and the view. We had a King suite with ocean view on the 5th floor. The room couldn't have been nicer for us. Great layout, plenty of room, awesome view, very clean, and my wife couldn't stop talking about how wonderful the temperpedic mattress was! It was very comfortable and so were the pillows. We set our two girls (6 & 1) up in the inner part of the suite on the pull out couch and our pack-n-play crib. It was nice to put them to bed and still be able to close the bedroom door and watch some tv or sit on the balcony and drink some wine. The room was very quiet and we never heard any noises or were bothered in our sleep. The beach and pool were very cool and we really enjoyed them both. On the beach, we had brought a little pop up cabanna with us, but we also rented a beach umbrella every day from Wills Beach Rentals right behind the hotel. an umbrella was $15/day. They also have chairs too, but we brought our own with us. The beach was great, but it we stayed during a heat wave so we went into the pool once in awhile to cool off from the heat. The pool was great for out young kids. My 6 year old put on her vest and snorkel and goggles on and spent hours swimming around the pool. The pool was nice. We ate dinner at Bull on the Beach twice because we enjoyed the food and service. It is located a block away from the hotel. We ate breakfast next door at the breakfast place (Lyton's, or something like that) and it was very good food and reasonably priced. We were at the hotel during the 4th of July, and there were spectacular fireworks at most of the hotels along the beach. It was very cool. One night they showed a movie on the beach, which my daughter really enjoyed. Check out was a breeze. We really enjoyed our family trip to Princess Royale, and look forward to coming back some day. We hope your stay is as enjoyable as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Akrogh
Reviews.Content: I stayed there based on the trip advisor reviews! Great value for money! Loved the convenience of the kitchenette. Great family friendly hotel. Loved the movie on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A T
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this resort for two nights in July. I can't say enough good things about this establishment. We stayed in a two queen bed cabana which had great ocean views. Initially, my family and I thought the palm trees would obstruct our view of the ocean. They did not. It was wonderful waking up every morning to such a stunning view. We enjoyed music played by a gentleman on the cabana level. He was awesome! The resort was clean. This is of great importance to my family and myself. The only negative was Schooners restaurant, the resort's restaurant on premise. The hostess did not notify the staff we were in the restaurant. We were about to leave. The staff gave their apologies and advised this was the hostess first day. Other than our wait in the restaurant, we loved the resort and look forward to planning our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Non-Existent”
Reviews.Author: Levy799
Reviews.Content: Room is average at best. Appliances and furniture is from 1970s/80s. Food is not good but the beach bar is good. The Staff is a mix. The Vallets and Bellhops are great the the room service, front desk, and especially Managers are horrible. It's understandable that issues may arise from staff but then you know you can take the issue to a Manager for resolution. This is not the case at Princess Royale. It became perfectly clear, why the front desk and room service staff believe they can treat the guest so poorly. Here are the details of my terrible stay and experience. Girlfriend and I checked in and paid in cash, however, we left a credit card on file for expenses as with any hotel you stay in these days. Somehow, the front desk managed to botch placing my CC on file and on the last day, when the gfriend and I ordered breakfast room service, the room service attendant demanded payment. We explained there is a CC on file and she left only to return a few minutes later and again, demanded payment. This time she was rude and implied we were trying to "rob" the hotel. Unbelievable. I called down to the front desk and spoke to Jasmine, who sounded like she was taking an order at a drive-thru McDonald's rather than answering a call routed to the Front Desk. She explained she could retrieve the card number on file and charge the service which was okay but then she make comments that there was no issue as though I shouldn't have called the front desk. When I explained there was an issue because we were disrupted during breakfast and also needed to pack and shower so we could check out; she started raising her voice - I simply hung up the phone because I'm not paying $350/night to have the staff yell at me. 10 minutes later, security and the Assistant Manager (Alroc, Alaric, something to that affect) are at my door knocking while I'm in the shower and the girlfiend is getting dressed. She didn't answer the knocks because she was naked and sure enough, they started entering the room but luckily, she finished dressing in time. Girlfriend let them know we would be down at checkout to take care of the issue. I contacted the same Assistant Manager, who reported Jasmine told him I cursed and called her a "B" which was an absolute lie. He did zero to resolve the issue and made it completely clear, he could not have cared less about what just occurred from the fact they failed to imprint my card at check-in, to the rude and demanding Room Service attendant, to the fact they tried entering the room while my gfriend was nude; all over $41.60. To boot, the room service took over an hour to arrive and was cold. Assistant Manager didn't care about that either and he refused to provide the General Manager's Name, which I later found out from the Vallet. I have never experienced such a horrible hotel stay. Please, do not ever stay at Princess Royale, you will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay - not as great as other reviewers are saying”
Reviews.Author: momofthreeMaryland
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that we are a family of 5 who go to Ocean City every summer. We have always stayed at Park Place on the boardwalk but because we were worried about the rain, we wanted a place with an indoor pool and this hotel fit the bill and had great reviews from here. As I write this review, this is our second day of a 5 day trip here at this hotel. Let me start with the pros. The room is large. There is a separate bedroom area so that's nice and the kids can go to bed early and my husband and I can do work or read. Second, Willie at the front desk was very nice and helpful and had a great attitude - easy to work with. Third, right on the beach and they offered Thursday night movie on the beach tonight and my kids loved it! Fourth, the pool is nice and big, especially for an oceanfront hotel, and my husband really enjoys the hot tub. Fifth, the shower has one of those drying lines you can pull out and we do like that - it is helpful. Now the cons: When we checked in to the hotel, the front staff was not very friendly and were not able to answer many of our questions (nor did they try) (again, except for Willie) - they seem hurried and could not be bothered and did not even smile. The hotel advertises that the rooms were renovated but the carpet looks old, the TV is old, the couches are old, and you can tell that many of the areas behind tables, in between beds, and next to the dresser were not cleaned (dirt, trash left there, spider webs) and a trash can is broken. I am a stickler for cleanliness and this did not fit my standards - Park Place, while smaller, was always super clean. In addition, the dresser and table tops still had sand on them from previous guests. The coffee mugs still had lipstick stains on them from previous guests. Second, the hotel advertises free WIFI but in the evenings, we could never get on - just too busy or the signal was poor and kicked us off. On vacation, normally we wouldn't need it so much but being in graduate school with exams and online assignments and my husband having deadlines, we were counting on on WIFI. Finally, the beds were not comfortable. My kids even noticed it and my husband's back hurt after one night of sleep. In addition, when we checked in, we wanted to use a coupon we had for free breakfasts. The coupon did not have any restrictions on it on its face and it even said to print it out. So I did print it out and brought it to the hotel, but it turns out that you had to click on it even more to find out the restrictions (but the coupon did not say anything about clicking on it more for restrictions - it just said to print it out). They did not honor the coupon, although the manager did give us a reduced rate on the room (which we appreciated). In general, it was okay. I don't think we will be coming back here, though. The best thing was that the rooms are bigger but other than that, I don't see why this hotel is "great." We are not thrilled with our stay here. Even my kids were iffy about this place.

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: wheelz51
Reviews.Content: great hotel, super clean, the staff was always cleaning something, the suite, was great we had a door between bed and couch area, loved it, for a beach hotel they did a great job keeping it clean, the only disapointment was the restraunt, we went for breakfast, the food line was not marked, so people were cutting, it was not organized, so next day we ate breakfast at, i think it was called lantins at 92nd, right next to our hotel, that place was 110%, service great home cooked food, awsome waitress,overall, we will be back great place to stay, lee nutting

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: beachbums87
Reviews.Content: Perfect when taking kids! It's beachfront and has an indoor pool when it's raining! Rooms are nice. Desk staff great at trying to accommodate needs of family. Even got upgraded once when the requested side by side rooms were unavailable. Garage parking. In area where it's not all highrises so the beach space is not so cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Roomy Suites, Perfect for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth C
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Ocean City, MD... was nervous booking a hotel online. Turned out GREAT, though! Princess Royale was perfect for our needs (two adults, two children, ages 6 & 8). The suite was roomy, with the bedroom area, bathroom, then kitchen and sitting area. This made it easy with the kids, preparing lunch / dinner, etc. Didn't have to eat out much because of the great kitchen. I thought the staff was very friendly. The maids were so flexible with our crazy schedule, too. Much appreciated. The beach is RIGHT there, and there's also an indoor pool that's a great option. Overall, I thought this hotel had everything we needed... and was worth the price. Looking at other hotels / motels in the area, it's one of the nicer quality ones on that stretch of beach, too. Thanks for a great stay! Hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBison
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and friendly staff. Room was clean and in good condition. Great view from Oceanfront room and full kitchen and sitting room in each unit. Lots of good restaurants in walking distance. My kids loved the location and large indoor pool. This was our third trip to the Princess. We will definitely be visiting the hotel again in the near future. Reasonable rates and nicer facility compared to similar hotels in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Suite Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeNEOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an extended weekend in early July 2012. The hotel is right on the beach and has a parking garage which is nice. The indoor pool/atrium is nice...especially if it rains or you need a break from the heat. I could see it being nice in cooler months too. I personally think they should add an outdoor pool too...they seem to have the room and they could probably capture some revenue from drinkers/snackers up there (as opposed to the beach). For the time of year, the prices were a not too bad. Overall the hotel was a little dated and could use some functional and aesthetic tweaks, but it was very clean and welcoming. The furniture and carpets in the rooms were in good condition, but the tile floors and walls could use a little attention (although they were clean). Beds (Tempur Pedic) were very comfortable. Staff was very helpful and courteous. We did not eat at any of the restaurants within the hotel, so I can't comment to the food. We also requested rooms next to some friends and they were able to accomodate without a problem. They also didn't have any issues extending us one extra day (and we could stay in our room). I would stay here again. If the prices were more reasonable for some of the newer hotels (Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn, Hilton), I might try one of those. However, for the price, location, service and cleanliness, the Princess Royale is a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: twobeaglefam
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped in the door, we found our stay wonderful-- people were helpful and friendly in the lobby..Our 2 bedroom condo was nothing short of amazing-- it was larger than I had imagined and had every amenity we could hope for...Our view was spectacular and we are looking forward to next year's trip!

Reviews.Title: “great time in OC”
Reviews.Author: jeff r
Reviews.Content: Really nice location, easy to get to everything, very friendly staff, would return tomorrow!!!!

Reviews.Title: “July 4th Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tammy T S
Reviews.Content: Checkin was quick and the person who checked us in was wonderful (I don't remember his name). Our room was ready early so we got to checkin early, which was great because the granddaughters (2 & 4 years old) were ready to relax after riding for 5-hours.The hotel was nice, the beds and pillows were wonderful. The room had a great oceanfront view and access to the beach was excellent. Schooner's food, service and quality were excellent. However there was one downfall to the entire room, the bathroom had a very strong urine smell. I will recommend Princess Royale to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel located right on the beach with numerous resturants and bars in walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: Copper8377
Reviews.Content: A great place to visit expecally on the off season you will live this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three generations girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: Joanne B
Reviews.Content: My daughter,granddaughter just returned from our first Girls weekend at Princess Royale. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the room/suite. We had an pool/ocean view and my granddaughter loved to sit on the balcony and 'watch' the pool (she is four). We arrived quite early for check-in,but were allowed to go ahead and use the parking garage and enjoy the beach until check in. They even gave us a number to call to check when room was ready so we could have fun until that time! the Bell service was extremely helpful with getting luggage to our room and taking it to the car upon departure and loading it! We plan to make Girls Week End a Tradition there!

Reviews.Title: “Definition of Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: W W
Reviews.Content: I am the owner of a small business in Pennsylvania, and I recently sent two of my best clients to the Princess Royale Resort in Ocean City, MD. The purpose of this trip was to see if this would be a suitable place for our yearly company retreats. These retreats are a token of my appreciation for their continued support and dedication to my organization. Without boring you with too much detail, here is a summary of the report from the 3 night stay at this hotel: -The room was very nice, however it smelled a bit musty (almost like stale cigarettes) and the furniture was out-dated. -The house-keeping staff did a very average job: the remote was under the covers when the bed was made, the coffee maker was not cleaned and replaced with new coffee for the next day, the coffee sat in the pot for the remainder of the trip (3 days) -The front desk staff was very helpful and were probably the most pleasant part of the stay -On more than one occassion, the valet staff were down-right rude and dis-respectful -When problems were brought to various managers' attention, they laughed and were un-willing to help resolve any problems -It was a contant reminder of the difference between a 2 and a 4 star hotel, this mistake will never be made again -After numerous occasions where the hotel was not performing up to expecations, my clients were ready to leave their vacation early. One of them even stated " I returned to my hotel room in tears, I was never so ready to leave an oceanfront Suite in my life!" We are in customer service for a living, so my staff knows what it means and what it takes to provide exceptional customer service. Imagine how disappointing it is to be treated exactly how you DON'T want to treat your own customers! It hurts! What a huge disappointment.. Even though I have no ties whatsoever to this hotel, it still reflects poorly on me, because I made the decision to send my best employees here to have what I hoped to be one of the best vacations they've ever taken. Now I can't take back their bad experience, I can only hope that the next place we decide to stay will be much better than this. I know many people and I have could have told them all about the great experience that was had at this hotel. Unfortunately, I will be telling them something very different, and this hotel will loose a great deal of business as a result of just a 3 night stay that turned out to be a disaster. When one makes a reservation at a hotel, you are patronizing that organization, you are pledging that you will stay at this hotel and you've chosen this particular hotel over the many other options that exist in such a close proximity. In return, one would expect that hotel to provide the guest with exemplary customer service, to make them feel as though they are the most imporant thing at that point in time, to make them want to return to the hotel time and time again. I must say that if the report from my clients were a good one, we were planning on taking a large group of 30+ people once a year to this hotel for a week at a time. Imagine how much money that would be for the hotel!! Now, however, there is no way we will ever give another dollar to this organization. You can not put a price on how someone feels when they are talked down to and mis-treated when they are choosing to stay there over any other hotel! My advice to you is that you do a lot of research before you make a reservation at this hotel. Read all of the reviews. If you do decide to stay there, I sincerely hope that your experience is better than one that was had by my employees. It was truely the definition of disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Soccer tourney trip”
Reviews.Author: lukezack25
Reviews.Content: Good for families. We were there for a soccer tournament in October. Kids enjoyed the beach and the indoor pool. Good location for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Misty G
Reviews.Content: My husband n I came early to the Hotel, we were planning on leaving our car in the parking garage n going to the beach until the 4:00 check-in. But, the friendly staff at the front desk let us check-in at 8:00a.m.. Which we were very pleased about. The room was very clean n smelled nice. Like it was a brand new room, which is a good feeling when walking into a room. The view from the room to the pool area was a pleasent view, we could tell that the hotel staff takes pride in their work in keeping the hotel in top shape. We had the bathroom light go out on us as soon as 30mins of being in the room. which was fixed within 15min of going to the front desk n telling someone. We thank you all for you courtesy n service. We found our perfect hotel in Ocean City. We will be coming back!!! Thank You Joe n Misty Perla

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ToniaPatt
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a great family vacation at the Princess Royale Resort. We stayed over the July 4th long weekend in an ocean front room on the 4th floor. Great view, great clean room. Lots of family activities. Walking distance to a supermarket, and to a decent family restaurant where we had breakfast each morning. The beach was huge and the ocean was wonderful. The hotel is a 15-20 minute drive from the Boardwalk. The hotel pool is just as it looks on the website, but we had too much fun at the beach, so never utilized the pool. I would say that the first floor pool rooms don't offer much privacy. We could see straight into people's rooms as we walked through the area. My only issues were 1) all of our key cards were deactivated before the end of our stay. I was told at the front desk that the cards were coded for the wrong departure date. The problem was quickly remedied, but it was a pain, as my entire family had to wait in front of the room wet and with all of our beach gear while I went to the front desk and waited on line for this to be fixed. 2) The bars on the balcony seemed a bit too far apart for my comfort concerning my 2 year old daughter. I was on edge every time she came out on the balcony, and it made me unable to fully relax while out there. I wish the bars were about two inches closer together, or that some sort of mesh was available that we could put up. (There may be, I didn't ask.) In any case, we had a wonderful time, and are already considering another OC vacation. We will definitely visit Princess Royale again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of value for the price”
Reviews.Author: UH60guy
Reviews.Content: On a last minute decision to take a quick trip to Ocean City we decided to stay at the Princess Royale. Their website offered a sort of "hidden special" when you searched for a room. This brought the price down to a very reasonable cost. Overall I am very sastified with our stay and I usually stay at Hilton type hotels. Pros: - Cost was very reasonable for a hotel located right on the beach - Overall quality and size of the room were great - Cleanliness of beach property was above average IMHO - Free parking - Temperpedic beds were awesome (however my wife didn't like them) Cons: - Front desk is a little slow and understaffed - Elevators are very very slow, faster to take stairs - congested entrance - No continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Momoko76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a weekend trip to the beach. We live in VA and work in DC so it's about a 3-hour drive from the city. I reserved the Princess Royale because we are not the biggest fans of motels, inns etc, also I work in a Hotel in DC so being aware of what could be found in a Hotel room, decided to go with the full service bit more expensive one. They are very highly priced I have to admit but it is peak season so, good for them. The Hotel is definitely not worth $289 per night (this was our daily rate), it should be reasonally priced around $209-229 to be honest. The location is awesome, right off the beach, a 2-minute walk. Loved it! The Hotel room is large, has a living room and a separate bedroom. The furnishing is a bit outdated, sofa had holes in it, but who cared, we did not spend much time on it. The small kitchen area was well-equipped, silverware, plates, glasses and a full fridge. Very handy. There is an in-room coffee maker whcih made me very excited, unfortunately the coffee brewed was horrible, some cheap kind. The bathroom is spacious, had enough towels, not enough toilet paper. The bedroom had Tempurpedic mattress, very very comfortable. We also had a small balcony, teh view is a bit disappointing, if you see a room with a side view, it is literally a side-view, meaning you must lean over the rail to see the water. Don't bother paying more, you don't get more. If there are no ocean-view rooms available, just settle with the regular run-of-house. Don't waste your money on extra hoping to get a view, there is none. We decided to try the restaurant's breakfast buffet, just skip it if you can. Eggs are made out of the powdered thing, taste horrible, bacon is burnt, watermelon was too ripe and a bit sour. We ordered an omelet a la carte - it was so greasy, we could not finish. $50 wasted on bad food. Such a shame. Overall, we loved the Hotel and would definitely return, love the location, free parking, (valet if you can, it is only $6 a night, we are used to $42 in DC!!!!!!) beach at the doorstep. We enjoyed every minute of our trip, thank you Princess Royale!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place for families!”
Reviews.Author: Aprilandtimgates
Reviews.Content: Honestly I was a little worried after I booked this place and read some of the reviews posted on here. IT WAS GREAT!! Im not sure what some of the people who wrote these negative reviews were expecting. It is perfect for families! It was clean, perfect location, house keeping was great, the beach was clean, and the price wasn't over the top. We have stayed in other places that weren't as fun or as nice for more money in the same area. THERE ARE NO BED BUGS! WHOMEVER SAID THAT DID IT IN SPITE I THINK! We didn't eat at the resteraunt or order room service so I have no review of the food. Parking was good. Kids loved the pool. It wasn't a " chlorine dome " as someone put it. It didn't smell. It was clean. The only thing I would like to see improved would be the carpeting in the rooms. They are worn and dated. The air conditioner was not working as well as I would have liked it, it was cooler in the atrium than in our room sometimes. I WOULD GO BACK ( however it took us years to save up lol!) but that tells you right there it wasn't a waste of money. I'm a mother of a six year old boy and four year old girl from a middle class family and it was more than great for us! Don't let those negative comments affect your decision to stay here! I don't have any affiliation to this place and this is an honest review from a mom from Rochester, Ny!

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale made us feel like royalty...”
Reviews.Author: MarciaEKS
Reviews.Content: I love this facility. Every aspect of the service and facility are exceptional. Everyone went out of there way to make us comfortable and feel welcome...

Reviews.Title: “At long last, we found our "go to" spot”
Reviews.Author: SmittyBelAir
Reviews.Content: We live only a few hours from OC, so we visit at least once a year for a 2 or 3 night stay. We have stayed in many hotels in OC over the years...some good, some not so good. There is that moment when you put the key in the lock and open the door to your room, and you are wondering what will be on the other side. Well, our room at the pricess royale did not disappoint. You can tell they have put in the extra work in making the rooms nice, given the wear and tear that beach hotels can take. Very clean room, granite topped counters and furniture, large refrigerator, with a cooking surface, sink, coffee maker. Carpet didn't look brand new, but was clean as well. Shower, curtain, etc...clean clean clean. Given that the room has a separate bedroom and living area with a pull out couch, it was perfect for us and our 6 year old daughter. Indoor pool and atrium were a welcome break from the sand and sun at the beach to end the day. This is a very family friendly place, but also had ammenities adults enjoy...Outdoor gazebo/bar overlooking the dunes and the surf. Cant beat it. Staff was very friendly as well. Granted some of the hotel is a bit "stuck in the 80s", lobby, decor, etc...but, again, was fine. I'm sure they will update that at some point. As others have said, the parking garage is tight, but since real estate is a premium in OC, I would rather deal with that and have a lovely indoor pool area to relax in. Also, the price...we went Sunday through Wed, and the price was very reasonable for the quality of the room. We will defintiely be back.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome convention setting”
Reviews.Author: farmgirl46
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Princess Royale for an annual convention for over 10 years. It is wonderful to have everything under one roof. The meeting rooms are wonderful, the room accommodations with all suites is outstanding. It is wonderful to be able to bring food in or to bring leftovers from a restaurant and be able to refrigerate and cook. It has spoiled me and miss those amenities at most other fine hotels. Will enjoy being back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Happy holiday”
Reviews.Author: eileen65
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have brought our grandchildren to this resort. It is ideally placed, right on the beach, so no worries about traffic when the children rush outside. The staff were extremely welcoming and accommodating when we arrived early. You have access to all aspects of the resort when you arrive early and can also have them after checkout time which is much appreciated by children who do not live anywhere near the sea. The hotel was clean and the beds extremely comfortable. We had breakfast and dinner in our room and picnics on the beach at other times. We had our mandatory visit to Assateague, which is nice and close. We had one stormy day and having the ability to go inside and use the pool is a big plus when travelling with family. We prefer the fact that this resort is north of the boardwalk and therefore quieter. We would certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Kate195202
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our vaca. What impressed us the most was the cleanliness of our room and the entire hotel. From the lobby to the hallways to the restaurant were always spotless. Kudos to the housekeeping staff!! Also, the mattresses were extremely comfortable and perfect for a great nights sleep. The staff was always smiling and helpful with directions, etc.. We did have a wifi connection problem in our room. When we reported it, we were immediately offered an upgrade room (which we declined because of our view and the connection was fixed in an hour). Room 474 is completely worth the money. Ocean front views with a side balcony and king size bed. We slept with the sliding doors open and the screens across so we could hear the ocean all night.When we noticed that the kitchen was short utensils, housekeeping IMMEDIATELY replaced what we needed.We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: hillg424
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time. Great hotel to stay with kids. If it rains, the indoor swimming pool is great to entertain the kids. The restaurant and bar is nice also. Highly recommend staying here. The staff is very polite & help you if you need something. Great family oriented location on the beach. The hotel is very clean & well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Family”
Reviews.Author: dottie78
Reviews.Content: Our family always stay at this hotel. Every room is a suite so you know you have two seperate rooms for kids and adults. So many amenties and a private beach. It's away from the hustle of downtown ocean city but close enough to everything. Since there is a small kitchen ( no stove just stove top and microwave w/ fridge). There is a grocery store across the street and another one down the road. Everything and andything you need is just steps outside of the hotel especially for families. Friendly staff and a comfortable place to stay families. We always love staying here. Our kids love that the pool and the beach is a hop and skip away from each other. When they get tired the hotel is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: BuddFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale Resort recently and had the best vacation ever! Being with family was great but having the pleasure of staying right on the beach was even better. The staff at the Princess was very friendly and helpful at all times and the rooms were very nice and clean. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have slept in while on vacation. Checking in and out was a breeze! The Hotel is located at the quiet end of the beach which is an added plus. This was our fifth year vacationing in Ocean City and our fourth year staying at Princess Royale Resort. No need to look around to try other hotels, the Princess Royale Resort will be our family's permanent vacation spot in Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families; a good buy on short notice!”
Reviews.Author: MomandTwoTeens
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeknights in late June and had an oceanfront double queen room on the second floor. I was concerned about noise from below, but that wasn't an issue. Guests were quiet and well-behaved (that says a LOT about management!! as many Ocean City hotels are party places). Palm trees did partially block the ocean view, but the palms blowing in the breeze, the nice little lawn (with bunnies hopping across) and dunes beyond the lawn were pleasant to watch. Our double queen room was a suite with small coffee maker, full refrigerator, small two burner electric stove and small dishwasher. Decent glass dishware, so-so flatware, very basic cooking utensils and two pans. If you plan to do a lot of cooking and object to scratched, old non-stick cookware, bring your own pots and pans, and you'll need cutting board, good knife for cutting. Otherwise the kitchen was really handy and allowed us to save money and manage food allergies by cooking all of our own meals. The living room furniture was on the old side but no odors; likewise, the carpet was on the older side -- however, the room was very clean, the beds were clean and super comfortable (Tempurpedic!) and the bathroom was clean and in very good condition. Having easy access to the beach was delightful. Every staff person we encountered was friendly and helpful; no unpleasant employees whatsoever. Guests in the hallways and other public areas were well-behaved; no late-night noise. A good place for families, the best place I found for the price and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: GAG39
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted with bellboys and the offer of valet parking. The hotel is very beautiful, clean, great staff, and wonderful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: nina a
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for 4 days...it was beautiful..a very family enviorment....we had an oceanview suite on the 2nd fl.. which i recomend to ask for a higher fl..because the palm trees block the ocean view.very quiet n the room service n cleaning ppl were great...we are definetely staying there again...if your planning on taking groceries which we did they provide silverware,pots and pans,plates n cups...

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel staff in ocean city.”
Reviews.Author: Magicmanpete
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale ocean side is the finest hotel value in north ocean city. The hotel treats its customers like royalty. They operate to please and their staff is the best. Compliments to Diane, the hotel manager for a wonderful vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travis B
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 kids had a good time here. Very easy to get around and beach front. My kids loved the indoor pool and had a nice beach out front. There is a chair/umbrella rental right in front which was handy. We did not eat here as we like to try different spots. The oceanview room still had a good view of the ocean. it was nice to have a kitchenette as i think we will never go without one now. The only downfall is the room was quite outdated as in the carpet and kitchen cabinets. The first pull of the bottom of the cabinet and it fell off. Someone superglued 2 pieces of wood together. I am not a maintenance person but i know better than that. The maid service was very good and they even did my dishes for me. The room was very clean. The shower needed updated. I dont understand the use of a generic shower head that blasts water soo hard it hurts and the tub faucet ran at the same time as the stop was broken. no big deal except when i had to wash my daughters feet and she was getting blasted from the shower head. Other than that I am considering coming back in august as we had an easy time here. Thats good because we usually try a different place everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week”
Reviews.Author: pam p
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel on the beach. Very clean rooms and a super staff. Love the pool and the food at the restaurant is really good. The beds are so comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend visit with family”
Reviews.Author: ndnzfan
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights with family at this resort. The room was clean and more than enough space for a family of 4. We stayed on the 2nd floor that opened up into the atrium area. Easy access to the pool and the beach from here. The staff went above and beyond what was expected of them. One of my sons had an accident and some injuries while there, and the staff handled the situation with great care and compassion. Thanks Princess Royale for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation and Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Fmly-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice Facility on the beach. A nice pool with a good sun deck off the beach. Restaurant for a wedding was very nice. great food, and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Kara D
Reviews.Content: My fiance just came back from a 2 night stay at the Princess Royale. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a two bedroom oceanfront condo with a balcony! The room was very clean and spacious. It had a refrigerator, stove, and microwave. At the Tiki Bar outside, the bartender, Daniel, was great! Super nice! We definitely will stay here again! Also, Layton's for breakfast and lunch is delicious located beside the hotel and Lombardi's pizza across the street. There is also a Super Fresh across the street which is super convenient!!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CoCoPulaski
Reviews.Content: We came in for a few days of rest and relaxation. The hotel exceeded our expectations. We had a pool/ocean view king room. Wow!!! We loved it. The room was beautiful and the view was so awesome. I felt like we were on a cruise ship, everywhere we walked. The housekeeping staff were so PROMPT and so thorough. Whatever we needed they immediately responded to our request. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. We may have found a new spot for all of our anniversaries to come.

Reviews.Title: “Night Away in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Jerelissa
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I recently stayed at the Princess Royal just to get away. We were pleased with the hotel overall from the check-in to the room, room service, and check-out and because staying mid-week the, rate was reasonable. We stayed in a room overlooking the pool and had a beautiful view of the ocean through the pool area's glass wall. The room was clean and sizable with a mix of newer and older appliances (there was a kitchen sink, dishwasher, and microwave with plates and utensils).The bed had a temperpedic mattress. The service was friendly at the desk and the room service breakfast we ordered was under 30 dollars after all fees and tips. The food was nothing spectacular, but a full meal prepared by someone else with no clean up is nice. The hotel has an outside sunning deck and grass area and its own personal access to the public beach. There were small bars in the pool and outside next to the beach access (nice even mid-week). All in all, we had a good time and were pleased with the service. Has a feel a a decade or two old but would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Pbnix1313
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place! The front desk staff is so great with getting you into your room early! We drove to OC MD on Tuesday afternoon in the pouring down rain with the hoping to get to the hotel and hopefully being able to check in early. We booked on reg side ocean view room for Tues night and a 2bd/2ba condo for the Wed thru Sat . We asked the front desk staff if there was anyway we could possibly get into the condo instead of the reg room only because we had so much stuff being that we have a three year old and everyone knows how it is with packing with children. I was hoping they would give me a deal only because I didn't want to pay a lot more because we paid off the room allready. The front desk supervisor just clocked out for the day and she took time to help us anyway and got us into the condo at no additional cost. This was wonderful and just so nice of her to stop and help us figure out our reservation. What a great start to our vacation considering the horrible rainfall all the way for our home to OC MD. The condo was so awesome and had everything we needed. And it was so clean and the maids were so wonderful! I can't complain at all about this hotel! Anything you needed they got for you! Our ice maker was broken in our room and they tried to fix it but meanwhile they sent up ice for us. It was just an overall awesome vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: beach_2384
Reviews.Content: The oceanfront room was not nearly as nice as we expected. I'm shocked it got so high a rating on here! We had to call "engineering" to the room three times in our three-night stay; once was for a whistling balcony door that sounded like a teapot whistling (they fixed it); another was for a flickering light and drip in the bathroom ceiling--they fixed the light and thought the drip was from an above room. We didn't see water again so I guess it was fixed? The final and worst time was when the (unattractive) plastic grate in the bathroom that was removed to look at the aforementioned problems came crashing down at 1:30am, waking us up and terrifying us with the noise. It turned out the plastic grate was already broken--plastic was snapped--and wasn't put up properly after the earlier visit. When I asked if it's fine to just shimmy the broken piece back up into the same spot I was told that it was broken before and it would be fine. NOT A GOOD RESPONSE! In terms of the overall appearance, the bedroom furniture and mattresses were nice but the carpets were old, the living area was severely outdated, and the shower "head" was more like a pipe without an actual head attached. The water pressure, as a result, was uneven and the water itself was prickly on the skin. If you're into a quiet place, this wasn't it either. There were two weddings held right below the oceanfront rooms in the grass area and thus there was music playing throughout the day. Some people won't mind that, but it interrupted the serenity of the ocean. I would NOT stay here again. Our room was falling apart--literally--and it was so far from the boardwalk that the ocean view didn't make up for all it was lacking. I'm used to staying in bargain hotels so was excited to try this one, but I've never had so many problems during one stay.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovey9298
Reviews.Content: Brandon at the front desk was amazing! Great customer service despite being very busy. He was the nicest person I ran into my entire stay. I called prior to arrival and spoke to Olga, she would not allow any early check in's unless you book directly with the hotel. In fact, it seems they will not budge on anything unless you book directly with them. If you book with a 3rd party vendor like I did (Ocean City's webiste) FORGET IT or any other options. (Check in is at 4pm, check out 11am). Luggage carts are only available to carry your items to your room if you use their bell boy (extra $$). Linda at the pool bar, started rolling her eyes and throwing a fit infront of customers becuase a little girl wanted her .50 in change! Infront of everyone she yelled you need to learn how to tip girls! Poor thing didnt know what to do and walked away without her money and her head down... all over .50! The food/beverage manager did seem geniune and concerned and had me take her a free drink. This hotel is definatley in need of some updates. I am not sure they have put any money into it since it was built. We paid for an ocean view was along the side of the hotel. The only way you could see the ocean is if you stand at the very tip of the balcony to me, it was not worth the extra money. Beach chair rentals are from 7-10$ a day. The rooms were big and quiet and bed was comfy. The beach was also nice. The pool was great. Overall, for the money, I doubt I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “st patty's day soccer tournement”
Reviews.Author: Anita L
Reviews.Content: this was the third year in a row that my family booked at the princess royale. This hotel/condo is just the most awesome place that we have ever been to and we have traveled to a lot of resorts in our 27 years of marriage. The staff are so accommodating and gracious that whenever we go to the Ocean, this is the only place we call first!!! and end up staying!!! Again, the staff is awesome, the rooms are awesome and the indoor swimming pool is always clean and an enviting place for our family. WE always have a great time and can't wait go go there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momwith2boys_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Princess Royal the second week in June 2012, family of four, 2 adults and 2 kids (ages 8 and 9). We had a one bed room kitchenette and we were very comfortable. The room had 2 queen beds, a full sized refrigerator , dishwasher and all the utensils we needed to cook. Having a kitchen helped with the cost of meals. There is a supermarket within walking distance. We were able to have breakfast and lunch in the room and ate dinners out. The beds were very very comfortable. I slept on the sleep sofa one night, its a sleep sofa, they are never comfortable, but I have slept on worse. The air conditioner in the room does not have a thermostat so the room got too cold for me at night, then you had to turn it off and it got warm. The beach was very, clean and outside is an umbrella' rental stand. A life guard station is right on the hotel beach as well so we felt very comfortable with the kids being in the water while we sat nearby on the beach. Take your own beach towels for the beach as you cannot use the hotels towels. Having an indoor pool was a life savior as we has a couple of rainy, windy days, and the ocean was chilly. The pool was always staffed although there is no lifeguard at the pool. The hotel was nice and quiet. There was ample parking. The staff were all very friendly. We had one negative experience at the hotel restaurant the one night we went there for dinner. Although they were not crowded we waited quite a while to be seated, then we waited quite a while at our table and several wait staff walked by our table, but no one ever came to serve us so we walked out. Overall, everything else at the hotel was great, and we would definitely return. It was nice being away from the broad walk, the hotel guest and beach and surrounding area was more family focused which was wonderful. My boys loved being able to walk out to the beach, and both enjoyed the pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation. Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: MaryL0u12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale in a cabana room. Great room, resort, amenities. The staff could not have been more accommodating. I am looking orward to returning here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for beach lax”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: Very nice and comfortable. Close to everything I needed

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: mdhi2007
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year we stayed at this hotel and I still think it's great for families. They have a nice size kitchenette, room was clean, big and we had a great view of the ocean. They had a decent size indoor pool and with very easy access to the beach. The decor was a little out dated. The only reason why I didn't give them a 5 was because the A/C didn't work on our last day and the buffet wasn't that good. The items they had for the buffet seemed limited. However, the wait staff was wonderful. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Check in was quick, but I think that will depend on what time of the day you go. Overall, it's a great family hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love staying at the Princess royale”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Princess royale every year since 2006 we love this beautiful resort, it has everything you could want . If you love the beach your only a few steps away from it. The pool is to die for largest I have ever been in.If you are looking for a great place to vacation you can't go wrong with this beautiful Hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Resort..”
Reviews.Author: Lolo b
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely accommodating and a perfect fit for me and my family. Everything we needed was at our fingertips, from entertainment to personal care. It was located in a great area of OC, by near shops, restaurants and entertainment. If you're looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay with the family or for an adults only trip, this is the PERFECT hotel to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: Moose21014
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very nice, spacious, and clean. I had not complaints about the hotel itself other than a few hidden fees. In their boiler plate contract, hidden in page 2 is a clause stating that...by signing below you agree to paying the $1.50 + tax for the in room safe. Who has ever really read through ALL portions of a hotel rental agreement? I brought this to the clerk's attention, they need to advice people that there is an additional charge. No answer. this charge is minimal but it was the principle of the matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in OC”
Reviews.Author: Queenie76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and was a great value for Ocean City in June. Close to many great food locales and right on the beach. Rooms were in relatively newer condition and surprisingly quiet considering the hotel was full. We were there for a lacrosse tournament and the hotel was maxed with families but check in and out was seamless. Only recommendation would be more parking. Thx for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Betty O
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, the staff is great and very friendly.They bend over backwards to make sure you have everything you need. The place is spotlessly clean and maintence is ongoing.The food in the restaurant is very good and reasonably priced. Parking is not a problem with valet parking, just drop off you car and when you need it again it is there right away. From the time you check in till check out, you are well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Val H”
Reviews.Author: Arvella H
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel... Enjoy my suite..... Wish they had activities for children. In addition, I was under the impression there was an outside pool.... What a let down; however, I enjoyed my stay.... Staff were professional......

Reviews.Title: “Our very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Judy P
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend the staff at your hotel. My husband and I stayed last weekend and were very pleased with your hotel in general.The young lady who checked us in, Jordan Ammerman, was very friendly and helpful. We were checked in, given our room cards within minutes of our arrival. Our room was very spacious and clean. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal -- best place to stay & play in Ocean City, Maryland!”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are regular guests at the Princess Royale Oceanfront Resort on 91st Street and Coastal Highway in Ocean City, Maryland. Having stayed at numerous other O.C. hotels over the years, Princess Royale has become our “Home Away from Home.” We would not think of staying at any other hotel (including Hilton Suites Ocean City Oceanfront, rated the #1 hotel on TripAdvisor.com). Today (June 4) is our 19th wedding anniversary. What do you think I got my husband for an anniversary gift? An upcoming 3-day weekend stay at Princess Royale, of course! My husband thought this was the best anniversary gift ever. We are very excited about our upcoming trip. It’s been over 2 months since our last stay at Princess Royale, and we miss the resort, its comfort, spectacular oceanfront view and all the great amenities. It’s beyond me why anyone would shell out such big bucks to stay at Hilton Suites, when you can get such great deals/rates and a comparable suite and amenities at Princess Royale. We’ve stayed at the O.C. Hilton Suites numerous times in the past, but no more! You could not ask for anything more in an O.C. resort hotel than what Princess Royale has to offer. All clean and well-appointed rooms are “Suites” (Queen or King beds/some with in-room Jacuzzi’s); spacious living room (Queen sleeper sofa); full/furnished kitchen with all the appliances (granite kitchen counters/table); granite bathroom vanities for all your toiletries (which I love); and Tempur-Pedic mattresses (the most highly recommended bed in America). After our first stay at Princess Royale, I went out and purchased a Tempur-Pedic which is the most comfortable bed in which I have ever slept. We always bring our laptop computer and the in-suite wireless high-speed Internet has great connectivity. The suites have two phones and two remote-controlled cable TVs (32” LCD flat-screens). All rooms have a private balcony, electronic in-room safe and the entire property is “smoke-free.” There is also a nice oceanfront art-deco restaurant on the hotel property. In addition, a multi-level parking garage is located just across from the front lobby. Speaking of lobby, both the front and side lobbies are beautifully decorated. A gift shop and small convenience store are both located in the lobby. As in my past Princess Royale TripAdvisor reviews, I’ve saved the best for last – the Atrium with Olympic-size swimming pool and large Jacuzzi. We’re not talking a small swimming pool as with some other O.C. hotels such as the Courtyard by Marriott or The Dunes Manor. This is the real-deal. No matter what the weather or time of the year, you can enjoy the fantastic swimming pool and Atrium at Princess Royale. Oh, did I mention that the O.C. Hilton Suites does not have an indoor Jacuzzi in the swimming pool area? There are also two pool-side sauna’s, a seasonal indoor pool bar and lots of arcade games and machines for the children inside the Princess Royale Atrium. If desired, you can book a suite with a pool/Atrium view. For those businesses looking for meeting space, one-half of the Atrium can accommodate business luncheons and even wedding receptions! In addition, just outside the Atrium is a large oceanfront deck with two small Jacuzzi’s. Okay, I’m giving away my best secret here – the package deals at Princess Royale. During off-season, the resort offers deals in which you get a free night if you stay on a certain day of the week such as a Friday (Thursday free) or Saturday (Sunday free). Yes, that’s right – a free night! What other O.C. hotel offers such a great deal? There are numerous summer vacation package deals in which guests also receive either a free night, or 50%-off room, free breakfast buffet and even gasoline coupons to help get you to Ocean City, Maryland. Just check the website at: www.princessroyale.com for all the details and vacation packages. Another great aspect of Princess Royale is that during off-season, based on availability you may receive a free upgrade on your accommodations (i.e., oceanview to oceanfront). You might even be lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the 30 magnificent and spacious two and three-bedroom condominiums on the property. No other O.C. hotel is this generous in upgrading guest accommodations. So, take it from us – Princess Royale is the place to stay while vacationing in Ocean City, MD, or just enjoying a long 3-day weekend or holiday. This resort blows away the competition and their rates for comparable accommodations cannot be beat. As one who has been going to O.C. all my life and stayed at numerous hotels – Princess Royale has become our #1 top choice. Oh, there’s a SuperFresh grocery store just across Coastal Highway from the hotel. What more can a traveler ask for in an Ocean City, Maryland, hotel or motel? The hotel property and garage have also recently undergone major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tashtone149
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Princess Royale from for the Memorial day weekend. We had three 3 rooms all side view ocean suites. The rooms were clean very clean the beds were very comfortable. (i was afraid to stay here based on some of the reviews on trip advisor, im glad we stayed) The staff was very nice at check in the hotel even provides complimentary bellman (of course I gave him a tip). Only gripe I had was that if we returned late parking was very hard to find, actually there was no parking in the garage no big deal as they have an overflow lot in the super fresh supermarket, but I chose to do valet parking as it was late. Beach was right out the back door and was easily accessible. The pool area was nice, I wish there would have been a kiddie pool for the little ones as 3 feet was a bit deep for them. Second night in town we had Higgins for dinner which was not the best. The next day I was on a search for some fresh crabs and came across Leo's Seafood on 139th street and Coastal Hwy. it was truly the best steam crabs I have ever had. It was not a glitzy place but the crabs were great.

Reviews.Title: “good location but need work”
Reviews.Author: princesskelly
Reviews.Content: We checked in for the Memorial weekend and we were given Suite 505. Immediately we noticed that the flat screen TV in the bedroom was not working. We called to the front desk. It took about an hour for someone to come up. It turned out the TV was broken. The technician took the TV off the wall and replaced it with an old huge TV. Next, I spotted a deadbug that was matted on the white sheet. I called the front desk and they sent someone up to change the sheet. We then opened the sofa bed up at night, I notice fresh blood on the mattress and the otherside had large spot of discoloration and black moles growing. That was yucky. The last item is the faucet in the bathroom tub separated from the tub once the water is turned on with high pressure. The bottom line is the location is great, the management needs to check the units after the rooms are clean for quality control. We paid a hefty price per night, we expect a more up to date room and everything should work.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Definitely Worthy of Return Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very busy OC weekend - Cruisin' Weekend! The staff couldn't have been more pleasant - from the valet to the front desk to the staff just passing by. The room was great - no complaints - and the restaurant was good. We had breakfast there our last day, and spent some time at the bar the evening before. Bartender was excellent - so was the entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Moriah C
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a girls weekend there for memorial day. None of us had ever been to Ocean City and we will definitely be back! We arrived late on Friday night and were told our room had been upgraded to a condo! Can we say psyched? The room was fabulous- it had two bedrooms, two baths and a full kitchen and living room with an oceanfront balcony. The staff were all great and the room was immaculate. The beach was quiet and beautiful and the pool was clean and a perfect temp. We loved everything about our room and would recommend this place for anyone going to Ocean City whether it's with your family or with your friends. It's a must!

Reviews.Title: “Bad taste in my mouth”
Reviews.Author: Clyde F
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through a third party (Booking.com) for an Oceanfront king room and received a king room facing 92nd street not the beach as I paid for. I was told several different explainations by a clerk who I found out later to be the manager. First a 3rd party booking isn't for the Oceanfront room, then was told my reservation was for the room I received then she checked again and saw that my reservation stated Oceanfront and that there were no more available even though I was there several hours before checki-in time. I was then told to check back the next day to see if one was available and if it was would I be willing to move but the next day no one contacted me to say if there was a room available or not, even though I had another clerk put it the commenstand send the manager the message to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: Sheril M
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently visted Ocean City for the first time. We stayed at the Princess Royale Resort and the stay was remarkable!!! The staff was very friendly, the resort was in a great location and the suite was very clean and roomy. The children really enjoyed the large indoor pool and arcade...I highly recommend Princess Royale for your next family get away

Reviews.Title: “Nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: Angel S
Reviews.Content: We hadn't come to Ocean City, MD for 16 years because frankly I felt the beach and the hotels were sorely lacking the last few times we visited. So imagine my surprise last summer when we took our two teenagers down to the beach just for one day and found the boardwalk and beach much cleaner and nicer than I remember. We had such a nice day last Augus.t that we decided to come down for the Memorial Day weekend this year. I searched the internet and found the Princess Royale. I was glad it had an indoor pool because we would still have pool access if it had been a rainy weekend. Luckily we had beautiful weather and thoroughly enjoyed the beach and the ocean and the pool! We have two teenagers but still had plenty of room in the pool view/2 queen room with a pull out sofa and kitchen. We also enjoyed the balcony overlooking the pool area/atrium and could even see through the glass to the ocean. My daughter and I even found some nice deals in the nice (but small) gift shop. The beds were extremely comfortable and the housekeeper even did our breakfast dishes the first morning. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Get A Way”
Reviews.Author: eleister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a short break from our busy daily lives and we can always relax and refresh ourselves at the beach. We Checked in on Tuesday, May 22nd and departed on Thursday, May 24th to avoid the Memorial Day Weekend crowds. The beach was very peaceful and the water clean and quite warm for this early in the season. We hit some of the nice restaurants and had room service for breakfast. The breakfast came promptly and was hot and delicious. We enjoyed it on our ocean front balcony watching the ocean and the gulls. This is just a great hotel to stay in with a parking garage and the largest indoor pool in OC. We were sorry to leave but left refreshed and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “The most honest review you'll ever read...”
Reviews.Author: josephandkari
Reviews.Content: There were many mixed reviews of the Princess Royale, so we decided to write one which was current, true and the most informative possible. We just left, having spent Friday and Saturday of this Memorial Weekend. Once we were able to check into our room on Friday around 3:00 p.m., we were pleasantly suprised by its size. We stayed in an ocean/pool view one bedroom king. It was very clean, had separate living room, dinette, full kitchen from the sleeping area. Our balcony overlooked the pool area. The first thing I must mention is that the pool area DID NOT HAVE A BAD SMELL. It smelled like a chlorinated pool should smell and it was in NO WAY overwhelming. Everything in our room was clean -- no molds, no smells, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. There was a bedroom door, which when closed, gave an excellent noise barrier to anything going on in the hall. We were never disturbed by hall noise and heard only one loud door closure during our entire trip. Now, I must say that there are cheaper rooms available at the Princess Royale, however, they are actually attached to the parking structure which faces Coastal Highway and is across from the main structure. I would venture to guess that any bad experiences may actually have come from staying in these rooms. Even for a value, I would not recommend them. The pool is fairly large, with an inside jacuzzi, two outside jacuzzis and two hot saunas. The hours of the pool were strictly regulated from 10am to 10pm. This meant no late noise from partiers and even the noise during normal hours was very reasonable, and when we had the TV on, you couldn't even hear it. The beach access was literally right out the back door, and five steps from the path was a beach umbrella and chair rental company. For $35 plus tip, we got a large beach umbrella and two fully reclinable beach chairs for the day set up for us. That was such a great convenience so we didn't have to put sandy equipment in our nice car. Please note that you cannot remove towels from the rooms or from the pool area to use at the beach so please remember to bring your own!!!! Although it was a busy weekend, we never felt really crowded on the beach and the sand was soft and clean. Our only negative comments are regarding their breakfast buffet and the parking situation. For such a nice hotel, which had been recently renovated and looked nearly brand new, the buffet was SEVERELY disappointing and grossly overpriced. It was sold as only $9.95, however, our juice and coffee, which we assumed was included, cost an additional $5.90 each. The eggs were dry, the sausuage was EXTREMELY greasy, and they only had melons as fruit, some dry breads and muffins and a few kinds of cereal. Knowing what I know now, I will go across the street to the Super Fresh grocery store and get food to cook myself, which is what we did for lunch -- making turkey sandwiches and bringing water and powerade in our cooler to the beach. Also, there is a Burger King and McDonalds a short distance up the street. We chose that for our Sunday breakfast, and that was less than half as much and left us just as full. When we checked in, we were given a parking pass and told that only hotel patrons could park in their structure, however, we found over half the cars had no passes and parking was pretty sparse. We always found a spot, even if it was close to the top, but we felt that the attention paid towards making sure that their guests had a place to park was lacking. Would we go back again? ABSOLUTELY!! In fact, we are coming back in September, and have asked for our same room on the fifth floor once again, as it fit our needs perfectly and was a fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “lousy and way too expensive.....”
Reviews.Author: na n
Reviews.Content: staff was fair, except maids, they were very disturbing and noisey. unprofessional...this place is way overpriced and inconvenient to smokers.... way too pricey and noisey. elevators and parking not good accomidations at all unless you're loaded with cash for any kind of services....bellman were fair. checkout desk unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “4 day getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: LenoreB1117
Reviews.Content: We started our vacation on a Wednesday evening, just jumped in the truck and started to drive! We headed for sand and once we passed the Delaware Beaches I began to search online for accommodations in Ocean City, MD. Princess Royale came up when I requested Romantic Hotels in OC, MD. I completed the online reservation process, and we reached the hotel with 1/2 hour of confirmation. What a pleasant surprise, the pictures online do not do this facility justice! Our room was sparkling clean with a fabulous view of the ocean along with a side balcony facing the pool deck. The in room jacuzzi was a real bonus and we thoroughly enjoyed this extra treat. Our room was spacious and the hotel was very quiet, even considering that it was Cruisin Week in town. I cannot compliment the staff enough on their welcoming and accommodating attitudes. With an upcoming busy weekend, you would expect that everyone would be preoccupied with their work for a last minute check in, not these folks!! We cannot wait to plan our return trip to the Princess Royale, and will request that we can stay in Room 268 again. The perfect room for a greatly needed getaway! How could I forget to mention the awesome mattresses in the rooms!!! I have never slept so well away from home. The waves outside and the perfect mattress make for a restful night's sleep! Thanks so much to the staff of the Princess Royale, you have new loyal customers!\ Lenore Biscotti and Jim Bergen Jeffersonville, PA

Reviews.Title: “What a Delight!”
Reviews.Author: LaPlataHills
Reviews.Content: I have been to Ocean City Maryland many times but this was my first stay at Princess Royale. I was so impressed: the grounds are beautiful, everything is spotless, the hotel has everything one could need. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angela F
Reviews.Content: We love this place! Parking garage for our car, an awesome indoor pool, super friendly staff, yummy room service. We have stayed at many different places in OCMD, but this by far is our favorite one. Love the tempurpedic bed too soooo comfy!

Reviews.Title: “not a great place to stay - good reviews may have come directly from the management”
Reviews.Author: mwchass
Reviews.Content: it is not a good place, the hallway stink, and the service is horrible. The hotel is relaxing. Buffet isn't that great, and break fast is horrible. the best part of the hotel is its location although not on boardwalk, it has a very nice beach. It really isn't worth the money. i tried speaking to the management twice, but no response. Although they claim on trip advisor that customer satisfaction is their top priority but try it for yourself...and waist your money.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Travelclem
Reviews.Content: We usually rent a house for an Ocean City trip, but we were only there for the weekend, so stayed here. Parking garage is in front of the hotel and is tight. Check in was quick. Room was comfortable, clean with a small balcony. Bathroom needed work. shower pressure was low and faucet was pulled away from the wall. Mold on the wall. Indoor pool is large with plenty of seating right outside of the fenced off area.

Reviews.Title: “Employees make the difference”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: Spend 4-5 days at the Pricess Royale each year for the past 11 years for an annual convention. I have never met an employee in any function of the operation who was not pleasant, smiling and anxious to help. All the money put into keeping the facility updated, neat and comfortable would mean little without the caliber of employees. They are the most valuable asset of this hotel and conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in OC, MD”
Reviews.Author: MarkM1016
Reviews.Content: This is a large resort/hotel that has most of the amenities you need. The rooms are large suite/type.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: RobertW913
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Princess Royale several times and its always well maintained and comfortable. It is getting older but they keep it in good condition and modernize as much as possible. The Temporpedic beds are wonderful. The suites make it much nicer than typical hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unique in it's setup. First, there are two sides facing the beach and one area across the driveway. In the middle is a large enclosed swimming area facing the beach directly. There are also many meeting rooms. You will be impressed with the setup and the magnificent cleanliness of the facility and most importantly, the rooms. I found the rooms well laid out, had refrigerator, stove, etc. and a separate room for the living area. The staff is excellent and understanding. Although I didn't eat at the facility this year, in past years I had dinner which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
