Reviews.Content: This was the second time staying at this hotel. Both stays exceeded my expectations. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The staff is among the friendliest I have encountered and go out of their way to make your stay a great one. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: piman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom 2 bath condo end of April midweek. It was only 20% full therefore nice & quiet during our stay. The view was fantastic ocean front from all rooms. Looks like it was upgraded very recently not like some of them as noted by others. Only complaint was 03 line in the condos is right next to the elevator & it is noisy in the morning when it is in constant use by guests & staff. Wish they had some essentials in the kitchen such as spices (salt & pepper) at minimum. The beach was fantastic for walks and sunrise & sunset. Enjoyed it very much. PS. This unit had the tempurpetic memory form beds which we have at home which was pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “In need of upgrades”
Reviews.Author: dangerpre
Reviews.Content: This is our sixth time staying at this hotel, and our worst stay, unfortunately. We have stayed in every room time, 3-br suite, 2-br suite, ocean front, pool view, and side view. This time, we stayed in a 2-br suite and it was run-down. The mirror in one of the bedrooms was cracked and when we called maintenance, they removed the door and said that mirrored closet doors were being phased out, so no replacements were available. The stove was so old that you couldn't read the numbers for the oven settings and the clock was not working. A couple of the shelves on the refrigerator were broken. The counter was white formica, popular in the 80's, but not so anymore. The decor was outdated and in dire need of a facelift. In the hotel's defense, we had friends staying in the same number room two floors above us, so their layout was the same. Their kitchen counter and appliances had been updated, and the old furniture was removed. Their room looked far better than ours--too bad we weren't staying in their room! Our previous experiences with this property were "very good" and "excellent", but this time we were generous and graded the hotel as "average". If we hadn't had the favorable experiences that we had in previous stays, we probably would have rated them as "poor".

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Cindy G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed recently at the Princess Royale, and enjoyed our stay very much. The room was spacious and very clean. We had an Oceanview room with 2 Queen size beds, the hotel staff was very friendly, they even called our room to welcome us and let us know to contact them if we needed anything. Look forward to coming back again next year :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spring get away spot”
Reviews.Author: SteveEF
Reviews.Content: As part of our 25th wedding anniversary celebration my wife and I decided to book an oceanfront condo at the Princess Royale Hotel in late April. We first visited the PR about 15 years ago and have been coming back regularly ever since. We love the big, mirrored rooms, jacuzzi tub, wonderful ocean views, indoor pool and whirlpool, and great service. During the second day of our stay there was a problem with the hot water that resulted in our having to endure lukewarm showers. The hotel acknowledged the problem and, as compensation, allowed us the AAA discount even though our AAA card suggested that our membership had expired (it really hadn't--AAA simply has been late in sending us an updated card). We also noticed that the hotel's "Schooners" restaurant was closed during the off-season so it wasn't possible to grab an in-house meal. The was no problem as there are decent (and less expensive) restaurants within easy walking distance. Overall--as always--we had a wonderful time. We're thinking of visiting again in the Fall to take advantage of off-season rates. If you pick up the occasional "two nights for the price of one night" off-season specials you can end up spending less per night than you would at a cheesy Holiday Inn Express. Thank you PR Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Todd E
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Princess Royale 3 times in the last 5 months. I have always had a positive experience with the hotel staff. The rooms are all clean, & every room has a kitchenette & refrigerator. The location to the beach is great & the ammeneties are better than 99% of the places I have stayed in Ocean City over the years. They always have large groups in the hotel, but it has never caused any problems. It is a great place to take kids with the indoor olympic size pool, hot tubs, sauna's, pool tables etc. Great places to eat etc. In fairnes this last weekend we did have some trouble getting hot water as one of the other reviews stated. However, I have never had a dirty room in all of the times I have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “a little run-down at the edges.......”
Reviews.Author: Gana B
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as part of a very large group, and overall the experience was a positive one. The room/suite was sufficiently large to accommodate two people comfortably. It was very handy to have a full-size refrigerator. The AC worked efficiently. The beds had very comfortable TempurPedic mattresses, and even though the room overlooked the indoor pool area, the noise level was acceptable. The bathroom, however, was not very clean. The water pressure was anemic, and the water temperature was just barely warm. Elevators are slow. Given the size of the group checking in, they should have had more personnel available to expedite the process. Catered breakfast was very good. Location right on the beach was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting”
Reviews.Author: Ashburnredhatter
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and the front desk was kind enough to give us an early check in.We stayed in the side ocean view suite. it was lovely. The beds were extreamly comfortable and the queen beds were the perfect size. The room was large and clean. I went down to the bar to have a drink our bartender was friendly and knew what he was doing. We had breakfast in the resturant the next morning, Our server was frindly and accomadating. Breakfast was good and it was not overpriced. We need a late check out till 1p.m and they allowed us to stay with no extra charge. We loved the hotel and are planning to go back there again. Arlene N.

Reviews.Title: “Gymnastics weekend w/ extended stay!”
Reviews.Author: lafaircloth
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to OC, MD for my youngest state gymnastics meet and wanted to make a long weekend out of the trip. Needed an indoor pool because of it being the off season. Indoor pool was AWESOME for my kids. For a heated pool, I must say it was a little cold though. The rooms were just average. That being said, they were CLEAN and this is the most important thing for us. The facility itself was awesome. We arrived early expecting to just hang out at the pool, and when we went to the front desk, our room was ready, so they let us check in. The staff at the resort was great. We needed some extra towels one night and they brought them right to us. Our room overlooked the pool and you could see the ocean. We had a very peaceful stay here! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Family Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: PinayMom
Reviews.Content: The hotel with its enormous indoor swimming pool was the perfect spring weekend getaway for us (couple with two boys 11 & 13)! Not only was it priced right, but we also got a free night, using the 'welcome back' coupon that we downloaded from their website. We got the oceanfront bedroom suite on the fourth floor.... I loved it compared to the pool-view suites because it was very private and quiet. Princess Royale is clean inspite of the fact that its an older hotel. It's certainly not a luxury resort, but as long as they keep their price reasonably low, I think its worth the trip. The staff were all accomodating and friendly, they even let us have a late checkout....suppose to be 11 am, but they let us stay till 1pm. Its nice too that the pool was open till very late....10 pm! Will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “The staff there made our vacation PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: Danny M
Reviews.Content: We had planned on staying 3 days and 2 nights there, but our children were having so much fun, we decided to stay an extra night! In doing so, the staff at the front desk acted like they were extremely excited that we were staying also! They upgraded our room to a larger suite for the same price! You can't ask for service any better that that! I will definitely return to this establishment! Thank you for making our little vacation memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: D G
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I have stayed at this facility and each time I have received excellent service. The staff is helpful and courteous. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The bed was extremely comfortable. There is a kitchen in the room which makes it very convenient to make meals. The kitchen has a dishwasher, stove, microwave and full size frig along with dishes and cooking supplies. Would highly recommend for families as well as couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for families :))”
Reviews.Author: Buffy616
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this hotel for years ! It truly is very accomadating for families with children! It is right on the beach, close to all entertainment and nearby resturants! It has a nice kitchenette so you can make breakfast & lunches and small dinners! Will continue to go to for many years to come :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room - ocean front”
Reviews.Author: mwtotten
Reviews.Content: Large all-suite hotel. Hotel/room was clean and well maintained. We had a double queen, ocean front suite (two beds in the bedroom, small (comfotable) livingroom, small galley style kitchen, and a bathroom). Beds were extremely comfortable - I believe they advertise that they are Temper-pedic. Large in room safe provided; seemed to entail a $1.50/day upcharge for its use. Hotel had a large atrium which contained the fairly large pool (pool towels provided)along with arcade games, Ping-Pong and pool tables. Seemed like a family friendly hotel. Check-in was a little awkward as a result of a narrow drive-up lane to unload, at which time you are greeted by a gaggle of bellmen. It would have been fine, but our room was not ready when we arrived, so we had to wait our turn in line to exit again. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Garage parking was fairly tight, but there were plenty of available spaces (we were there in the off season). Easy beach/ocean access.

Reviews.Title: “Alwaays a Favorite for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: CLCCL
Reviews.Content: We've come back each year at Spring Break for 7 yrs because the kids love the indoor pool and the rooms are large enough for my family of 5 and has a small kitchenette so we don't have to eat out all the time. The rooms have been renovated so now has nice granite tops and flat screen. Best thing is the free internet which they only put in a couple of years ago. Overall we are happy staying here - cost has gone up every year.. I remember being able to stay here for 55/night. We used to get oceanfront but pool/ocean view is fine. Good breakfast buffet. Would recommend esp for families

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: JaaaPeee
Reviews.Content: We were in for a conference. Room was fine, but took a long time to cool down even though it was only in the 50's. We were on pool level, pool side. It was convenient and not too loud. The proximity of the beach was great. Banquet food was average. Conference session rooms were too hot one day and too cold the next. No coffee available at conference was a down item.

Reviews.Title: “My recent stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandy K
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Wonderful staff. Very clean and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “made for us”
Reviews.Author: Kay S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several hotel/condo resorts both in OC and other beach communities. What makes Princess Royale stand out is that the hotel management also manages the condo's for the owners. You have the maid service, and all the other amenities you would find in a nice hotel, but have the convenience and privacy of a condo. We can have kids, grandkids and friends visit and still have our privacy. From the full kitchen, laundry, and wonderful ocean view. We could not beat the value and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Not So Royal”
Reviews.Author: Anna N
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of people out there that will never be satisfied no matter the experience. I am a passive person and easily satisfied, but this hotel was TERRIBLE!!!! Although the Princess Royale hotel is not the worst place I have stayed, it could have been better. My husband and I stayed for three nights in hopes of a nice getaway. We stayed in the off season (3rd week of march) because it was quiet and we wanted a nice ocean view. We booked a kind suite with an ocean view, supposedly. When we got to our room, our "ocean view" was really a look into the condo's across the street, but if we turned our head sideways and peered down the street, we could see a few feet of ocean. We were told we had an ocean view so what was the problem. I chose this hotel because it offered room service, ocean view suites, a convenience store and a resturant. Since we didn't get the view we had hoped for, we checked out our room, which had a strange smell, we later decided was mildew from the bathroom not having a fan. Without a fan all the steam from the shower has not place to go. This also could explain why the 1990's pink wallpaper was bubbling and pulling away from the walls. The carpet was in bad need of updating, as well as the couch and chairs, all were worn and faded and had that same smell. The kitchen was sufficient, but the dishwasher had standing water in it, from being installed wrong, and the ice maker wouldn't shut off so at 3 in the morning I kept being woken up by what I thought was knocking at the door. The bed was the only great part of the stay, sleep was good. Our first night we went out to dinner and enjoyed the city but decided to order room service the next morning for breakfast. To our dismay we put out our card, but the next morning there was no food. We then decided to head downstairs to the resturant, figuring maybe someone dropped the ball. There was a note on the door than read, "Closed until Wednesday" as was the store and gift shop. WHAT??? I booked the hotel for all of these amenities and they are all closed from Sunday to Wednesday....? When we spoke with the front desk they told us the hotel capacity was below the amount they needed to keep these amenities open, so "tough luck". Of course they apologized for the room service, but said there were plenty of places in town to eat. Of course we asked to speak with management, but were told no managers were available, I guess they don't work either when the hotel drops below a certain capacity. Disappointed and ticked off we decided to go for a little swim, only to find out the pool, despite clearly posted hours, was closed off. Then we got told they had to put in a handicap ramp so they apologized for the trouble. None of this is my problem.....I paid for a hotel with special amenities and didn't get to enjoy ANY of them. The staff was ignorant, the rooms were mildewed and outdated, I've had better showers at the gym, and better views at worse hotels. We will never, NEVER, stay at the Princess Royale AGAIN!!!! GUESTS BEWARE, call ahead to see if the hotel is functioning properly before you book in the off season. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Resort - Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: Janice276
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Princess Royale Resort various times over the years for a variety of occassions - dance competitions, weekend get-a-ways, and most recently for my daughter to attend the job fair. It is always a treat to stay at the Princess Royale. We have always had good service and friendly staff. The suites have been updated and are very spacious, plenty of room for everyone to spread out. Most importantly the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable! The indoor pool is awesome! I would highly recommend the Princess Royale any time of the year. Off season the prices are very reasonable and makes staying in Ocean City a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Picture perfect beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: lindseyhope
Reviews.Content: We were upgrades to a two bedroom condo upon arrival. We were blown away by the awesome views, spacious rooms and friendly service. Beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean, spacious, and nicely decorated. The granite countertops, flat screen tv, premium bedding and whirlpool tub were nice additions to our stay. Pool area was huge and very nice. Really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Resort Review”
Reviews.Author: sewerman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, it was also very clean and we would stay there again anytime

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE UNDER THE OC SUN”
Reviews.Author: Kristine H
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay I traveled with 4 teens and a nine year old. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom condo the kids all were crying when we had to leave including the 19 year old. i have asthma so the no smoking policy is what I liked most.Everything was above the rating of excellent, I will keep coming back my daughter already wants to return for Mother's Day 2012. The Princess Royale is the way to go!!!!! thanks Kristine from Elkton MD

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review!!”
Reviews.Author: KJoy84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to go somewhere last minute. Never been to Ocean City, but have heard great reviews! We went March 6th-8th. We stayed in an Ocean Front Room with King Size bed on the end. The hotel it's self was ok. Nice and spacious. The balcony is on the side, not straight ahead like you would normally think. The window where the balcony would be had a screen/sliding glass door. The room had a funny odor to it. Kinda like damp towels had been left all over the place. No matter where I stay (I don't care what type of hotel it is), I have gotten into the habit of spraying the room and it's entirety in Lysol.Long story short, there were ants in our bed and along the night side table. This was noticed the 2nd day into our trip, in the afternoon. All they offered, ( the office manager/a guy ) was to spray our room and change our bedding, and extend our stay from an 11 am checkout to 5pm. WTH? Next day we awoke to more bugs. I would not stay here again. I dislike bugs. Especially in my bed. Boooo. Thumbs down. The hotel had a nice decor. The pool was closed.... So was the hot tub. Had the beach to ourselves. If there weren't bugs I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: runwithsue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away on a last minute trip and we were able to get a room at Princess Royale. We chose an ocean front room. They were out of rooms with a king size bed, so we stayed in a room with 2 queens. We could have taken this vacation with our three kids because there was also a sleeper sofa in the living room area. Our room was more of a mini suite which included the living room area, a small dining area and kitchenette...2 burner stove, microwave and full refrigerator included...oh, yes, and a small dishwasher as well! The bathroom was nice and included many special little things that make a stay at the beach easier....tall towel hooks and short ones as well as an extra little shelve to the side for vanity items. It isn't fancy but it is very nice. The balcony puts you right in front of the ocean with a beautiful view. As for the hotel staff...they couldn't be nicer. The indoor pool was super. This is a great place for families as well as couples. We are definitely planning to stay here again in the future. The only reason I did not give the hotel 5 starts was because the restaurant was not our favorite. We went on a Friday during lent and the buffet only had beef and chicken on it. On the plus side we watched the wait staff work with a family that had small children and they were super. We decided on an appetizer and dinner salads which were huge for the price. Oh, I forgot to mention the Temporpedic mattresses. Super comfy! Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cwetzel1979
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel a week ago when our original hotel room at the grand hotel and spa was cancelled due to the jacuzzi tub being broken.so we booked this hotel room with the jacuzzi suite. It was wonderful..I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I will b returning this summer with my whole family...thanks for a great experience..

Reviews.Title: “Needed this wonderful break!”
Reviews.Author: denisezucc1957
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princess Royale as a last minute idea. I made reservations from my cell phone driving to the beach. I asked for the best rate, then asked for the AAA discount, getting an oceanfront, 1 bedroom apt for $116 for the night! I thought I was getting a regular hotel room! The Tempurpedic king bed was incredible, now I want to buy one! The view, heavenly. I purposely slept with the curtains open so the sun would wake me. I woke up just as the red tinge was crossing the horizon. As it continued to brighten the sky, something caught my attention in the ocean. Approximately 10 dolphins were playing happily in front of me! What a way to start a beautiful day! The staff was very friendly, everyone said hello! There were a ton of kids there for a soccer tournament, and although I changed my mind about swimming since the pool was full of kids, the indoor arena was the perfect place for families hoping their children would burn off some energy! I picked this hotel because of the indoor pool and didn't use it, but it didn't matter, the view is what stole my heart! Breakfast was very good. There was a choice between buffet or off the menu. I looked at the buffet and chose to get a western omelette from the menu instead. It was made how I like it, with potatoes and rye toast. The server was pleasant and quick. It was so convenient to eat at the hotel, as opposed to looking for a place to eat. A second stay is in the cards, and the next time, it will be for 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Resort”
Reviews.Author: CLDLSLCL
Reviews.Content: Good location, good beach, fair price for off season, beds comfortable, room clean. Cons: Staff was adequate, but not the friendliest which sort of surprised us since things weren't hectic.

Reviews.Title: “beach paradise”
Reviews.Author: E J
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in march taking our chance on the weather...the weather was fabulous! we were greeted with amazing hospitality..the hotel upgraded us to an ocean front condo to our surprise when we checked in..beautiful room..beautiful view..so peaceful and quiet this time of year.. we loved it... the golf in OC was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Tracey D
Reviews.Content: Princess Royale has beautiful spacious rooms that allow a visitor to prepare meals without leaving the hotel. The pool is large and has a relaxing atmosphere. The hotel has a restaurant and bar which offers a convenience to visitors who do not want to leave the complex.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression-Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sandy V
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel and it was an excellent experience from check-in to check-out. I was allowed early check -in which I absolutely love. The room was immaculate, the hotel clean, the staff, bell hops, and houseskeeping staff all were friendly. The kids loved the pool area and so did I. Since it is enclosed and my room overlooked the pool, I could constantly keep my eye on them and watch them enjoy the arcade, go swimming, play pool,or ping pong. Easy access to beach with a great view from the atrium as well. Great place to stay, would recommend to friends with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel. Both experiences have been wonderful. The hotel and staff are wonderful. The rooms are very clean and spacious. It is a wonderful place to stay especially if you have kids. The Indoor pool is clean and great for the kids to have fun in. We are a family of 5 and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Again, extremely happy”
Reviews.Author: cindycPasadena_MD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions. Fabulous place, especially if you have kids. Pool Level rooms are great, however if you want something a little more quiet try the ocean front. Lisa, group sales is great to work with for a large group. Will continue to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but with some catches”
Reviews.Author: E P
Reviews.Content: There are cheaper places in Ocean City, but this is my go to location for hotels whether it be a family trip or a couples get-away. Note, there are 2 hotels, One is ocean side. One is bayside. I've stayed in the suites with jacuzzi , and the regular suites. The regular suites were nicer, bigger, more spacious... if you aren't into the jacuzzi thing, go for the suite! The jacuzzi room I had at Oceanside resort was rather sad, the handle to the jacuzzi fell off, and the jacuzzi needed to be upgraded The jacuzzi room at the Bayside resort was cleaner and in better shape, however our overall room location left a lot to be desired for a romantic getaway. The balcony view was a dirty rooftop. But hey, a bottle of wine, darkness, love, and we didn't really care if the rooftop view was dismal. Walking distance to various eating places. Oceanside resort has an indoor pool with noisy children. You will want to make sure you don't get a room that fronts the pool area, or has your balcony near the pool, unless you have kids and want to keep an eye on them! Ask for rooms higher up in the hotel floor level if you want some privacy away from kids. One thing I LOVED about this location was the midmorning and afternoon outdoor grassy area.... great drinks and live entertainment, while sitting in the ocean breezes and hearing the crash of the surf. You can't see the ocean while in teh lounge chairs due to the dune, but the sky, palm trees and breeze were all lovely. The bayside resort is nice too. Check out the rooftop pool at sundown, and if you are nice to the staff, they will let you stay up there with a bottle of wine after the pool is closed! Beds are great. Very comfortable mattresses, bleach fresh clean sheets/pillow cases. Plenty of towels provided, and extras given without a blink. Rooms were clean and spacious enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vectorsmom
Reviews.Content: I originally booked a room at another hotel, but ended up checking out early and moving to the Princess Royale. I have stayed here in the past, and wish I had booked here in the first place. The rooms are always very nice, and I had an ocean front room on the corner of the hotel, which was nice and quiet. I especially like the large pool, which is great for swimming laps. The restaurant was closed during my stay, but there are plenty of accessible restaurants within walking distance. The staff are all very nice - everyone I encountered was pleasant and cheerful. Cathy, who was at the front desk both when I checked in and checked out, was particularly helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU FOR A GREAT 3-DAY GETAWAY W. GRANDKIDS!”
Reviews.Author: JeanneTester
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th annual 3-day stay at the Princess Royale with our young grandchildren and, as always, we could not have had a more perfect time! From when we walk in the door and check-in with the very friendly and helpful front desk, until we reluctantly leave, everyone and everything is above and beyond what you would typically expect. The kids love it so much that they never want to leave the hotel for anything except to go outside onto the Hotel's beach -- only Gramma goes alone to do some grocery shopping. And it's not only the pool that they can't get enough of -- they just love being in the suite. It's beautifully decorated and spacious, like brand-new -- the 3 of them can even play hide and go seek (over and over and over again)! My husband and I love that they get out of the TV/video mode and we have good old-fashioned family time together. Play games, put together puzzles, read books to them, and spend time just watching off the balcony or out the big window to see the Ocean waves and try to find dolphins -- which we almost always do! (AND, they love all the mirrored doors everywhere -- love being able to watch themselves dance in front of them, as we do, too! The morning we have to leave is always a sad one. We go always talking about when we return the next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a getaway weekend in February at the Princess Royale. I originally rented a suite but when we arrived we received an upgrade to a 2 bedroom condo because the pool was going to be closed part of the time. The condo was great with an ocean view-I love the ocean.The front desk also gave me a second coffee maker when I asked. We have stayed at the Princess Royale before and my grand kids love it. The pool is great and they love the games in the atrium. I would recommend the Royale to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerrieJarrell
Reviews.Content: WE recently spent a nice weekend at the Princess Royale and as always service, cleaniness and stay was wonderful!!! We acutally left behind our coats by accident and contacted them and they shipped them back to us at home!! The staff is always very accomodating and willing to help. The resort is always clean and we return every year, especially with the stay Saturday and get Sunday free coupon!!! Where else can you get a deal at a luxury hotel for that. We have always been very satisfied and will still always return each year. As a matter of fact we bought gift certificates for family members for christmas so they can have a wonderful weekend getaway too!!! Highly recommend this great establishment!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: dottie78
Reviews.Content: Princess Royale Oceanfront is the only place we stay. We have 2 small children and it fits perfect to our needs. You always get a suite which is standard. I love that it has a full kitchen. I like that the kids can sleep in the living room w/ the pull out sofa and watch t.v. and the grown ups sleep in the bedroom w/ the door closed (some peace and quiet). The hotel has an indoor pool, directly on the beach, away enough from all the tourist traps but a hop and skip to everything.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wading River, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale OC, MD”
Reviews.Author: Mandy S
Reviews.Content: We booked a corner room on the ocean Presidents Day Weekend 2012. It was very nice and very quiet. The inner room around the pool are popular but we wanted quiet. We slept peacefully on the Temporpedic Mattress and the ocean was right out side out window. I bet in the summer it is awesome. The view was amazing. The kitchen is great with two burners and a full size fridge and dishwasher. The Microwave is a bit dated and should be replaced in my opinion. But no big deal, since I didn't use it. I love having a seperate bedroom from the kitchen and living area. My husband could get up early and I wasn't disturbed. The new flat screen TV in the bedroom was great. The facilities were a little dated also. But very nice. I think an updated decor would really be good. Parking was a breeze with their own parking garage. The staff was very nice and the bar and restaraunt were good also.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average - Well Priced”
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: We just spent our 2nd straight Valentine's Day in one of Princess Royale's jacuzi suites. These are well priced ocean view corner suites with a second sliding glass door on the side wall which shows you not only the ocean but a view up the beach. The temperpedic bed is very comfortable! The heart shaped hot tubs are fun to use after a day at the beach or boardwalk. The hotel has new paint and carpets which have improved it's overal appearance. Staff and the indoor pool were both decent as well. My only criticism is the poorly lit parking garage which is extremely tight and has very steep ramps between floors. Overall, this is an above average hotel for a reasonable price which happens to be located right across the street from the best pizza in Ocean City at Lombardis!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: premiermass
Reviews.Content: Well this is the first time we have been in Ocean City during the winter. Went for the long Presidents day weekend. Came down from Boston Stayed at The Princess Royale. I have to say that the upgrades look good. With the new carpet and paint in the hallways. Stayed in a ocean front condo, it was very nice. The staff was great. Look forward to going back in August. We had a great time. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Omega club Weekend winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ndntelliott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with the Omega club. The suite rooms are very nice. Our rooms overlooked the pool area. Since it was cold outside the inside pool came in handy. The pool area was nice and warm. The hot tub was amazing. Not too hot and not too cold. The beds were so comfortable. The early morning breakfast buffett was very tasty. The rooms were nice and clean. I was able to meet my housekeeper. Her name was Nicole and she was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chases_MomVirginia
Reviews.Content: We come to Ocean City several times a year, and have been doing this for many years. This was our first time staying at a hotel off of the boardwalk. This hotel is amazing! We didn't want to leave. The indoor pool was perfect since it happened to be snowing outside - the area was warm and water was as well. We stayed in a pool deck level room, so our balcony area opened right up to the pool - major bonus! The staff was very nice and let us in our room early since it was ready. Everything was clean and there were up to date furnishings in the room. Parking was very convenient at the garage right at the hotel. We ordered room service and the food was wonderful. We cannot wait to come back again! Thanks for an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “A Lot of Window Dressing, Little Service”
Reviews.Author: petitepoet
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractive hotel and we had an ocean front room with a jacuzzi. The lobby looks pretty and elegant. Our room had a small kitchenette included with refrigerator and microwave. It was stocked with dishes, glasses, silverware, etc. Down the hall there was a soda machine. This was a one night stay. This room had a king-size bed which was fairly comfortable. The jacuzzi was heart shaped, very uncomfortable and it leaked. We had brought wine to enjoy as well as a couple of sodas. We looked for an ice bucket and found none. Upon going down to the room with the soda machine, I found there was no ice machine! When I called down to the desk, they said this huge, allegedly fancy hotel didn't have an ice machine in it! They directed us to the freezer of the refrigerator, but there was no ice made in there when we arrived and by the time it would have been ready it would have been too late for us to use. The only thing I can conclude from this is this hotel is not interested in people only staying one night! I have never in my entire life (and I am almost 60) stayed in a hotel totally devoid of ice machines! Also, when we called the desk for extra pillows, I was first asked, "How many do you have?" They refused to give us any until I let them know and then said they would give us two more. We also had difficulty getting more towels. The people at the desk were rude, full of attitude and downright stingy. You would think that a hotel that looked so inviting had such an attractive ambiance would treat their guests in a more welcoming and cordial manner. Not so. Between the total lack of ice machines, the leaking jacuzzi and the attitude of the staff, I would never, ever go back there. Needless to say, I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Time at Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: T D
Reviews.Content: I coordinated a youth retreat in Ocean City for a weekend. My group advised Princess Royale was a great hotel to stay in. I booked the rooms and from that point until we checked out, the service was great. The hotel was very nice and accomodating. Even though it was January, being on the beach was nice as well.I recommend this hotel highly. Our group will definitely return for our next retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale -- "Jewel" of Ocean City, Maryland!”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: As a native Marylander, I've enjoyed get-a-ways to Ocean City, Maryland, all my life. We're talking a span of six decades and hundreds of trips. However, it was only within the past couple years that I happened upon The Princess Royale Resort while surfing the Internet looking for a change of venue. Upon discovering this "Jewel" of Ocean City, my husband and I now stay exclusively at Princess Royale for weekend and holiday get-a-ways. Having stayed at numerous other Ocean City, MD, hotels such as The Dunes Manor, Hilton Suites Oceanfront, Courtyard by Marriott, The Grand, Best Western and others, we would not consider staying anywhere else but at Princess Royale. What more can a vacationer ask for? Many hotel rooms are oceanfront and others are oceanview and atrium/pool view. All standard accommodations comprise full-size suites (with two 32" LCD flatscreen TV's; comfortably-furnished living room with sofabed; large kitchen (complimentary coffee) with all modern appliances, dishware, glassware, silverware, cookware and granite countertops; dinette area; bathroom with mirrored vanity and granite countertop; spacious bedroom with King or Queen-size Tempur-pedic beds (voted #1 mattress in America), and balcony/deck in most all suites. Personally, I love the soft, comfortable and warm microfiber blankets on all the beds. Of course, you can upgrade your accommodations to a King-Jacuzzi suite, or two and three-bedroom condos. Oh, don’t think about swiping the bathroom towels because they have a security sensor. Princess Royale has two spectacular lobbies and most all amenities such as a free health club (spa service available); business center; free WiFi (great connectivity); convenience store; gift shop; valet parking; arcade and much more! You will find that the rates are very affordable and wipes out the competition. I'm saving the best for last -- the four-story oceanfront glass atrium with Olympic-size indoor swimming pool! Hey, I'm giving away my best secrets here. The pool area also has a large indoor Jacuzzi and saunas. Just outside the atrium is a sundeck with two small hot tubs. The inside atrium area is very large and can accommodate special events such as wedding receptions and business meetings/luncheons. Schooners Restaurant/lounge is located oceanfront within the hotel if you want a quick meal/buffet and don't wish to leave the premises. Nice, cozy ambiance! There is a horseshoe driveway at the lobby entrance for registration. Bellcart service is available. If you wish to use a bellcart, a Bellman must take your luggage to your room. A multi-level parking garage (free parking) with elevator is located just across from the hotel lobby. We have never had any issues with finding a parking space. Princess Royale boasts 310 two-room suites and 30 two/three bedroom condos. I believe Princess Royale to be the largest resort in Ocean City, Maryland. Okay, I've been holding out on you. There are some great package deals to be had at Princess Royale (during off-season). Check out their website at: www.princessroyale.com. During the off-season, you might even get lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the condos. I’m not sure about the methodology of an upgrade, but I’ll take it if my name is pulled out of the hat. I would also like to add that Princess Royale has a great management staff. In addition, the hotel has recently undergone renovations to include all new hotel room doors and hardware, plus new hallway carpeting. We were fortunate on a few occasions to be on the receiving end of an upgrade which was very much appreciated. Once, I was recovering from knee surgery and enjoyed the spacious, well-appointed accommodations. It was so nice to be able to enjoy the condo since I couldn’t get out much due to stitches in my knee. During our last stay (January 28-30, 2012), we received a condo upgrade which really lifted my spirits, as I was headed to the hospital upon check-out for a hip surgical procedure. Timing is everything! One thing I have read on TripAdvisor.com is that some folks have issues with having to take two elevators to the condo section of the resort. Even with stitches in my knee and on crutches, I had no issues with the longer hallway walk and utilizing two elevators. Believe me, if you're lucky enough to receive a condo upgrade, it's well worth the extra steps. In closing, this review doesn't cover everything the Princess Royale Resort has to offer, so check out their website for the full details. (No, I am not an employee or agent of the hotel). I should mention that a Superfresh grocery store is conveniently located just across Coastal Highway from Princess Royale, along with Roses Department Store for those last minute travel items. Enjoy your stay at The Princess Royale Resort -- we have and will continue to do so for many more years to come! "Life's a Beach."

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale winter vacation”
Reviews.Author: Peggyfrank
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a mid winter vacation at the Princess Royale.It was my husband's Birthday and our 23rd anniversary. The room was excelent as well as the view of the atrium and the ocean. Maid service was excellent we had a minor glitch that was corrected immediately.Looking foward to being back in the Spring.Thanks Peggy Frank

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ByronE43
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Princess Royale. The rooms were nice and clean. The pool was fantastic. The only problem that we had was there was a drinking party going on in the hallway with lots of profanity after midnight, and there didn't seem to be any security keeping folks quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! We enjoyed everything about it except for the pool. It is not as heated as you think. It seemed a bit chilly each time we got in. Other than that we had an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in O.C.”
Reviews.Author: dawnie13
Reviews.Content: The reviews really don't do the P.R. justice. It seems to have it all. We just returned from a two-night mini vacation and stayed there for the first time. The room is large enough, but the added livingroom (with another tv) plus the fully equipped kitchen was great. The place is really spotless. Good strong shower. The Tempur-pedic mattress was wonderful. Ocean front view is spectacular. Balcony large enough for two or more to enjoy. Staff very pleasant and professional. Since it was mid-winter and Monday-Tues stay(with 58 degree temps and sun) we did not get to try the closed restaurant and some of the other ammenities. We will certainly return as the rates are competitive with other quality hotels nearby. And with a nice indoor pool that was just warm enough to enjoy and a hot tub hot enough to really get the most from, it is a perfect winter get-a-way for us retired folks!! Try Lombardi's for white pizza, The Shark for an excellent organic dinner (bayside @ the inlet off route 50).

Reviews.Title: “Where we always stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tclarke87
Reviews.Content: We love this place. We've been staying here for a few years now and always come back for more. :)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet midweek January luxury”
Reviews.Author: Daphne W
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Monday MLK holiday, stayed through until Friday. Clean room, lots of space, friendly staff, balcony looking out at the Atlantic. Comfortable beds, small kitchen with full-size frig (Craig loved the icemaker!). Two-room suite, very spacious. Reasonable rates year-round from what I can see on their website. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “stay here every month thru the winter”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel..rooms are suites..great relaxing getaway thru the winter..and the "welcome back specials" are a great reward for return guests..

Reviews.Title: “Great way to relax before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Kellsterr
Reviews.Content: Our family comes here every December to relax and hang out. The hotel has a great pool and pool area with tables to accomodate a big family gathering, there are close to 20 of us who go. The kids love the arcade games and pool table, ping pong table, airhockey all right there with the pool. The adults love the indoor and outdoor hot tub, and sauna. We get a room that is pool level so we just walk right out of our room and its all there for kids. All the rooms are suites which is very helpful. The resturant is a little pricey but its right there so we don't mind paying a little extra because we don't have to leave. Can't wait to do it again next winter!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Dinishia P
Reviews.Content: Some of my close friends and I wanted to get away for the weekend and just hang out. The hotel is very high class and the suite was fantastic. Our suite faced the ocean and it was very peaceful and serene. Staff was very professional and accomodating. I would totally stay again.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Weekend at the Princess”
Reviews.Author: Louisa M
Reviews.Content: Our first New Years Eve at the ocean and we had a wonderful experience at the Princess. Very clean, delicious quality food and drink and the most professional and courteous staff we have ever had at a resort. Not only can you spend a fun night at the hotel and enjoy their party, live band and food & bevs by the indoor pool on New Years eve, but can enjoy the party from afar by staying in one the indoor pool side rooms with balcony. Also be sure to take part in the Penquin Plunge the following day 01/01/12. The plunge takes place at the resort and plunge is directly in front of the resort. Plunge benefits the Atantic Hospital in Berlin. The BEST news years!! Thank you Princess Royale Staff! The McMorrow Family

Reviews.Title: “First rate.......quality and clean”
Reviews.Author: Amy P
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 children stayed at the hotel and found the staff was professional and attentive. Plenty of parking adjacent to the hotel and check-in was quick. As we walked to our room it appeared that the hallway carpet was new and once we entered our room we found that the mattresses were new as well. The indoor pool was great with a combination of adult (bar) and children activities (game room). Easy access to the beach. The room was actually a suite with a kitchenette and adjacent room with couch and TV. Extra room was perfect for putting the kids to bed and still being able to stay up and enjoy the perfect weather and ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Jeff A
Reviews.Content: We visit this hotel several times a year, the staff is excellent, during the off season the staff has upgraded our room on several occasions, its a great fall and winter getaway with great service and very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “after Christmass draw down”
Reviews.Author: Francis C
Reviews.Content: Good prices with excellent service at all levels. Renovations u nderway but they did not interfere with services or availablity of things within the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: binkyboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid December with a group of family members. This is an excellent place for families to meet. We had about 10 rooms total and we were able to gather by the pool to share meals together. The view of the ocean is fantastic from any floor above the 2nd. Some rooms had newer couches than ours. The hotel is being renovated but we were not bothered by any noise. Everyone was very kind, especially Diavana who helped us book rooms as a group. Two families got upgraded to ocean front villas. The kids love the ping pong tables and the arcade games. This is the 2nd year we went in the winter and look forward to going back next year with even more family. You can't beat the price in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one stay”
Reviews.Author: sms74
Reviews.Content: We had fun here, but I would not come back. There are no rooms where you can get away from the pool noise. Some may not be bothered by that, but I had a harder time with it. Rooms are very spacious. Off season price was great. I do not regret it at all. Just not great enough to make me want to come back. But if you are not sure where to stay, this is at least a decent bet.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: PokrChick
Reviews.Content: Was extremely pleased with everything the hotel had to offer. Room was clean, service was prompt and price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City in December”
Reviews.Author: Panoonie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1st week in December during off season so unable to enjoy the beach although the view was wonderful. Was there for a conference and had a box sent to the hotel. Checked on the box several times during the weekend and before I left on Sunday and was told it wasn't there. When I tracked the box on Monday found out it was received at the hotel that Friday. Called the hotel they verified they had box and would send to me. Called back next day for tracking info was told box wasn't sent but they would look into it and call me back. Had to follow up again and was told I had to pay to have it sent. I explained it was the hotel's mistake and I shouldn't have to pay to forward the box. Received follow up call and was told they would send box at their cost.

Reviews.Title: “4 day stay ....nice far from strip but overall good.”
Reviews.Author: 807bkny
Reviews.Content: rooms were clean... had the balcony by the pool. beach is walking distance ... didnt stay around too much...a little far from the boardwalk and other attractions especially in memorial day traffic...i would go back but be careful at night on the boardwalk. the hotel was safe ..garage is a pain to park but i would def go back again. great places to eat and fun...worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale resort off season”
Reviews.Author: Jerry J
Reviews.Content: There are so many things to do even in the off season. The pool, hot tub and sawnas are great. Great price and a variety of room types. The inside pool view is especially nice in the Winter. Plenty of great restaurants around, including the one in the Princess. I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Princess resort off season”
Reviews.Author: pixeegrl
Reviews.Content: Decent priced hotel in the off season. It's in the middle of renovations which it needs but all in all it was fun. The walls are pretty soundproof too, at least on the 5th floor :) The parking garage can be hard to get in and out of with a larger or longer vehicle but you can also park on the side of the hotel by it's restaurant Schooners easy. Kids loved the pool but it was a bit too cool for my taste. The sauna will warm you up though before you head back to your nice sized room with full kitchen :) For dinner or lunch I recommend Fat Daddy's Pizza and subs up the road. They also deliver but we picked it up!

Reviews.Title: “mid-November , mid-week stay”
Reviews.Author: mmbjr
Reviews.Content: courteous staff very clean good meals on site and easy walk to grocery store still plenty of off-site restaurants open, while many others closed in the area after the tourist season

Reviews.Title: “You'll Get Your Excercise”
Reviews.Author: gypsy1684
Reviews.Content: The design of this establishment dictates that you'll have a long walk from the front entrance ( and your car) to your suite if you choose to be oceanfront, (or a condo on floor 6 - 10.) We had an oceanfront suite on the 5th floor. The beds were very comfortable, the balcony was fine - private, large enough and the railing was very solid. The lighting was very poor throughout , dim everywhere ( cfl bulbs) and no reading lights between the beds!! The kitchen/eating area had good facilities but was poorly lit overall ( and there was a burned out bulb in the light above the peninsula the whole time we were there) and too warm ( only the heat kept it from being a dungeon) The corridors needed new carpet - it appeared faded and looked dirty. The pool area was large and had a gate to restrict access but there did not seem to be anyone monitoring the area. Unfortunately the outdoor hot tubs were locked ( on a saturday ~ 7pm.) there was no explanation and there were kids in the indoor hot tub ( there was a sign clearly stating no one under 16 y.o.) The price was good for the area. Check-in was very easy and there were bellmen available. The personell we encountered were very nice and professional. and at check out we were given a coupon for a free extra night during a future winter stay. We stayed Nov. 11 -13 ,2011 ( arrived Friday left Sunday)

Reviews.Title: “Fun Family Vacation For Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: mike545454
Reviews.Content: A cheap get away during the winter months for the family. Kids had a great time at the indoor pool. Pool level rooms make it very convenient for use of kitchen and bathrooms during stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Weekend Escape”
Reviews.Author: sharriewatson
Reviews.Content: My husband's birthday was coming up and we wanted to take a short trip but somewhere with a view. I'm really not a huge Ocean City fan as the crowds are overwhelming and I'm no longer a 'lay on the beach' person but we figured the off season would be nice. It was! We got off season prices and our room was just great. All was clean - and quiet although I'm sure visiting in December had something to do with that. The bed was comfortable and we had a microwave, refrigerator and mini kitchen. Waking up to the view out our window of the sunrise on the ocean was spectacular. We may make another mini-vacation this winter and if we do, we would stay again at the Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Frederick T
Reviews.Content: The wife and I had searched for years for the "right place to stay". After reviewing hundreds of hotels we chose the Princess Royale in Ocean City Maryland. They advertised an ocean view with a jacuzzi. Making the reservation was a snap, and from the moment we stepped up to the registrration desk we were swept away with friendly service. The room was exactly as described and our view of the ocean was spectacular. We had dinner brought to the room and it was hot and delicious. The bed was most comfortable, the jacuzzi was great, the stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for off season months”
Reviews.Author: Jenny M
Reviews.Content: I have a family of four and we had a great experience. We stayed the weekend following Thanksgiving and got an extra night free. Very clean rooms, well equiped and definitely bug free. Nice furnishings and beds. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Alot to do in the hotel....gift shop, convenience store, restaurants, beauty salon, indoor pool and saunas. Only problem is the water smelled funny and tasted weird when brushing your teeth and hallway rugs and sofa/chair in living room could be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend visit with the family and cousins”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: We found the Princess Royale experience to be very nice. The hotel was easy to find and close to local shops, taverns and eating establishments. Meals at the hotel's restaurant were excellent and at a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving 2011”
Reviews.Author: 1814Sailor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived late the day before. Since we have stayed there before, I had no fears of waiting for someone to attend the check in desk. The front desk man was attendative, quick, and professional. Our room was a ocean side view but it was still perfect. The beds were comfortable and sleep was great. The dinner was just like it was made personally for us. We always enjoy staying here. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good family resort”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly063
Reviews.Content: I liked having a full size refrigerator in the room along with micorwave, 2 burners and a place to sit and eat. Decor is old fashion but in good condition. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Towson_MD
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights over the Thanksgiving holidays. This was our third stay at this hotel. The last was about 5 years ago. Our room was clean and bug free. Decent mattresses. The pool was well heated so that my children had very little problem acclimating to it. The hallway rugs could use a proper cleaning. At $68 a night for a two queen bed suite, the price is very affordable. A good place to get away for an off season break at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer F
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a gorgeous 3-bedroom condo. The view from our balcony was beautiful. Seeing the sunrise was gorgeous. Even though with out short stay we enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: hcprichardson
Reviews.Content: spent a long weekend during the summer at this hotel with my husband and toddler. I have vacationed in OC since I was a kid, and have stayed at hotels, condos, houses, etc. This one was really great, and a good price. We will more than likely choose this one every year. The rooms are great for families in general because you have a split between bedroom and livingroom/kitchenette, you won't feel crowded into one room. Also, the pool area is great. My son loved looking out the window down to the pool, and loved the balcony as well. check-in and out were easy. One complaint, you can only use a cart or get info from the guys out front if you will be using them for valet, otherwise, they didn't care what questions you had. I understand making money but they create the initial experience as you enter the hotel so it would be good for them to be more positive and attentive. We reluctanly visited the restaurant for dinner (buffet) and it was not the worse we have had but very close to it. NOT WORTH A DIME TO GO TO THAT BUFFET EVER AGAIN. The beds were comfortable but very high so if you are coming with young children, consider bringing something safer for them to sleep in. My son did well but we were always afraid of him falling in his sleep. The hotel was filled with people but was still calm and quiet, a little getaway. You have the beach right there, a pool area inside for inclement weather or just to relax, and then you are also right near main attractions. The hotel is not the newest but it is certainly clean and resort-like. Just about a perfect match for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We went down for the Salisbury Autumn Wine Festival but wanted to stay in Ocean City by the beach. The hotel was clean, the staff was extremely friendly and the price was so low we couldn't believe it. The room we received had a bedroom, kitchenette and a sitting room. It made for a perfect getaway for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City get away”
Reviews.Author: MrTom_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Princess several times in the off-season. We get an ocean frount condo suite - they are beautiful. Feels like home. Clean, quiet, well maintained and the beds are very, very comfortable. We love Ocean City and the Princess. After our first stay, we've never considered staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeDowningtownPA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at the Princess Royale with my hubby, son, daughter-in- law and my 4 and 1/2 year old grandson and we had a great time. Got a big surprise when we went to check in, they upgraded us to a three bedroom three bath oceanfront condo on the 10th floor at no extra charge and it was really nice! The view was amazing from our huge balcony. The staff is excellent, and the whole hotel is immaculate. They have a really nice indoor pool and my grandson just loved it. Wished we could have stayed a little longer because my grandson did not want to go home because he said he wanted to live there(wish we could).We had such a good time we will be back for another stay in the summer when we can enjoy the beach.

Reviews.Title: “The VERY BEST place to stay in OC, MD”
Reviews.Author: Walter H
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this Princess Royale Hotel for 17 continous years and would not even consider staying at another hotel. The staff is excellent, and the rooms are immaculate, What ever you may need just call the front desk and they will make it happen. Great resort facility, everyting you could want is right there. We can't wait to return next year once again.

Reviews.Title: “We were spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: DH-in-EC
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last minute reservation for four. The person making the reservation was very helpful. When we arrived, we found out that we had been upgraded to the 2 bedroom/2 bath condo. Wow!! Then we went to the condo and saw how wonderful the condo was. The rooms were spacious, furnishings were comfortable and the kitchen had everything we needed and more. The balcony provided a lovely view of the beach. The staff was friendly and professional. Our stay was short but memorable. We're already talking about returning next year on our annual OC trip and staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: workman32
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the resort.. It was amazing spending time with friends in such a wonderful place the people and staff was extremely nice. The food wasn't the best bit everything else was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Always outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Allen M
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be one that all other's follow with staff and prices. A excellent suite hotel no matter were your room is located.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Tywanda
Reviews.Content: From the moment reservations were made Ms. Martesha Spencer made me feel welcomed and I looked forward to my stay. Ayo the young gentleman that was working the front desk at the time of check in explained everything and even offered to assist me. I plan on returning because the service was wonderful the property was very clean and working. Even the house keepers were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sue R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the resort for a two day conference and had booked an additional 2 days for a mini-vacation.. The room I was given for the conference was first floor oceanfront suite. The 2nd room that I had booked and paid for was not of the same quality so they upgrade me for free. Staff were wonderful and the suite was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “i would NEVER stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: julie R
Reviews.Content: On Nov. 12, 2011 i stayed at this hotel. Please look at the picture below. when we checked in and got to the room the first thing we always do it throw off the bedspread... we figured we were ok but nope.. i pulled back the blanket to lay down and the sheets (which were washed) still have male body fluids on it. It was gross and disgusting. the worst thing is that they had already been washed so why were these marks left on the sheets? how good are the washing machines? Even the front desk and the house keeping staff surprised. The housekeeper said "Oh my God!" They changed the sheets which were old and pilly. (see second picture) I could not stay there another night. What else was left in the sheets if they couldn't get these stains out? The hotel gave us a coupon for dinner. Too bad the chicken and ribs were dried out, they had instant mashed potatoes, floating green beans and dry cake. It was pitiful to say the least. Other than that the manager would not do a thing. This is not an inexpensive hotel. They should be ashamed of themselves. Even hotels.com called and they could not get anywhere either.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ruth M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Princess Royale Resort in Ocean City, Maryland to attend a two day conference. Even though it was in the off season (early November), I found that the hotel staff was just attentive to details and making me welcome as when I have been here in the summer time in peak season. I found my room and areas that I spent time in for the conference to be very clean and everything to be just right. It may not be a very fancy place but it has everything you need and the staff are very accomodating. The bed and pillows were more comfortable than those at a high end hotel I had just come from in DC and it was so relaxing to hear the ocean, especially at night. I was able to stay in an ocean front room for the same price as a room without a view of the ocean. Parking was very convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stillmoose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a long weekend. The location was great. Centrally located in Ocean City but away from the boardwalk. The ocean front room was clean and spacious. The tempurpedic beds were a nice touch. We will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, just a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy21
Reviews.Content: We checked into a king pool ocean view suite on Thursday night. Suite did show some age, but overall was clean. Tempurpedic bed was very nice, but the pillows were small lumps in need of replacement. We usually take our own, but considering we were only staying for 2 nights we didn't bring them. Take your own and you will be fine! Room had a full size fridge, microwave, 2 burner range, & a full sink. The hotel has a nice little quick-shop store off main lobby with snacks, drinks, etc. Did not eat in the restaurant, but had drinks in the bar one night and snacked on crabby toasts which were very good (imagine crab imperial on french bread toasts). Check in was smooth and the bell hop was excellent! Parking was fine (we were there in early Nov.) but I imagine it could be horrendous in season as the parking garage was very small! Overall, stay was very nice, but we had a coupon deal that made it all the more worth while. Would stay again, but would hesitate on paying full price in season as the hotel does not offer any unique or "wow" amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away”
Reviews.Author: Tracy O
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, I would recommend it for any get away on or off season. The rooms are nice and clean. There is not a bad view in the hotel. Our stay was very relaxing. The jacuzzi room is very nice. The restaurant was closed but it was expected for being off season. Over all great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, pool is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie R
Reviews.Content: Clean Rooms, great location and children loved large swimming pool/game room. Rooms are spacious with comfortable beds and great views. This place has all the amenities, from a full service restaurant/bar, hot tub and sauna for adults to a large swimming pool/game room for the children. Would recommend for familiy or business. Staff very friendly and check in/out very speedy. Our family has stayed at many places in Ocean City and this is truly are favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convention type hotel”
Reviews.Author: Godguy
Reviews.Content: While this facility is showing some age, the rooms have everything you could ask for including a kitchen w/pots and pans. They have Tempur-Pedic mattresses which people either seem to love or hate. The restaurant is lacking but there are plenty of good options nearby. A car is useful. Note that inside suites face an enclosed pool but may actually have a better water view through the four story glass enclosure than the rooms on the outside of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale OC Room 458”
Reviews.Author: Shane D
Reviews.Content: I found this Resort to be very friendly, polite, and willing to help or answer any questions. I would recommend it to anyone. The employees would smile and seemed like they really enjoyed working at the resort. The food at schooners was excellent and great variety. OUr youth group will be staying there Jan.6-8, 2012 for a youth conference in OC. I cannot wait to be there. Rev. Shane Dickinson

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Ocean City Md!!!”
Reviews.Author: trudys56
Reviews.Content: My family has stay at the Princess Royal many times in the past 10 years. The rooms are always clean the people can not do enough for you. Guest services always are checking to make sure everything is ok. We stayed at the Princess on October 29th for a family wedding the hotel up graded us to a ocean front room room 571 what a great view just what you wanted to see. we have stayed at the Grand on 21st street can not come close to the Princess. The rooms have 2 queen size beds and a living room with a small kitchen great. Thanks PRINCESS

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Overkill But Still a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian_Donna_2010
Reviews.Content: I booked one of the 'honeymoon' rooms for our first anniversary: Ocean view King bed with jacuzzi tub and kitchenette. Upon arrival, we were 'upgraded' to the full family extended stay condiminium suite consisting of two additional bedrooms with enough space to sleep 14 people besides ourselves, a fully appointed living room with TV and entertainment, a washer and dryer, and a completely equipped kitchen with full-size appliances including trash compactor and dishwasher as well as crockery, glasses, and utensils. We stayed in the "master" side (which did include a jacuzzi tub) since we really had no need to go into the other areas. My wife and I enjoyed the overall decor scheme of the wallpaper and furniture, with art pieces and sculptures scattered around the suite- a pleasant cross between American Southwest and marine themes. The view was very nice from the top floor- our balcony faced the Atlantic and we could walk around the south end to view the bay. The staff was good and helpful- we needed a guide to get us to our room the first time as it was a bit convoluted, as others have said. The on-site restaurant was closed, so the person at the sundries store pointed us to a different part of Ocean City for meals. Ocean City in the off-season is 2/3 shut down, but we still ate very well at La Hacienda and the Bayside Skillet, both just down the road (separate reviews coming), and enjoyed some clearance shopping and strolling on the famous Boardwalk. All in all, we got what we came for- a very quiet, pleasant stay for a couple of days away from our hectic lives.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Ever Stayed At!”
Reviews.Author: Jim N
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom condo upon arrival at no additional cost. Let me tell you, it was excellent. The rooms were clean. We had 2 bedrooms, 3 beds, 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen, living room, with 2 sofas and another comfortable chair, and a dining room. There were 2 televisions, one in one bedroom and one in the living room. There was a full size washer and dryer in our room. The living room and one of the bedrooms had big windows with a great unobstructed view of the ocean which was right there with only a sandy beach betwen us and the ocean. The other bedroom had a view of the bay. There was a balcony. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We felt very safe, there was plenty of staff close by, if we needed anything. The room was very quiet and no one bothered us, we had privacy. There is a large supermarket one block away and a church a 5 minute drive on the same highway.This is the 1st time we have stayed in Ocean City, and on our next trip there we will return to the Princess Royale and no other hotel. Mr. & Mrs. Noonan and family

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Tcoster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Princess Royale because of a recommendation from a family member. We booked an ocean front king suite. When we arrived at the hotel the gentleman informed us he was going to upgrade us so we give the hotel a good review. They upgraded us to a two bedroom condo which was nice. We decided to go back to the room we booked for two reasons. The condos were a bit of a pain to get to. You had to go up two seperate elevators at opposite ends of the hotel. We were traveling with our 9 month old so it was a bit inconvienient. The second reason is that we are used to sleeping on a temperpedic bed and the condo did not have them. When we went to the desk to change back to our regular room we were told it was not available. We had to take a double queen room- which was fine. We stayed from saturday to tuesday. On Monday afternoon we went back to the room to let our little one grab a nap only to hear Bang, Bang, Bang for hours! They were remodeling the room next to us. The banging started again at 7:45 am on Tuesday morning. I ended up forgeting my infants cloud 9 giraffe ( the one that makes the soothing noises to drown out the banging). The hotel was nice enough to mail the giraffe back to me but it did cost me a COD fee of $30 when UPS delivered the package. We did have a nice time at the beach and plan to go back for the festival of lights but we will not be staying at Princess Royale. Emily, PA

Reviews.Title: “Next best thing to a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: LumbertonCruiser
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay!!! From the first moment to checkout, we had a wonderful experience. The front desk staff had clearly been trained in the art of hospitality - friendly, courteous and helpful. The ocean front rooms were lovely - million dollar view. The palm trees gave you a tropical feeling and the atrium pool was fantastic. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast - and the view - and would have to say our only disappointment was the $2.50 charge for coffee, which we felt was excessive since it was added to the breakfast price and we were not informed of that prior to ordering. Seems a rather silly idea to cause ill-will for an overpriced beverage - better to increase the price of the buffet and include the coffee. Rooms were clean, nicely equipped and the beds were a treat. Our entire weekend stay reminded us of being on a cruise - and we can pay no higher compliment than that. Are already planning our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cagtrips
Reviews.Content: As always I had a great stay! Excellent staff and the accommodations were great! Will be back to stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Charlene B
Reviews.Content: Suites overlooking the beach were very nice. The hotel did not have that cheap ambience of some shore properties.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Monty1230
Reviews.Content: You have to decide what little things are important to you. The hotel probably does misrepresent itself by stating that the suites were recently completely remodeled. The bed and TV in the bedroom seemed new. The cabinets and TV in the living area were not. The chair and sofa could be two years old and just ugly. It's true, the carpert in the halls should have been cleaned more often, or changed two years ago. The good news is that our room looked exactly like the photos on the web site. At an average of $134 per night (after taxes and fees) we got what we expected. Everything worked; was clean; and the pool water was warm. Overall, I liked the place, and will return. Parking was very convenient in the garage in front of the lobby - exiting and entering was easy. Don't underestimate this benefit. Bring your own coffee and filters (4 cup), the stuff that housekeeping leaves is nasty. The kitchen needs a bottle opener - I forgot ours. I can easily recommend this solid three (not five) star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: kswing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October 21-23 2011. It's a nice hotel/resort complex. We had an oceanfront king suite and we definitely had million dollar views! The decor of the hotel is a bit dated, but it's very clean and was a good value for the money. I will be honest, we had wanted to stay at the Hilton, but they didn't have a king suite available, and Princess Royale did. The room was more than adequate and you can't beat being able to lay in bed and watch the sunrise!!! The bed was comfy, and the in room jacuzzi was nice. I have read some comments really bashing the decor, but really, how important is the hallway carpet??? Staff was nice, food was good (we only had breakfast room service) and all in all I would go back. Again, what was important to me and my husband was a nice clean room, a big comfy bed and being oceanfront. If that's what you're looking for, I would look into staying here!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: zeefikre
Reviews.Content: i went to this resort on October 22nd ,2011 for my birthday. i had a terrible experience in this resort .....first and most the room the carpet ,bathroom and the Jacuzzi was not clean. secondly My room number was 107 in the ground floor the room key was not working properly. on the other note,i forgot my iPhone mobile charger in the room and i came back and ask the reception desk they said that they didn't found any charger in the room. i paid $198 per night. i strongly suggest that if you want spend just like me, go to another hotel or resort .this resort is not belongs to you.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time to the 80s”
Reviews.Author: PAtrippin
Reviews.Content: Whoa! Is this place ever dated! I felt like I was living in a Miami Vice scene. Anyway, once I got past the "decor" I will say that the place was convienient and good for families. We stayed in a suite on pool level that included a master bedroom with a king-size bed and a living room area with a pull-out sofa, on which my 12-year-old and 9-year-old slept. So, it worked out pretty well for the 4 of us. Our oldest (16 years old) was unable to be with us on this vacation and having had experience with 3-kid vacations I would say this place would have been cramped with our family of 5. If someone had 3 very young kids it would probably be okay. With the sofa pulled out there was not much floor space left. The room was pretty clean, considering it's peach and green decor. There were 2 TVs in the room and they both were NOT flat screens, which I would think should be standard these days. The king-size bed was very comfy. The pool was so-so.
