The kids liked it but it was crowded and the water was cloudy. The pool area had arcade games that my kids liked. From pool level you could walk down steps to the beach, so it was very convenient. Parking was in a garage, which was a good escape from parking in full sun. The "package" deal we got online included breakfast daily. It was nothing to rave about...pretty mediocre and the same thing every day--waffles, eggs, potatoes, fruit--cafeteria-style food like you would expect at a conference ceter, which this place pretty much is in the off season. There was a stove, refridgerator, dishwasher, and microwave in the room. We only used the fridge for drinks. For the price and location, I would go back because, in my opinion, compared to other beach places, it would rank above average. But, like I said in the beginning... it was so 1980s it was almost comical.

Reviews.Title: “"Another GREAT STAY! "”
Reviews.Author: Karla W
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Princess Royale a few times a year and have never been disappointed! I have been coming to Ocean City for 38 years and just within the last few years found the Princess Royale which made an already marvelous vacation even better. We do a week long family trip in the Summer and my nephew loves the pool and game area. ( Even if it rains he is entertained ) My husband and I do mini vacations (love the car cruise's) later in the year and enjoy just sitting in the atrium and watching the ocean. The hotel is always clean and the staff is always welcoming! We are so glad that we found the Princess Royale and look forward to each return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon weekend”
Reviews.Author: annyong1
Reviews.Content: We decided to go on a last minute honeymoon to Ocean City & found the Princess Royale on Priceline. We had a great stay. We got a corner ocean view room which gave us plenty of ocean view, All the rooms are suites with kitchens. We weren;t there long enough to use the kitchen but is great if you dont want to always go out. The beds were super comfy -memory foamish. Great indoor pool so it's a perfect hotel for the off season. Easy walk down to the beach. We walked to restaurants & bars from 48th-95th, but there is a bus for $1 if you dont want to walk so far (& also to boardwalk). We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Marion B
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Enjoyed the ocean view, swimming and the close proximity to all our favorite spots.

Reviews.Title: “"Great fall vacation"”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie C
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Princess Royale, we been here before but this time we were upgraded to a condo!!! The condo was awesome, spacoius and clean. We love our beautiful view of the ocean. The staff was very friendly. The pool and hot tub are always a hit. Princess Royale is a great place to stay, we will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: misspatElkton_Md
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other hotels in Ocean City but this was by far the best. The hotel is very clean and our room was very comfortable with a fully equipped kitchen. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Thank you Princess Royale for a fabulous stay! We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful fall beach getaway”
Reviews.Author: tfahsl
Reviews.Content: Over Columbus Day weekend, I and my wheelchair-bound friend stayed in a 2 queen bed suite, with pool view; we asked for an ocean view room, but none were available. the hotel is very nice, loved the indoor pool and atrium, and the staff super helpful (especially Bill the bellhop!). the breakfast buffet was limited, but we enjoyed the view of the ocean while eating it! the only problem was that the doorways to the bathroom and bedroom were very narrow, despite the hotel's claims that all rooms were handicapped accessible. Still, we had a terrific time , received a good deal on the price, and highly recommend this resort. we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: Robert E
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Princess Royale Found the suites & all of its amenities a welcome to the stay and the fact that the Complete hotel is SMOKE FREE is a plus. Staff was very helpful in all areas, the rooms were cleaned & serviced every day with out a hassel, The indoor pool was clean and we enjoyed it every day. the beach was cool for our stay, access was very easy from the pool area. Our stay was for the cruse at Ocean City, parking was very good although the lot filled up quickly. The family and myself enjoyed the 3 night stay. Looking forward to next year spring and Fall cruse's. Thanks to the staff and all personal at the Princess Royale Hotel & Resort Our stay was the greatest

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Brigitte F
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old son and I stayed at the Princess Royale in October 2011. We had a great time. The room was spacious, the beds were awesome and the staff was so nice. We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, beautiful ocean views, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BriWas
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a mid-October, two-night Saturday to Monday stay at the Princess Royale. Although we've driven through OC several times and have camped at Assateaque Island, this was our first time overnighting in Ocean City. We selected this hotel due to the good TripAdvisor reviews and also a coupon for a free night on the hotel's website (make sure to check there if you are staying off season!). Anyway, on to the review: The Good: - Super-friendly and helpful staff. Really impressive! For big hotels like this I usually assume that service and staff attitudes will be poor. Everyone we dealt with was helpful and friendly and seemed genuinely concerned that we have a nice stay. - Our oceanfront suite was nicely appointed, roomy, and clean. Temper-Pedic mattresses were a nice touch and were very comfortable. Full kitchen including a full-size refrigerator and a small dishwasher (with provided dishwasher soap, too). - The view and the beach. Our second-floor room overlooked a row of palm trees and then the beach, making for a view that was more Caribbean than Maryland. Very relaxing! Since it was off season the beach was very quiet and uncrowded. - Parking was readily available both on side streets and in their parking garage. - This place really is a true resort with lots of guest amenities. An amazing indoor pool complex under a giant atrium, complete with a pool bar/snack stand, sauna, game area with both video and regular games (ping-pong, etc.), and outdoor hot tubs. On a rainy day this atrium pool area would be a godsend with a family! The Negatives While I can't come up with any significant negatives, there are some things to comment on: - Pricing seems a bit high for off season. Thankfully we used a coupon that gave a free Sunday night with a Saturday night stay. But our Saturday night stay pushed $200 with tax, resulting in an acceptable per-night cost of $100 with the coupon. If we had paid full price for both nights I'd say it was not worth it given other off-season prices in OC. - Decor in public spaces is a bit dated design-wise, but it is not run-down or shabby. Really just a taste thing rather than a negative. - The restaurant was OK. We ate breakfast there (buffet), which was just average for its $10 price (not including drinks). A bit outdated looking, but a great view of the ocean. Service was a bit slow. Our second day we had a better breakfast at a much better price at the Denny's restaurant a few blocks north. - While the resort and the beach are great, be aware that the location isn't near too much else. You could easily spend the entire week there and not have to venture outside the resort, though. But if you want to check out other restaurants, the boardwalk, etc., it's a bit of a trip by car and definitely not walkable. - This comment doesn't relate to the hotel, but to OC in general: we were left unimpressed by OC, feeling it was too built-up and citylike for our tastes. Also, restaurant prices were very high across the board, which was surprising. We expect a bit higher prices in a resort area, but OC restaurants seem to have passed into the realm of price gouging. For future trips we'll either make the longer drive to Virginia Beach or head to Rehoboth in Delaware or Ocean City, NJ.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: Yvette I
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Princess Royale in September 2011 and had a wonderful time! The room was beautiful and what a view-we were on the oceanfront! You could lie on your bed and feel like you were right there on the beach!! The room was spotless, the balcony great and the staff was very pleasant and helpful! My brother stays hear often and has told me how wonderful it is but now I know for myself and will come back again and again! We have been coming to Ocean City, aryland for years and have stayed at many oceanfront hotels, but this was above and beyond the very best one of them all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Fall Weekend at the Beach.”
Reviews.Author: afarmandthirsty
Reviews.Content: If I could give this a 3.5, I would as I see the property hovering between "good" and "average." The decor was a little dated, but it was clean and we found the front desk/house keeping service terrific. If you want a basic accomodation that's right on the ocean, this is a good bet and great for a night or two. Basically, we wanted to stay ocean front to enjoy the sound of the waves and have a balcony to sip wine and enjoy one of the last fine weekends of the summer. These were our priorities for this trip and the Princess Royale met these requirements. We stayed on the second level so we were steps from the beach. Is there anything better than walking up in the morning and watching the sun rise over the ocean? Having a full kitchen for our weekend trip was a pleasant surprise for a hotel. The hotel was an easy walk from many shops and restaurants so we didn't use our call during the little weekend trip, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: vickiseberly
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was motivated by a need to get away, to see the ocean, and to feel pampered due to Vickis not feeling well due to back and leg issues. We saw the ad in the Lancaster, Pa. newspaper. We called and the first impression was already good--the reservationist was kind and personable. We arrived on a Sunday nite--the room was clean and a pool view--great from the bellhop that put the suitcase in the room, turned on the lights and drew the curtain. When I tipped him he was so great--said it was too much, but I said to keep it. The next day after roaming around, I went in the pool. Getting out I had pain and difficulty on the steps. An employee, obviously on break, rushed over and gave me a hand out and brought me a towel--refused a tip! The staff in the shop and rest. were equally helpful--Mary and Chris come to mind--just delightful and made us feel as tho we were the only ones there and it was their private home. Spoke very highly of the establishment. There was a water issue and we were instantly put in a condo-ocean front by Mike! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “No third party”
Reviews.Author: DavTap
Reviews.Content: Booked through AAA. Reserved a suite with balcony and king size bed. 2 night stay, Sat & Sun Columbus Day weekend. Was given a queen sized bed and no balcony for first night. I was told that hotel cannot gaurantee third party reservations. Was given a new room for second night. No refund of price differance, but a 5% discount for future stay. While at front desk manger was supposedly on the phone and couldn't talk with me. Overall hotel was good. Parking and location great. Breakfast buffet very bland, coffee and juice were charged extra. Carpeting in hallways needs replacing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craig L
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you would expect for the price....nothing fancy, but not at all rundown or dirty. The bar was a plus, as was the parking garage. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ocean view!”
Reviews.Author: cjajsmom
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed in one of the "towers" -- condominiums are on floors six through ten. We were on the tenth floor and the ocean view was absolutely amazing. I walked out on the balcony and simply said, "Wow." The view to the west from the hallway overlooks the bay and it is also a great view. Check-in went smoothly with only one little blip that was quickly corrected. The bell captain was quick to unload our car and entertained us with trivia as he showed us to our room. Yes, it is a long walk through the halls and you do have to take two elevators, but we have stayed at other resorts with equally long or longer walks that were outside, so walking the long hallway really wasn't anything to complain about. Our condo exceeded our expectations. It was nicely decorated and well-maintained. Furnishings were very comfortable, especially in the living room. Kitchen had everything anyone could need for a long stay although the only thing we used was the coffeemaker and coffee cups. The master bedroom had a wonderfully comfortable king bed, bathroom with a garden tub (didn't soak in the tub) and a terrific shower head, and large window facing the ocean as well as a patio door to the balcony. The second bedroom had two beds -- I think they may have been doubles, not queens, but I'm not certain. In addition, there is a pantry, coat closet (in the dining room), and a utility closet with a washer and dryer. There is ample drawer space for a family's belongings for a week and plenty of room for everyone to spread out. All of the staff that we encountered at Princess Royale were courteous and helpful. Housekeeping did their job well. We only had one minor issue with housekeeping and that is that we were not left any regular coffee for our last morning. Decaf just doesn't work for my husband. Since we were going out to breakfast any way, I didn't bother to request some regular coffee to be sent up. For the first time in all our visits, I used the pool. The entire pool area was clean, the music playing was wonderful, and the water was a perfect temperature. Very few people used the pool even though three of our four days there were not beach days (too cold). When we used it, no one else was there. Post-season maintenance and repairs were going on in several locations during our stay but this in no way intruded upon us. The second floor doors and hallway trim were being painted and windows in the pool area were being replaced. I noticed some other exterior work also being done. It never bothers me to see this kind of work going on when I am at a hotel as it tells me that management wants the resort to look its best for their guests. Overall, this was another great stay at Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Beach trip”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth H
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time at the Princess Royale. Great room and view, restaurant was great. employees were attentive and very pleasant and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for sunfest. Had a room off of the atrium. Could walk right out to the pool and game room. We could also walk out onto the deck and see the ocean. Very happy with the room. Nice and clean. Queen size beds were very comfortable. We had a kichenette and a sitting area. Plenty of room. Staff was very pleasant. i would recommend this hotel. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanaOC21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Princess Royale for the first time last weekend and it was great. We had an ocean side view on the 5th floor...it's so nice to wake up and see the ocean. My room was wonderful and the beds were very comfortable. We ordered brownie sundae's from room service and they were delicious. I will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “wow, what a place!”
Reviews.Author: scott f
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the princess Royale Resort in Ocean City Maryland. All I can say is wow! From the minute you walk in you can tell its a high end resort. From the covered Valet parking, to the indoor pools and spa the place is great. I enjoyed the fact that that you never had to leave the resort if you didn't want to. Multiple Bars, both indoor and out, to the Ocean Front Restaurant and lounge. The hotel was spotless, the staff very helpful and friendly and the direct ocean views from our balcony were breathtaking. The rooms were very comfortable, AC worked great, Flat screen TV, and memory foam mattress all contributed to the experience. I've stayed at many places over the years, but none compare to this. I will definitely be making this a yearly trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: melubitz
Reviews.Content: Princess Royale, is a family Hotel. If you have a pool view room, the inside pool is outside your room. It's great when you have small chidren as the rooms on the first floor is only steps away. I found this Hotel very clean. Staff was very friendly. The gift shop was very resonable. The breakfast buffet could of had a little more choices of food.

Reviews.Title: “A good off-season family getaway”
Reviews.Author: MD-H2Oboy
Reviews.Content: Albeit a fine hotel to visit during the “in-season", my wife, two young children and I prefer the Princess Royale Resort in the off-season. The reason being is that they have a wonderful indoor pool; and many of their suites face the pool. The pool area is VERY light and airy and is several stories tall. It has lots of skylights and a large glass wall looking towards the ocean. There’s also a pool table, ping-pong table and many electronic games located in the pool area. The rooms are comfortable and the king size suite we requested had a tempurpedic mattress. All-in-all… it’s a great place to take the family.

Reviews.Title: “Had a really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel and we had a very nice time. The check-in and checkout was quick and smooth with absolutely no problems. Since I have walking problems, we wanted a room close to the elevator and we also wanted an ocean view. Our room was a very short walk to the elevator and we had handicap parking right across the road from the hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable. The kitchen was clean and totally supplied with dishes, pots and pans, etc. The dishwasher, Frigidaire, stove, and microwave were spotless, as well as the bathroom. The room was a bit warm when we entered but because it was cool, 55°, it was not too warm. However when we looked to turn the heat down in the evening we saw that the thermostat was turned off. So, we had to open the door about an inch to make it cooler for sleeping. We stayed for three nights and every afternoon when we returned, the dishwasher was running-the maids had done the dishes for us. We did not swim in the pool only because we did not have the time. The pool was large and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable as were the pillows. I always have a problem with bedspreads in motels, thinking that they are not clean, and many people have used them. So, I always take the bedspreads off the bed. A think it is time for them to replace the bedspreads. All in all, I think this is a great hotel and I would certainly return again

Reviews.Title: “"Great views and good value"”
Reviews.Author: FRED S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 2 times at the Princess Royale Resort in Ocean City Maryland. Both times have been during the off season (Oct./Nov.) and as such we took advantage of their reduced rates as well as one of their coupons for a free night. The beach front rooms are excellent and provide as good of an ocean view as anywhere. I'm only familiar with the ocean front rooms. The Hotel is a little older but appears to be maintained well. I had one occurance where a reservation was in error, but the front desk personnel took care of it immediately and very professionally. I plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mary890
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale is a great place to stay. Clean! Great staff! Nice restaurant/bar area overlooking ocean. Easy, free parking. Great convention area as well. Nice, large pool area. Best of all --- Tempurpedic mattresses!!! Each room has a large living room area, kitchenette and eating area. Great deal for the price. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Flashback to the 60's!!”
Reviews.Author: maddogandtornado
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and then checked out. We were supposed to be in an "updated" 2 bedroom condo. The counters were updated. Everything else filthy. Light brown carpet was "black" with dirt, walls dirty, bathrooms old. In order to get to the condos you have to take 2 different elevators and walk around an entire floor. The decor in the lobby/halls is an awesome flashback to the 60's with mirrors/lighting. I would not stay here again. I will say that the staff was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo for a family of 7”
Reviews.Author: CeclaM
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this hotel, the first time renting a 2 bedroom condo. The ocean front views from the condo are fabulous. Even the rain couldn't get us down with such views. We love that the hotel has an indoor pool. The tempurpedic mattress is very comfortable. We had a very easy check in and check out process. My son left his Nintendo DS behind, but after a phone call to lost and found, the security manager Mike promptly mailed it to us. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel but Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: meeta4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two night. The hotel isn't new but well maintained and comfortable. Our room had a tempurpedic mattress, that we enjoyed trying out since we don't have one at home. It was pretty comfortable. We didn't like that they did not give us a discount for staying there on Sun. and Mon., they have one rate all week long. Also we stayed off season so it was relatively quiet on the inside paper thin walls, but then the kids across the street had a party on Sun night with a gang of 30 people. The nice thing was when we finally called the front desk at 1:30 am to complain, the front desk did take care of the problem immediately. It was also kind of pricey for off season

Reviews.Title: “Why stay any place else in Ocean City, Maryland?”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: During the weekend of September 23-25, 2011, we enjoyed our third stay this year at The Princess Royale Resort in Ocean City, Maryland. In previous years, we generally stayed at The Dunes Manor Hotel and had decided it was time for a change (for the better). The Princess Royale does not disappoint! Why stay in a small one-room hotel such as The Dunes Manor, when you can stay at The Princess Royale where all rooms are suites and in which the rates are generally lower for comparable accommodations? It's not rocket science. After our first stay at Princess Royale I fell in love with their Tempur-Pedic mattresses. When I got home, I bought one despite the expense. Few hotels anywhere offer such comfortable and therapeutic mattresses. The big draw card for us at any hotel are the pool facilities. Again, Princess Royale does not disappoint with an Olympic-size swimming pool and large Jacuzzi set inside a huge atrium. There are also two smaller outdoor oceanfront Jacuzzi's (seasonal). We stayed in an oceanfront double-Queen suite. Considering this was the last weekend of summer and the hotel had been pounded all summer by guests the suite was in near immaculate condition. The only complaint I have is that the pillows are too flat and uncomfortable. Not much to complain about, right? Everything else was great. The living room area is spacious with a sofa bed and lounge chair. There are two granite end tables with lamps, a pole lamp and granite coffee table. There is also a large credenza with drawers with a TV on top. Having a full kitchen is such a treat. The kitchen counters are granite. The full-size refrigerator (with ice-maker) is great for storing those large milk cartons and all your other refrigerated food and beverages. You don't have to bend down over those small refrigerators supplied at most hotels. There is a nice granite breakfast nook table area and two chairs with ceiling lamp. We enjoyed some cheese, crackers, caviar and fruit as a late-night snack at the breakfast nook. The kitchen is equipped with dishes, silverware, pots and pans and 4-cup coffee maker. We would have liked an 8-cup for brewing the Starbucks coffee we brought, but you can't have everything. No prob. There is also a large above-counter microwave. The sink even has a garbage disposal. I love the large granite bathroom countertops which have ample space for all the toiletries I bring along when traveling. The shower nozzle has good water pressure. The towels could be a little more plush, but I'm not complaining. The oceanfront bedroom has a large credenza with draws and a 32-inch plasma-screen TV on top. The suite did not have a DVD player and although we brought a portable one, we could not connect it to the other two TV's in the room. Again, no biggie. There is a large closet in the bedroom and also a lounge chair and pole lamp. The floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall sliding glass balcony doors allows ample morning sunshine to brighten the room. You can sit on the patio chairs and enjoy the sunrise over the Atlantic Ocean. It doesn't get much better than that. We were lucky enough to see a pod of Atlantic Bottlenose Dolphins migrating south during our stay at the hotel as we sipped our coffee on the patio. There are many more amenities too numerous to mention, but suffice to say The Princess Royale is now our new O.C. "Home Away From Home." The hotel rooms are clean, well-appointed, spacious and comfortable. The Housekeeper was friendly and thorough. The cozy oceanfront "Schooners" Restaurant is located on the premises which we find convenient when we don't wish to venture out for a meal. What more can you ask for without paying an arm and a leg for a hotel room such as with the O.C. Hilton Suites? (Been there, done that). You can always find parking in the multi-level garage just across the driveway from the hotel lobby. Bell-Hops can assist with your luggage, although we prefer to cart our own gear to the hotel room. Check-in at the Front Desk has always been a breeze. I'm so glad we found The Princess Royale Resort for our many O.C. stays throughout each year. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great suites for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel0804
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale for 2 nights in August. We reserved a side oceanview 2 queens suite for a family of 4. It was very nice, clean, and spacious. The beds are very comfortable. Overall, we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a few concerns”
Reviews.Author: KEI2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale for 3 nights this September. We reserved a pool view room with two queen beds. The room itself was quite comfortable and very clean. The beds were comfortable with all tempur pedic mattresses and the kitchen had enough dishes and utensils so we could have breakfast and lunch in our room without going out to eat all the time. The staff was very nice and attentive as well. Our main concern had to do with the location of the room. We knew it was a pool view (we were on the 5th floor), however, we weren't expecting there to be a conference/dinner in the pool area one evening. A dinner buffet was served in the pool court and there was a podium set up for speakers to make statements. Unfortunately, the speakers and noise continued until after 9pm. The noise was very audible in our room and made it difficult for our daughter to sleep. The room also constantly smelled like the pool and there was no way to get fresh air in the room. If we returned to the Princess Royale, we certainly would not stay in a pool view room. People should be warned that if there is a conference or banquet going on and it happens to be in the pool area, it could be loud later into the night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin W
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families! We have three small boys, and with the indoor pool, arcade/game area and of course with the ocean just steps away, it's the perfect place for us. This is our second time staying at the Princess. The first time we stayed in an ocean view room, and while you can "view" the ocean, the balcony is very small. We're a value-conscious family, and for our most recent stay, we booked the room months in advance to take advantage of the $100 Princess Bucks deal for a 5-night stay in an oceanview suite. To our surprise at check-in, they upgraded us to an oceanfront room for the same price as an oceanview room. It was really nice having the larger balcony overlooking the ocean. While my wife was inside with the baby, she could look out on the beach to see me playing with the other two. If you can swing it, it's worth the extra cost to get an oceanfront room. We also like having a kitchen in the room to cut down on food costs. We did our grocery shopping across the street at the Super Fresh on 94th street, and spent less than $100 for the 5 nights/4 days we were there. The only downsides to staying at this hotel are: 1. You have to drive pretty far to get to the boardwalk, but if you only plan to go there 1 or 2 times during your stay, then it's not a big deal. Parking near the boardwalk is $1/hour at a meter down one of the side streets if your lucky enough to find a spot, also the cheapest, at the inlet if somethings not going on (i.e. Sunfest), a little bit more, or $10-$20/day at a private lot. You can also catch a bus to eliminate the drive altogether. The bus only costs $3 for an all day pass, and children under 42" are free. 2. The parking spots in the garage are a little tight, but that's the norm for most of the ocean hotels I've been to. We have a minivan with the sliding side doors, so it wasn't a problem for us, but if you have a big SUV or truck, you may find it a bit of a squeeze. All in all, a great place to stay for a family looking to save a little money!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dated and not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTravelers30
Reviews.Content: The carpets look like they have been cleaned never, the rooms are dated and gross, and the smell is unpleasant and stale.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: curisgrg
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit again (second year we've been there). The rooms are great and cleaning staff did a great job. I would recommend it to anyone. This year we were able to stay on the 4th floor (very nice view). If you plan to stay in an ocean front suite, it is by far better to stay on the 3rd floor or higher. The only thing I found distracting was the light on the balcony. It didn't have a switch to turn it off. I would have liked to have turned it off during the night. And the only complaint I heard from my wife was that the coffee in the room was bad and could be a better brand (pretty picky but honest).

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Princess”
Reviews.Author: Fourchonet
Reviews.Content: Went there as a family retreat / birthday celebration. We were in a 2 BR which slept 10 perfectly fine. Great ocean views. Staff was overall friendly, and the huge indoor pool was a little cool, but the location is very convenient. Easy access with (nearly) personal elevator straight to the restaurant and the beach. Great outdoor bar with bar drinks! Highly recommend Lombardi's Pizza across the street. (Don't bother with non-pizza items). The restaurant is actually very good with the best Club sandwich in OC. Beach wasn't crowded at all, and convenient with umbrella and chair rentals right there. Overall, very Big Family friendly, with a PERFECT spot, and GREAT view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: PATRAVELER032
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Bike Week, check in was easy and quick, Bellman service was handy so that I didn't have to lug my bags up to the room. Nice parking , they let us park our bikes in the valet lot on the first floor felt really secure. The suite was large overlooking the pool in the atrium, which came in handy as it rained all day on Saturday, the pool was a comfortable temp. very clean and a nice hot tub indoors. The room was very clean, the help was very courteous and friendly, the bed was very comfortable, The AC unit was a little noisy as it is in the bedroom, the room itself was very quiet you could not hear any noise from the pool or the halls or other rooms.Everything functioned well in the suite, and was well stocked with kitchen utensils and glassware, it was also nice having an ice maker in the room. I did hate to pay extra for a safe that I did not use, they should just charge you an extra two dollars a night built into the room rate. The restaurant and bar were very good the service and food were both very good, I did find it a little odd though that the bar closed at 11PM on a Friday night while a bike week event was going on, we had to walk to a nearby bar for our nite-caps! We will be back for bike week next year and any other time that we visit Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “our stay!”
Reviews.Author: bigdirty1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for bike week, the room was nice, did not like the fact that the air conditioner was very loud when it kicks on, and it wasn't very cool in the room either. Also did not like the fact that they charge you each day for rental on the safe you don't use. But it was nice to just get away.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sbbear
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Princess Royal. Everything and everybody were excellent. Beautiful oceanfront view and room. Went before the busy season in April 2011 and would differently return again.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale, not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hotrod53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale the weekend of September 17th, 2011. Unfortunately we did not know that it was Bike Week! Although the bikers themselves were absolutely no issue, the trafic was heavy and the restaurants were all full. Finding a parking spot in the Hotel garage was difficult because the bikers took over. For every coupe of bikes, there was a truck and a trailer to go with it. Upon arrival we got into our room around 3pm which was about an hour early. Within the first hour we realized that our A/C didn't work, we called the Front Desk and someone was to our room in 15 minutes. Our A/C was fixed in 5 minutes, compressor tripped. A few hours later we discovered that out toilet wouldn't flush, called the Front Desk and again, 15 minutes later they were there with a new fill valve. We then discovered that the ice maker didn't work, we went and bought ice. The shower valves have the wrong stems and all the knobs turn backwards, but the shower head was fantastic ,.., like a turbo shower. The bathroom sink drain was real slow. They advertise 32" TV in the bedroom and yes it was there but no HD. You know how a TV looks with poor service, the aspect ratio was all wacky. The one in the livingroom looked to be about worn out and the picture wasn't real good. The pool area was great, inside hot tub, 2 saunas, inside bar, everything was well kept. The outside bar is closed this time of year and the outside hot tubs although open, were only 89 degrees and low on water. Be prepared to be kicked out by 10PM inside and 11pm in the outside hot tubs, no exceptions! Be cautious of their termionology regarding the rooms, only "DIRECT Oceanfront" faces the Ocean and these are all condos. Our room was Ocean View but it was really Pool view looking over the pool, thru the glass Atrium, and then see the ocean. If the weather is crappy, this is what you want anyway, but you really can't keep the sliding door open, it's too humid in the atrium. The good: it was clean, the maintenance staff was on the ball, check in was easy, All Temprupedic (SP?) mattreses, pretty nice. We has a suite, plenty of room and looked nice. We had a direct view over the pool and thru the Atrium windows to see the ocean. The Bad: the forememtioned maintenance issues, the room was a little musty, the A/C compressor is in the bedroom room and it was noisy (ours was going bad and was way too noisy). The couch and chair in our suite livingroom, while almost new, was the cheapest furniture I ever sat on, you felt like you would fall thru it. Overall: not bad, I'd stay here again. It's away from the Boardwalk and would normally be a little less crowded.. that is unless it's Bike Week!

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay in oc”
Reviews.Author: joseph g
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Princess Royale oceanfront every year on our annual trip to OC .usually in late september and really love everything about the hotel. Last year we booked a ocean front room and were pleased to find that the hotel upgraded our room to a oceanfront condo that really put the icing on an already delicious cake .. we would reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing comfortable stay in OC. plus the room service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Love it-Hate to leave it!”
Reviews.Author: Summer of '42
Reviews.Content: We always seem to have a pleasant experience here-this is the sixth summer in a row that we have been coming here. We come as a girls week away. Love the large and beautiful atrium area-the very available hot tubs and right on the beach. Great rates in the Fall, and the ocean is warm, and there is less traffic then. The people here are very nice, and the accommodations are beautiful, and not lacking anything that I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: Darlene H
Reviews.Content: When I woke up the morning after our 1st night, there were raised and inflamed bite marks all along the back of my neck. We reported it to the front desk and they immediately sent someone from housekeeping to our room. She lifted the top part of the top covers up about 2 feet, exposing a small portion of the bed. She also lifted up one of the 4 pillows. She then pointed out that there were no bugs. We insisted on another room and got it. When we checked out the following morning we asked the woman behind the counter if we could get a copy of our bill (we didn't want to be billed for oceanfront the second night). Still without a word to us, she printed the bill... she didn't ask how our stay was. So I told her our stay was really bad. I pulled my hair back and showed her my neck. She told us "I'm not a doctor". I wasn't looking for medical advise... I just wanted my complaint to be told to a manager so the room could be treated for bedbugs or spiders. My husband & I left immediately... we both knew it would be futile to talk to this woman.The disrespect that this woman treated us with was the reason I called a few days later. I asked for and spoke to a manager. I didn't know until that conversation that the woman who checked us out was also a manager. Incredible! The 2nd manager that I spoke to could not understand why I was calling. She went into a diatribe (reading from comments on her computer) of company policy and how the bites happened. She repeatedly told me that it either happened on the beach or mosquito's on my 4th floor balcony. She insisted that was how it happened. I asked by who's authority was it certain that that was the cause? Her answer was... "that's what's written in your files comments". As I told her, my neck was fine when I got in that bed on Sunday night... and it was bitten when I got out of it Monday morning. I also told her about the first managers comment "I'm not a doctor" and the 2nd manager actually told me "well that's not written in the comments". I then asked her why the 1st manager would even make written comment on a negative statement that she, herself made!! Another incredible!! I then emailed yet another manager who claimed all of it was a "simple misunderstanding". She went on to say that she hoped my experience wouldn't influence my decision to go back to that hotel. The only thing I wanted the hotel to do was.... get the bedbugs out of the room. They wouldn't even do that! I just hope that the next people that stay in room 470 or any room have a better experience than I had.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly and family oriented”
Reviews.Author: Momsdazeoff
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach. Indoor pool perfect for off season and to protect the little ones from too much sun. Clean. Convenient. Comfortable. Much friendlier and customer oriented than most. A very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel/Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: From_19390PA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. Although we had reserved a regular king-bed oceanfront room, to our surprise at check-in, we learned we had been upgraded to a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom ocean front condo! The condo was very clean, the bed and pillows were clean and incredibly comfortable, and the staff was incredibly friendly. Our dinner and breakfast at the Schooners restaurant was very good and it was especially gratifying to see the kids menu selection (I had initially assumed the restaurant was more geared towards adults). It was our loss that we were only able to stay the one night because we would have certainly enjoyed a longer stay. While this is not a 5-star hotel, it is definitely worth a return trip! The downside if you do stay in a condo on the 10th floor is that you have to first take the elevator to the 2nd floor, walk down several long hallways, and then take another elevator to the 10th floor. Slightly inconvenient for the folks who pay big bucks to stay in these types of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time!”
Reviews.Author: jayew19130
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Princess Royale at least six times and have not been disappointed. The oceanfront suites are fantastic, especially since we like to keep the balcony door open to hear the ocean waves. Just a few quick steps to the beach. The beds are super comfortable and staff are extremely pleasant and helpful. We always hate to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: Brook_Hbg
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 3-night Sept Saver package. Room was clean. Beds were comfy!! Stove/micro/dishwasher and pots/pans/plates made coming in from beach to make lunch for our toddler very convenient. Breakfast in restaurant was tasty and staff were very friendly. Wish we were still there...

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for the money”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNY71
Reviews.Content: Although certainly not a 4-star hotel, the PR is certainly nice considering the location and rate. Considering the context of the MANY overpriced and dated hotels in OC, the PR makes a valient effort to hide the age of the facility and will go out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We've stayed here the last two years and if we head to OC will likely be back (especially since the Hilton was $150 MORE a night). Oceanfront with indooor pool, a full size fridge and decent kitchen area, a large beautiful section of beach, and away from the craziness of the Boardwalk. Probably the best value in OC. Get the breakfast buffet special - one less meal to worry about and great each morning.

Reviews.Title: “First time there and loved it”
Reviews.Author: cg62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale for 3 days in August right after Hurricane Irene came through. We loved it. We had a room with a side view on the south side. It was very nice and more than we expected. The beds are extremely comfortable The staff at check in was very friendly and let us check in a little early since there weren't many people there. They had just reopened about 24 hours before. We really enjoyed the amenities of the hotel and definitely will consider going back

Reviews.Title: “"Out of the Rain!"”
Reviews.Author: leo1934
Reviews.Content: My sisters and brother-in-law wanted to spend a few days on the beach while my one sister was visiting from Texas. We had not been to Ocean City in many years and didn't know where to stay. I went on line and discovered the beautiful Princess Royale Resort. It was raining when we left my home with rain predicted the rest of the week. What a gift we received as we entered Ocean City--blue skies and bright sun! The Princess Royale more than met out expectations! It is even more beautiful than shown on the web site! From the moment we entered the lobby to the time we left, the staff and guest services were excellent. Every request was promptly met. The rooms were large and comfortable and luxury-equipped. The amenities such as the indoor pool, the beautiful lawn in front near an outdoor bar, has lovely tables, chairs and umbrellas to relax and enjoy the ocean view. The beach is wide and beautiful as well. I highly recommend this resort and will definitely stay there on my next visit to Ocean City...and I will look for those blue skies and bright sunshine from our oceanfront balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay in O.C.!!”
Reviews.Author: MeredithO88
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale is awesome! We have stayed there for two years in a row for a weekend soccer tournament, and could not have asked for a better hotel. The rooms are huge, with a full kitchen and plenty of space. The beds are so comfortable and everything is clean and modern. The staff at the hotel were all extremely nice, and they have a gift shop and small convenience store that between the two, have anything you could have forgotten or just want to pick up quickly. The view is very nice, and the hotel is right on the beach. There is a nice parking garage just for guests, and we never had trouble finding a spot. There are restaurants and a 7-11 within walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “First Time visit to this facility”
Reviews.Author: Darrell M
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here, service and accomodations were outstanding. Great rooms, food, service!

Reviews.Title: “Get away weekend...”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer O
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The lobby was tastfully decorated upon entering. The hotel staff is very friendly and extremely willing to help whenever they can. The room was great! Clean, soft sheets and pillows, quality items, didn't feel "hotel" cheap. Kitchenette was a great plus along with the attached sitting area. We had a wonderful stay overall! Oh, and the view was awsome. Waking up early to see the sun rise over the ocean is a definite must do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Amy D
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Princess on multiple occassions and this is a great hotel with wonderful staff. I love how things have improved since the hotel implemented the No Smoking policy. On our last visit we have one of the ocean view rooms but we were on the back corner so we have 2 sets of patio doors. I love the corner room more than the ocean front rooms we had because of all the light and air flow. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RedBaron7718
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right on the Atlantic beach. Rooms are spacious with living room area and kitchenette allowing for cooking/eating meals in the room. Exterior facing rooms all have a balcony with a view of the ocean. Staff are friendly and helpful; food and food functions well done.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Princess Royale. I there when it was brand and have been a frequent guest many times over. The rooms are clean, well priced and welcoming. The hotel staff is lovely and I am a huge fan of a suite. A suite is the only way to go. Its time for a facelift for Pricess Royale...but keep your excellent staff and customer service the same. It is working for the hotel. I am a repeat customer.and the whole package keeps me coming back. I am a propeerty owner in Ocean City, MD and I will happily pay for my own mini vacation at the Pricess Royale!

Reviews.Title: “vacation ON the beach”
Reviews.Author: chrisrrosenquist
Reviews.Content: Great vacation, even better hotel! Beds were TempurPedic, rooms clean and well maintained, pool was lovely, and the hot tub outside on the deck delightful a night. You can leave the pool, and walk from the pool to the outside deck and down to the beach, The staff is friendly and competent, and the restaurant and bar are both convenient and quite good. The chef came out in the evening and discussed his latest experiments with us, as well as asking our input on the dishes. All together a memorable and very fun experience!

Reviews.Title: “A Family Favorite”
Reviews.Author: bobbiemasakomoore
Reviews.Content: One of our family's favorite vacations is always a trip to the Princess Royale in Ocean City. There is something for all of us to do, the rooms are comfortable, clean and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “What a trip can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: LisaBellefonte
Reviews.Content: Our family visited Ocean City the middle of June. We were thrilled to be staying at the Princess Royale again. The hotel has everything you need an olympic size indoor poo game room and resturant, and just steps away from the beach. We arrived very early and checked with the front desk to see if there was any chance for an early check in. We were told to check back in an hour and to take advantage of the pool or beach in the mean time. We checked back in an hour and was promptly given a key, We stayed in a corner room that had a great view of the beach and the bay. The front desk clerks were so friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and very clean. We are already looking forward to our next visit to the Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “what a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: william j
Reviews.Content: i been going there for about 20 years the place just gets better and better the last time i went there last july i stayed stayed pool side they were just redone the rooms they were so clean and nice like i said the place just gets better and better

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Ma2Jenna
Reviews.Content: The beds are the best hotel beds we have ever had. We even bought the same mattress for home after our first stay! It is always clean and the staff if friendly and quick to help. It is more pricey than we would like, but to know we have a safe, comfortable stay it is worth it. The only downside is the restaurant for breakfast is always under staffed and a long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Troxlub”
Reviews.Author: Toni L
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Princess Royale, love the amenities. Utilized the spa while my family was entertained by the pool and beach. Hotel staff very friendly and were most accommodating. My children recently stayed at Princess Royale and truly enjoyed their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Annette K
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel during the summer of 2010. We were quite impressed with the location to the beautiful Ocean City beach. The hotel was very clean. It seemed as if staff was constantly polishing and cleaning surfaces.The rooms were spacious and comfortable. We were able to accommodate 2 adults and three children comfortably. The morning breakfast buffet had many hot and cold selections. The food was delicious and the wait staff very efficent. All in all a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “business meeting”
Reviews.Author: bob4353
Reviews.Content: booked late for a convention but got a great room overlooking the ocean with a heart shaped jacuzi right in the room. service was great food was even better, close by to bus so didn't need to use car , near great rerstaurants and other necessary services highly recomend as have stayed there over 20 times

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME VACATION !!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: We have been enjoying Ocean City, MD for many years. Decided to stay at The Princess Royale Resort for the first time. The room was incredible. Loved the separate living bedroom areas. Great restaurants and entertainment. The view was wonderful. We will continue our trips to Ocean City and most definitely will stay at The Princess Royale Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Retreat”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyNewJersey56
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed going there and staying for two nights. We had our own kitchens. The beds were comfortable. We had our own meeting space and the group loved the rooms and the food.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosanne S
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the availability, price and service . We had a delightful 4 night stay and we were towing a boat. They were extremely helpful in helping us find a secure location for the boat on the premises. We had a poolside, ocean view roon. It was great !Food was excellent and the room was so clean! We will return next year

Reviews.Title: “OC Golf”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Cannot overstate what a great place to stay! From management to bar staff everyone works together to make sure your stay is a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale Resort Ocean side”
Reviews.Author: Kyle B
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel.The rooms are clean and modern.The staff is courteous and helpful. I stayed at the beach side hotel which has direct access to the beach, with a outside bar and indoor pool side bar. The restaurant had good food. The hotel also featured an all you can eat buffet which was good. The hotel offered entertainment as well( they had a very reasonably priced comedy show)

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Spot in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Room was clean and comfortable. Hotel provided all amenities I look for: Nice big Indoor Pool, immediate access to the Beach, exercise room, games for the kids, adult lounge for the evening, convenience store, friendly helpful service. Was also able to and encouraged to use the facilities before and after check-in and check-out which creates a comfortability connection to the hotel. Service was good, location was excellent. Take a dip in the indoor pool, get out walk 30 seconds and jump in the Ocean. Enjoyed the patio bar and the beautiful view from the room. Decor,especially carpets need refurbishing, but hotel was clean. I would definitely recommend and stay at Princess Royale again.

Reviews.Title: “The best stress reliever.”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: My family and I just wrapped up our annual trip to Ocean City. We almost always stay at the Princess Royale however I never took the time to write a review. The staff is so friendly and accomodating, I told myself this time I will write a review. I travel for a living and stay in my fair share of hotels and resorts, at least one a month. I have yet to find a more pleasant staff or enjoyable stay than at the Princess Royale. From the moment you walk in the door, you are treated like the most important guest they have ever seen. We called down to the front desk to ask for more towels and less than 15 minutes later, there was the knock at the door with the towels. The maid service is always thorough and they are not shy with their smiles. The Princess is located withing a 2 block distance of some great restaurants: Lombardi's Trattoria, Bull on the Beach, Layton's and a few others. The beach is clean and they have a nice outdoor lounge area and outdoor bar. Breakfast in their attached restaurant is fabulous and the perfect morning cure after a night of fun. I will be booking for next year as soon as reservations open up !

Reviews.Title: “Great for family weekend”
Reviews.Author: Junipa
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale is a good run for the money overall. It's kind of your usual middle-of-the-road American Hotel that is completely sufficient for traveling with family while on a budget. We went there for my daughter's gymnastics meet so a group of us booked rooms for a lower rate. A nice feature is the room we stayed in had a kitchenette which eliminated eating out $$ every meal. The "ocean view" from our window was partial at best, but you can opt in to face the indoor pool, where my daughter enjoyed swimming with other guests/friends also staying. All In all, it's slightly run-down, I do mean the decor, however they do their best to keep it clean and provisions are adequate. Bed was comfy, shower alright. Staff are quite nice, but you have some nicer ones and a snarly one (isn't this almost everywhere?) Parking garage is right up front and there is an old-school restaurant located int the building as well. Sure I would consider this hotel again for this kind of trip. Way better then Howard Johnson's but if you are looking for Ritz experience, do go there instead!

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility during our Soccer Tournament”
Reviews.Author: Michelle S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay during the soccer tournament, Kids had a good time at the atrium pool. Plenty of room for the parents as well.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place To Stay In Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: Ken W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Princess Royale on several occasions. It is our favorite place to stay when we visit Ocean City. We have recommended the hotel to family and friends and they have been impressed as well. The rooms are always clean and the staff is very courteous. Many of the restaurants and bars are within walking distance. And if you want want to venture out without driving, there's a bus stop conveniently located directly in front of the hotel. The bus line runs from the Delaware state line down to the Ocean City inlet. I beleive you can ride the bus all day for about $2. The hotel itself has a nice bar and restaurant. The bartenders have always been friendly and helpful in suggesting things to do while we were in town. Some of our favorite watering holes near the hotel include Kirby's and Bull on the Beach. The hotel is right is oceanfront, so it's the perfect location for beach goers. For those who don't want to swim in the ocean, there's a large pool in the atrium area of the hotel. I expect to make many return visits to the Princess Royale. Definitely a worthwhile place to stay in Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Girls' Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean-front room and the view was spectacular! We watched dolphins and parasailing from our balcony. The room was clean, the beds were very comfortable (memory foam mattresses) and the kitchen was handy. Lighting in the bathroom could be better and the sofa bed was uncomfortable (although it makes the room a good value because more people can occupy without sharing beds.) When we checked into our room, the icemaker hadn't been turned on in our freezer. There were no ice machines on the floor, although the vending machines were well-stocked. When I explained to the front desk & asked where to get ice, they sent me "over the river and through the woods" to the restaurant to fetch it myself, rather than offering to bring some to the room. The food in the restaurant was good quality; however when we got the breakfast buffet, I asked if they could make an egg to order and after a lengthy check, they were going to charge me an additional $4.95 for one egg! At other resorts, that's normally complimentary if only scrambled eggs are offered on the buffet. The indoor restaurant service could've been better and we were wishing the Sunday brunch would be available earlier in the morning. The beachside dining and bar is a definite plus (better service too!) and is landscaped nicely with palm trees, etc. The resort is very conveniently located on the beach - but bring your own towels, they don't provide them. A rental station for beach chairs and umbrellas is right next to the beach entrance and the service is wonderful. We went early to claim a spot on the beach and the rental agent carried the gear to our location, set it up, dragged it back in for us when it started raining and set it back up shortly after the rain stopped - totally worth not having to cart your own stuff around! The enclosed pool area is very nice & a safe bet in case it decides to rain during your stay (you never know). I suggest utilizing the available vallet parking UNDER the building - they've never had any problems with theft or vandalism there, since it's more secure than the outdoor parking garage. The vallets are very helpful and polite. Bus stops are postioned close to the resort. Outdoor lighting around the parking garage on the way to the bus stops could be enhanced, but we didn't feel unsafe. All in all, a great place to stay in Ocean City and a good value! I'd defintely choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Princess Royale Resort for Md State D.A.V. Conv.”
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this resort and we would highly recommend it to anyone who is traveling to Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: Darthy12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale in early May, the room was VERY spacious and we had a wonderful view of the ocean. The indoor pool and jacuzzi were very nice and relaxing. We also ate at the restaurant, the waitstaff was wonderful and full of information on future promotions.

Reviews.Title: “We visit 2-3 times a year and it is always wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jakeandjazz
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Princess Royale for years. It is always a great time and wonderful experience. I will not stay anywhere else in Ocean City, MD!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Ocean City Md”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best resort in ocean city Md.Great rooms,great foos,great service it's all here.Stayed several times in the jacuzzi suites.Great views and staff is always friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “VFW convention June 2011”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence M
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Princess Royale quite a few times over the years, mostly with the VFW for convention. I have never had any bad experiences. I can't think of anything negative to say. Our trips have always been fine. The rooms have always been clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “MiniVacation”
Reviews.Author: Holly G
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean and spacious. The ability to use the facilities both before and after check in and check out was a plus. The decor is a touch out of date but the amenities made up for it. The location to the beach was very nice and the pool was also nice to have. I would recommend this location to my friends and family. The staff recommended a very nice restaurant and the entire family enjoyed both the view and meal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds with a nice view”
Reviews.Author: Heather A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for an extended weekend during a trip to OC for a car show and the room was nice, clean and spacious. We had a 2 bedroom oceanfront condo and could not have asked for a better view. The beds were very comfortable as well!!

Reviews.Title: “PRINCESS ROYALE REVIEW - GREAT LOCATION FOR FAMILIES!!”
Reviews.Author: thomas y
Reviews.Content: This destination is wonderful for families. The resort is situated directly on the beach front and very close to area attactions. Our family, two kids 12 & 10, has stayed at this resort in each of the last 4 years, sometimes twice during the year and "never been disappointed with the experience". The rooms are very clean and comfortable. We highly recommend the Thanksgiving feast from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale with my daughter's gymnastics team and we all had a great time! The indoor pool/game room area was the kids favorite :). I loved the tables where we could sit, eat and relax while the kids swam. The rooms were very spacious and very clean! The staff was excellent and very helpful. Definitely going to book here for our next Ocean City gymnastics meet!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time with family at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinnywop1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Princess Royale in a 2 bedroom condo. We had a wonderful time, received excellent service, and will be back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Todd E
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at least 10 times at the Princess Royale, and I don't have a negative word to say. The ammenities are excellent, it is always clean, & the staff is always courteous. I ask my grandkids what they want to do for their birthday and they always say "let's go to the Princess Royale".

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Ann M
Reviews.Content: We love staying here. Great location, great indoor pool, nice rooms. We love being able to walk to some of our favorite restaurants (Lombardi's and Bull on the Beach). Saves us money to have the kitchenette. Housekeeping does a good job. Our only complaint is that the HVAC is a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, needs some refurbishing/updating of decor.”
Reviews.Author: Goldenchic
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were clean and comfortable. Able to use facilities before and after check-in and check-out which makes for a great value. Service was good,location was excellent with a bus stop in front. Enjoyed the patio bar and the beautiful view from the room. Decor,especially carpets need refurbishing, but hotel was clean. I would definitely recommend,and stay at Princess Royale again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation Spot in North OC”
Reviews.Author: MooseFamily80
Reviews.Content: Princess Royale met my expectations...stayed 7 nights with my family of 5 - 3 kids 8-8-10. The room was spacious and clean, great beach location in North OC, close to stores / restaurants (recommend Bull on the Beach, Nicks Ribs and most definitely Lombardis!)... View of ocean and bay from our 5th floor Oceanview room... Enjoyed the singer/guitar player in the afternoon and movie on the beach. Kids loved the LARGE indoor pool. Overall - a good value for the beautiful beachfront location! (Lastly, be sure to book a pedicure with Marilyn in the on-site nail salon!)

Reviews.Title: “I’d stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: kesibmik
Reviews.Content: Good if you are on a budget but I definitely won’t be staying here again. I was expecting so much more and was very disappointed. If you are on a budget and want a cheap place to stay that is somewhat clean and has the accommodations with a kitchen, living room, etc. and is on the beach this is the place or you. The room was ok. It was clean but showed its age. The beds were very comfy. The view wasn’t quite ocean view as it was as far away from the ocean as you could be and not be facing the road. We had the view of condos. The free WiFi was spotty and had a very low signal most of the time. The hallways show years of wear and tear. All of the elevators smelled weird and were very slow. It wasn’t busy so I couldn’t imagine how the elevators would be when the place is full. The pool area was nice with nice size pool and hot tub. They have two smaller hot tubs on the deck facing the ocean. Access to the beach was a bit confusing and cumbersome. The beach itself wasn’t very nice and also smelled very strong. I’m not sure if it is left over damage/smell from Hurricane Irene or not. We didn’t notice this at Assateague National Seashore which is 10 miles away. I was expecting a much nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “"WHAT A GREAT LABOR DAY WEEKEND"”
Reviews.Author: Roger V
Reviews.Content: Rooms were above expectation, very nice and clean. Great service all around. Housekeeping cleaned our rooms every day. All employees very nice and professional. Will be staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility and wonderful helpful employees”
Reviews.Author: Liz H
Reviews.Content: I was attending a workshop held in the hotel and participants also stayed at the hotel. I have attended this workshop approximately 11 times in differents states and cities. This was by far the nicest hotel and the best accomodations ever. The staff was very helpful with suggesting places to visit and places to dine. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like a great vacation or to businesses who hold training or meetings. The meeting rooms were big, confortable and nicely appointed. Two meals each day were catered and the food was excellent. I was very impressed with not only the hotel but the beautiful area surrounding it. Thanks for a very pleasurable stay. Would love to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria S
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was soo pretty. Everything went great. The staff was very nice. I liked parking my car in the parking garage because I knew it would be safe. The room we stayed in was beautiful!!! Ocean view with a heart-shaped hot tub. We stayed here for our wedding night and we will be back every year to celebrate out anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Sharon g
Reviews.Content: My trip was for business, the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very nice and the bed was the best I have slept in. The rooms were very clean and huge with a Kitchenette. The restaurants where nice and the food good. This was the first time I stayed in Ocean City, but the next time I come it will be for pleasure, and you can be assured that this is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “It was so relaxing and the staff was very friendly and efficient, We can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: eleister
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely clean and extremely well furnished room Ocean Front on the 3rd floor. The maid service was excellent and all the staff throughout the hotel greeted you and were very friendly. The weather was sunny with 85 degrees all three days and the ocean was warm and the beach was larger than last year. It seems as if the storm washed in sand for a change instead of taking it away. The sand had been cleaned and life guards were on duty. Both our check in and check out were timely and with a smile.We have been coming here for the past 15 years and the entire property always looks new. They do a great job of keeping the property fresh and new. Try it and you will always come back

Reviews.Title: “Was great”
Reviews.Author: donnalee014
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, confortable and had a great location!!!! Oceanview hotel rooms opened out balcony to overlook the pool area (inside type atrium) with view of the ocean from every room. Easy access to beach. Entertainment was fun - saw comedy show with all you can eat buffet - good food!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort...definitely would stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: sweethi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was by far one of the nicest hojtel I've stayed at in OC. It was slightly far from the boardwalk but local transportation made it easy to get to and forth from the hotel. Staff was friendly and beds were clean.

Reviews.Title: “much better stay in OC this year thank you Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: Allie W
Reviews.Content: This hotel although needing an update in decor was far better than your last hotel experience in the OC. Our room was good, great balcony with ocean front view. We were a little afraid to stay in Ocean City because of our last experience and due to some of the reviews we read on this hotel. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel overall there was an unusual smell in the hallways but, this hotels sees a lot of guests during the season dragging in sand and other things that could have contributed to the smells. Overall we saw staff cleaning all day and into the evenings. The grounds were well kept and the housekeeping was visible and offered every day to clean our room even though we kept our do not disturb sign out so it was not for a lack of trying. The staff was pleasant. The one negative is being approached immediately by the baggage handlers. Some may find this a valuable service however when a guest wishes to handle their own luggage please be respectful not rude and let them take up their own things. Parking was good the pool was large and had a great view of the ocean as well. The only other negative was this annoying light on the balcony that we had to cover up because there was no way to shut it off and it takes a way an ambiance to site on the balcony at night. This is a good value for the money and we would stay here again for sure. Thank you Princess Royale!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hgrub
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here for labor day weekend- this place is NOTHING like the pictures!!! It's old and dirty!! The pool is disgusting and the hot tubs are beyond dirty and gross! The hot water in the shower took 15 min before any remotely close to warm water came out and it felt like the water was ripping your skin off! The staff is awful and definitely needs an attitude check! We even complained about someone opening our door while we were in our room several times then trying to quietly shut it while we were in there and surprise, surprise the manager said, " I'll look into it." She didn't do anything! We then needed to leave this Sunday instead of Monday and the extremely RUDE and UNFRIENDLY woman manager said NO REFUND and walked away! So NEVER EVER worth $1000 for 4 nights! Well, 3 since we have to leave a night early! I wanted to go somewhere else as soon as we walked in!! Stay anywhere else! They'll just give you an email and fax number to file a complaint that just goes straight back to the hotel where they do nothing with it!

Reviews.Title: “Room 406 Ocean Front...nice BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Laurie D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the PR from Aug. 22nd - 25th. Stayed in room 406. The hotel is dated. Our room had a small sitting * kitchen/efficiency area, bathroom and bedroom with 2 queen beds. The bed part was fine, however, the sitting / kitchen area had a really old/kinda dirty looking couch. Opposite the fridge was the bathroom. The tub had mold in it covered by silicone - completely visible. The toilet was grimy. Just looking at it, mold/grime was visible under the rim. My bowl at home is always spotless...a toilet brush and lysol toilet cleaner should do the trick (just a hint to the management who oversees housekeeping). The beach was great. However...overall, for the price of this place you're paying strictly for the ocean front part of it all. The rooms are dated. Perhaps renovations to the kitchen area and new tub/toilet/tiles should do the trick. For the price, you would expect cleaner bathrooms. I would have to pay all that money and be grossed out of having to give my toddler a bath in that tub. Please have someone look into this and periodically spot check rooms. It is a nice place but a little overpriced for the quality. I've had cleaner bathrooms, etc. at comfort inns in PA. PS: We had to evacuate on Aug. 25th b/c of hurricane Irene - that management and staff was extremely diligent, etc. in getting everyone out and check out was smooth given the hightened nervousness of the impending storm. Great job at the front desk, etc. for the smooth operating on that part. They were great!

Reviews.Title: “VERY HAPPY,PLEASANT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Johnny D
Reviews.Content: This was,as a family,our first trip.I can give you our honest opinion that this hotel staff was friendly,professional,and willing to go the extra mile.We traveled 9 hours,through the night,and asked if we could check in early.Not only did thet let us in early but 4 hours early!!! For me that was a big deal with 2 children under 3 years old.Food was excellent,location was perfect and hotel room was clean and "family" friendly.For those of you with bad experience,maybe your expectations are too high.For us this place was top notch and we couldn't be happier.Thank you to both trip advisor and to the hotel for holding up to my standards,which are very high.Happy travels :) Johnny D

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay U
Reviews.Content: The room was NOT worth $309/night. While the efficiency kitchen was convenient--what was not convenient was the arrival of the cleaning staff--during lunch hours and sometimes much later (2 pm), the lack of clean towels, three lightbulbs missing, and fan in the bathroom inoperable. Beaware--there is no dvd players in the hotel rooms for your children to watch (should there be a rainy evening). There is not outside pool. The indoor pool is nice, but crowded and humid. The wireless internet is useless.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: Donna V
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my boyfriend away his birthday weekend, and was willing to pay a little more to have a nice room. I booked my trip through booking.com and i feel i was completely ripped off! I paid almost $300 a night for a ocean view suite. The room was old and we had to ask the person at the front dest where our veiw of the ocean was. He instructed us we needed to go on the balcony and turn to the right and hopefully then we could see it. The hotel was not impressive at all, and for the price I paid it just wasent worth it. If you are a family of 4 and dont care if the room is very nice it would be a good choice, but not for a romantic getaway. Its a average quality hotel but the price i paid was for a higher quality, and I didnt get waht I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane didnt dampen the experience!!”
Reviews.Author: schooner427
Reviews.Content: We only got 2 days in before we had to evacuate the city but the princess Royale did everything they could to be helpful and understanding.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!! Excellent Room, Perfect Location - Ocean Front”
Reviews.Author: s w
Reviews.Content: The room was great! Two queen size beds in an ocean front unit. Everything was clean and well kept. The staff was outstanding. Loved the view. The beach was wide and we didn't even have to leave the hotel to eat and enjoy entertainment. The atrium with large indoor pool was great. All we had to do was take the elevator down (or walk the steps), and we were outside and on the beach in minutes. This would be a great place to come in the off season as well as in season. The other nice thing is that it does have convention facilities / meeting rooms so it would be a nice place for a business to have an event. We have stayed here before and will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay For All!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn R
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked an ocean front suite and let me tell you it was the most spectacular view ever!!!! The beds were extremely comfortable with the memory foam mattresses. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant because we were forewarned by other guests to stay clear. Aside from that, all was perfect in the world. We had the most incredible sunny weather. They even had a fireworks display on the lower end of the beach but the next night it was almost right in front of our beach area. The room was very clean. They had all we needed for a week long getaway.
