Flat screen in the bedroom, stovetop in the kitchen, pullout sofa, dishes and flatware..... basically everything they described in their online advertisement. A little expensive but it's a vacation spot so it was to be expected. They do have a Food Lion and Super Fresh that's not five minutes from the hotel. Also, things do close up kinda early but we did manage to find a Denny's that had great service and even better food!! The pool was kinda green and cloudy but I chalked it up to the high levels of clorine in the water. The front desk staff were extremely pleasant and the bell hops were great. Over all, I would definately come back and will positively book an OCEAN FRONT suite. Our kids had a great time as did my husband and myself. Thank you Princess Royale for an Awesome vacation. SEE YOU NEXT SUMMER, IF THE LORD WILLING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jlwynder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a side oceanfront view room with my 2year old and mother in law. We had a great time, got a good deal on our 1BR suite, also included the breakfast buffet every morning. The buffet, was not your top of the line type of food, but it was pretty tasty and having a toddler it was easy to just go downstairs, get him a few bites and not feel like I wasted my money. We did the seafood and prime rib buffet one nite, that was good. Swimming pool did have a weird color to it, but it was fine to swim in. Had a good time there. Housekeeping came a little late (for our taste, because my 2YO still naps, so they were always coming around nap time) so we would just have her give us some fresh towels and empty the trash. We didnt really use the dishes, so that wasn't an issue. One day she was able to come in at a good time for us, and completely clean the room. But she was always very accomodating and the room was totally clean when we arrived. No issues. The beds were comfortable for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We Never Stay Anywhere Else in OC”
Reviews.Author: JD D
Reviews.Content: Great Amenities, Right on the Beach, Great Food in the building and near by. We love the pool and hot tubs. The rooms are clean, the TV's great, we love the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel we'll be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: AWaga
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in an 2 bedroom condo that had great views of the ocean. Kids really enjoyed the free wireless and the pool. Schooners restaurant was really nice and the entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Our family will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy smelly hallways and elevators; like staying in an upholstered sewer”
Reviews.Author: Jlukekhoury
Reviews.Content: Took a gamble on finding a nice new clean oceanfront hotel in ocean City. Didn't pay off. The princess royale was probably nice 20 years ago. It is a bustling cavernous and confusing configuration of moldy smelling damp carpet and popcorn sprayed walls. We stayed in both a 3 BR/3B oceanfront condo unit goes for $600 night and the furniture is old and smelly and bathroom reeked of urine. Mattresses were saggy and sheets stained. Moved to a 2 queen room and while furniture and beds were slightly better, the carpets and bathroom still smelled of urine or mold. Food was mediocre as well and indoor pool was yellow. Pros: helpful staff, close to lots of places to eat and shop bit off the boardwalk. Cons: a new motel might have been cleaner

Reviews.Title: “The beach and the food!!!”
Reviews.Author: LIkestoTravelNJ
Reviews.Content: We come to Ocean City several times a year. In the fall and spring for golf and in the summer for the sun and the beach. We have stayed at the Princess Royale several times and always enjoy the stay. The Ocean front rooms put you right on the beach and the restaurants, like Liquid Assets across the street make it even better (no need to drive!) The beds are comfortable - the ocean front rooms are very quiet and large enough for the 4 of us. We came down most recently in July for a long weekend and had a great time. There was one non -beach day and the large indoor pool kept the kids busy for a good part of the day. Once the sun came out we were all back on the beach - a great short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ginny B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right on the beach. The pool was great too. The mini kitchen was nice with a family to keep meals cost down. Only disappointment was the restaurant at the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Myscottie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royal for four nights and had a great time. The hotel was just footsteps from the beautiful beach and there was plenty to do nearby. Layton's next door was great for morning breakfast and coffee. Lombardi's across the street was great for dinner. As far as the room goes, it was nice and spacious. Expected higher quality for the price though. Our ocean front view was unbeatable. Will certainly return to Princess Royal year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Great 10 year anniversary getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lori H
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the front desk staff was great, could not have been more welcoming! We had lunch outside while we waited for our room. The food was very good and the atmosphere and our waitress were wonderful! Our room was ready 2 hours early- unheard of! The room was beautiful and very clean. By far our favorite part of our stay was the gazebo bar and Matt the bartender! He went above and beyond to make his customers feel welcomed. Thanks for your dinner suggestions, the drink specials of the day, and helping to make our stay very special! We decided to extend our stay for another night and the front desk staff were very accommadating and had it worked out in minutes . Thank you Princess Royale for a wonderful 10 year anniversay! Can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale on our last trip to Ocean City, MD. The hotel is a little old looking, but it's clean and the beds are the most comfortable we've ever slept in! The pool was great and the staff was even better! We also ate at the breakfast buffet which offered a lot of variety and it was a little different every day. Not to mention the food was delicious! On the downside, the parking in the parking garage is not the best and the elevators were super slow, but I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Condo in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Jill K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several condo's in Ocean City over the past 16 years. I've always found them dirty upon moving in (even after they were supposed to be clean). The Princess Royale was spotless, plus the daily maid service was a great addition. No towels or sheets to drag from home! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation week in OC”
Reviews.Author: premiermass
Reviews.Content: Stayed in OC MD for over a week. Rented a 3 bedroom condo. Very nicely appointed, Staff was very friendly. Will go back. The only thing that I would suggest for the Hotel to do is upgrade and update the hallways and carpet. Im sure they get hundreds of guest through there, but it would go a long way. Looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trigmj
Reviews.Content: This was our second year at the Princess Royale and eventhough we arrived much later than anticipated (10pm) check-in was a snap. There was a medical emergency with our room type (Side Oceanview) so they gave our room to another guest and upgraded us free of charge to a Full Oceanview. We were VERY pleased with the free upgrade!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mjamama928
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay overall. The high points: 1. location, which was fantastic....only steps to the beach, and a very friendly, helpful beach chair rental staff. Not on the boardwalk, which made it less crowded. 2. The beds--incredibly comfortable temperpedic mattresses 3. Nice ocean view from the side balcony. The low points were the shape of the hotel--dingy worn-out carpet in hallways, loud air conditioner (to the point that it woke us each night), not enough bedding and incredibly thin mattress for fold-out bed. Also, I found it laughable that the hotel claims to be energy conscious, and wants the traveler to reuse towels, turn off all lights, etc, but the housekeeping staff ran the dishwasher for two coffee cups. I would have enjoyed being able to get a to-go cup of coffee somewhere closer to the beach (Coffee service set up at the cabana bar would be good!) All that being said, we had a great time and would consider returning if we're in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Amanda30034
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Princess Royale will not be forgotten. Apon arriving to the hotel after a long drive, I experienced rude service from the front desk cleck. When entering our room we found that the air conditioner did not work so we had to call and wait for maintence to fix it. As the maintence worker was fixing are air conditioner, a house keeper entered our room and used our phone. I had found that very odd. Later that evening after dinner, we returned to our room to find the door open. After calling the front desk, hotel security came to our room to write a report. Thankfully nothing was missing but we were told from the hotel security that "there were 2 famous people staying at their hotel, why would someone pick our room to break into? " I talked to the manager that evening about the situation and was assured a call back after he had reviewed the hotel video but never recieved a call. I would say that the Princess Royale is a nice resort but unless you are someone of their importance, you will be treated of like you are a burden.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back!!! Great place! Loved that it is non-smoking!”
Reviews.Author: Studentpastor
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Ocean City and it was fantastic! Definitely pay the extra money to get an ocean view room. We spent a lot of time just sitting and watching the beach. The beds were great and that there was a little sitting room with another TV and couch for our little one. There were a couple of things I'd change... The down switch on the elevator on our floor didn't work and when we told the staff member, he suggested that we take the stairs instead. (We were able to get on by pressing the up button.) Everyone else was great. The indoor pool needs a life guard as we saw a lot of safety rules being broken with parents not watching their kids and boogie boards in their. Other than that, the housekeeping service was great. The restaurant was good. The location could not be beat with the beach being right at the doorstep. And the best quality the entire resort is completely smoke free!!!! We're allergic, so it is awesome to have a place to go. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “This was our first stay, but it will be the first of many.”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette D
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about the Princess Royale. Although it was our first stay here, we are already planning on returning next year. The service personnel were especially friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nurse86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and 9 month old son. We had a great time but the hotel needs some updates! Pro:Great customer service, very clean, 2 room suites, large pool, quiet in room, great beds, great location, nice to have a small kitchen Con:Entire hotel needs updated, pool water is cloudy & it's very hot in atrium, breakfast buffet is not very good, Wifi was down the entire 4 days, slow elevators, toilet kept getting clogged All in all it was a good trip and my family and I had a good time. I would recommend that there was someone at the pool to enforce the rules. Kids had boogie boards, surf boards, throwing balls, diving in...not safe for a 9 month old! At the breakfast buffet there was not much of a selection and the food was cold, also coffee was not very good. Would def consider staying here again if some minor changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: misshodgson76
Reviews.Content: I always thought that people who left reviews were either employees/owners who were trying to bolster their rating or disgruntled guests who had a bone to pick. I can assure you I am neither. I have never left a review before, but I felt compelled after our stay at the Princess Royale. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful as we stayed for the first time in Ocean City. Our room was BEAUTIFUL...and a great price for Oceanfront. Our maid service was great and accomodating as we had to be in the room while our little ones napped. The other guests were so friendly as well. I don't know that I would recommend a pool view room...pay the extra money for one of their oceanfront rooms. OH...and the BED!!! A king size tempurpedic! It was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on! I would pass on the all you can eat buffet...head to one of the restaurants in town. Oh...if you have kids make sure to check out the movies on the beach on Thursdays. It was so relaxing to sit on the beach at night while the kids are mesmerized by the giant movie screen. The convience store saved my life as we ran out of milk for the baby... We will definitely be back. My only wish? An outdoor pool!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: john j
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, THE BEDS WERE GREAT, breakfast was good, room service was fast, friendly staff, pletty of parking and right on the beach. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Karen A
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Princess Royale. We had an oceanfront room. Many hotels say oceanfront but this was literally on the beach. Beds were so comfortable and the staff couldn't have been nicer. This was our first stay at the hotel but we loved it and we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Netsurfer733
Reviews.Content: The scenary was beautiful, the room was great, and the service was flawless. In fact, the management went above and beyond the call of duty and really put the experience over the top. The convenience to the beach and everything else was fantastic, and we ultimately had a great time. I'd say what they did for us in response to our problem I would, but then everyone that reads this might want to take advantage of the same thing. In any case, Ayo, Matt, and Lauren were particularly great, so have no fear when you come here!

Reviews.Title: “Total Family Package”
Reviews.Author: DacronStyles
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel/condo, perfect location away from the boardwalk. Oceanfront is the way to go, perfect accommodations with kitchen & large rooms for an extended stay. Perfect for all age groups we stayed with 7 adults & 4 kids ages 4-11. Get out to the beach early to claim your spot & take the bartenders word for eating & fun. The drinks were killer.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and will definitly come back!”
Reviews.Author: mrae26
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with two young kids age 7 and 5 and we stayed in a 2 bedroom queen oceanview room. Upon arriving at the hotel a bell man took our luggage to our room which was Ausome. Upon entering the room I was very happy to see a small living room, kichentte and then a bedroom. The room was very clean and the bed's are the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Daily Maid service was wonderful and guest service response time was very fast. I have one recommendation to the hotel and that is to anchor the safe to the wall or the floor for extra security. I have stayed in other hotels in OC and this was by far the best, from the room, pool, etc. and I will definitly be bringing my family back. Thank you Princess Royale for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: tammybpampered
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City, MD. We found the Princess Royale Resort online looking for our vacation getaway--hoping that everything it looked to be online was truly what it was in person. We were not disappointed at all! The resort is beautiful. Our suite was perfect. We enjoyed an oceanfront suite for five nights. Rooms were clean and immaculately kept. Temper-Pedic beds were wonderful. Service was prompt and all staff members were very friendly and eager to assist us. We truly enjoyed the balcony facing the ocean with live accoustic music below us in the afternoons. The breakfast buffet also was delicious at the Schooners Restaurant. The pool and hot tub area is beautiful as well. Wonderful experience. Thanks Princess Royale!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: davidcito989
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Cabanas at the first level of the hotel. So I am not sure how these compare to the other rooms and not sure if my reviews apply to those. Pros: - Check in was easy and quick. - Rooms are neat and clean - Can not beat the location for the cabanas. You open your door and walk out onto the grass lawn by the outdoor bar. Just steps away from the beach access. No waiting for elevators or going up and down stairs to get to the beach. When traveling with little kids and Dad has to haul all equipment to and from the beach, the access is invaluable. - Beds are very comfortable - Live music in the afternoons we good Cons: - AC unit could not keep up with the heat. I think it was something to do with the level because as soon as you moved from the 2nd floor to the 1st floor where the cabanas are, the increase in tempurature is significant. We could feel heat radiating from the floor tiles and the AC just could not keep the room cool enough. - Kitchenette is basicaly useless. This is related to the AC prblem because if you attempt to cook or heat food in the microwave, the AC (located in the bedroom) can not keep up and it made the heat even worse. We didn't expect to cook gormet meals there, but at least whip up something for kids and adults for breakfast and lunch if neeeded So instead of saving some cash and eating in on occaision, we had to eat out every meal. - Pool was disgusting: The pictures shows nice, clear blue water in the pool. When we arrived it was a cloudy, yellowish-green. It may have been better if the hotel chose to provide more oversight on cleanliness. They allowed a group of people who had just arrived, but unable to check in to thier rooms, to enter the pool fully attired in street clothes!! - Avoid the hotel restaurants. Expensive for less the average quality. We only ate breakfast there once, but I figured if they can't get breakfast right then I don't even want to try anything else. For fine dinning go to Liquid Assets across the highway. For breakfast go to the restaurant next door (can't remember the name. - Weird design: To get from the first floor cabanas to the front desk on the first floor, you have to take an elevator to the 2nd floor, walk across the entire 2nd floor, then go back down to the 1st floor. The elevators are excruciatingly slow.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay here again but needs some changes”
Reviews.Author: chelle695
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying when it comes to a hotel room I am very picky, the room has to be clean and the hotel has to have nice ammenities. I prefer the Hilton or Holiday Inn Suites but we had a last minute trip and they were both booked and I am very scared of many of the Ocean City hotels so we tried the Princess Royale and I was pleasantly suprised. This hotel is very nice for the most part. The rooms are suites with a living area, small kitchen, bathroom and separate bedroom area. For the most part this hotel is pretty clean. The rooms could definitely use some new furniture and some updating, I was actually affraid to sit on the couch it looked dirty. It had a kitchen area with a full refrigerator and it was pretty clean but outdated. The bathroom was nice and very clean. The bedroom area was very clean and the beds are absolutely WONDERFUL! They are temperpedic and very very comfortable. I have stayed here twice and quickly learned to research the room type before booking. Even though your room may have a balcony some of the balconies are not outside, they are within the pool atrium so you really can't see the beach and its not fresh air. The hotel has lots of great ammenities and is very family oriented. It is a completely smoke free hotel, you cannot even smoke on the balconies and for me this is nice because I am a non-smoker but friends of ours did not want to stay here because they wanted to be allowed to smoke outside. Some of the hallways need some fresh paint and new carpeting but that really is not a big deal. The thing that disappoints me most about this hotel is that there is no outdoor pool at all. There is a very nice indoor pool but during the hot summer months it is VERY hot and you can't see the beach, hear the ocean waves or get a suntan. There is a very small deck outside the pool area for sunbathing but not many people can fit out there and you have to go inside to get into the pool. Overall this is a pretty nice place to stay and I would definitely stay again because it has reasonable prices for the OC area but it definitely needs a facelift and it would be really nice to have an outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good time, but??”
Reviews.Author: mugsey1967
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from this resort, but we feel that there should be some upgrading requirements, such as there is no a/c in each of their elevators, the hallway carpeting was not at all apealing due to wear and staining throughout. The electric at localized areas such as our smoke detector in our room was hanging by wires, while I noticed broken taped up sections in the lighting on the ceiling in the hallway as well. I also notice there was minimal handicapped parking where there was only one spot per level. This was not our first visit to this resort and I hope it isnt our last, maybe some reqirements can be looked into before our next visit. Thank you for your time in this matter. Carmela Ruggiero

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it, will be back”
Reviews.Author: lanello
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, Tue - Sat. We rented a 2 bedroom condo. The condos are very nice, modern, clean, have washer and dryer (which we loved), a full kitchen (appliances all very new) and the master suite had a temperpedic king size bed, 2nd bedroom with 2 double beds, great for our kids. Balcony was small but faced the Ocean. Only complaint was the master shower had a little mold on the tile grout. A small concern, but something that should be addressed, so it does not get worse. Cleaniness is one of the most important areas for us in hotels and rentals. Love the beach side hot tubs and bar. Nice size indoor pool. One suggestion, would love to see someday even a small outdoor pool. They seem to have room for it, it would be a nice add on a really hot day. The indoor pool, while nice, was cloudy and it's pretty hot in there. We really like this hotel and have had two really good experiences there. Some folks complain about the odd layout, somewhat a maze to get to the beach, but it really didn't bother us. The other positives made that not a big deal. We come all the way from Ohio, so hope they keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back like every year!!!”
Reviews.Author: susanMorrisville_pa
Reviews.Content: Always happy here and great staff in hotel itself and in Schoooner's Restuarant . A lady by the name of Kelly was really knowledgable and very kind to us every day we ate in there. Room was clean and nothing broken, love the beds especailly if you have a bad back they are terrific. Had room 266 nice great balcony and close to the ocean even if you can't afford the oceanfront rooms. Always deal with Diane Anderson and have for many years now, always very kind and will try to help you out if she can at all.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy my visit to Princess Royale.Wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Tom1945
Reviews.Content: We loved the service.Especially enjoyed the rooom(1006).Felt like home.It is spacious and very comfortable.Granddaughter and I enjoy the indoor pool and my wife and daughter like the patio outside with the entertainment and bar.We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bkapla1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Princess Royale over the weekend of 7/22. We stayed here a few times before, but that was about 7 or 8 years ago. We had a room overlooking the pool area and were surprised that we didn't have any noise issues being so close to the pool. We could hardly here any noise in fact. Bed was very comfortable, rooms were spacious, staff was Very friendly. We ate breakfast twice at the hotel's restaurant and food was great and prices reasonable. We ate lunch at the outside grill once and the food was average and priced, but as expected for a poolside grill at a hotel. Great location as it's on the upper end of Ocean City, thus away from the younger crowd nearer the boarwalk area. Only 2 negatives (minor): 1. Can't use luggage carts on your own as you "must" utilize the bellman to take your bags in. Helpful of course, but an unexpected expense to tip the bellman. 2. Access to beach could be improved as you need to go down a flight of stairs to get there... not ideal when you're lugging a large wagon of beach supplies.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for family & fun”
Reviews.Author: Fullhouseblitz
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale is a great place for family & fun. You'll enjoy the stay with lots of conveinence at your fingertips! They have an indoor pool in their Atrium area with two jacuzzis just outside on the upper deck that looks over the bar & grill facing the beach. The rooms are kept clean with a very hard working housekeeping staff. Should you have a problem in your room, engineering is very prompt. Go out on the beach to be served non-alchoholic beverages that include smotthie type drinks such as pina coladas & strawberry daqs! From the start at booking, front desk check in, bellman & check out- you'll be treated like a King. Joe Testa - Maryland

Reviews.Title: “It was an awesome place with all the accommodations like a condo!”
Reviews.Author: katertot0810
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay with affordable rates. It wad nice being right on beach. Kids had fun in pool and the game room.the suite was clean and like a little apartment. Had a great beach view from balcony. Overall very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “It could've been better”
Reviews.Author: Joshuaisawesome
Reviews.Content: It was ok, but wasn't the best i stayed at because, they're were plumbing issues in the bathroom,the ac poorly worked, the outlet was burnt, and it wasn't worth the money they charged for.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale is a great resort.”
Reviews.Author: Freejd
Reviews.Content: It is very clean, the staff is friendly & always helpful. My husband & I were just there again last weekend & I had the most restful sleep. Once you are in your room you hear nothing from the hall or the adjacent rooms. The amenities are also great. I love this resort!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: gaugler
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in oc maryland before but this hotel suite was the best place so far with its full kitchen, seperate bedroom and clean rooms, i would recommend this hotel to anyone. , the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: jersegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Arrived just before 1 pm and was told check in is 4pm but was given a parking hang tag, and invited to use the facilities including the pool area if we wished. We found the grassy palm tree lined area just below the pool deck to be perfect for us. There was live entertainment, a bar, food stand, ocean view, comfortable lounge chairs and a cooling breeze. What more could you ask for? We spent the hottest part next afternoon enjoying the live entertainment and a cool drink in the same area. Around 3 o'clock we wandered back to the lobby and saw a couple checking in, stood behind them and the key to our ocean-view room on the 5th floor within minutes. The room was spotless, bed one of the best hotel room beds I have slept in, bathroom basic but clean, kitchenette quiet workable the full sized refrigerator with ice maker was appreciated. Unpacked and headed back down to the beach area and noticed a long line at check-in. My recommendation is to arrive early, use the facilities and try to check-in earlier then 4 or after.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in OC.”
Reviews.Author: Jml0717
Reviews.Content: They go out of their way to meet your requests. I asked for a 4th or 5th floor ocean view room. It wasn't available but an ocean front room was available. They gave us a free upgrade. It is a family friendly hotel. Nice grounds and kept clean. Being right on the beach is a plus too. We have gone here for 3 years now and will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing has changed in 30 years...”
Reviews.Author: nomadnordstroms
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting the Taj Mahal, but were taken aback by the overall shabbiness of the place. Great location and far from the madding boardwalk scene, the physical-plant condition is just OK, needing a facelift. Elevators are slow, sharing them with cleaning and mntc staff; the memory foam beds get decent marks and kitchens appear recently remodeled. Breakfast buffet is convenient, but below average, with commercial/frozen muffins and breads and institutional eggs; btw, we were charged $3.15 for a small extra glass of milk for our coffee, with the waitress defending the charge by saying: "if we gave a glass of milk to everyone for free, imagine what would happen." Yes, imagine--you might have a hotel full of happy tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: rfluck
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, clean, no smell of smoke. Beds were very comfortable. The shower was great with good pressure, not like alot of shore towns were they just give you enough water to get wet. Getting to the beach was easy and parking was very good!

Reviews.Title: “I'll go back!”
Reviews.Author: xsnapshotx
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip to Ocean City, I have to say I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised with my stay. Staff was all friendly, room was clean, hotel was right on the beach. To top it all off with their specials we got a night free...always good, all though the only thing I can say is I wish the specials applied to oceanfront rooms! We were on the side of the hotel, but had a really nice view of the ocean, I cannot complain, had a great time and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our Third Trip Back”
Reviews.Author: jacordova31
Reviews.Content: This was the third time that my family has returned to the Princess Royale. We currently have a five year old and a three year old. We love the indoor pool and hottub area. The view from all of their side oceanview rooms is wonderful. We also love the fact that all of the rooms are suites. We are able to put our little ones to bed at a normal time and continue to enjoy the evening in the "living" room. We also like the full size fridge and kitchen area so that we don't need to eat out for every meal. This is definitely a family friendly place. But at the same time, my parents who are in their sixties also are able to enjoy the hotel. It is not at all noisy. They even have family nights on Thursdays with kid-friendly movies on the beach. The hotel is far enough away from the crazier areas of Ocean City, but close enough that you can get to the boardwalk and other fun things easily. The hotel is very clean. The staff is also polite and friendly. The hotel food is overall good and not too expensive. The biggest downside to the Princess Royale is that it is hard to get to the beach. You need to travel through the pool area and down a set of steep stairs that can be slippery when they are covered in water or sand. (A staff member is ALWAYS there sweeping.) This is a bit scary when your arms are full of beach items and you have two little ones with you. There is also an elevator to go down, but then you need to walk through the restaurant. However in my mind this is not a big enough problem to keep me from coming back next year. Overall, this is a wonderful, clean, family - oriented hotel. Not to mention that the beds are super comfy! I'm already looking forward to going back next year and we just got home today!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful oceanfront view and a great weekend”
Reviews.Author: BirdsOfPreyDave
Reviews.Content: We were in a special class of room that had a king-sized bed and a heart-shaped Jacuzzi tub. (It wasn't what I went looking for, but was the last oceanfront room left with a king-sized bed. While a little smaller than the other suites and without a couch sitting area, we still enjoyed the room. Because it was on the corner, we had large windows on two sides of the room. We were able to open the sliding glass doors on both walls and let a wonderful ocean breeze come through. Lying in bed you could look out one way into the ocean, and the other to see up the beach. The room had a full-sized refrigerator with an ice maker, a stovetop with two burners, a dish washer, and a full complement of pots, pans, dishes, and silverware. This made it very convenient to cook breakfast and quick lunches in the room. The decor is a little dated. (The lobby screams 1980's!) We also took note that the chairs at the kitchenette in our room were cheap plastic patio-type furniture, and the rug and other furniture in the room were a little worn. I will say, though, that everything was incredibly clean. Each day, it was evident that the maid spent a good deal of time servicing our room and paying close attention to detail. We tried to avoid doing so, but knew we tracked a lot of sand into the room. Somehow, there never seemed to be a trace of it the next day after the maid service. There was no skimping on the most important piece of furniture in the room -- the bed. It was an incredibly comfortable tempur-pedic mattress. The linens were soft and fit the bed well. (Unlike so many hotels where the sheets are like sandpaper and pull out before morning, these were very nice.) The hotel sits right on the beach. We'd go down in the morning and set up our chairs and umbrella, enjoy the ocean and beach, and then retreat back to the hotel when the heat (or hunger) would get to us. There is a bar both at the beach and by the pool. There are convenient places to shower off the sand. We'd shower, swim in the pool for a while, enjoy a drink at the bar, or head up to our room to make lunch. Then, we'd be right back down on the beach. We could see our chairs and umbrella from our balcony, so knew no one was bothering them. The hotel offers a seafood buffet in their banquet room. We tried this one evening and were very impressed. We actually enjoyed it more than the Phillip's Buffet we went to the next night. We purchased a package that included dinner and the comedy club, and enjoyed the show. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant the morning we checked out was also enjoyable. Their breakfast buffet had a good selection of tasty food, and wasn't very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay...!”
Reviews.Author: judesays
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just got back from spending 3 nights at the Princess Royale Resort-it was recommended to us by a friend. Not only will I DEFINITELY go back but I WILL recommend it to others as well, including families with children. Our 5th floor room (2 double beds,flat screen TV, oceanfront balcony, sitting room with couch, chair, coffee table & TV w/kitchenette that included full-size fridge, apt-size dishwasher, 2 burner stove & sink, seating area for 2, nice-sized bathroom) was exceptionally quiet & clean & kept that way throughout our stay. Requests for extra towels & coffee for coffeemaker...not a problem. Every member of the staff were friendly & could not have been more accomodating. While we did not take advantage of the restauraunt or indoor pool, it was nice to know they were there. There was sometimes a few minute wait for the elevator but it was not a problem for us. The outdoor bar (with afternoon musical entertainment) w/seating area provided a nice break from the sun for a drink or an item from the luncheon menu. Clean, well-kept grounds, walkway to the also clean beach, chair & unbrella rentals available. They transported our luggage, etc... to our room upon check-in & to the lobby when we checked out & loaded everything into our car for us. The parking garage adjacent to the building was a nice feature as well. All in all, a really nice, clean place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GerandMar
Reviews.Content: My family occupied several suites during our stay. We had a lovely time. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. I would like to give a special thanks to Ryan at the front desk. He was efficient, thorough and very pleasant. The entire front desk staff were very helpful. The hotel is nicely designed and had spacious, clean suites. The only negative was the disorganization in the dining room, including a lack of utensils. But, the lovely hostess made everything right for diners. One night into morning there was no air conditioning in the halls and the dining/bar area. But it was corrected early in the day. Of course it was a record breaking heat day and things happen. Nice hotel with a GREAT STAFF!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: jamesb425
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and 4 days and had a wonderful time. When we arrived 2 hrs. early we not only got our room but an upgrade to a 2 bedroom condo.The room was immaculate and spacious. The main bedroom and the living room are on the beach side. There was a second bedroom on the road side. The kitchen comes with a large fridge, electric oven,dishwasher and some kitchen supplies (but not many). All the staff was very friendly and always said hello. Had to get used to the two elevators to get around but that was a minor inconvenience. The front set of elevators only serves the first 5 floors, so you have to walk to the back to get to the elevators that serve the upper floors. The nice part was you only had to take the back set to get to the beach. Hotel is away from the noise of downtown but it a convenient location for many restaurants. There is a grocery store just about across the street (easy enough to walk to if you are not getting many items). Definitely will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again”
Reviews.Author: niknate4
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in two rooms by the pool area the week of July 4th. This is our 4th trip to Princess Royale and we've stayed in various rooms. We really enjoyed the 3 bedroom condo last Easter but opted to be by the pool this time since the walking distance was pretty far in the condo and with children, convenience is important. We were in rooms 211 and 213 and neither of the back stove-top burners worked. We felt the hallway carpeting and walls are looking pretty dated, there weren't enough washers and dryers and the dryers didn't seem to get very hot. We were pleasantly surprised that the gameroom shut down at 11pm because prior visits made the noise level unbearable. Unlike our 3 previous visits, the pool was very warm this time and a nice surprise. The parking garage is a little less desirable on busy holiday weekends because the elevator is slow and the top floor's white paint is blinding. We had booked our rooms in Feb and requested a particular area but when we arrived, they had us about 9 rooms apart. Seems no matter what hotel we book at though, no desk attendant ever bothers to looks at special requests so if you don't speak up, your request may not be granted, We waited an extra two hrs to have rooms side by side but we were thankful to use the facilities while we waited. I think Princess Royale makes a concerted effort to have something for everyone but the one thing I think would be a great asset would be to add a children's play area in the grass by the bar area. The beach down on the boardwalk has a few wooden play areas and this would have topped our vacation! We could have opted to have a drink while our children played :) Anyway, we always enjoy our stay but things seem to need refurbished soon. Bedrooms are very nice but otherwise, the 80's look needs updated. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “This was our second trip and we will be returning!!”
Reviews.Author: mremail1964
Reviews.Content: Awesome views of the ocean, friendly staff, beautiful accommodations. You can't go wrong with this choice. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: NickPaper
Reviews.Content: Room size is large, balcony is kind of small but I didnt expect a big one either! It is away from the boardwalk but you can take the bus or drive. Almost all the hotels on the boardwalk are crap. So we loved this one. The bus stop is across the street from the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a change of pace and enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: 9OverPar18
Reviews.Content: Loved the pool, hotel is conveniently located and rooms were nice for a non-chain hotel in OCMD. I usually do not trust non-branded hotels (they tend to have less consistent standards) but I enjoyed my stay here and would not discourage anyone from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dtseaw
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out stay at the Princess Royale. The only complaint would be the shower head was not the greatest. Other then that it was nice. We were on the 4th floor with a side ocean view and it was very nice, It took a little while to navigate the best way out to the beach and back in, by the end of our stay we found a better way to get out to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back!")”
Reviews.Author: lspencer501
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Princess Royale. We loved the cleaness of the Hotel, the staff was wonderful and very helpful. When we come back to Ocean City, MD we will be staying at the Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: mariachina1
Reviews.Content: This hotel & resort is amazing. The staff is very kind and ready to help anytime. The whole place is very clean and comfortable. Easy access to the beach, excellent food. My kids were so sad that we could only stay for four days. I promissed them we[ll go back to Maryland and stay in the same resort. Beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, good location”
Reviews.Author: brightidea777
Reviews.Content: The hotel has clean beachfront, not crowded even at high season. Kids also love the swimming pool. I like the separate living room and TV in each room. Everything looks clean. The only thing I felt a little uncomfortable is that there're not enough dryers in the hotel so that I ended up waiting until mid-night to get my swimming clothes dried up for next day.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Ocean City hotel”
Reviews.Author: Potomac_11
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and been pleased with the room, great atrium pool, and super easy access to the beach. The outdoor bar and restaraunt are great for a break straight from the beach. Food is OK - average for Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: DustyDominic
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations. Suite was clean and well equipped. However, there seems to be little air conditioning in the hallways or elevators which can be unpleasant. There were also not enough handicapped parking spaces. Only four were provided and they were always taken.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: JazzyKathy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Princess Royale Resort, the staff could not have been more accomodating and nice! They have certainly trained their employees well, from the valet, bellboys and bartenders; they just did everything to make our stay enjoyable. We had a very nice pool, oceanview room on the 3rd floor. It was nice to have a roomy suite with kitchen and bedroom separate. The bed was very comfortable (our first experience with Tempurpedic). Spent a lot of time at their Gazebo bar outside because the weather was so pleasant. Matt really made excellent drinks and it was just so relaxing to sit there and enjoy the crowd and beautiful view. I think I can safely say that we will return to Ocean City and the Princess Royale!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Beachy722Maryland
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of nights at this hotel for business. It was great to have a suite with a small kitchen where you had a place to keep food and drinks on hand. The room was clean, and had nice amenities such as an ice maker, hairdryer and iron/ironing board. Each room has a balcony, and I could walk out and see the ocean from the side view, although the balcony was very small. There is also a room safe, but I found when I checked out that I was charged a daily rate to use it. The indoor pool area is nice, but I didn't have an opportunity to actually use the pool. It would be great for kids, especially on those rainy days that sometime occur on vacation. The beach in front of the hotel is also very nice. The parking garage was convenient. The staff was always pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Another relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: gjm105
Reviews.Content: Comfortable clean room. Great location with access to all the necessary activities...including easy walks to restaurants and shops. Great beach front and wonderful lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: bemac15
Reviews.Content: Every staff member we had contact with was more than friendly and helpful. When we needed extra towels or pillows, they were there within minutes. Nice size room, clean, nicely appointed. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but no real value”
Reviews.Author: john40_67
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here the last week of June 2011. There was some delay in checking in and out at the desk but the staff was friendly. However, one complaint I have is with the handling of the "Rodney deal", which is buy four nights and receive one night free. The reservation was made several months in advance and was confirmed with an email invoice. I inquired about the free night at check-in and the desk clerk stated it would be taken care of at check-out. However, at check out the desk clerk only asked if I wanted to keep the balance on the same credit card, but did not state the amount (which I found to be a little strange). When I asked the amount she stated a figure more than what it was supposed to be because they left off the free night. To their credit, however, once I "reminded" them of the free night deal they quickly deducted it and charged the accurate amount. I would recommend if booking through any of the deals that you figure in advance exactly what should be owed. We were provided a side "ocean view" room on the second floor that had a living room with a pullout sofa, kitchenette, bath room and separate bedroom with king size bed. Mattress was very comfortable. Now they just need to work on replacing the pillows. Below average view and the room was somewhat small but everything worked - no real value though for what was paid to what was received. For the amount of money we expected more space and a little better view. No other option but to use bellhops to carry luggage in and out. Ample parking in hotel garage. Pool and hot tubs are nice. We did not dine at the restaurant so I cannot comment about it. Overall, a decent family place in a good location on 91st Street. I would recommend this place but would also look elsewhere for better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale did not disappoint!!”
Reviews.Author: Patti9518
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our two-year old son just returned from a 3 night stay at the Princess Royale Resort. We decided to take a quick trip to Ocean City, Maryland over the 4th of July weekend and were having much difficulty finding a decent oceanfront hotel. I read as many reviews on Trip Advisor as I could until I narrowed it down to the Princess Royale and then crossed my fingers that we could get a room. I went to their online reservation system and couldn't find any oceanfront rooms, so I decided to call them and they did have an Oceanfront Queen Suite available. I was ecstatic! But on the ride to OC, I prayed that the reviews were correct and that the Princess would be a nice hotel for my family. We arrived at midnight and had no problems with check-in. Our room was a corner suite and looked just like the pictures I had seen online. It had a small living room and a nice sized kitchen area which I appreciated with having our 2 year old along. The suites were clean, our maid service was wonderful and we loved the location. It was just far enough away from the boardwalk that we had some peace and quiet and not as much traffic to deal with. The indoor pool was nice and we loved Schooner's restaurant onsite. They had a seafood buffet in the evenings and that was perfect for us. We also took the public bus down to the boardwalk one night for only $4.00 so we didn't even have to take our car out of the garage the whole stay! My husband and I felt that Princess Royale was everything we needed for a nice, quick getaway to the beach. I am already planning our trip there again next year and will definitely be looking to book at the Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and good location for families.”
Reviews.Author: Randr060222001
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice and the on the staff and the on the beach location great. We had a blast at the Beach bar during the afternoon. You will need to drive to the boardwalk and hub bub of OC. We didn't want to be near all of that action and chose this location because of that. Eat outside the hotel -- the seafood buffet looked very disappointing -- more meat and fried seafood than fresh seafood. Layton's is great for breakfast, Lombardi's has great pizza and Itailian meals, Bull on the Beach has a fun atmosphere and wide variety of food-- you can also drive up town and get crabs and ribs. Kirby's Pub is a local establishment with an interesting menu and good drinks. Liquid Assets looks like a great place for date night.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay.....”
Reviews.Author: George_H_5_11
Reviews.Content: For the last several years, I have attended the Maryland VFW Convention held at the Princess Royale Hotel, Ocean City. I can recommend this hotel without reservation. My stay there has always been most enjoyable.. Rooms (suite actually) (I usually get one facing poolside) are always clean, and ready to go upon arrival. If something happens in the room that requires attention.... their engineering staff is there in a jiffy to take corrective action. Hotel staff are polite, seem well versed in their duties and actually seem to care about the needs of visitors. It is just one nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just as expected, a clean room with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EdisonMann
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. Parking is not very convenient, but managable. The beach is well groomed. It's one of the better options in upper Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Heart-broken mom”
Reviews.Author: upsetMOM20
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I had to cancel our reservation due to my newborn developing double ear infection, high fever, diarrhea, vomiting, etc the day prior to our arrival. I called the hotel after the doctor advised us not to go away. The reservation manager basically didn't want to hear my sob story, told me I was wasting her time while she could've been taking an order and at the end of 20 minutes conversation, she says "ma'am, what would you like to do? Would you like to still keep your reservation?"..Are you kidding me?! Didn't I say I needed to cancel in the beginning? She was implying that I was a liar and if I knew that my first night couldn't be refunded maybe I'll change my mind and still go on vacation?! On top of having to care for a sick infant, she made me feel horrible. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “We will NOT be back”
Reviews.Author: misc03
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were upgraded to an ocean-front instead of ocean-view. This was basically the only positive thing that came out of this stay. The room smelled horrible but we decided to stay with it because it was only a few days and we didn't want the hassle of switching. Everything needs an upgrade. The appliances are old. The elevators are quirky. The parking is a pain in the rear. And last but certainly not least, the maid services WILL steal your items if you let them. We found that out the hard way. I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: 68ginger
Reviews.Content: Although the room was very nice, the customer service at this hotel is horrible. The first front desk person we encountered told us that our room was on the first floor but we had to take the elevator to the second floor then take the stairs down to the first floor to reach the room. We took the elevator up, found a stairwell and ended back in the lobby. We went back up to the second floor and found signs pointing to the elevator that you need to take to reach suites 101-111. After wandering through halls we found that elevator, but it was out of service. We went back to the lobby and asked the front desk person how we get to our room. Again she said just take the stairs! After arriving on the second floor again, we found a bell hop who had to think a moment then took us down a flight of stairs and we ended up in the staff parking garage. We walked across this and he found a door, entered a code and got to the floor where our room was located. When I asked him how we would get to our room if we left he said he wasn't sure because we didn't have the key code!! Fortunately we found a route by exiting the building and going in through the restaurant. The second night the hotel was having a function outside on the lawn in front of our room. When we asked the front desk what time the loud music and dancing would end (we had a small child who wanted to sleep), the woman at the desk was completely unaware of anything happening. She checked with someone else and after a 15 min delay she said she thought it would be over around 11pm. We asked to be moved to a different room away from the noise but was told the hotel was booked despite the "VACANCY" sign out front. When I asked to speak with a manager this person told me that the manager "was too busy to handle this minor issue" So if you want a nice hotel with good customer service stay anywhere but here!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel To Stay A-Shop NO Further!!!”
Reviews.Author: OceanCityFan_BB
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd stay here and every time we are never disappointed with the hotel room, staff or anything. This hotel is right on the beach as you will soon learn when you go look it over on the internet. The beds are very comfortable. If you have any issues (light bulb goes) or anything you just call and they are on it and taking care of it. If you decide for no maid service - you better know you will get a call later in the day just checking to make sure you do not need them or anything the maid service provides. I truly "as the wife" get to hang up my wife hat and so like that. Anything minor we experienced was just that and has no room for talk here, because the overall stay was amazing and we will be back. You also will enjoy walking right onto the beach and the umbrella, chair rental folks are right there. Then walk right outside the hotel to the main road and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel, so awesome. Rooms service is yummy and a great treat. I sure hope we can go again in 2012, because Princess Royale here we come!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Happytotravel48
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, beds were comfortable and everything was as promised in the reservation. The location is perfect since you can go right from the lower floor through the pool area and directly onto the beach. The pool bar was open and that was fun. I would stay there again off season.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and plan on returning some day.”
Reviews.Author: rdimeo34
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, easy access to whatever you wanted to do. Staff was very polite and helpful. The pool area was unbelievable. As well as the acess to the beach, which was right outside the door. Hotel restaurant was very reasonable with a great atmosphere. The mini-mart and clothing shop inside the hotel was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest part is its locatedon the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Paki_Princess
Reviews.Content: I went to OC from 6-17 thru 6-19 and I stayed at the Princess Royale Resort. I didnt experience much of the hotel but the best part was the beach right outside the pool area ! and it was wasnt tooo crowded like on the boardwalk. The Hotel has an indoor poor (wish it was bigger) and a sauna ! Prices were decent for a 2 night stay..

Reviews.Title: “We Love it Here!”
Reviews.Author: vlyak
Reviews.Content: We recently visited "our home away from home" again for a milestone birthday and were thrilled when we were upgraded to one of their beautiful two bedroom condos. It just made this special occasion perfect. It is just like being at home (well, actually better because of the beautiful ocean views!!) with the large full kitchen and washer and dryer if you choose to do laundry. The additional private bedroom and bath is great for extended family to have their own "space". The Tempur- Pedic beds are wonderful, we always sleep well when we are at Princess. Although we were "spoiled" with the condo this visit, the one bedroom suites are fantastic as well. There is a kitchenette and separate living room area where other family members can also relax or sleep and watch their own TV. The large pool and atrium area is without a doubt one of their best amenties and absolutely the best pool area in Ocean City! The outside Gazebo bar was open this time of the year and many of us enjoyed this while listening to music. Their Schooners restaurant has great food and offer breakfast and dinner buffets on some days. We never miss the breakfast buffet ! The views from the balconies are fantastic and many mornings you see Dolphins. We can't wait to go back next month for a family vacation. We absolutely love the Princess Royale and will continue to come back for many more years!

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT DONT LIKE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: sheri28
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was ok.The rooms are pretty large so it worked well for the 4 of us.I was there during sunfest and it was very crowded and conjested.I like to stay on the boardwalk so this year we will be returning to Park Place its a smaller room but the location is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: msocen
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time, we were upgraded to a three bedroom condo, view was unbelievable, room was amazing, decorated in such a beachy decor! Oceanfront room, just steps to the beach! All the staff was so friendly and knowledgeable! I wish I could go back every month for a few days, I hope we can return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great family location for all ages!”
Reviews.Author: Momsdazeoff
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach! Restaurant in-house and surrounded by some of the best bars & restaurants in all of O.C. Clean, convenient and reasonable! Nice but not so over-the-top that you're afraid to touch anything or share quality family time. LOVE the pool as you can get sun while at the same time protect the little ones from too much of it.

Reviews.Title: “Our family had a great time at the beach!”
Reviews.Author: laxmombeachlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale for a lacrosse tournament. We had a condo unit that faced the beach and my family loved it! The Princess Royale is perfect for families. The rooms are spacious and clean and the amenities are very family friendly. The indoor pool is very big and beachfront location is perfect. We were able to walk directly to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Room and We"ll be back”
Reviews.Author: ocean1147
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale Resort is a great Hotel but needs to update the lighting in meeting area and Hallways. The air conditioning is not good in the rooms and needs to be repalcaed. If I had paid full price I would have been very upset with the room. The new beds are great and the room are decorated very beachy. Thank you, Larry Musson

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Post18
Reviews.Content: We have been vacationing in OC for the last 16 years. We came across the Princess Royale after driving down Coastal Highway and stopping in a variety of hotels and picking up information at each. We found that the Princess Royale had a lot of perks that fit our family. The main thing being 2-room suites (with kitchenettes) that suited us well when our children were younger and went to bed earlier than we did. We have also utilized the self-serve laundry services in the past located on two floors of the hotel. That started a yearly tradition that has been going on for about 6 years. This year (2011) when we checked in, we were promptly met by a bell hop by the front door. Valet parking was an option ($5 a night) or park yourself, if you like. We have always been able to find off street parking in the small parking garage in front of the hotel (no extra charge). We were taken to the 2-bedroom condo that we would be in for the week. The condo was beautiful with an incredible view! It had a full-size kitchen and washer and dryer. It was also nice for our teen and almost teen daughters to have their own room to share and their own bathroom as well. Another bonus is a small safe in the master bedroom. Two shelves, large enough for a laptop computer and you set the 4 diget code each time you close it. The rooms have always been clean. We brought a laptop this year to take advantage of the wireless internet available in the room. I'm not sure if it was high speed, but it was very handy for planning the next day's activities. We had an issue with the TV this year. The last tenant set the parent lock on the TV in the living room. We had someone from Engineering in the room within 10 minutes, at 9 PM no less, who had the problem fixed in less time than it took him to get to the room. Our room had a VCR and a DVD player with the TV in the livingroom. Though I didn't take advantage of it this year, the hotel has a workout room on the first floor. I have used the tread mill, weights and stationary bike before. Being on 91st Street, the hotel is across the street from the Super Fresh grocery store, which we utilized to save some money cooking our own meals in our full size kitchen. Having the ability to prepare and eat meals in is a real money saver, plus we had somewhere to put the leftovers from meals out (for the next day's lunch). It is also across the street from Sunsations, which came in handy when we needed to replace broken goggles right as we were heading to the beach. They also have a small convenience store and a gift shop on the first floor. Both came in handy when in need of an item, but I didn't want to leave the hotel. Since the hotel is oceanfront, the beach is accessible right from the hotel, so no need to travel and find a parking space. Also across the street is Candy Kitchen and Layton's Restaurant is next door. We took several trips down to the Boardwalk, but were very happy to come back "home" to the hotel where it's quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of the Boardwalk and surrounding area. When we had our fill of sand, we headed into the beautiful Atrium to use the indoor pool and indoor and outdoor jacuzzis. This has been invaluable to us when the kids want something to do, and it's either too late in the day to swim on the beach or the weather doesn't cooperate. The pool and jacuzzis were well tended and cleaned by the staff daily. We saw the outdoor jacuzzi was emptied at night and refilled every day during our stay. They also provide complementary towels for use at the pool. The Princess Royale has one of the best kept secrets in Ocean City - Schooner's Restaurant. The food is unsurpassed! We make it a point to eat there at least once during our stay. The wait staff there is also great. We never had to look for our waitress or ask for a refill. We have never been disappointed. Unfortunately, we've never been in OC during July or August when they have their Seafood buffet, but if it's half as good as the food off the menu, it's definitely worth the trip. Whenever we have had to call the desk for assistance, the staff has been courteous and prompt in responding. We have come to view the Princess Royale as our Ocean City home.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was very lavish and nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: TMWood
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed being on the beach, with access from the hotel, and the view, breakfast at the beach from the hotel, and accommodations were amazing. I would definitely recommend this resort for translate and will stay again. I, also, enjoyed the indoor pool and patio view of the ocean, from inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HaileysMomMom
Reviews.Content: We loved the accommodations. We stayed in a 3 bedroom oceanfront condo. It was gorgeous, clean. Nicest place I have ever stayed. The only negative was the maze to get to our room. Once we figured it out, not a problem, good exercise.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely time for beach fun for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: Outbackdad
Reviews.Content: Beach front location provided us with a fun filled time for everyone. Well suited for children, our boys loved the pool and had the run of the beach. We will return here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 3-3.5 hotel with convenient amenities and good location”
Reviews.Author: ericapeace2000
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed at this hotel the weekend of may 21st. The hotel stay was pretty good. Pros Great indoor pool area with large pool, saunas and hot tub. This unique area is a vacation life saver if the weather stinks. Rooms were spacious and had s full size refrigerator and lovely kitchenette. Beds were good. Parking lot was great Beach sin deck was nice with 2 hot tubs. I can imagine when it gets crowded this could be too long of a wait. Check in/out was smoothe Cons Beach could be kept cleaner Fire alarm went off in middle of night and no staff members could be found for direction or explanation. We saw a lot of older people very upset and confused. Decor could be updated but it is still in good condition for most part Bar inside pool area was never open Bar outside by beach seemed to have limited availabity Toilet had a pee stain Hot tub in doors was extremely loud We had a very good time and I think the average person would. If You are a pickier person, spend the extra money for a more luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SharpEyeNJ
Reviews.Content: 2 bedroom condo on the 9th floor overlooking the beach and ocean, whats better than that? Room was very clean, staff was nice and helpful, bartenders were great, food was great, pool was outstanding, price was very good. Of course some ----- set off the fire alarm in the parking garage at midnight so we had to evacuate outside for 20 minutes but thats not the hotels fault some drunken loser that I would love to have a few words with face to face set it off but whatever it happens. Don't listen to the few negative reviews on here, hotel was perfect, go there.

Reviews.Title: “Condo room was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: oldaardvark
Reviews.Content: My wife and my sister and I stayed in one of the condo rooms in the part of the hotel next to the beach. I believe it was the cleanest, most beautiful hotel room I have ever stayed in (we have traveled a lot both in USA and abroad). And not all that expensive considering the quality. The service at the hotel was excellent. We had stayed here about 10 years before at a perfectly adequate room but this exceeded our expectations. Have rebooked for August (the beach was a bit buggy in September). It's true that we had to use two elevators. We got over it.

Reviews.Title: “I Was In Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Jennasbeachboy
Reviews.Content: My young daughter and I just got back home from a vacation at Princess Royale! I thought I was in Heaven! I loved it there! My 4 year old daughter and I had a grand time! We booked an Oceanfront suite with Debbie, who was so informative and helpful! When we got there, we received an upgrade to a two bedroom condo! It was beautiful! It was renovated, clean, had comfortable tempur-pedic beds, loved the layout of this condo(room 1002 on 10th floor), and what a beautiful scene of the ocean from the 10th floor! I loved it!!! At night we left the window open to hear the ocean waves crashing. The pool was awesome! It is a heated inside pool and this is the first time I was ever able to just walk into a pool that was called "heated"! It usually takes me a few minutes to submerged in a pool and get used to the water temperature, but this pool was really heated! So I could just jump right in! The Atrium was clean as every where I went in the hotel was super clean. The pool was opened till 10pm at night and the lights in the pool were awesome. Even the elevator was neat, with the glass so you can see out to the ocean as you go up to our room. My daughter would push the 10th floor button and we would both go to the glass to watch the ocean as we go up! We ate at Schooners (breakfast and dinner) and it was delicious! I had a chicken and pasta plate. The chicken was so tender it just melted in your mouth! Loved the ice tea! This resort is right on the beachfront. So location and amenities were perfect. Boardwalk not far from this hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. I can say everything was perfect and my daughter and I will be back! Thank you Princesss Royale and staff!

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return next year”
Reviews.Author: verypickytravler
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to take the family on the kids vacation in april as we always do.We travel with another couple and their two kids so we like to go somewhere close to home. Last year we stayed at the princess royale and had a great time. So we chose to try it again. I called and spoke with a manager Divanna and explained what I was looking for as far as my stay and she was more than helpful to assist me. We chose to stay four nights in april in an ocean front suites. Since we were returning guest the they were nice enough to waive the extra fee for our children over 12 so that was a plus. We checked in on wednesday and was meet by a very nice bellman chris.He took our bags and showed us to the front desk. At the front desk I was greeted by a friendly worker who checked us in. Thank god out room was ready early because it's a long drive from mass.When she checked in I was told that they upgraded us to a two bed room suites. I was shocked and very pleased. At this point chris the bellman took us to our rooms. We had to take two elevators to get to the rooms.At first I thought that would be a problem but when we got to our floor there were only three rooms on it. this was great because there was not alot of foot traffic in the hallway. The rooms were great they were so spacious and the beds were so comfortable. The kids rushed off to the pool which they loved. Let me say it was great for adults too. I could keep going on and on about how much fun we had and how great the resort is but I think this says enough. Thanks again to Divanna and all the other people at the princess royale for making out vacation such a great time. I can't wait to return next year. Dont believe the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “This place could use some upgrades.”
Reviews.Author: scm13
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Ocean City. When we first arrived at the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised, but as our stay progressed, I became more and more disappointed. On our first night, someone from guest services called the room to make sure everything was okay and to see if we needed anything. I asked for a portable crib for our 1-year old. The woman didn't know anything about cribs, so she put me on hold for a few minutes, only to tell me that they charge $15/night for cribs. I don't know how that compares to other hotels in Ocean City, but out of all the hotels we've stayed in since my 4-year old was born, we've NEVER been charged for a crib. The next day, we found out that neither of the two televisions worked very well (they both had poor reception on some channels), and the remote for one wasn't working. Also, the jacuzzi bathtub - one of the things I was looking forward to the most - didn't work. The furniture in the living room was a bit dingy and the mattress in the bedroom was way too soft for me so I had backaches every morning. Finally, when we called down to ask about a business center where we could print something, the operator told us where to go and said she would have security open the door for us. However, when we arrived, it turned out we needed a credit card to use the computer (which we hadn't brought with us). This wouldn't have been a big deal except (1) it was annoying that we were being charged, and (2) it takes forever to get from the lobby to some of the rooms. The floorplan is strange, and to get to our room on the 8th floor, we had to take one elevator to the second floor, then walk down three long hallways, then take another elevator to the 8th floor. It took a while. So it would have been helpful if she had TOLD us about the credit card on the phone! The good things were the location - right on the beach, great view from our balcony, and the suite we were in had a full kitchen so we were able to cook some of our meals in the room. Also, most of the staff were friendly and helpful. Although I don't have anything to compare this place to in Ocean City, I will definitely look around for something better if we go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: drfox623
Reviews.Content: I stayed off season, and the hotel is fabulous! The tempur-pedic bed was an extra pleasure. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I had a minor problem with my icemaker and had barely hung up the phone when repairman was there. Problem resolved in minutes. I will be going to Ocean City once per year & will always stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: EarthyBarbara
Reviews.Content: Over the past few decades my husband and I generally stayed at the same Ocean City, MD, hotel. It was time for a change. So, I searched the Internet for a change of venue. I came across The Princess Royale Resort. My main criteria was an oceanfront hotel with a large indoor pool and Jacuzzi. The Princess Royale seemed the perfect choice. I scanned TripAdvisor.com and found many positive reviews. So, I went on-line and booked a 2-night stay. I decided afterwards to add an extra day so called the hotel. Then, a short while later I checked the most recent TripAdvisor.com reviews. Much to my dismay, there were several very negative and troubling reviews. I therefore called the hotel and canceled our reservation. I was then charged a $25.00 cancellation fee on my credit card. I did not recall seeing anything on the website about a cancellation fee although I'm sure there is a blurb somewhere. When I had called the hotel to add an extra day after I booked on-line, the reservationist did not mention anything about a cancellation fee. So, I called the hotel complaining about the $25.00 fee and was basically told "tough luck" that is our policy. I was aware that on the second page of the hotel confirmation in fine print the cancellation fee. However, this is after the fact and after the reservation had been made. I decided to send an e-mail to the hotel complaining about the cancellation fee. A few hours later, I received an e-mail from one of the hotel mangers waiving the cancellation fee on a one-time courtesy basis. The gest of this is be aware of the $25.00 cancellation fee when booking a room at The Princess Royale. In my e-mail communications with the hotel I also stated that the reason I canceled our reservation was due to several negative TripAdivsor.com reviews. The PR manager, Diane, took the time to explain the nature of the negative reviews and that misunderstandings and misinformation had been posted on TripAdvisor.com. I very much appreciated the time that Diane took to explain the negative reviews which ultimately resulted positively in my mind-set about the hotel. She also offered us a 25% discount on our room. Feeling comfortable, I decided to go ahead and book my husband and I at The Princess Royale for 3 nights. When we checked in at the hotel, low and behold we were booked in the VIP condominium for the price of a regular suite! The condo was absolutely spectacular. Two bedrooms (one King bed, the other two Queen beds), two full baths (one with Jacuzzi tub), one bedroom even had a sink and vanity. There was a large living room overlooking the ocean with a balcony with views of both the ocean and bay-side. The large kitchen had a huge granite counter with three bar stools which served as a dining area. There was even a formal dining room. Also, a washer and dryer inside a linen closet. The condo was spacious and magnificent with plenty of closets with shelves to put all our clothing and other travel items. The carpeting was new, clean and comfortable. The only damage I noticed in the condo was a small area of peeling paint in one of the bathrooms. The furniture left a little to be desired. One living room chair was damaged and felt like you were sitting on the floor. One bedroom ceiling fan was inoperable. Other than that, all was great! There were issues with the water, (especially hot water) and one day the water was turned off for several hours. This is not unusual for O.C. hotels. The Tempur-pedic beds were very comfortable, a little firm but quality sleeping. The pillows were a little lumpy and odorous. I don't understand why hotels don't use pillow liners under the pillow cases to keep perspiration from penetrating the pillows. Oh, well. There was a very nice almost terry-like thin blanket on the beds which was comfortable, warm and fuzzy. Be advised that the towels are equipped with tracking devices that will set off an alarm if you try to walk out of the hotel. There is a sign in the bathroom advising guests. For the life of me, I don't know why anyone would want to steal hotel towels when you can buy better quality towels just about anywhere. One minor thing, there is complimentary shampoo but no conditioner, so you may wish to bring your own. We had no issues with the Wi-Fi in the hotel whatsoever.
