The Housekeepers did a great job servicing our room on a daily basis. The hotel itself is very clean and custodians were cleaning all aspects of the hotel and lobby regularly. One thing that is noteworthy is that the entire property is non-smoking. I am not a smoker, but I did notice many cigarette butts just outside the hotel lobby. Perhaps the hotel should install smoking outposts outside the property to prevent this eyesore. Custodians had to sweep the cigarette butts constantly. Now, about the swimming pool. Many hotels post website photos of their pool area taken with a wide-angle lens to make the pool appear larger. This is certainly not needed with The Princess Royale Hotel indoor atrium Olympic-side pool. There is also a fair-size Jacuzzi next to the pool, but unfortunately, several of the water jets were inoperable. The pool and Jacuzzi water is clean and chlorination and Ph levels are checked regularly. The water temperature in the pool and Jacuzzi was very comfortable. The pool itself was very clean (no scum on tiles). There are also two saunas located near the pool. In the summer, there is a snack and beverage bar and plenty of video games and claw machines for the kids. One suggestion I would like to make to The Princess Royale hotel management is to install a lock at the pool entrance area wherein you must have a hotel key to access the pool. This would prevent non-guests and non-desirables from just walking inside the pool area and taking advantage of the entire pool facilities. When you enter the hotel lobby you will be impressed with the fountain, plush furniture and decorum. One thing I noticed in the hotel hallways is that the carpeting has no tears or split seams. Generally, hotel carpeting leaves something to be desired. However, the hallway carpeting was clean and in great shape. One problem that deters from the aesthetics of the hotel are dents in many of the hotel room doors. We attributed this to guests letting the doors slam on the Bell Carts as they dragged them inside their hotel rooms. That's a shame that some people are so careless. We dined twice at the hotel restaurant "Schooners." It's a medium-size quaint restaurant and several tables are oceanfront. The food is average but the soup is great (potato cheese and French onion). We also had the breakfast buffet which was also average and limited. The ambience of the restaurant is great and I'm sure there are some dishes that are delicious. During the summer, there is a seafood buffet in one of the conference rooms. The hotel also has a gift shop and convenience store which is a little pricey. Anything else you want to know about The Princess Royale you can find out on the hotel website. Overall with our very positive experience, we have decided to make The Princess Royale Resort our "Home Away from Home" when visiting Ocean City, Maryland. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Unbelieveable Stay”
Reviews.Author: cjp333
Reviews.Content: Great room and we come here every year for my husbands birthday but was never upgraded to a room like this one. I hope to be able to get this room next year. Thank you all so much!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: padeamal
Reviews.Content: First off I want to say I was very skeptical of the hotel since the reviews I had been reading leading up to our stay were all over the place. Even a review (a very negative one) that was on this site yesterday I see was removed so I am wondering what's up with this place? Anyway, this hotel is what I would expect at a summer beach community, not the greatest place, not the worst place, just average. It was clean but in need of some upgrading. The front desk staff checked us in quickly and they, as well as all the staff I encountered, were very pleasant . We stayed as part of a group attending a cheerleading competition held at the convention center and this place was sufficient for our needs, rooms a great size. The indoor pool area was ok and appealed to the younger kids, but I would not have wanted a room that overlooked it, it was a loud area. Two complaints I had: there was an odd odor in our bathroom which I decided may have been the cleaning products, I did report it to the front desk to have housekeeping check, (but not sure if they addressed it since odor remained) and their fitness room was not so great, very musty odor in there, I could not stay in there and was unable to use it because of that, but I was not impressed by it anyway. All in all this place was nothing to write home about, but like I said, was sufficient for our needs. Almost forgot, the Tempur-pedic beds do deserve a mention, they were great.

Reviews.Title: “This was our first visit to this hotel and we will definetly be back!”
Reviews.Author: squickel
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the Princess Royale was just wonderful! We orginally booked a 1 bedroom suite so we could have some privacy from the children. To our surprise for some reason or another we were upgraded to a two bedroom condo! The condo was absolutely gorgeous and spacious! The room was immaculate and the ocean front view was beautiful. The children very much enjoyed the large swimming pool and arcade area. We orginally chose this hotel due to it being a little more pricy to avoid the younger crowd due to St. Patricks Day parties and it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for our Women's Retreat”
Reviews.Author: beachick18
Reviews.Content: We just held our Women's retreat at the Princess and everything was great. Our suites were clean with plenty of room and we LOVED the tempur pedic beds! The food was good and the weather was beautiful(for March!). The staff we worked with from group sales, banquet managers, to even the bell hops, were all very friendly, professional and accommodating. Thank you, Princess Royale!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Carol42673
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I have ever been to...rooms were amazing and service was great! Can't wait to go back next year!! Will be bringing friends who saw my pictures and can't wait to go also.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel entertained 350 of us and everything went without a hitch!”
Reviews.Author: skhoober
Reviews.Content: We served 350 of our employees and their families at the Princess Royale and eveyrthing went unbelievably well. The staff was professional, prompt, and courteous. All of out catered meals were excellent. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. Location was excellent. We will not hesitate to return to this same venue.

Reviews.Title: “The suites are great for families”
Reviews.Author: sdhMaryland
Reviews.Content: The suites are great - more room than a traditional hotel room - sleeping area with a TV and a door to close it off from the sitting area which has another TV and a pull-out couch. It was nice to have a full kitchen too. The inside pool area is great for the kids - plus it's an oceanfront hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again! The worst!”
Reviews.Author: 60811Traveler626
Reviews.Content: Yes, they renovated, but the design of the hotel is bizarre. We had to switch elevators (the elevator doesnt stop at every floor!) and walk through a crazy long maze to get to our room. We requested a change but it was no better. The 3rd room had a stale smoke odor, was unbearably hot, the AC was hot air blowing all night. The bathroom was poorly designed, the toilet dirty. Sleeping in the heat was impossible and we cut our stay short, left the following morning. Minor maintenance issues were not addressed beforehand, we had to find our own doorstop for a door that would not stay open. What a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Service was A-1.”
Reviews.Author: hmaymay
Reviews.Content: We knew nothing about this hotel when we booked and were delightfully surprised. From the check-in by the super friendly and professional O-Hio giving us an unrequested upgrade to an ocean front room to the SUPER comfortable Temper-pedic beds to the very clean rooms (the entire hotel was spotless), we couldn't have asked for more. The rooms were average in decoration and our meal at Schooner's was average, but overall I would definitely choose this resort again and again. I must say that if you are there for the indoor pool and hot tub and you are not fond of kids and loud noises, be sure to check if there are any groups before you book. While we didn't mind, someone else might not have been pleased with the pool being overrun with the kids there for a soccer tournament. The atrium area got really loud and since the pool closed at 10 p.m., I also wouldn't recommend a room overlooking the pool! Our room was completely silent, however, and was totally relaxing. The suite has a door separating the living area from the bedroom, which is really nice when not everyone wants to go to bed at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Get-a-way to relax”
Reviews.Author: dennisf72
Reviews.Content: I went by myself just on a spontaneous get away after a disatrous birthday weekend the previous weekend. The hotel lobby was immaculate. Put you in the mind of a casino type hotel elegance. The room was very clean and nice. The beds were very very comfortable. The parking was great and I even left my bike there and felt it would be safe. I would like to see the bower shower rod in the bathroom. I like them and the only negative was that the bench press bar was broken. The pool area was phenomenal. You would not expect the area to be so large and the glass roof and wall allow you to look at the ocean. And it is right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone enjoyed theirselves on this vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Edgecampingfamily
Reviews.Content: Place was very nice, room was big enough to accommodate the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ellenandmike_11
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a place to go to escape the winter this is the place to go. The balconies in the Atrium are great! To sit and look over the pool while it's cold outside gives the feeling of summer. The pool and pool area is well maintained and clean. The pool itself is very relaxing as well as the hot tub. The rooms are a great size, they are clean, and the staff is very friendly. We came and stayed in February and then returned again in March. I'm already looking forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Their slogan "Casually elegant; elegantly casual" is definitely true.”
Reviews.Author: prozonfm
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Princess Royale many times and have always enjoyed our stay. This trip, we were pleasantly surprised to have been upgraded from a one-bedroom suite to a two bedroom condominium. This gave our family of four extra space to relax and an extra bathroom to make the morning routine easier. The condos have been recently remodeled, the kitchens are beautiful, and the beds all have comfortable Tempur-Pedic mattresses. The view of the ocean and beach from the eighth floor was spectacular. With only three condos on a floor, the stay was very quiet. We're late sleepers, but the housekeeping staff never made us feel rushed to vacate the room so they could clean. We will definitely stay at the Princess Royale in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: lowens03
Reviews.Content: We loved the great location on the beach. Pool was large with a great game room to keep the kids occupied. Rooms were very spacious and well designed. Beds were very comfortable and had a great sleep, which is not typical being away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cbouchat101
Reviews.Content: MY family had a wonderful stay at Princess Royale. Check in was quick. The room was very clean and the beds are so comfortable. The oceanfront view was nice. The wireless internet was easy to use. The kids loved the pool and arcade games. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay at when either traveling with a group or individually!!!”
Reviews.Author: cindycPasadena_MD
Reviews.Content: Our cheerleading group stayed at the Princess Royale the weekend of Feb 26th - Feb 28th for the Reach the Beach competition. As the secretary for our organization this was the first hotel I called as I have stayed there many times in the winter and it was also a sponsor hotel for the competition. Our organization has stayed at numerous hotels in past years and none can compare to the Princess Royale, I arrived a day early just in casr there were any issues during check in for the parents and was pleased that there were none. I introduced myself to the people in group sales and they were extremely friendly and accomodating. I never experienced any issues with noise, which can happen when you have 500 cheerleaders in a hotel. I had a pool level room and when the sliding glass door was closed the room was very quiet even when the pool was packed with the cheerleaders. The pool is huge and was a great amenity for the kids as well as the parents. The beds are extremely comfortable as they are tempurpedic and you just sink into luxury when you are sleeping. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious with all the comforts of home. Great for when you are traveling with family as you have a seperate living room and bedroom. The rooms were very clean with plenty of towels and pillows. The sauna and hot tubs were wonderful as well. The parents in our organization just raved about the hotel with no complaints at all. Our organization has already booked again for next years competition. My husband and I also have stayed at this hotel many times during the winter and we love it. We have stayed in poolveiw as well as ocean front rooms and both are very very nice in ther own way. If you want and ocean front room try to get a corner room because the balcony wraps around and you get the extra bonus of having a veiw of the bay as well. My husband is a very light sleeper but has always had the best nights sleep in the comfy beds at this hotel. Noise has never been a problem. My husband loves the pool as he like to swim laps and the pool is extremely large and is great for laps. We have eaten in the restaurant a couple of times for brunch and it has always been good. It is great having 2 tv's as he can watch his sports and I can watch what I like as well. We typically do not go to Ocean City during the summer because we don't like the crowds but I have a friend who stays there at least 2 times a summer for family vacations and they would stay no where else. They have even been upgraded a couple time to a 2 bedroom condo. I highly recommend this hotel for all your stays in ocean city.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel for Sports and Youth Groups”
Reviews.Author: morinci
Reviews.Content: Our youth sports club had the pleasure of staying at the Princess Royale while visiting Ocean City for a soccer tournament this month. The entire staff of the Princess Royale was friendly and extremely accommodating, they made our entire stay a pleasure. The suites were vary spacious, clean and had a great view of the atrium pool area and the ocean. The hotel offers such amenities as a restaurant, bar, indoor olympic size swimming pool, indoor and outdoor hot tubs, sauna, pool side arcade and workout room, The location of the hotel was perfect as well. There was plenty of restaurants and entertainment close by. The kids were never bored at this hotel! We look forward to coming back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Place is Great I dont know what the past 3 reviews are talking about”
Reviews.Author: manors18
Reviews.Content: Notice the last 3 bad reviews they are all within 3 days , they are witten by the same person , so keep that in mind .also notice the reponse from the hotel . My wife and I stayed in room 468 a ocean front jacuzzi and it is great clean room .I can only speak for this specific room but this is a good hotel and I would recommend it , the room had an awesome temperpedic mattress awesome sleep

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: justme028
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here unless you want to sleep in filth or feel like you are back in the 70's!! I had to take 2 elevators just to get to my room, those same 2 elevators smell like someone vomited in them. I can't say I saw bed bugs, but I was very itchy. The front desk is so, so rude, it's obvious they hate their job! Spend the extra money and stay at the Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Do not EVER stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: milwife2003
Reviews.Content: Our room was very outdated, seemed clean until my son woke up the next morning with what looked like bites all over his body, that got worse throughout the day (He was taken to the doctor as soon as we arrived home, and is now on steriods). When I advised the front desk of this the VERY RUDE women did not have a care in the world. When I asked for the phone number for corporate she handed me a business card, it only had a fax and an email on it. I wanted a phone number, she told me there was no phone number, I told her again I wanted a phone number, she then called security to escort me out just for asking for a phone number. My reciept was also thrown at me when I left. We were there with a large group of people, some people of our group had sewage in their bathtubs and this same manager told one of the other parents "we'll get to it when we get to it." Security is awful, we had to call for them three times with people running up and down the halls yelling and nothing was done, this lasted until 2am when the cops came to try to handle the situation but nothing could be done, it was the hotels responsibility and they did nothing. Also the morning of checkout the front lobby was completely flooded. We paid over $100 per night and the Princess Royale is only worth about $30. I will NEVER stay here again and I'm sure after all the complaints from other parents our organization will be going elsewhere next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: aprilstay67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a heart shaped jacuzzi, it was wonderful, the temper-pedic bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on and I wanted to take it home with me. The jacuzzi was awesome and pretty big. Check in was easy only had to wait 1 minute tops and check out you could call the desk and leave your key in the room. Everything was clean. We ordered room service, the food was great although it did take a little bit to get to us. We also ordered breakfast and it was good also. My only complaint was, I thought the room was a little pricey for it being an off season. Great experience, would def. do it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Business Savy”
Reviews.Author: jessikade510
Reviews.Content: I loved the feel & the look of the hotel. It was comfortable, had all the amenities available for a traveling business woman such as myself. 5 STARS, would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: woo33
Reviews.Content: We had a ocean front room , the sunrise was spectacular. Our stay was great. The hotel was clean and in good order and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best pool during the off season months!”
Reviews.Author: rudedog_ginger
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale is the place that we ALWAYS stay in the winter months. Their large pool and atrium with game room is perfect for our family. Mom gets to use the hot tub and sauna while dad and 9 year old son practice laps in the large pool. The attached restaurant, Schooner's, is perfect for a cold winter's meal and you don't have to go outdoors to get to it. We try to rent the condos because they are plush and spacious - and we like to do our own cooking for much of the trip (especially breakfast) although all of the rooms have kitchenettes. We always go ocean front because that is our preference, but I can see how having pool view could be desirable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: brlmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a quick weekend getaway, choosing this hotel for the affordability and beachfront location. Room: We were wary after reading some of the reviews, but had a decent experience . For the money, the suite was large and had plenty of room. The beds were GREAT, and the furniture appeared fairly new. The kitchen area and bathroom definetly needed updating, as did the carpet (looked pretty dirty). There was a faint scent of seafood, that had apparently been microwaved by the last tenant (not a good scent, btw). The location was good for us, as we didn't care much to go to the boardwalk, but only wanted some beach time (loved that). The indoor pool was a very nice option, as one of the days was chilly and rainy. Most of the staff was fine, but certainly not friendly or welcoming in any way. We did have one small issue, where my child left an item in the room when we checked out. I called about 5 hours after checkout and was shuffled around from person to person before finally reaching an answering machine. I was shocked and completely taken aback by this. I tried to reach the manager or supervisor on duty and was literally told that I couldn't speak to anyone else about my issue and to leave a message with the lost and found. I felt that the operator and front desk clerk were giving me the run around and trying to keep me from talking to anyone "in charge". In my opinion, this is TERRIBLE customer service. Long story short, I reached a much more helpful employee the next day (I think her name was Brandy) who took it upon herself to check with security while I was on the phone, and offered to check again the next time she worked. The item was never found, which was of concern as well. The bottom line is that Princess Royale is a fine place to stay, as long as you know what you're getting into. The customer service is less than stellar, but if the stay is problem-free, that isn't really an issue. I would only recommend if you can get a discounted room rate, though.

Reviews.Title: “They don't care about constant fire alarms going off!”
Reviews.Author: SarahDena
Reviews.Content: So many issues with our first stay here. I would never go back. First, the condos are only accessible by using two elevators and walking through the whole hotel! Not easy for people traveling with young kids! Secondly, the fire alarm went off multiple times and we had to walk all the way to the front desk---only to be told to ignore it and all subsequent alarms. This was at almost midnight! The manager told us he had too many phone calls and couldn't deal with us! He yelled at us repeatedly instead of offering and explanation. We couldn’t use the Jacuzzi tub in our condo because black and green gunk flowed out...leaving 5 of us with one bathtub. Also another major safety concern is that there were no lights on the 3rd floor of the garage. We were extremely scared that one of us could fall in the dark, but the manager at the desk didn't seem concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Princess is like coming home.”
Reviews.Author: SandyWard
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recomment the newlt renovated condos to anyone. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff is very accommodating. This is one of the best values around!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, it's worth staying just to relax.”
Reviews.Author: ricksbabe22
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful, check in was easy as was checkout. This stay we had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, in any hotel or timeshare I have stayed in. Tell me what hotel do you stay in that has two TV's a full refridgerator and with a living room area and a table you can sit and eat. It's just perfect, we took the day to come down walk around, stop and with my illiness it is too far for me to travel down and back home in the same day so we choice Princess Royale and we do love how they take care of their guest. thank you Mary Anne Berlau

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving weekend with Family”
Reviews.Author: eleister
Reviews.Content: We reserved three pool-side rooms for Wednesday thru Saturday for our son and daughter and their children. The rooms were clean and we could see the Ocean thru the glass antrim window wall. We ate at the Thanksgiving Buffet and the food was absolutely as tasty as home cooking. The service was excellent everywhere in the hotel. I used the exercise room each day and the equipment was top quality and very new. Evvery employee we met through out the facility spoke and were so helpful and polite. This hotel really wanted us to enjoy our stay and have a wonderful Thanksgiving Holiday. I can't wait to return for another relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! DIRTY BED SHEETS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: darin1965
Reviews.Content: This Princess Royal came recommended by a business associate. This was my Anniversary weekend trip. We drove all friday evening and arrived around 1 am. Upon arrivial the entry way was very nice and somewhat elegant. Check in was hassle free and quick. We made our way to the room #470..entered our room , found it to be on the older side but appeared comfortable. with all the news reports of bed bugs we decided to check our room well. My wife pulled the sheet and comforter back and immidiatly found this bug crawling across the sheet. we nnotified the front desk and the promptly sent some one with a new key card to another room. so on to #570. we talked along the way could it be that all the hotel rooms could be infested? we get to room #570, walk in and began our inspection. we didn't see any bugs but we did find dirty pillow cases. We are simple people, we just wanted a relaxing stress free 3 days. By the look on my wife face that wasn't going to be possible here. We made our way back to the front desk where i informed the night clerk that i was sorry but i couldn't stay in his hotel. he asked what was wrong with that room? i explained the sheets were dirty, he said he'd have them change right away. i told him no that wasn't going to work. that between the bugs and the dirt there was no way we could rest in his hotel. He say's fine but i'm not giving you a refund. I questioned his position and asked him if he would sleep in either bed? he refused to answer, but responded again that he wasn't refunding my money for that night. I again asked him is that the right way to handle this? How about I start knocking on doors and telling everyone about his bed bug problem. He responded go ahead l'll call security. i demanded all info he could give me on ownership and management and told him this would not end well for his hotel. He gave me the numbers I had requested. as we are making our way to our car we we're forced to search through a 3rd floor parking deck with no working lighting. 2am and we're still looking for a room. we stopped at the Clarion. The clerk was very helpful but couldn't provide us with a room. she did however point us in the direction of the Hilton. We arrived and found a very clean upscale hotel that in the end was only $20.00 more a night. We had the most enjoyable stay. The service was amongst the best we had ever recieved at any hotel or resort. I still have not recieved a refund from Princess Royal, but I will not stop telling about our experience. We understand things happen, but the night clerk at the princess royal forgot he works in the hospotality industry....He was far from hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying at the Princess Royale Resort.”
Reviews.Author: Dollcrafter
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The employees are warm and friendly. The rooms are very nice and clean. I just love it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: Thrilseeker125
Reviews.Content: The room was good and it was nice to have the Temperpedic mattress. Loved having by coffee and evening cocktail with the coconut trees by the beach. A little far from the boardwalk but maybe thats a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “We had a pleasant and rejuvenated stay.”
Reviews.Author: Yvonnesan
Reviews.Content: We loved the ocean view, our accomodations were comfortable and the bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great beds, pleasant staff; what else can I say!”
Reviews.Author: Photogeek_10
Reviews.Content: I booked the room late on a busy weekend so we got the last room available but he second noite was totlly open so asked for a cheaper room and they move our stuff free while we were out during the day. New room was ready when we returned at 8:00 in the evening. They were very accomodating. We have stayed there often in the past and have always been satisfied. Beds are terriffic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dps3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for family's, I love the separate bedroom and two TV's. We had a view of the indoor pool and the ocean. The kids really enjoyed that. The beach is a short walk and right off from the pool. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “our nice 2nite stay”
Reviews.Author: theburb023
Reviews.Content: even though one of the elevators was broke the stay there was great and the people nice and friendly i would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay out with friends or family”
Reviews.Author: YonkersRoyalTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a perfect location. It's near highway 90 which takes you to the mainland of Maryland and not that far from Delaware and it's Outlets. If you want to walk along the beach, it's right there. All the rooms are smoke free. Great!!!!!!! The hotel is very clean and their staff are very friendly. This is my third year in a row in which I have stayed at this hotel and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: familyof3boys
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, comfortable hotel located right on the beach. The beds were extremely comfy (memory foam). The decor could have used a little updating (think seafoam and mauve with gold and mirror accents), but overall a good value. The separate living area made it spacious enough for our family of 5. We were traveling with a sports team and had a great time at the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “our best ocean city stay”
Reviews.Author: mizzdrums
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Princess Royale or the 3rd time. First 2 times in a suite in the summer which was nice. This time in a 2 bedroom condo. The rooms were large and clean. The staff was friendly. My only suggestion is to put a tv in the 2nd bedroom. Views from balcony are great. We were there offseason so no crowds. Our teens said the hot tub was not hot enough so thank goodness for the indoor pool. Folks were still swimming in the ocean in October. Car show weekend made for interesting driving. Found a great seafood take out place..Belly Busters. Talbot's Asseteague tour was fun. Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the condos”
Reviews.Author: rockmom3
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of women to stay at the three bedroom condo. First - the pictures on the website are WRONG! Pictures show second and third bedrooms both with 2 double beds. Only one bedroom has two beds - the other is one - which is fine as long as people know they are sleeping on a sofa bed and not a real bed! I can't respond on the sleep quality since I was one of the ones on the sofa bed! Room smelled horribly like smoke every time we left which is what a bunch of other people have said. My guess is this was once a smoking room and the carpets and such have not been changed. Paint on walls was chipping off, walls were dirty. Halls outside of condos were very old looking. We had a great time despite our accomodations but I would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Be treated like a Queen at the Pricess Royale”
Reviews.Author: sbrantner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Princess Royale many times, and I have never been disappointed. The service is great, the employees are all very personable, efficient and polite. The location is not boardwalk, but a beautiful beach location. Sitting in the Schooner's Restaurant you have a beautiful view of the ocean! I highly recommend this hotel and I am looking forward to my next stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay”
Reviews.Author: sunandfun21122
Reviews.Content: We visit the ocean at least once a year and always look forward to staying ocean front at Princess Royale. The location is great beacause you are away from the boardwalk but never too far from fun. The staff are always friendly and helpful. The resturant is nice, food is always good and service is good as well. The room is always clean and the beds are very comfortable with a great view of the ocean.We have tried other places in the past but none compares to the great room, service and all over good time to be had at Princess Royale.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: delduster
Reviews.Content: hotel this time of year offers a nice deal rooms are as low 60 dollars and even those rooms are very nice i tell anyone traveling to oc md to book a rm its clean and very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “My second trip was even better than the first”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie914
Reviews.Content: We stayed in on of the lovely two bedroom condos. The rooms are very spacious and the decor is very bright and cheery. We really enjoyed our stay and can't wait to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “best place we've stayed in O.C.”
Reviews.Author: km4man
Reviews.Content: very friendly atmosphere, big rooms, kitchens with full size refrigerators, very clean, most comfortable bed we've ever slept in. Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: cpsunset35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Princess Royale Resort to celebrate our 22 wedding anniversary. Good choice. Check in was no problem. We had an oceanfront king cabana room. Very spacious and clean. We had an issue with the toilet running loudly but maintenance came quickly to fix the problem. We had a nice view of the ocean but would have been better if the tiki bar wasn't right in front of us. Bed was wonderfully comfortable. Water pressure was very strong and plenty of hot water. We enjoyed the tiki bar for a little while and sat in the hot tub for a while. Very nice. The indoor pool is very large and clean. Ate dinners at Fresco's on the Bay and Bull on the Beach. Fresco's is a fine dining establishment and very good. Bull on the Beach is a bar and grill just a block away. Very good also and less expensive. All in walking distance of the Princess Royale. Both establishments have parking. Had lunch in the resort restaurant, Schooners. Nice view of the ocean and food was good. The resort is big would be nice to have a map to follow for our room was at the back of the hotel and a little confusing to get to but we did figure it out. All is all this was a great choice that my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed and would definitely stay at the Princess Royale again. Thank you for a wonderful weekend!

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: muttandmandy
Reviews.Content: This place was great! We got there way too early to check in. I simply asked if there was a place we could change into our swimsuits but the man at the desk looked to see if our room was ready and it was! The room was nice with a beautiful view of the ocean. I only wish there was a way to turn off the balcony light so I could have heard the ocean through the screen without the light shining into the room at night. The mattress was awesome! The pool was a lot of fun especially when the kids were tired of riding the waves in the ocean and walking a long time on the boardwalk. I wanted the indoor pool in case of bad weather. While we were out I put the maid service sign on the door. I really only wanted wash clothes and the trash emptied but she washed the dishes and pulled down the beds. I felt bad because I did not expect her to do that. The housekeepers have plenty enough to do but it was very nice. I did want to tell you guys that the faucet in the tub is loose and you might want to fix it before it breaks. It was room 573. There was an African American woman who who worked the front desk and helped me check out and fix my car registration info when we checked in.(I wrote down the wrong car) I do not know her name but I wanted to say she has a most welcoming and contagious smile. It looks like everyone works really hard there. Keep up the great work guys!

Reviews.Title: “Friends' Favorite Spot”
Reviews.Author: Summer of '42
Reviews.Content: We just love it when we find ourselves sitting in our room at the Princess Royale Resort, knowing we just arrived and have our whole vacation time here to look forward to once again. I can't think of anything that is missing in this place. The rooms are great, the people who work here are friendly and accommodating. We have a beautiful indoor pool and hot tub in a very large and cheerful atrium. Right outside the atrium we have a large deck with two more hot tubs. And we're right on the beach. No lugging chairs, towels, beach bags, etc., a couple blocks. We're there! And, when you come in from the beach, there are really convenient faucets to wash your chairs and feet, There's a nice lawn right there, also, in case you don't like to get sandy, but want to be out near the ocean. We are very close to restaurants, shopping, and just everything we need. They have tempurpedic mattresses on the beds, so we sleep very well. We have been coming here for at least 4 years, and we plan to keep coming back. Thank you, Princess Royale, and all your wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable relaxing beds!”
Reviews.Author: jcelauro
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i were recommended by a friend to stay at this place. The hotel is in a perfect location and most of the staff was accomodating. We had a little attitude from the clerk in the small store, it seemed as if we were interrupting her, but that was the only problem we had. Our view was so beautiful, we had the pool view with partial of the ocean which was awsome. The king bed was unbelieveabley comfortable, we both had the best night rest! I would definitely stay here again. Good Luck and have a wondeful time in Maryland, what a beautiful state!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, Reasonable rates, Friendly + Helpful staff, Glad we stayed there!!”
Reviews.Author: ITCanada
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean, comfortable hotel with reasonable rates, look no further! I spent hours upon hours reading reviews of almost every hotel in Ocean City, MD as we'd never stay in the area before. Albeit, a little nervous, we decided on the Princess Royale and am I ever glad we did......especially after being in Ocean City for a week. It was very clean, the staff was extremely helpful and polite, and the rooms were comfortable. I also had to work while being on 'holidays' and chose one of the pool/ocean view rooms......Great choice on our part! We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the hotel's restaurant each day of our stay! While not the best breakfast buffet we've had, it was definitely worth the money....and it was convenient (the kids enjoyed it too). HOWEVER, the fact that the rooms had a full kitchen also made it easy if we just wanted to eat breakfast in the room too. OVERALL, we're planning on going to Ocean City again next year and will definitely stay at the Princess Royale!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool with stunning ocean views. LOVED the full kitchen.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn302
Reviews.Content: Perfect for large families as our room slept six. The extra bed linens for the sleeper sofa were already in the room. The full kitchen saved us a fortune and loved the large frig/freezor. The pool and hot tubs, the views, the restaurant, the bar, easy check-in, friendly staff, clean rooms, made this a wonderful stay. We were there for Delmarva Bike Week and this hotel has a multi-story covered garage (for those of us who don't want our bike stored outside). It was such a pleasure to walk out teh side door of the hotel right onto the beach to have coffee every morning. I plan on making a reservation during the Winter to bring my son & nephews. Loved our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great 2br Condo, Dated Outside of room”
Reviews.Author: LandJR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the 2 bedroom ocean front condos for the weekend. The room was lovely and updated with great furniture but there was no remote for the tv in the living room. The front desk said that none of the tvs had remotes - bummer. The hotel has a weird layout when it comes to elevators. To get to our room we had to take 2 elevators. It was like a maze trying to get to the various other places in the hotel. The hotel overall felt dated esp compared to the room. The breakfast buffet wasn't great, there was some fruit but the rest was generally just ok. Also the price in the elevator was 8.95 but at the restaurant it was 9.95. My parents tried to do carry out from the restaurant and had a hard time getting someone to take their order. The gym smelled so weird and the smell permeated the hallway around it as well, so weird! We were able to check in a little early which was nice and check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel at the beach”
Reviews.Author: tamsheck
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly. Our room was large and comfortable. We were extremely pleased with the price, location and overall ambiance. Will definitely come back and recommend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice stay alittle expensive”
Reviews.Author: bigdirty1
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at a little more expensive that normal room and I must say it was very nice, The room was comfortable, it was cleaned every day and the staff was very nice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone...Thank you for such a nice get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....will come again!”
Reviews.Author: nyrlisa35
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale was a very clean, comfortable place to stay in Ocean City. Check in was a breeze, and the staff were very friendly. We stayed on the 4th floor, in an ocean front room. The rooms were extremely clean, and we had a full kitchen, living room, bathroom, and a big bedroom with 2 queen beds. The beds are Tempurpedic, which were very comfortable. The bedroom had a balcony overlooking the ocean. Everything was perfect. The only thing was the water in the bathroom sink smelled a little weird...almost like a gas, or diesel smell. So, we didn't take the chance of drinking it! We had a problem where the screen door of the balcony kept coming off its track, but we called and they came to fix it within 10 minutes. I will definitely come back here again, as our overall experience was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the beach - especially good for families”
Reviews.Author: Todd_From_Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Princess Royale; we had an oceanfront room on the fourth floor. We were very happy when we checked in that the room was very clean - immaculate, and each day it was cleaned very well by the housekeeping staff. We had five people (family with 3 young children), so having the room cleaned each day while we were out was very nice (we had considered renting a house or condo for the week, so in comparison, the hotel room with housekeeping was much better for us.) Our room was a suite with two separate rooms (with a door separating the two), and a nice efficiency kitchen and a full refrigerator/freezer. We ate most breakfasts and lunches in our room, which meant not waiting for service in restaurants, and this worked out well. We found the kitchen to be quite adequate for this purpose. It would be challenging to prepare a full dinner on the two-burner stove, but we did make spaghetti for dinner one night, and it was fine - it was actually cozy and one of the things we'll remember as a fun family time together. In general it was very easy to get to the beach (and back to the hotel for the inevitable bathroom trips). We found that there were many other families staying at the hotel, and we found everyone (hotel staff included) to be very friendly. We ate at the buffet one night and were not terribly impressed that a) the ice cream machine didn't work because it hadn't been turned on b) only one person in the restaurant could turn it on c) the food was pretty good, but not great. Overall, this is a great hotel for families - it's right on the beach, and the rooms are like an efficiency apartment with everything you need. I would recommend that you take a couple sharp knives, and extra silverware if you have more than 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: cjajsmom
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Princess Royale in early September. Our room was very nice and the bed was very very comfortable. So comfortable that, although I am normally up and at 'em by 5:30, I missed the sunrise three of the four mornings we were there (and I love watching sunrises). Everything in the room was clean and neat and we were well-supplied with toilet paper and soaps and shampoos. (We decided to not use housekeeping services and I was able to get anything we needed from one of the housekeepers in the hallway.) The room includes a kitchen area with a stove, dishwasher, microwave and refrigerator. We didn't need these items, but for a family that wants to save on food while vacationing, this is a great asset. The beach in front of the Princess Royale is very nice. Umbrellas could be rented with the plus that they also planted the umbrellas for you. (We joked about slipping the guy a few bucks to put ours in the sand for us because we couldn't get ours in as deep as the young fellow did.) Our room was oceanview this time instead of oceanfront. To be honest, if money isn't a factor, I'd choose oceanfront. We didn't hear nearly as much street noise when we were oceanfront as we did this time in the oceanview room. The oceanfront room just seemed more private than the oceanview room. But if you are on a budget, the oceanview room does give a good view of the ocean, not just a little peek like you get at some hotels. There are a lot of amenities here that we did not take advantage of -- gift shop, sundries shop, pool, hot tubs, work out room, jewelry shop, and salon come to mind. We did eat several times at Schooners, the in-house restaurant and there is review of that in the dining section of tripadvisor. Schooners is a very nice place for a meal or a snack or a drink and seating is available outside if you want. The only category that I did not give a full 5 rating to was service and this was because of the attitude of some of the folk at the front desk. I've written to a manager and she assures me that she will address this issue. Other staff that we encountered were great. We will not hesitate to return to Princess Royale in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Solomami
Reviews.Content: I'd like to keep this short and sweet: I will NEVER book a room in this hotel again EVER!!! The staff at the front desk was rude and inconsiderate! I brought a guest with me for a conference and they harassed him! He has never been treated so badly in all his life and I've never been so embarrassed! I remember calling back a few times for general questions about the suite and they were rude and did not take the time to answer the questions throughly. The waitresses at the restaurant were NOT attentive and did not exercise any kind of customer service! The cleaning staff allowed themselves into my room without me asking while my guest was there sleeping and startled him! He had to lock the door from that moment on! Ugh! This is BY FAR the worst hotel EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Princess Royale with our children ranging in age from teens to toddlers and it was all that the website said. First when we pulled in they were friendly to all of us from check in to check out. The employees that we encountered were all friendly and very helpful. The pool was great and very clean. The beach was wonderful and not that busy. Being a few blocks from the boardwalk made it nice with a family, we could choose when we wanted to be in the crowds, the only complaint that we encountered was that the public was leaving all of their trash on the beach, but in the morning it was combed and ready for more. I am a smoker but I do not view the beach as a giant ashtray. Our suite was very clean and the maid service was there every morning to make our beds and restock our towels and hygiene products like clockwork. I would definately suggest this hotel to anyone and the price is amazing for the stay. AAA review Princess Royale for a great family vacation we all had a great stay. -----Sherry in PA

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded all our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: curisgrg
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be extremely nice and everyone that worked there was willing to help. This hotel has good access to the beach, and is far enough away from the boardwalk to make it quieter and would be very family friendly. It is close enough to everything that you can take the bus (stops right outside the hotel) wherever you need. I can only think of one negative: we wanted an upper floor, but only got on the 2nd floor. It had a nice view, but their were a few palm trees in the way. Ask for 3rd or higher if you want to be on the ocean front.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, comfortable bed, right on the beach, a great deal”
Reviews.Author: RNMommy120
Reviews.Content: My husband, 19-month old daughter and I recently stayed at the Princess Royale on our trip to Ocean City. I had read the reviews here and was somewhat hesitant to book this hotel, but was pleasantly surprised by what we found. We stayed in a Side Oceanview King room and were extremely happy with it. It was very clean and looked recently renovated with new furniture, new granite countertops in the kitchen and bathroom, new tile in the shower (but with old shower head and fixtures) and one of THE MOST COMFORTABLE BEDS I have ever slept in in a hotel (all rooms have new tempurpedic mattresses). Parking was not a problem at all. They had an area designated just for over-sized vehicles (car-top carriers, trucks, etc.) which we used. The indoor pool area was nice as well, and the pool was kept at a nice temperature. The hotel's location right on the beach is GREAT, and even with a Side Oceanview room we had an excellent view of the beach and ocean. The front desk staff was pleasant on both check-in and check-out. We had an issue with our bill being incorrect, which was addressed the day after we checked out. I have read on previous reviews that management staff is unwilling to help with issues, and speaking for myself, I did not find that to be the case, as they addressed my problem in a timely manner. The hotel is in a good location along the main drag in OC. There was shopping and restaurants (The Bull in the Beach was a particular favorite) within walking distance. Overall, I would reccommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean hotel with a great location at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Leisurely Oasis”
Reviews.Author: mr2turtle
Reviews.Content: A wonderful view of the Ocean. Quiet room well appointed with amenities, great idea having ice maker in the room! Belhop staff very friendly and helpful. Thanks to all!

Reviews.Title: “Long overdue vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tweetybirdb
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and clean. There were alot of amenities such as the exercise room, pool, shops and restaurant. Room was spacious amd kitchen are was nice to have.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXED FAMILY GETAWAY!”
Reviews.Author: whoznext
Reviews.Content: Great place for the family. Staff was pleasant and eager to please. Facility had everything we needed except I would have liked a stove in the room and would have liked to see a better facility at the resort for doing laundry. We all woke up excited about the day in front of us and would love to come back for the next stay in Ocean City, MD.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: rvpagano
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! We just returned from a long weekend. We traveled with another couple who had never been there before. They were also very impressed with the friendly staff, great customer service, updated rooms, the nice indoor pool, and the dinner buffet . We hope to return for another long weekend during the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place & Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Ang313
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay again, loved it there & so did the kids, very friendly staff, very clean, amazing bed more comfortable than my own bed, lol

Reviews.Title: “A Keeper. Clean and Well Maintained. Good Value for the Money.”
Reviews.Author: poconomtngrl
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a GREAT hotel, considering... OCMD turns over tens of thousands of visitors, hotel rooms, and condos each week during peak season. That alone takes a toll quickly on a facility and let's not forget the sand and moisture. This is a very nice hotel that is well maintained and clean. I travel for business and have worked as a hospital housekeeping manager so I am particular yet realistic. The only criticism I had regarding the cleanliness was very minor: carpet edges in our room needed attention (dusty). We did not use the indoor pool so I cannot comment. Wireless internet was available but signal strength was low to very low which may be a concern for the business traveler. It was a pleasure to sleep on a Tempur-Pedic bed. This is the first hotel I have ever stayed in that offered such an expensive bed. The fact that they made such an investment says a lot.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Place Every: Family Reunions Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: rivierasun
Reviews.Content: The was the worst place that I've ever stayed at. We held our family reunion the end of July 2010. The resort in nasty and lacks customer services throughout the place. We had no idea it was going to be so many problems. 1) Family had problems booking their rooms due to poor service. Although we had an identified contatc person to assist us (Lisa Roberts), she did nothing to accomodate us for the price we all paid. The rooms that were to be held for the family were not. Amazingly, all the ocean front rooms were booked but not by my family eventhough we reserved them for the family with Lisa in Febuary. 2) The condo's were also booked. Again they were to be held for the family. I was told that I could not reserve the condo for the dates that I wanted. But before signing off on the reunion contract with this place they had the dates avaible. I just wanted to stay Thrusday-Sunday the time of the reunion but I was told that I could only stay Friday-Monday. Why?? When the cost for the affair was over $3,000 not including all the booked rooms. I was told that I had to rent a smaller unit for Thursday and would be still charged for Sunday. One family member wanted to rent a three bedroom condo for a week. She was told that she had to rent the room from Saturday-Saturday and check into a two bedroom condo on Saturday-Sunday because the only rent the condo's from Sat-Sat. Why??? To rent the condo for a week was roughly $3,000 and you cant make adjustments so they would not have to pack up and relocate to another room. No accomodating or customer services from Ms. Roberts or any other staff. 4) At the front desk for check in they had the most rude people working there.. When my group checked in at went to the rooms they were dirty, smelly and old. An Ocean View room could be really the view of a parking lot and a few buildings. When I called down to the front desk to tell them of the problems the person on the other end strated yelling at me that "It was nothing we can do". I then aked to speak with the manager she said she was and hung up the phone. Down at the front desk people were already there complaing of the smell and service. A woman was at the desk stating she had "mice" in her room. The front desk staff was telling people that it was "nothing that they could do because they were already charged for the room and they were booked so no room alternatives were available and the charge was non-refundable." I asked for the person who was managing. When she came out with an negative attitude and wlaked over to the couple standing off to the side of me. When she was told that I had asked for her she stated rudely that she did not have "time for this and would call for sercurity". She was unhelpful in trying to understad the problems of the guest and was hostile. We had to rent a house at the last minute instead of staying at the place. But some family members had no choice but to stay. The Banquet had to go-on because thousands were non-refundable at this point. 5) At the Banquet, the food was under-cooked properly and nasty. All of it was sent back four times and still not served properly. The air condition was broke and in the middle of the affair they brought in a ladder and began to try and fix it. They were unable to but made a mess along the way. And still charged us full price and some extra for all of this mess. The PITS!! The WOrst place every. . Don't ever stay here you and your family will be disappointed that you did. And once they get your money they have you locked in for the whole ride. The poor customer service cant help individuals, couples and absolutely no Family Reunions.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the beach, this is the place to enjoy it!”
Reviews.Author: GSMurray
Reviews.Content: We looked at too many hotels online and were very anxious, but our fears were quickly replaced by enjoyment. We had a blast on the beach, and the hotel, rooms, and staff were very nice. The only concern was the indoor pool- it was rather cloudy and we didn't stay in long. But we came for the beach, and we weren't disappointed. It was a 10 second walk from the hotel, through the dune, to the beach. The sand was clean, and there was a volleyball net up for general use. We packed our cooler and spent the day in the surf. Then we went back to our room, showered up, and headed out for dinner. The local bus, at $2 per day per person, came every five minutes, so we ventured to the boardwalk, hit the bay side, and toured up and down the strip. Our nights were peaceful and quiet in our room, and it was a great time. Free wi-fi was spotty, though, so don't plan on doing too much business, but it's a vacation, right?

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: jandthud
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a long Labor Day weekend at Princess Royale. We were very disappointed with the hotel. Check in was very smooth and fast. There are bell hops to help you take your luggage to your room. The room and hotel are just OK. Everything appeared dated from the late 80s or early 90s and that appears to be the last time there was a major upgrade. We stayed in a king jacuzzi room and while the room wasn't filthy, it was worn and time for a complete renovation. Particularly the rug was dirty and there were threads pulled up, the microwave made an awful smell when we tried to heat up some pizza, the jacuzzi tub was worn and dirty which we didn't even use, and there were other minor issues with the room. However, it was fairly clean and the bed was awesome (memory foam type). The pillows however, were old and very thin. One more issue, we had with the room was the fact we needed to jam a towel in the AC vent so it didn't blow cold air across our necks (the first night we got stiff necks). The biggest disappointment of the place was the pool and hot tubs. We expect the water in the pool to be clear but the water in the pool was so cloudy and dirty we didn't even get in. The indoor hot tub looked dirty and brown. The outdoor hot tubs didn't look much better and the water level was very low in those. The poolside bar and restaurant's food was just average. The other thing I would like to mention in the parking garage. It gets full quickly and luckily on Saturday night I got the last space. If I didn't get a space, the only other choice was to use valet parking. Also, the parking garage is very dimly lit especially on the top floor. Not very secure. Overall the hotel would have gotten a higher rating but considering the price and the dirty pool, I had to bump it down considerably. We will never return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time in ocean city was fun and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Roadmedic34
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceed expectations, staff was friendly . Except for a few loud guests at 3am......which only lasted a few minutes the stay was quiet which is what i want in a relaxing vacation. Liked the location, plenty of resturants nearby. Loved being able to walk out to the beach. Swimming pool and hot tub was good for the stormy hurricane friday we had to endure. Only drawback and to me a minor one, is the carpets in the elevator and my floor which is the 5th were very dirty, could use a new one or shampoo the old ones.

Reviews.Title: “Was not excited about going there, but it turned out to be a fun stay”
Reviews.Author: Caramel38
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Ocean City Beach. My husband & I favor the beaches of South Florida and had no interest in the beaches nearby where we live (Maryland). However, we wanted to take our two young children (under 10 yrs old) to the beach before school started and was only working with a 2-wk window. So, a week before school started, we settled on O.C. While our kids were super excited about the trip, my husband & I were blah. I couldn't believe that O.C. didn't have 5-star accommodations and only one 4-star, especially since the prices weren't cheap for a 3-star. After much contemplation, I decided to go with the Princess Royale Oceanfront. I was very pleased with the property & staff. The room was nice & spacious. It had two comfortable queen beds, a separate livingroom area and full kitchen. The indoor pool was great and stayed open until 10pm. I did not actually eat on the property, but we did order room service one night. It wasn't good, we ended up returning it for a full refund and ordering pizza. One great plus -- FREE self & valet parking. For valet, you only give the employees a few dollars when they park or retrieve your vehicle. The beach was clean and the water was not as bad as I imagined. I thought it was like the water of the Chesapeake Bay. No, it's not. It is not Miami, West Palm Bch or Ft. Lauder, but it was ok. I didn't actually swim in it. I went in up to my thighs. That was good enough. O.C. itself was nice too. My children loved the amusement park & boardwalk. Overall, my trip to O.C. turned out great and I will definitely go again and again!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: MVMD_Family
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Princess Royale in July and are hoping to go back next weekend. The beds were so comfortable and the service was wonderful from the help unloading our car to the made service. Our 9 year old loved the indoor pool and the outside cafe was excellent for lunch on the beach. We felt that the hotel was very clean and remodeled rooms from the bathrooms to the furniture were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Laptop_10
Reviews.Content: Two adults and two children stayed at the Princess Royale, beach front room with eat-in kitchen, balcony overlooking the beach. Our room was relaxing in itself. A separate TV area, nice, roomy, perfect for a beach vacation. Great pool, food served right off the beach, clean, friendly, couldn't really ask for more. If I had a magic wand, I would improve two items for better functionality - 1, add an oven under the stovetop and 2, have a more central and quieter air conditioning unit. We have come here for many years, and hope to keep coming for many, many more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ROSENY1
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel thinking it would be a pleasure to stay at. It was a nightmare. We walked in filthy, old, smelly. One of the worst hotels ever. Then to top it off filled with Roaches!! I was watching TV and saw a 2 inch Roach walking on the wall. I called front desk all they did is send people to clean the room. I just wanted to get the hell out of this disgusting place. They don't clean around pool area we left a cup on a table it was left there for 3 days. The elevator had a terrible odor. Then went to the gym smelled like dirty water who could excercise under that condition. I go to use the treadmill they were both broken. I go to use the weight the handle comes flying off. We just had a terrible nightmare stay at this hotel please do not stay here it's not worth it not even if they gave it to me for FREE!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: manfredhanover
Reviews.Content: We paid nearly $300 a night for a room in mid-August. It rained one day and water starting pouring into the room. My concern is that if was leaking when I was there it has been leaking. God knows what kind of mold spore is growing in the crawl space. The "indoor" pool was FRIGID. We stayed at the hotel because it had an indoor pool. The kids only stayed in the pool for five minutes on a day it rained. Normally when they go to the pool they are there for hours. The "hot tub" was not hot. It was had an oil slick and hair balls floating around in it. The maid forgot to leave coffee and it took guest services over one hour to bring coffee to the room. I strongly recommend that you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The best staffed resort on the East Coast, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: mugster
Reviews.Content: To describe the Princess Royale in one word... necessary. For anyone, who wishes to find that little slice of Heaven, they need not look further than this getaway from the madness. Not only was I impressed with the rooms, but the staff were so polite and accommodating to my every need and want. For those who can't afford the Caribbean, this is as good as its ever going to get.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal destination for those in need of a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: mugster
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been more rested and relaxed after my stay. The view and the service were top notch. I have already reserved for next year. Just exactly what the doctored ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Good to be back, again and again!”
Reviews.Author: dangerpre
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to the Princess Royale for a conference in May, without the kids, and we really liked the hotel. The accomodations were adequate, the beds were comfortable, and overall the suite and hotel were abive average for Ocean City. We stayed here with our kids last week and, though the weather wasn't the greatest, we had a great time. The pool was a lot of fun for those "not so sunny" days, and the beach was simply AWESOME. We already made reservations to come back with the kids next week, and we're looking forward to it, again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Meet all my expectations and then some”
Reviews.Author: R0adTripFamily
Reviews.Content: I booked based on others feedback and I am glad I did. It is VERY CLEAN and GREAT BEDS. Pick the room with the pool view, best in my opinion... I got room 439 and it was dead center of the atrium so the view was PERFECT!!. FYI pool is on the 2nd flr with arcade, so if you want to be in the middle of it that is good, but not much of a view from balcony as it leads into the pool. The staff was great, when we checked in they told me the pool was closing in 90 minutes, before I even asked. Also overheard me looking for coupons and pointed me to them with out asking. Shower defintely has water pressure and HOT water.. Beach is awesome, best I have been to in the US. A drive to the boardwalk (1st street to 28th st) but I preferred it that way. Supermarket a block away to stock your full size fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Royale Treatment”
Reviews.Author: ToesNdeSand
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of friends here in June. What a nice experience it was. We had great rooms, good food on property and excellent service. even though no one in our group had their kids with them, I couldn't help but notice how well the Atrium pool is set up for children and adults both. I would suggest this location to anyone with young children or teens.

Reviews.Title: “Not understanding all the bad reviews ...”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom037
Reviews.Content: I had to take the time to write a review of our stay at this hotel. We stayed at the Princess Royale August 16 -20, 2010. I am VERY fussy about the cleanliness of hotel rooms. I found our room to be very clean and well kept by the housekeeping staff. I agree with the other reviews that the hall carpet is a bit tired looking, but it has to be hard to keep the hallway carpet looking good in a large beach front hotel. A few previous review mentioned the water outage...we were there that night. There was a large sign on the front desk alerting guests to this outage from midnight until 6a.m. I thought this was an excellent time to shut off the water. Any other time would have been a much bigger inconvenience. We were also there during the fire alarm, which was handled well and only lasted for a very short time. All in all, the room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the outdoor bar area was a nice place to grab a drink or a snack while on the beach. The staff was very friendly also.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wrld_Trveler_2010
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the reviews concerning this hotel, and to be honest, I believe most of the negative reviews are either from people who like to nitpick, or should be better off staying in a RItz Carlton. I stayed (with wife and 2 small children), with another family (husband, wife, 1 small child) for 4 nights in August. The Pros: 1. Location - this can also be a con if you want to near the boardwalk, but you should know better before booking. The boardwalk is a good 15 min. drive south (impossible to walk to). However, if you are looking for a hotel that is RIGHT ON THE BEACH, this hotel cannot be beat. You walk out of your room, and there's the beach. They have hoses to clean yourself off before you return to your hotel room. 2. Cleanliness - yes, some of the carpets in the hotel look run down. WHO CARES. Do you sleep in the hallway? It is a BEACH HOTEL. People track in sand all day, what do you expect? And when I say rundown, I don't mean holes or stains or odors. It just looks old. GET OVER IT. The rooms however look great. I stayed in a condo, the other family in an oceanfront 1 bedroom suite. Both rooms looked to be renovated and clean - no bugs, no odors, everything worked, etc. Furniture was NOT rundown. The TV has a BUNCH of cable channels - no HBO - again, WHO CARES? Do you go on vacation to watch HBO??? And each day, housekeeping cleaned up the room nicely. The one day that we stayed in the room because of rain, they came 4 times asking if we wanted the room made. I actually felt bad because each time I kept saying "another 2 hours". And they kept coming back to check - great attention to detail. And I never saw stained towels either. 3. Service - it seems to me that OC in general, not just this hotel, has some type of large student exchange program with Eastern European countries. Everywhere (stores, restaurants, hotels) there are young kids working with accents that are of Eastern European descent. So yes, at times it can be a little challenging to maybe try to communicate with them, but for the most part, they are all friendly and have a good command of the English language. But again, it's not just this hotel - this is commonplace throughout OC. 4. Balconies offer a great view. And yes, the chairs on your balcony are plastic, white chairs. Again, who cares??? 5. Pool - yes, it is unheated and indoors, but that was great when it rained and provided some cool (not COLD) relief after baking on the beach for a few hours. It is very clean and wasn't crowded at all throughout the day. The Cons: 1. The limited access to the Wifi is annoying, however, after repeated attempts, I was able to logon multiple times per day. If they can fix this issue, this would eliminate my number one complaint. 2. Schooner's food is pretty good, but not the best. If you want the best seafood in OC, go off property. But if you want a convenient, adequate seafood buffet, there is nothing wrong with Schooner's. I do think the alcoholic drink prices were a little pricey though. 3. Workout facility - it is very small (about 15 machines only) and the weight machines are dated. This needs updating. Other notes include - the entire place is non smoking, and it is VERY quiet after 10pm. There is no outside noise whatsoever. And there is a grocery store right across the street. A/C worked fine in both rooms. The cons were minor. This is a FANTASTIC hotel, if you don't mind being so far from the boardwalk. I would definitely book again here..

Reviews.Title: “Royale? I don't think so!”
Reviews.Author: WashDCTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Re-book if your planning to stay here! The infrastructure is in dire need of an investment: *Carpets are run through the threads, hallways smell of mildew/mold. A/C units are vintage 1960 era. They belong in the Smithsonian! Tiles are moldy, cracked....overall they need to shut down for 6 months and overhaul this property. *The decor has only description = Cheesey On top of it all the prices per room are off the chart for the value. The staff tried really hard, but you can't turn a rock into a diamond. Rating = 1/18th of a star.

Reviews.Title: “ONCE A BEAUTIFUL HOTEL, NOW OLD AND DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: PuffWhitehall12
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth and last trip to Priness Royale! This hotel has definitely taken a downward spiral...not good! We spent 5 nights in a room with a terrible odor...housekeeping gave us a can of spray to use...which we had to use every time we entered the room...it never went away!! The air-conditioner was old and apparently outdated...sometimes it ran cold and then would suddenly stop working. You could not open the sliding door for outside ventilation as there weren't any screens! Each day, we had to call the front desk and rquest washcloths and hand towels as they were never left in the room by housekeeping. Hallway carpets were faded and in need of replacement. We used the seating area outside the Schooner Restaurant and found it difficult to converse with the hostess as she did not understand English...and we found that to be primarily true for most of the hotel staff. AFTER check-in, we were informed that the hotel had a water problem and the water would be shut off from midnight to 6 a.m. the next day for repairs. When it came back on, we found the water to be cloudy with some rust. That evening the fire alarm went off and we had to evacuate the building while the firemen and police checked the building. We were told that there was a "water leak" which triggered the springlers and the alarm...this was after the water problem was "fixed" the day before! The only this hotel has going for it is the location ant the Tempur-pedic mattresses. Definitely NOT worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “A very unhappy guest.”
Reviews.Author: fkower60811
Reviews.Content: My third and last stay at this large deteriorating hotel. A 77 YRO disabled vet with a disabled wife, I reserved a $338-a-night ocean view room for my wedding anniversary. This large facility is badly in need of major renovations. From a cosmetic view, it's great but in reality, for the price, there are many unsatisfactory guest amenities uner the surface such as: (1) The $3000.00 Tempur-Pedic mattress sleeps great but on the balcony, we found two cheap white plastic molded stack-type chairs, one which my wife found had a broken leg. Had she sat in it, she would have fallen and injured herself seriousy. After a second call to guest services, the chair was replaced with a similar one from another room. The next morning, maintenance again replaced the chair that he brought in the previous evening with a similar chair that had a fractured leg in the same area as above which had also been repaired (glued). (2) Upon check-in, we found the in-room safe locked. Although maintenance responded within 15 minutes to open it, I would expect for such a pricey room that should be part of the housekeeping procedure to check when preparing the room for new guests. (3) When my wife attempted to use the kitchen sink disposal, she found a plastic bottle cap and several other items in it. She didn't use the sink thereafter. Again, not good pre-occupancy checks. (4) Unable to connect to the hotel's Wi-Fi system, consistently getting "out-of-range" or "inaccessible" messages. (5) Inaccessible and unclear TV station guides in each room and difficult to get local news although CNN, HLN, MSNBC and BUSINESS news stations were included in the "Delmarva" TV station guide; no HBO pay-per-view movies are available. (6) The hallway carpets are severely worn and faded. Looks like the originals when the building was first constructed. (7) The ODOR in the fitness room is very BAD and seems to permeate from the carpet. (8) The restaurant offers very little menu selections. Guests are better off seeking outside eating facilities. (9) During my stay and on the morning of check-out, the elevator in the multi-tiered garage was not working, causing guests to hae to walk up stairs which are located at each end of the garage. I found the unacceptable, even for me wit a serious breathign disorder. Definitely a TWO STAR FACILITY and not worthy of the room prices.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious....would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Tprwife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 1-6 in a sideview double room with two adults and two teenagers. We've been going to Myrtle Beach for the past 7 summers, staying in a two bedroom condo, so I was a little apprehensive about the amount of space the Princess Royale suite would provide for the five nights we were there. I was also growing a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on here. Both concerns were unnecessary. When we opened the door, the first thing I checked for was cleanliness. It was very, very clean; and we liked the layout very much. Plenty of room for the four of us. It had a closing door between the bedroom and living area which provided privacy. We only ate lunch in the suite. It had a full-size refrigerator so we had plenty of room for food and drinks. We got the breakfast buffet with our summer saver reservations, and it was very good, albeit it could have been a little hotter. I saw steam rising from the catering trays, so I'm not quite sure why the food didn't stay hotter. The bathroom was very clean and a good size (we're used to having two full baths in Myrtle Beach). Housekeeping was good. No hallway or outside noise. The only annoying noise was from the air conditioner located right next to one of the beds in the bedroom. It vibrated and was a little too noisy. The hotel itself was very clean, despite the pigs who come to stay as guests. In all fairness to the hotel, it must be a herculean task to keep that place clean. The sand people bring into the hallways near the rooms! You think they would try and rinse before they come in. There is a hose right outside (actually two) near the entrance to the pool.
