And then, one day, as we were going to the elevator on the 4th floor, we saw that someone had left a dirty diaper on the bench next to the elevator. COME ON PEOPLE! Have a little courtesy and respect! We did have an issue one day with one of the "clean" towels that was left in the bathroom. It was streaked with some kind of brown streaks. My husband brought it down the the front desk and they quickly had another one delivered. Ironically, the next day, we had a similarly streaked towel with our "clean" batch. I can't imagine that the dirty one from the day before had somehow found its way back to our room! Out of all those rooms, what would the chance of that be? I said to my husband that since they were a symmetrical type of streak, it almost looked like it had gotten caught in the dryer or something, and maybe that was what was happening and accounted for us getting two of the same-looking towel. I'm going to keep telling myself that anyway. All in all, it was a very nice stay. I can't comment on the indoor pool because I didn't use it. But the staff we encountered were all very helpful, professional, and attentive. We would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: OliviaMaryland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 8/1/10 - 8/6/10. We booked a ocean front king suite/room. Payed for 4 nights and got the 5th one free. Positives: VERY, VERY clean; temperdic beds; all new cherry furniture with granite tops; full size refrigerator; quiet room; great ocean view; beach chair & umbrella rentals in front of the hotel; good live afternoon music at the beach bar; really nice indoor pool; easy fast checkin and check out; free valet parking. Negatives: no outdoor pool; AC unit in bedroom - some noise so we turned it off at night - it was not an issue. Breakfast at the restaurant was very good. Across the street is Laytons - also a good breakfast place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel tagline: "There are no guarantees"”
Reviews.Author: marmar84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not renovated!! You can't throw some granite on some surfaces and call the rooms renovated. I stayed in a suite and the furniture was so grody, I refused to sit on it. If I had put the couch and chair on the curb, I guarantee no one would pick it up. I was told I would have a side ocean view with a balcony, but my room had neither. My sliding doors did not even open to the outside. I had no privacy whatsoever. Outside the bedroom was a bunch of rug rats playing ping pong and arcade games all day and night until 11pm. When I went to speak with the front desk, they were extremely haughty and rude. Their token line is "There are no guarantees". Unbelievable! I would never stay anywhere that promised one thing and then revokes it upon arrival. This place is an eyesore and overpriced! Even if I had a family, I would not vacation here. I have been at motels in OC for 1/3 the price and that were much more updated and clean. Do not stay here, there are plenty of better options!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Princess Royale was our best family beach vacation yet.”
Reviews.Author: JWilkAltoona_PA
Reviews.Content: I started planning our July family vacation in Ocean City MD a couple of months early. I shopped for places online and found the Princess Royale. In the years past, we rented a cottage, a condo in a high-rise, and other hotels in Ocean City Md. This year I wanted us to stay at a place where we did not have to worry about alot. The Princess Royale offered the important amenities I was searching for. A clean and modern 2 room suite that provided plenty of room and comfort for all 6 of us. I chose poolside since I knew we could spread out even more and the kids loved it. Breakfast buffet was included in our package and was well worth the extra $20/day. We had dinner one night and $10 for crab legs was a pretty good deal. Lunch and Drink service on the beach was a great suprise. The staff was very courteous and accomodated all of our requests. Including providing us with an additional mattress for added comfort on the pullout sofa. Past beach trips have left some of us feeling unrested, but our suite and beds were very comfortable . The kids loved the movie on the beach. We didn't want to leave, but we will definitely return to the Princess Royale. Overall it was the best family beach vacation our family has had. Thank you! John

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach18
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Ocean City and really enjoyed our stay. This was our 2nd stay at Princess Royale. My family loves to stay here because it is more than just a room. It's like a little apartment with the comforts of home. To address the decor, it may be a little 80's but I still like it. It's beachy and the pictures on the web site are current so you could check it out before you book it. I do agree the pool water was cloudy this stay, didn't think to complain to management. The couch is made of itchy material. All in all , one of the nicer hotels I've seen in OC.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Good About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oct1400
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Ocean City Maryland for many years and stay in upscale hotels, like we thought this one was, but we were SO WRONG! First of all the hotel itself was horrible! It was totally outdated. It had a musty weird smell throughout the whole place. The elevators took forever and always sounded like they were going to break down. The whole place was dirty. The parking garage had an awful setup and when we went on that elevator and it wouldn’t work! The door finally opened so my family and the other family decided to get off and take the stairs (we used the stairs the rest of our stay). Second, the rooms were awful! We had reserved a cabana room, but then realized you had to walk down creepy hallways and take 2 elevators to get to the room! When we got to that room we couldn’t get the lights to work until we realized that you have to put your room key in a power slot at the door. Who ever heard of such a stupid thing!? We also realized that people were standing right outside our patio fence which was creepy. My husband would not have let me or my daughter stay there so called the front desk and luckily got another room. The second room we got was on the third floor, with no view except the building beside us, and this room was even worse than the last one! It smelled horrible, it was dirty, and the a/c barely worked. Our room was hot the whole weekend! Third, don’t eat at Schooner’s! We went there for breakfast before going to the beach. We ordered off the menu and did not get the buffet! There were only 3 of us and our food took forever! However when we finally got our food it was cold and literally tasted like cardboard! Fourth, be careful when you take a shower! I took a shower while my husband and daughter were at the pool. The smoke alarm went off in my room 3 times! The first 2 times I fell trying to get out of the shower and made sure there was no fire. However the third time it happened I called guest services where I got a woman who in a smirk voice said “No there’s no fire in this building”. I explained to her what happened and that I fell, but she just wanted to send up maintenance but I said no I’m trying to shower! She then transferred me to the front desk where I got the manager Mortisha. She was very rude and informed me that there was no fire, but she wanted to send up security (I wasn’t sure why she wanted to send security). I said no I’m trying to shower, and she said “Take a cooler shower” so the alarm wouldn’t go off. I hung up to finish my shower and she called back and wanted to know why I hung up, I said so I can go finish my shower! She then told me I need to make sure to stop at security before leaving that day. On top of it the next day when I was showering, my daughter saw a bill slide under our door and watched the guy walk away. While the fire alarm was going off in our room! Fifth, the pool is green and cloudy! It was so disgusting! Sixth, the employees were the most inconsiderate, rude people we’ve ever had to deal with. For example, I went down to check out and I had a man helping me he asked how my stay was and I said awful! He didn’t say anything, but kept looking up my information. I then asked if the charge for the safe box was already charged, and another female employee jumps in and very nasty says “It was charged when you checked in and we have signs on both ends of the front desk walls about the charge.” The thing is I was fine with the charge I just wanted to pay cash for it instead of them charging my credit card, but I couldn’t even get that out. After all of that I asked for the hotels insurance company because I fell 2 times. That’s when Mortisha jumped in and started yelling at me that I should’ve stopped at security, it was only then she told me I was to put in a complaint with them about falling she did not say that before. She also said that if there was a real fire there million dollar security system would have went off (wouldn’t you think if there was really a fire in the room and our smoke detector went off that the whole hotels alarm would go off?) She kept going on yelling, and called security to get us away from her front desk. We hadn’t even done anything! While we waited for security Mortisha and the other white female kept yelling, and I don’t think it’s very appropriate when a hotel manager says to you she has thick skin on her take me out. I had not even said a word to her! Security gets there and I explained to him about my whole stay and what just happened. He could have cared less, and then another security man came and said the only thing I could do was to call Mike Meyer head of security, and with that we left. Not one person has yet to ask if I was ok from falling. ALL of the employees that work there could care less about anything! Those were just a FEW COMPLAINTS I had about this hotel! About 8 people know about my whole experience and ALL of my complaints! Overall I will NEVER stay here again and I DO NOT recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A Hot Mess”
Reviews.Author: amlang80
Reviews.Content: When we checked into our room the cushions on the sofa and chair were turned up, all the drawers in the dressers were opened, the door to the balcony was open and there were six or seven flies in the room and the safe didn't work. The air conditioner was not working at all in the living room with very little air flow in the bedroom. The front desk told us they would send someone from the maintenance department. When he finally showed up he never entered our room. He stood in the hallway and told us there was nothing he could do. He offered to close the vent in the bedroom which would give us air conditioning in the living room but then the bedroom would get nothing. The temperature outside was in the the high 90's and our room was just as hot. The front desk never offered to switch our room or even offer a fan. The next morning I took a shower and the tub filled up with water and didn't drain out. We checked out that morning after only staying one night. The hotel refused to give us a refund and told us all we could do was write a letter to their board members to express our complaints. I would never suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a joy to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: frankbie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean with a beautiful location right on the beach. Beautiful olympic size swimming pool and very clean rooms. Beds are heaven. Location is perfect, not right on the boardwalk which is really a plus because of all the noise and commotion there, but close enough to reach it within 5 min. so the beach is much less crowded and cleaner. Actually the beach is beautiful as is the entire Hotel resort. You won't be disappointed! Our kids, 12 and 9 yr. old girls loved it.

Reviews.Title: “we would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: KGlass803
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to make our stay wonderful! Our room was clean and anything that we needed was taken care of right away. We had our two young children with us they had as nice of a time as we did. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, one good comment...bellhops and the...”
Reviews.Author: reillyrose
Reviews.Content: Ok, one good comment...bellhops and the valet parking were great. Overall, the hotel seemed like it was plucked directly from 1970 with no updates since. The INDOOR pool was very cloudy. The hot tub was green. The ocean view balconies were indoors in the pool trim. It was very humid and chlorine smelling. I think it is deceptive how they describe that every room has a balcony( usually this means outside where you could smoke).

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!! WILL NEVER STAY EVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EcAke
Reviews.Content: I did not care for this hotel! I was pleased with Ocean City but not with the Princess Royale Resort. This vacation was amazing but the hotel was REALLY BAD. When we booked the hotel we asked for two queen beds in one room togeather. When we got there I told my family "we cant stay in this room" it was because there was only one king bed. We then went through the hard labor of lugging all of our things downstairs. We were then told that our second bed was a pull out couch. I mean COME ON! ARE YOU FREAKIN' KIDDING ME? This was so stupid. We went back up too our room. When we looked closer at it we saw that there was only one washcloth and the shower was dirty. For the entire stay we never had enough wash cloths. We always had to ask for them for more! It took them at least a half hour every time to deliver them!!!! Also the towels were no longer white they were gray!!! Ewww!!!! There was also a cigerette stain on our toilet seet! I will never stay here again but I will be back at Ocean City!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: rpr222
Reviews.Content: All of the comforts of home and then some.Indoor Pool and indoor parking garage.Pool and ocean view.Many extras included for everyone.Give this one 5 stars for a extra ordinary vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: NeverComplainedBefor
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was rude and non responsive to our terrible situation with overheating (over 100) degrees in our room. After over 2 hours of waiting for the room to cool down the front desk person simply told us that he could not promise that if he moved us to another room it would be cooler....all while giving us a very smug and arrogant expression. When we suggested it that was the case we could go elsewhere his repsonse was that we could go - but the charges would stay. (American Express told us not to worry - they would handle that). Do yourself a favor and do not stay here, I am certain there are better accomodations in OC.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfied customer and very, very attentive staff!”
Reviews.Author: mamaG823
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. My first trip to OC though the other 3 with me had been many times. From the complimentary valet parking to the warm greetings in the hallways, our stay was most enjoyable. Every attention to detail was given. We were on the third floor pool side. We did have not have any problems with noise. A very refreshing cool pool (though an outdoor pool would be nice!), easy access to the beach. The food service was very good. The housekeeping staff most friendly and helpful. The beds are COMFORTABLE! Very clean hotel. Better ventilation could benefit a few hallways as well as the elevators. Thank you for a wonderful girls getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: littleone1981
Reviews.Content: I came here for a long weekend with my boyfriend. The hotel was clean and well kept as was our room. I wish the AC was on temp control though......after a few hours I was freezing. The beach which is right outside of hotel was fantastic, you can rent umbrella's and chairs for a reasonable price. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on that. The staff was very polite. We took the bus to Seacrets, it was very fast and convenient (the bus stop is right outside of the hotel and it's $2 for the whole day.) Overall we thought it was great and plan to go back. The only bad thing I can say is the shower is a bit slippery, I fell. Oh and p.s. this isn't the Trump Soho, so if you're expecting a lot more you should go somewhere else more high maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “exceptionally nice, clean, great service. I will stay here every time in OC!”
Reviews.Author: ocroyale
Reviews.Content: Great amenities, great service, clean faciity. Again, I will stay here everytime I am in OC!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, accommodations, and value - worth a try!”
Reviews.Author: SDSH
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Princess Royale - I think the biggest "perk" is the pool - even if it rains, you still have the pool because it is in a glass atrium. Friendly staff - super clean - and perfect location - will be repeat customers for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for teenagers and college age family members”
Reviews.Author: parkrdrew
Reviews.Content: Arrive early to enjoy the beach while you wait for your room to be ready. The service was great and the the rooms very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience so far in Ocean City.”
Reviews.Author: 811chandler
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the worst first. The high speed internet was not the greatest. I had to constantly fight to get online due to the high volume of users. Aside from that the only other thing that could have been a little better was the price. That being said, this was by far the best experience our family has had in Ocean City in the past six years since we have been coming to OC. The rooms were very accommodating and the poolside view was the best for keeping an eye on the kids. The location was excellent with grocery store right across the street, convenience store next door and various restaurants within walking distance. Wife enjoyed the spa in the hotel as well as on the beach and the kids enjoyed the games when they were not in the pool. We have been to some really good places over the years but this experience was the best so far. We will be coming back next year if not sooner. Highly recommend this hotel for your next trip to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: digiam07
Reviews.Content: Great place right on the beach. Quiet beach front hotel that seemed to cater to families. The Ocean view is a little pricey, but worth it. We will definately return here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families with children”
Reviews.Author: luvstj04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely family friendly. I have a 4 year old and 2 year old twins and this hotel was perfect for us. Our room was a pool level atrium room. It is on the same level as pool and arcade. It gets a little noisy at night, but it closes at 10:00 PM. THe noise was only loud one night. THe TV and AC usually block out the sound. We had a kitchen and stove/microwave in our room which was great for cooking for the kids. We had lunch outside one day and it was good, pricey but good. Recommed Bull and the Beach next door for take out and Lombardi's. The staff is courtesy and always cleaning something. The pool was cleaned every night. The place is very clean. Negative The pool was very cold...even with it being 90 degrees outside the pool was cold. THe kids didnt mind it, but their teeth were chattering the entire time they were in the pool. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal out there!”
Reviews.Author: Booya69
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Hilton with my wife and two young kids but this year we decided to try something diffrent. we're glad we did. Not only we saved thousands of dollars wich we used towards the vacation (food, recreation, etc.) We were able to have such a GOOD TIME. Hotel is VERY CLEAN and the staff very helpful. And the beds are SOOOOOO comfortable. We stayed on the Fourth of July weekend and we loved it so much that we are coming back for labor day weekend. Did I mention that we're staying for six days this time?

Reviews.Title: “Giving it a 3 because it's OC.”
Reviews.Author: Chilaxn
Reviews.Content: All you need to know about this spot has been written. Just read the prior posts. Every bit of it is true in one form or another...it all comes down to your state of mind when you slide that key card thru the elecro-metalic-locky-thingy at the door of your digs. Because it has all been said before, I won't go into detail about it all, but rather just give a short perspective on my experience, for scientific purposes...Oh, and to give another view point. Knowing what we know, we looked 'round' for a last minute deal at OC. We booked this spot last minute (on Thursday for a Sat. thru Mon. stay) on a local site (as opposed to one of the big 3, or 4, and so on), and found a great rate at this hotel. After checking the reviews on TA, we popped. The front desk was friendly and helpful and check in was a breeze. We were assigned a 1st floor oceanfront "CABANA". Yes, they do call it a CABANA, but it's a 1st floor walk-out with a patio instead of a balcony. It was a chore to get to but once we found the secret (walk 'round the beach side to the front) it worked well. Our CABANA (#113) was very cave like at night, but in the morning and thru out the day it was flooded nicely by natural light. Our CABANA did have a nice view of the ocean from the ground floor, but was partially blocked by the beach bar. Why they would put the bar in front of a room/rooms (111 & 113), I don't know, but they did. I did read on TA of the noise complaints from the music act and did get to see/hear it up close and personal-like... He was 25 feet from our CABANA, just beside the bar. Oddly enough, being that close to our CABANA wasn't a bother...the bother was it was too loud when we were drinking at said bar enjoying said act! The dude is good and was very entertaining and we dug him, but honestly Diane, it is a bit loud. Now for the short of it. Didn't eat the food there. Didn't swim in the pool. Would never, ever, ever (did I say never or ever?) book a room on the pool level or in the atrium due to the arcades/pool tables and so on...But we did like this spot for its beachfront locale, customer service (no doubt due to the TA users feedback), and for the last minute price we found. If we would have paid full price, our review would be different. All in all we had fun, yes the CABANA was a 'lil worn (as was other rooms we peeked), yes in comparison to other parts of the beachfront world its a 'lil shady, but thats OC, and its why (for OC standards) it gets 3 stars from us. (And thats a good thing).

Reviews.Title: “We loved our 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: gmyers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 3 teenage grandchildren--ages 15 and twins fourteen stayed for 4 nights in a two-bedroom, 2 bath condo on the 9th floor. The condo was beautiful and very clean--very important to me. The kitchen had all of the pots and pans and utencils and plates we needed--nice size frig for all of our food. Resort staff were very nice and helpful with any questions you had---one day maid forgot to leave coffee for the next morning and we called and it was brought up immediately---the maid even unloaded the dishwasher and put everything away----something that other condo-cleaning staff usually dont do. Pool was very nice and clean---restaurant had good food and reasonably priced--beach was very nice and very close to the resort---I would highly recommend this resort to anyone wanting to stay in Ocean City, Maryland.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation - Perhaps the best OceanFront Resort in Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: PhillyFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Mon through Fri family vacation at the Princess Royale Ocean City MD. All I can say is that we had probably the best beach vacation ever. Instead of booking one of the regular rooms (which are very nice -- depending upon what view you pay for) we opted for a Condo this visit. Condos are located on floors 6 to 10 at the Princess Royale and are all Ocean Front. All I can say is WOW! We were lucky and were assigned a 3 bedroom 3 bath end unit that had at least 25 feet of Ocean Front facing balcony -- with views of the Ocean and a wrap around tail to the balcony that enabled you to see the bay too. Breathtaking! The condo has three sliders to the deck. One from the Master; family room and front guest room (with two beds); The third bedroom had a king size bed -- as did the Master bedroom which also had a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom and then a full size master bath with huge walk-in shower. These condos were done very nicely and include dining rooms and fully equiped kitchens that even have granite counter-tops. Honestly.. you cannot find a nicer, cleaner, friendlier, convenient and reasonably priced Resort like this anywhere else in Ocean City, MD. Walk down the hall, down the elevator and and you're right at the beach! While we opted to eat around town for dinner everynight, we did have breakfast every day at the Princess Royale's Schooners Restaurant. We all vote this restaurant a 5 out of 5 stars for consistently good food and friendly service. The pancakes are enormous and our eggs and bacon were cooked perfectly every day. We also enjoyed meeting the many exchange students working at the Resort over the summer. Many of these kids are seeing America for the first time and are amazed at how well we all have it here. So- take a moment to ask some of the servers about their home country and you'll be amazed -- we met kids from Russia, Muldovia, Jordan, Serbia etc. And they are so very hardworking and friendly. Outside, between the Hotel and beach we had the opportunity to visit the snack bar for some of the coldest, frostiest and tastiest Pina Colada's this side of the Bahamas. Topped off with whipped cream and Pineapple -- they were some of the best around! Kids enjoyed the hotdogs and salads that are sold right outside too. Very convenient and reasonably priced. THe Hotel even has service right on the beach !! Where on earth have you seen a server on the beach in Ocean City? The answer is no where. Only here. We didn't use the indoor pool but it appeared to be well kept and popular with many guests. Honestly -- the weather was just so georgeous and the kids wouldn't come out of the waves with their boogie boards all day -- so we never even had time to think about the pool. Some nearby recommendations if you decide to stay here include: Lombardi's Pizza -- right across the street. This place is hands down the number 1 pizza place in Ocean City, MD. Lombardi's has the best pizza you will find in town. It's New York style pizza and it's not a chain. Two brothers run the place and it's obvious they care about what they serve. Equally good is Olive Tree restaurant -- a long time tradition in Ocean City, Md. Of course, right across from Princess Royale is a Candy Kitchen for the kids and a great Cigar store for Dad. Of course, Princess Royale even has room service -- so you have that option too. Well -- that about covers it. Hope this review helps you pick the right resort. If you have a family of four or just want more space, check out the condos. It's nice to have a little more space; privacy for mom & dad and a luxurious spot to unwind after the beach. You won't find any nicer -- so check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissJeray
Reviews.Content: I reserved my stay with the Princess Royale two months in advance after looking at multiple reviews and recommendations. I was so excited for my vacation UNTIL I checkedin. I understand I went on a holiday weekend but the staff was absolutely horrible. They were rude and inconsiderate and did not want to answer any questions. My room was wrong and when I said something to the manager I was told "oh well we are booked up....nothing I can do" When I asked if they had a shuttle I was told "take the bus its $2" and when I got to my room it wasnt clean. I was so disgusted and disappointed. It put a damper on my vacation. Also they screwed up my billing and I was double charged for a night. The Princess Royale has the worst customer service I have ever received and I will never go back. I will also be complaining to the corporate office. Oh and PS.....they will tell you they are by the boardwalk.....the boardwalk is 4 miles away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: grminalac
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel over Fourth of July weekend 2010. Our basic goal was finding a larger hotel room that was clean, beachfront, not too expensive and spacious as we were traveling with two young children. We found all of this in the Princess Royale and were pleased with the experience. I usually read reviews of hotels before booking and found some mixed reviews stating the hotel was dirty, smelly or the service was bad and was slightly concerned, but those worries were allayed after checking in. Sure the carpet was faded in areas, but generally everything was well kept and the service was adequate. The beds were comfortable, clean and even the sofa bed was ok… Honestly, has anyone really ever found a sofa bed in a hotel even remotely as comfortable as a real bed??? I didn’t think so. Let’s be real- the purpose of a sofa bed is its utility in that it will get you by if you don’t want to spend the money for another room and want to accommodate a couple guests. Would I put my grandparents on it? No, but my two children were more than happy. To put all of this in perspective- oceanfront hotels see a lot more wear and tear than typical hotels: you get partiers, sand from the beach, etc… So in my experience if you are checking into any mid range hotel on the beach and are expecting a Marriott Renaissance or W hotel you will be disappointed. In addition would I be happy if I had paid 500 per night for my king side ocean view suite I received at the princess? No, but for the price I paid I was more than happy with everything. Pros: Competitively priced Decent location (if you just are looking for the beach, not boardwalk) Clean Adequate and friendly staff Hotel was booked solid for the holiday weekend, but it didn’t seem crowded. Cons: Indoor pool seemed very cold- a lot of people complained. Could have used a few more utensils in the kitchen efficiency- if you plan to cook anything more than grilled cheese and tomato soup bring some measuring cups and or other utensils. We wanted to make pancakes one morning and didn’t have anything to measure ingredients. (We just guessed) One last note- I saw a lot of complaints about the parking. Yes the garage is a bit tight, but I was driving a Full size seven seater conversion van… even so I had no issue getting in and out of the garage. Anyone driving a vehicle smaller than a Hum-Vee and or paying attention should have no issue.

Reviews.Title: “Princess Royale is a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: farmmedic
Reviews.Content: Four tears ago we stayed at the Princess Royale and they had temperpedic matresses. We bought a matress for our home. The hotel is clean and the staff was very friendly. It is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “we always enjoy the princess royale”
Reviews.Author: august075
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the princess royale for years and usually visit a few times a year. The hotel has all that you should need. We like to stay on the pool level so we can use the tables in the atrium to play games. We go every winter with family members and have been doing so for about 20 years. It never gets old..the kids are grown but the adults still have a great time on their own. You would not be disapointed...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: NyTrojan05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess for a weekend trip and our first visit to Ocean City. After searching and searching for the right hotel and sifting through all the good and bad reviews on this site, we decided on the Princess Royale because of its location uptown and its price for a weekend stay ($199 per night). The hotel staff was excellent and extremely accommodating to all our needs. They even allowed us to view one of the 3 bedroom ocean front condos at the spur of the moment on a busy Saturday night, when we stopped to inquire about future dates. The room was dated, but extremely spacious and really, we didn't come to the beach to spend much time in the room. The ocean view was limited, but we could still clearly see the water from our balcony and the air show above us during the weekend. One of the best features of the hotel has to be the proximity to the beach, lots of beautiful open beachfront. We were going to use the pool, but it was quite crowded all weekend. Overall it was a nice area, with video games and entertainment for kids. Plenty of parking right on site and free... they even have valet service if needed. We will definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Late night very loud uncontrolled party on the back patio”
Reviews.Author: Linus03
Reviews.Content: The only problem we really had with this hotel was a vacation ruiner . From midnight on the back patio and beach were occupied by very loud drunken people. I can't imagiane anybody with beach front room not been awoken by loud drunken screaming. The drunks were on hotel property and Im not sure why the hotel security could not handel it but they could not. Friday -Sunday nights it was the same thing. Sunday night was a drunken laser tag game. red team was on the patio, green team on the beach, I know this because when I opened the curtains to see what all the noise was and green laser was aimed into our room. called down to the front office many times, they said they would send security but nothing ever seemed to change and it went on for hours. Maybe the non beach front rooms would be fine

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay, better than expected, great Rates and Service”
Reviews.Author: familyguy7337
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Ocean City and to the Princess Royale. This time aroud we invited friends to join us. Knowing that on memorial weekend every hotel/resort would be almost all booked. We deceided it's best to go somewhere where we knew the service team and hotel resources could handle stress. I was surprized to see that not only was everything smooth as can be - the hotel was very clean, the staff was corteous and attentative and quick to respond. Although most of the rooms were full - we didn't feel at all crowded up or that any thing was disorganized or that the normal due diligence wasn't being done. We even stayed at the beach til the afternoon the day of checkout and had lunch there before heading to the boardwalk area later for a final para-sailing trip to finish off the weekend. It was a great little vacation! Thank you again Princess Royale - we are now officially return customers!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: ccnj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Princess Royale for two nights during Memorial Day weekend and really enjoyed my stay. Check in was very quick and the front desk staff was very courteous. Th bell hop was very helpful and promptly took our bags to our spacious suite with a balcony overlooking the pool area. The kitchen contained everything I needed and the bed was comfortable. Free wi-fi was a plus. The pool was good sized and never seemed over crowded. There were hot tubs on the deck in the back of the hotel as well as a bar by the beach. The staff was very friendly and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, CLEAN, FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: IANHOL
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - stayed here for 5 nights - from the time we made our reservations (Dante was a great help) to the time we left we were constantly impressed by the courtesy of the staff. The hotel itself is very impressive and spotless. We liked the pool, hot tub and sauna all of which are indoors - that was a good thing because the weather was not that good while we were there. We had an issue with air conditioning which took two visits from different maintenance men - they were at our room within 5-15 minutes of our call to the front desk. While we still had a problem on the second night after the second attempt to fix the problem, we found that by turning the unit off and restarting after a few minutes did the trick. The suite is spacious with the living area seperate from the bedroom which had two queen beds. Great if one person is tired and the other is not. Housekeeping always tidied up our room even though most days we didn't put the "service" sign on the door until after 2:00PM. We ate at the hotel restaurant and that was not a good experience for us. It was Thursday night and they had a buffet - prime rib was ok, rest of the food was not hot and seemed to be left over from another night. Chocolate cake for dessert had been sliced ahead of time and displayed with another dessert for your choosing - that made the cake dried out. We order the cheese soup in addition to the buffet and that was superb - we asked our server and another server for soup spoons and they said they didn't have any - curious how such a classy place could not have a soup soon??? All in all, that would not stop us from returning to this fine hotel. Again, the staff is friendly, informative and genuinely glad to see you as a guest - if you traveled much, you know that this is not the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Family Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: We stayed their for a quick weekend getaway. They have a very family unfriendly policy of making families pay $15/child/day for children over the age of 12. I have never stayed at another hotel that does that. Why should you have to pay extra for your 13-year old child to stay in your room? I guess it is their way of discouraging families from staying there. To make matters worse, their website asks how many guests you have that are adults, 13-17 and 12 & under. If your kids are 13-17 and you check that box, the estimated room charge does not reflect an extra charge for the teen children. When you get there, they tell you that your two teens will cost an extra $30/day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, not so good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: blazius
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the standard kind of ocean-front resort. Very friendly and helpful staff (with exception of the restaurant). Room was nice and clean, quite large with a kitchen. Shower was hard to make work! OK pool in the hotel's atrium, the pool area was hot and humid and not pleasant if not on pool business. Some food marts across and down the street for those who prefer to self-cater - this is a good idea, as the service in the restaurant is VERY slow - took them more than 45 minutes to prepare simple food (soups and salads) for 5 people. No apologies. Free WiFi everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Marin Corps reunion”
Reviews.Author: deadwalk
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in a very relaxing atmosphere. The large deck outside of the pool overlooking the ocean was absolutely fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly comfortable beds, full kitchen and the ocean - what more?”
Reviews.Author: AuctionSue
Reviews.Content: Went to Ocean City on a business trip and had never stayed at the Princess Royale, well let me tell you, view of the ocean, full kitchen with dishwasher, the beds have the new foam comfort mattresses (i want one).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing View”
Reviews.Author: WiseBeach
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, love the room and the Nice Beds and bedding. It was a very relaxing place to stay and enjoy the view and sound of the Ocean! Was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Really good facilities and services”
Reviews.Author: DaveParker65
Reviews.Content: As a non-smoker, I really appreciated the non-smoking policy throughout the hotel. Parking garage was crowded on the lower levels, but with the elevator, it was no problem to go almost to the roof to park.

Reviews.Title: “The Princess Royale is a wonderful place to relax and enjoy the ocean view.”
Reviews.Author: denisesc
Reviews.Content: Be sure to reserve an ocean view room to see the breathtaking sunrise from your private balcony or sleep to the sound of the surf outside your room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Property”
Reviews.Author: raffybetty
Reviews.Content: Great service - employees at desk very friendly and accomodating - all employees eager to please - it was the perfect place for a convention

Reviews.Title: “the princess royale- sleep tight, eat right adn enjoy the view”
Reviews.Author: tom20783
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed a very realaxing two day conference- very nice accomodations, good food and a grat view of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time. I will be returning next year.”
Reviews.Author: verypickytravler
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I chose this hotel from trip advisor and was not disappointed at all. I stayed 3 nights with my wife and 3 kids age 3 to 15 and was very pleased.The hotel is in a great location.The people at the front desk were not the best but still ok. We got up to our room and I was happy I chose ocean front the room it was big enough for the 5 of us.The only bad thing I could say is that the stove top was broken (not that I was using it to cook anyway) and after the 1st night i started to see tiny ants in the bathroom. All in all the room was perfect and was very pleased. Now to the pool and pool area it was great. The area around the pool and the pool was clean. The pool was a little cold but not that bad. They have an area of games and a small bar right next to the pool.The restaurant was good and the staff was very friendly. Room service was good also. So let me say this about the Princess Royale.The location was great. It is a beautiful hotel on beach .The staff is friendly and the hotel was clean I was very happy that I stayed here. I will be bringing my family back next year. Thank you for a get away.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: pleonardp
Reviews.Content: I was fortuante to get a reservation for the one night I was able to take a break! This means a lot to me! The room was very pleasant and clean, comfortable and accommodating! Although the time was short for my family it was a pleasant break from the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: enerG1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and the staff are always eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful weekend”
Reviews.Author: theduke22
Reviews.Content: Our room was a water front view. It had glass sliding doors and the view was amazing. It was warm enough to open them and we listened to the ocean. The beach was very clean. We had a peaceful get away weekend.

Reviews.Title: “FAMILY FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: chingvil
Reviews.Content: We have young kids and a kitchenette is something i always consider when booking a hotel room.The room is nice and well kept and the beds are very comfortable.We stayed in the second floor and loved the fact that the pool/arcade was just outside the door.The staff are also very accomodating and they really make you feel at home.This is our second time here and would definitely consider staying here during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.....For Fun or Relaxing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sprintfan45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been going her every year for 4 years now. We love the place and will continue to go there in years to come!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a week or weekend”
Reviews.Author: crd0011
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with plenty to do with kids.Doesn't matter if you get bad weather with the large indoor pool ,arcade games,ping pong ,air hockey ect. steps to the beach .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Getaway”
Reviews.Author: lil6112
Reviews.Content: The Princess Royale was everything we expected and more. When we arrived, we were greeted by a welcoming staff and a gorgeous lobby. When we registered, the desk clerk politely asked for the "Book Friday, Get Thursday Night Free" coupon. I was anticipating a problem with this discount, but it was no problem at all. Our initial impression of the resort was enhanced by the large, clean, well-equipped, and comfortable room. The large indoor pool was absolutely gorgeous. Even though my children are 17 and 22, they enjoyed playing the games in the pool area and hanging by the pool. The location of the resort could not be better. There were too many restaurants and stores within walking distance to list. A Princess Royale Spring getaway will be an annual event for my family !!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be staying again!!”
Reviews.Author: abbarlip
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time at the Princess Royale. The kids loved the swimming pool, arcade and other amenities. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant service was excellent. We were there for Easter and would like to make it a tradition!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, I have been staying here for 20 years”
Reviews.Author: jjlbtnj
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for at least 20 years. We have a golf group that stay here twice a year, and when I come to this town at other times, I stay here. You are the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: baaad_lady
Reviews.Content: Very plush beds. Gorgeous lobby. Nice swimming pool. I would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!”
Reviews.Author: cbouchat101
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews and my price range. I arrived their to a friendly staff and quick check in. The room was very spacious and the beds were so comfortable. Everything was clean and we had an awesome view of the beach. I would definitely recommend an oceanfront suite. There were two TV's, so my boys could watch cartoons in one room and we could watch what we wanted in the bedroom. The wireless internet was easy to use. This is where I'll be staying from now on. Had a wonderful Easter weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Retreat by the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: ButterflyNewJersey56
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Princess Royale Resort. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable. The bed was comfortable. The service was good and the people friendly. The food was good. I plan to come back next year for another retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ajdh46
Reviews.Content: Princess Royale is a wonderful place to stay. Very clean and accommodating. Staff is courteous and helpful. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our family to stay at for soccer tournament!”
Reviews.Author: donmom14
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a soccer tournament and this was an ideal setting for our boys. The pool and arcade area was a great place for the boys to hang out and for the parents to relax and spend some time together. Felt like a true "beach weekend"......almost forgot that it was March outside!

Reviews.Title: “Have used this venue for the last seven years and will continue to do so”
Reviews.Author: Dallas31Bowie_MD
Reviews.Content: Staff is always willing to assist you! The grounds are always maintained and you will find lots to do in and around the facility. There are plently of fine eating establishments.

Reviews.Title: “This place has the best rooms and the very best pool ever!”
Reviews.Author: rudedog_ginger
Reviews.Content: We just love the Princess Royale. The rooms are spacious, have kitchens in every one of the rooms and the atrium pool is awesome! If you ever get the opportunity to stay in one of the condos, that is a big plus. It is just like being in an apartment with everything you could possibly need right there in the room. Save money and calories by preparing your meals in the room, instead of going out to dinner every night (or better yet, for breakfast!) We have stayed here 3 times so far and have plans to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “We shared a 2-bedroom condo with our best friends with plenty of room for everyone to enjoy the oceanfront view.”
Reviews.Author: HoneyII
Reviews.Content: If you are going to book a condo, be sure to request a newly renovated one. Only about one half of the condos had been renovated so far in February 2010. Our condo was just beautiful. We like a 2-bedroom condo because we travel with our best chums, and we like to play cards, and the roominess just suits our needs. There is a roomy oceanfront living room, full kitchen, dining room, master bedroom with sink and with private bathroom and Jacuzi tub, second bedroom, full bathroom, washer and dryer. We really enjoy the daily maid service, too! There is also an indoor swimming pool and there are two outdoor spas adjacent to the pool. We have had the Sunday Brunch and it was hot and delicious. We always book a high condo with an oceanfront view. The condo rates in the wintertime are very reasonable, and they include daily maid service. The only drawback to the condos is they only provide two (2) TVs in the 2- and 3-bedroom condos, one in the living room and one in the master bedroom. So, if a TV is important to you and you will be staying in the 2nd or 3rd bedroom, you may wish to pack a TV to bring with you. The entire Princess Royale staff is very accommodating and pleasant. We have been going to the Princess Royale Condos for many, many years and highly recommend it. The Princess Royale is in a very convenient location (91st Street and Beach) to either the "Boards" or to Delaware, which ever way you wish to travel. The Princess Royale has garage parking, which is also a plus. We highly recommend the Princess Royale Condos!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: donnyjr
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, everyone was very nice and made us feel very comfortable at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are really nice.”
Reviews.Author: joyseaturner
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great and it is just like having your own apartment for your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Our first and only choice in Ocean City!”
Reviews.Author: singrdave
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Princess Royale Resort every year since we moved to the East Coast. This is a great, very family-friendly hotel. Our family (mom, dad, and four children) loves the suites, the pool, and the hot tub. My wife and I love the Tempur-Pedic mattresses in every room.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. Stay- Not a Resort”
Reviews.Author: orlandovisitor
Reviews.Content: Daughter, husband and I had an overnight stay, oceanfront room, on 3rd. floor clean, but needs updating- marks on floor, etc. from wear and tear, small suites and not really a resort. Beds are foam variety and need to be replaced. Old, very noisy heating/ air conditioning unit., so much that we had to shut it off to get some sleep. Ice maker in refrigerator wasn't working at first, but called front desk and it was fixed. Staff was friendly, however when checking out, no one was at the front desk- waited 5 minutes before waited on. O.K. stay, but would never pay summer rates.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMomSS
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter and several of her friends to celebrate her 13th birthday. We all had a wonderful time. Everything was perfect from check in to check out. Front desk staff was very friendly. Needed extra towels in room and also safe was locked. Staff came immediately to help. If I had to make a comment for improvement it would be the indoor pool. Otherwise it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jack21903
Reviews.Content: The rooms provide adequate space for a family. Two tv's, small kitchen, large bedroom and living room, and plenty of storage. The indoor pool was great for kids and the pool bar was great for adults. The Schooner Bar and Restaurant was a little on the high price end, but the food and service was good so worth a little extra, especially since it was so bitterly cold one evening and we didn't want to go out for dinner. GREAT!!! The hotel is great for a family, couples seeking romance, or just for a quick get away!

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!!”
Reviews.Author: ticky v
Reviews.Content: I don’t know where to begin with this hotel. Besides being out-dated, smelly and falling apart, the rooms were filthy. Everything in the kitchen was sticky, the bath tub was dirty and the rugs were so dirty that my socks developed black footprints on the bottom of them. I wouldn’t let my kids walk around unless they had flip flops or socks on. I don’t know what housekeeping did when they came in my room every day. My towels were never refreshed and the blankets were just tossed up on the bed. The pool, which was supposed to be heated, was freezing cold. There were people hanging around the pool all night drinking beer and carrying on until way past midnight. I let the front desk know about my issues and they didn’t really seem to care. No appoligies or nothing. About 20 mins after we left, we realized that my son left his sleep sack (which he always travels with) in the room. We called the hotel and they informed us that nothing had been found in the room, but to try back later, as the person cleaning the room, might not have reported finding it yet. It was never found. I am convinced that it was ‘kept’ by the maid.

Reviews.Title: “Above-par accommodations, rowdy guests”
Reviews.Author: graymom
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservation, we asked for an oceanfront room with 2 queen beds in a quiet part of the hotel. We emphasized that we were a husband, wife, and 15-year-old staying just one night to visit family locally, and we wanted quiet room that would be minimally impacted by any planned receptions/parties (we made this request having read the recent reviews). When we checked in, we were taken with the appearance of the lobby; it’s more lavish than other 3-star hotels we’ve stayed in. We were allowed to check in early, and registration went smoothly. The front desk staff was polite and pleasant. A bellhop helped us to our room. The carpeting in the hallways appeared a bit faded, though not really worn; the walls, doors, etc were in good repair; everything appeared clean. We were shown to a lovely oceanfront room. Upon entering, you walk directly into a sitting room with a sleep sofa, chair, and a tv; all the table tops were granite. The upholstery on the chair and sofa was worn and the cushions offered little support. To the right, there was a kitchen/dining area which consisted of a sink, dishwasher, 2-burner electric stove, and a full-sized refrigerator. The cabinets were stocked with dishes and cookware. To the left was the bathroom with a sink surrounded by a granite counter, tub/shower, and toilet. The suite was very clean except for grime imbedded in the grooves of the vinyl flooring of the kitchen and bathroom area. Clearly, this could not be removed with a simple mopping. At the back of the suite was a bedroom with 2 tempurpedic beds (with an abundance of pillows) and spreads which appeared new, and a wall-mounted flat-screen tv; again all table tops were granite. The highlight: a spectacular view of the beach and ocean. Thankfully, the palm trees lining the beach side of the hotel had been cut; otherwise I think they may have obstructed our 2nd-story view. But, as it was, the view was breathtaking. We dropped our bags and hurried to visit family, returning at 7:30 PM. When we returned, it seemed like a different hotel than the one we’d left 6 hours earlier. Gone was the peaceful quiet, replaced by the raucous partying of football fans who had flocked to the hotel for the Colts/Ravens game that night. Children ran and shrieked through the hallways with no adults in sight. That’s when we discovered that the quiet room we had requested was directly above Schooner’s, the hotel bar/restaurant. The lounge singer (who usually only performs until 8 PM, but was performing until midnight because of the partying) sounded as if he were serenading us in our room. Bright light streaming from the restaurant below washed out our ocean view. Two boys, who looked to be only 8-years-old or so, raced past our door repeatedly, all the while screaming into their hand-held radio. But it wasn’t limited to unattended children: we heard stomping outside our door, only to find that a father was with his two teenage sons who were responsible for all the noise! He offered a sheepish, “sorry,” and moved on. With no hope of enjoying either the view or the restful lapping of the waves hitting the shore, I sat down on the sofa and cried. My husband hurried down to the registration desk. Thankfully, without any argument, the front desk moved us to the 4th floor, opposite side of the hotel, while still remaining ocean front. My husband went to check out the room before we moved our bags. The smell of smoke inundated the hallway but there was no odor in our newly assigned room, which was a mirror image of the first though slightly narrower. (The hotel has a 100% no smoking policy, so my husband informed the front desk of the odor. He later learned that security swept the floor and found the culprit, fining him $200. I hope that fee is not just punitive, but is also used to thoroughly freshen the room.) As we traversed the hotel with our bags, I now noticed a lot of food scraps in the hallways, which I’m sure could contribute to the infestations described by kimisusu. However, I was pleased to find there were no screaming football fans or children near this room, and the light from the restaurant at the other side of the hotel actually enhanced our view of the beach. This suite was also very clean except for the imbedded in the grooves of the vinyl flooring. All was well until we got ready for bed and tried to turn on the heat. The metal panel covering the unit rattled loudly and incessantly; my husband tried lining the panel with towels to dampen the noise, but to no avail. And after 10 minutes, when we still did not have heat coming from the vent, we gave up and slept in a cold room (the temperature that night was the 30’s). We chose not to request another change of room. Here’s one of my pet peeves: bathrooms that don’t vent and are filled with steam by the time you finish even a quick shower. I find this to be the case at 90% of the hotels that we stay in, and the Princess Royale was no different. A vent seemed to come on when the light switch was flipped, but it had no effect. As a result, showers had to be taken with the bathroom door left open and a fan propped in the doorway, offering little privacy. Then, there was the water pressure in the shower which is very strongly aerated...our entire family agreed that it felt as if we had been power-washed rather than bathed. I imagine the hotel does this in an effort to conserve water, but we would have been able to shower more quickly had we been able to endure more than 10 seconds at a time beneath the stabbing torrent. In the morning, we enjoyed breakfast at Schooner’s. A buffet is surved from 8AM-11AM on Sundays and it consisted of the typical fare but offered a wider selection (scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, French toast, pancakes, corned beef hash, fruit, rolls, and cereal), and the ocean view was outstanding. Unfortunately, there was “stuff” at the bottom of my father’s glass, which he discovered after drinking almost all his OJ. He pointed it out to the waitress who insisted it was only on the outside – however, he was able to move it with the straw, so clearly it was in his glass! Our waitress did not deduct this from the bill, and was not apologetic; instead, she seemed frustrated by father’s pickiness. At breakfast, we overheard older adult couples complaining about the children and teens who ran though the hallways and apparently banged on doors until the early morning hours. They indicated they were too frightened to call the front desk because they were concerned there would be “pay-backs.” (Very much in keeping with Murphydogg’s review.) We were very glad we asked for a new room, because we enjoyed a peaceful (though cold) evening and had a good night’s rest. I took a quick tour of the hotel to assess its amenities. On the 3rd, 4th, and 5th floors there are laundry facilities consisting of one coin-operated washer and one coin-operated dryer in a vending area. In the main lobby, there is a gift shop and a convenience store. Near the lobby there is a small fitness center and a business center. At 6:15 AM, I asked the front desk to open the business center for me, they told me that it would open in 45 minutes; when I told them the sign posted by the door stated the hours were 6 AM – 11 PM, they called for security to open it. I was very disappointed in the business center, finding only one computer/monitor, and one printer/copy machine. Furthermore, there was a cost of $0.39 per/minute for the computer, and $0.50 per printed page. This is substantially below par compared to other 3-star hotels that we regularly stay at which offer multiple computers without charge and free printing. I would not recommend this hotel for business travelers. Other amenities include an indoor pool (the water did appear yellow as described by murphydogg) and a game area beside the pool. There appeared to be 2 hot tubs, but I could not see them, nor could I access the beach from the back of the hotel, because the doors remained locked even as late as 9 AM. Overall, I felt the accommodations in many ways exceeded those expected of a 3-star resort, and the view from oceanfront rooms is spectacular. Raucous guests left a very poor impression, and it is unfortunate that security was not more visible to quiet unattended children running rampant through the halls.

Reviews.Title: “shouldn't indoor pools be heated?”
Reviews.Author: murphydogg
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel after an extensive search and time consuming review of prior customers. I was looking for a hotel with an indoor pool to relax away a December day before viewing the Winterfest Lights display. I was so disappointed. The pool water was yellow looking and ice cold, the hot tub water was yellow in color too and had so many children in it that adults couldn't enjoy it. In addition the children were unattended. The only place to get a drink was Schooners because the pool bar had a sign that it was being used for a wedding reception. I only booked two weeks ago or so and I wasn't told that the atrium was being converted to a wedding reception and the ocean view would be blocked, the poolside room we booked would be loud all night long with a festive, inappropriately located wedding reception. I was accomidated to a different room with an ocean view on the 5th floor, but soon found out upon arrival home that evening- a large portion of intoxicated, loud, rude, immature guests were staying on that floor as well. I literally was woken up hourly until 3:45AM by people litterally yelling, running an having 100% disregard for anyone else in the hotel. I was so bothered but scared to call security because I was afraid of repercussions from the rude guests partying in the nearby rooms. I kept hoping hotel security would at least make a routine walk along each floor. I had a nine year old afraid of the commotion- and was woken up along with myself numerous times. All I wanted was to treat my family to a fun day of swimming at a classy hotel. I feel disgusted by the caliber of guests that were there, the cold, discolored pool, and the overall esthetic value of the hotel. I wasted my $89.00 (+ taxes )dollars and will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vactions my family has had”
Reviews.Author: queeng4
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were polite and very helpful. Our room was fantastic. We had a 2 bedroom oceanfront suit. It was clean and seemed recently update. I would and plan on staying here again. Our view was absolutely gorgeous and our kids loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “not a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: charleswill
Reviews.Content: when me and my wife first got there we were met with a very rude front desk help. they tricked us in saying that the ocean view was not what it was that we should have asked for ocean front not ocean view. second they did not offer an upgrade to the "ocean front" and then on top of that they had a policy of no refund on early check out. the room was not as clean as a hotel should be the linen was dirty and not fresh or clean had to buy our own sheets! ok! sad just sad. will not use expedia again at all. just want to say that it was a terrible experience overall. will not stay there to save my own life. we had a lot of trouble to get hotel staff to get what we needed in our room basic stuff such as toilet paper towels and washclothes never again.

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kimisusu
Reviews.Content: The moment we pulled in we were impressed with the "grandness" of the hotel - then it went all downhill.....The front desk manager carried on a personal conversation about her weekend with the agent checking us in. A dirty rag over the shower railing, dirty tape in the bathroom, a needle on the bedroom floor, three roaches in the kitchen and a mouse was seen in the 3rd floor hallway. Filthy. When I voiced my concerns It was conveyed to me that not one individual on staff cared - I spoke with five different staff members about the roaches and NOTHING was done. We had to throw out all the food and launder our belongings before taking them home. Marteesha, the Front Desk Manager has no clue how to run a front desk or how to handle guest concerns. She needs to be fired. She would be the reason I would never stay her again. If my issues had been met with even an ounce of concern it would have been tolerable. Not even close. I would be very surprised if the Hotel Manager responds to this complaint. I will keep TripAdvisor informed of my progress.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: kathen302
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute for a one night getaway. Check in was fast and easy. This hotel is in need of a facelift. Its clean but very outdated. The mirrors everywhere have to go. We had an oceanfront suite. The kitchen counters, bathroom counters and bedroom have all been updated but the rest of the room hasn't, which I don't understand. The couch and chair looked 10 yrs old. Customer service was good. Our ice maker wasn't working so they sent someone up w a lot of ice for us. The pool area is nice. Its large w a lot of loungers and not humid like indoor pools can be. This is not by the boardwalk, so be prepared to drive. This time of year its only about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A Disgrace”
Reviews.Author: CEJ47911
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff was insincere, without the most basic understanding of customer service. The toilet in our room did not function properly during our entire stay. The hotel staff simply ignored our requests simply stating "we are very busy this weekend." Further, the room accomodations (1bdrm o/f suite) were tattered, worn & old. The hallways smelled of food and the carpet and wallpaper were ancient.

Reviews.Title: “This was by far our best hotel experience in Ocean City ever.”
Reviews.Author: cjajsmom
Reviews.Content: I decided to try the Princess Royale based on TripAdvisor reviews and it was an excellent decision. The fact that management reads and responds to these reviews told me, before I ever picked up the phone, that they care. We arrived late Sunday afternoon and were greeted by Martin, a very friendly and helpful bell hop. Registration was simple and handled very professionally by another friendly young man. We were ready to unload our car in no time. Martin handled our belongings carefully and efficiently and we had a very pleasant chat as we walked to our suite. Throughout our four-day stay, he greeted us warmly every time we saw him. Our suite was absolutely wonderful. Everything was very clean and well-maintained, no signs of wear on the furniture at all. We had a living room (w/TV), small kitchenette area (stocked for cooking and dining in), and a lovely bedroom (w/TV). Our bedroom had a king-size bed with the advertised Tempur-pedic mattress (my husband wants one for our home now), five pillows, and excellent sheets and blanket. I was very pleased to find that the bottom sheet was a fitted sheet. (This is important enough to me that I travel with our own fitted sheet in case we need them.) From our room we had two sliding doors. The northerly door opened to a balcony that afforded a great view of the ocean. (Unfortunately, it was way too windy while we were there to enjoy the balcony.) The other door opened to the east to face the ocean. There was no balcony there, but because there was a rail there, you could open the screen fully and stand there at the rail and enjoy the sights, sounds, and smells of the ocean. We looked down on an outdoor dining area with tables, umbrellas and palm trees. Housekeeping took excellent care of our room each day. We never had a complaint about lack of towels and toiletries. The young ladies that we spoke with were very friendly and tried to be as helpful as possible if we had a question for them. We did notify maintenance of one problem while we were there -- the hot water faucet in the tub did not always turn off. We called them about that, went to breakfast, and when we returned about 45 minutes later, the faucet had already been repaired. I never had an opportunity to use the pool, although the pool area is very nice and inviting. Also, there was a conference going on at the hotel while we were there but that did not take away from our stay at all. Additionally, we dined in the on-site restaurant Schooners several times and I have posted a review of that in the restaurant review section. The Princess Royale also has an exercise room, spa, gift shop, sundries shop, and jewelery store. There may be more amenities that I did not see. The thing that impressed me the most about Princess Royale was the professionalism, respect, and friendliness of the employees. I have had so many negative experiences in Ocean City hotels that this was an extremely pleasant surprise. The only other place we have ever been treated so well was at a Disney-operated resort. The Princess Royale is on par with Disney, which I consider to be the standard that the hospitality industry should strive to achieve.

Reviews.Title: “Reminded us of all inclusive resorts we stayed at in Mexico and Punta Cana”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaPatti
Reviews.Content: It was clean, well kept and had everything you could possibly need or want right there.

Reviews.Title: “Midweek is a perfect escape”
Reviews.Author: AWA45
Reviews.Content: First time at Princess Royal Resort and the staff is very accomodating, friendly, and professional. Really had no issues, or negative moments during our stay...just what u should expect on a vacation, in the medium price range for ocean view, very nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Mad me feel relax and mellow.”
Reviews.Author: jome52
Reviews.Content: Hotels location was perfect. Near the beach and near the heart of Ocean City. We were down for bike week and they were very accomodating. I would go back again. No doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend to Treasure”
Reviews.Author: mouseyphiladelphia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, modern, very accomodating, the staff was very courteous and polite my experience at the indoor pool and sauna great and most helpful were the directions received by the staff to the area attractions. Yes, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: doobiec
Reviews.Content: except for being slightly pricey, this hotel was the bomb. the room was great and spacious. would have liked the ocean view to be better thru the glass. the restaurant was good, but the bar drinks were too high.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, easy access to beach, pool and arcade games for the kids”
Reviews.Author: TJBBallstonLake_NY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. We have stayed here the last four times we visited Ocean City. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Kichenette is very convenient. The beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...More than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Sue1076
Reviews.Content: Royale Princess resort was a last minute vacation we decided and it turned out great. The suit was very clean. I am very picky about the bedsheets and was worried as the room wasn't very costly but the mattress and the clean white bedsheets were a delight. The kitchen was just perfect to make breakfast and small meals. The location and view were so pleasant. Lobby to room service staff was so humble. The swimming pool was big and clean. My kids had so much fun in the water inside and on the beach too. We tried their buffet dinner and loved it. It was so relaxing to sit in the balcony with wine and watch the waves after wavescoming (we carried few bottles of wine from home). We would definitely go to Md again and would stay at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “worse experience ever”
Reviews.Author: songyue
Reviews.Content: AC was not working luckily it was september. The matress had not been replace since the hotel was built. Managers said nobody had complain all summer, so must be something wrong with me, finally agreed to replace the matress that had whole all over, the romm was like a cave, the hall smell terrible, my grandoughter only 4 years old keep saying what smell???

Reviews.Title: “A must see!”
Reviews.Author: BlackButterfly20
Reviews.Content: My compnay has stayed at the Princess Royale 2 years ago. We stayed at the Carousel last year, and everyone agrees that we loved the Princess Royale more. The location is great, the view is wonderful, and the atmosphere to include the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: teeituptv
Reviews.Content: Has all the you can ask for to have a pleasent relaxing getaway. Very large suite like rooms, clean and friendly Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good time”
Reviews.Author: cbro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been visiting O.C. a couple times a year for the last decade and have tried (and had been disappointed) by many of the hotels down there. The Princess Royale is consistently clean and the staff has always been very nice and helpful. The hotel is on the beach which makes it very easy to hit the sand. There is an outdoor pool and gazebo type bar that serves up some food and a deck that has 2 saunas. Inside there is a pool that is surrounded by seating, video games, ping png tables and a pool table. Excellent place if you have kids especially since some of the rooms face the indoor pool so you can check on them. There is a buffet and bar/resteraunt and on certain nights they have comedians. There are some negatives depending on what you are looking for. They do not provide a free complimentary breakfast that some hotels do. Some of the rooms have just a side view of the ocean, the rooms facing the pool have to deal with the chlorine smell (Not something that bothers us, but I've heard a few people complain about it). You have to drive to get to the boardwalk since it's a mile or two away(again not something that bothers us, it's less hectic being further away). They do have rooms with heartshaped hottubs, but you have to call to reserve them. I've tried a couple times to do it online and those rooms never show up on the availability. Those rooms are oceanfront and have an elevator right next to it that leads right to the beach. Excellent. I would defintiely recommend this hotel especially if you have kids. The kids can keep busy at the indoor pool/game area on those rainy days.

Reviews.Title: “Euphoria in Ocean City Maryland”
Reviews.Author: Summer of '42
Reviews.Content: Once again, 2 friends of mine and I went to the Princess Royale for our annual retreat in the Fall. We were once again elated at the friendliness of the staff, the nice rooms, the ocean view, and the many amenities of this Hotel. We just love the Atrium, with its very large heated pool and the hot tubs available in the Atrium and out on the deck right out from the Atrium. It was cloudy and windy two of our vacation days, and this was a wonderful alternative to being out on the beach. One of our friends is not allowed out in the sun, and this allows her to go along with us, without having to go out in the sun. Then there's the location! We don't like to be down in the boardwalk area in the thick of things. We like the more tranquil site of the Princess Royale. There are many nice restaurants nearby, and shopping. Or, if we want to, it's a quick trip to either end of Ocean City, since we are probably near the middle. I also like the fact that they are trying to be eco-friendly, in that unless you want the sheets changed, they will just make your beds for a few days. It seems like they are always interested in improving their customer service. So, once again, we came away pleased and relaxed. Melanie Lutz

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ocboy300
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Princess Royale for a week after labor day. We originally booked an economy room that came with either a queen murphy or a king bed. After checking into the queen murphy room we went downstairs to see if we could get an upgrade. They changed our room with no problem, offered to help us move our stuff, and even called later that day to make sure everything was to our liking. The rooms are extremely spacious, clean, newly renovated, flat screen plasma tv, and tempurpedic bed. The front room and kitchen area are separated from the main bedroom with a door which blocked out any noise coming from the front room. The hotel is right on the beach but the week's weather wasn't so nice so we really appreciated the indoor pool. The cleaning staff was quick to service our room and after we had forgotten to hang the maid sign called us to see if we needed anything. I would highly recomend this hotel and we had an excellent stay. We are planning on staying at the princess royale next year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at an affordable price!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaPinkstar
Reviews.Content: Right from the moment of walking in we felt like we were in a much more expensive hotel. Our room faced the atrium but when we opened our patio door we felt like we were on a cruise ship, it just wasn't moving. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is beautiful, clean and reasonable. And, the bed - I don't think I've ever slept so well. I am buying that mattress for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Quiet.. No Frills Stay.”
Reviews.Author: sorryjokerBuffalo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than i expected,it was clean,comfortable and quiet. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Ocean City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachygal81
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were still able to check in. Our room was clean and spacious. The beds were amazing. Nice flatscreen T.V. to watch when we were in the room. Plenty of room for all of our stuff. Room service and maid service was prompt and satisfactory. Beach location was perfect. Great little outdoor bar overlooking the beach, plus a very cool bartender named Steve! Nice indoor pool, although the weather was so perfect we didn't have to use it.
