We hope that you otherwise enjoyed your stay and will give us another chance." ? Instead, rude letters in response to my expressed disappointment that our vacation was ruined. Isn't this supposed to be part of the hospitality industry? Not very hospitable! Guess what -- there are a lot of other lovely options for beach vacations in the area. We will never again stay at the Princess Royale and we have been sure to tell all of our friends of the poor customer service!

Reviews.Title: “clean, Mattress were great!”
Reviews.Author: islands2
Reviews.Content: This stay was for a "cheeleading competition" weekend for my grandaughters last year in High School. We had originally booked another hotel until someone recommended this one to us. When we called Amanda said we could have a low floor. I have panic attacks in elevators and heights. She emailed us back & said we were good to go with a low floor, so we canceled our other hotel. Upon arriving 1 hour prior to check in time we had a nice boy give us our room and it was on the 10th floor, highest floor with an outside glass elevator. I tried to do it but could not, so we went back and asked for a lower floor and he told us they had none. So we went to the room and I started having an attack. My daughter went down to the hotel desk & asked ABBY if out of courtesy for customers could they please switch me with all the other people waiting in line for a room, keep in mind we were there at 3 its now 4 & people are starting to check in. So when we checked in they could have switched another room or given us one on a lower floor as were we emailed by Amanda. ABBY proceeded to tell us that there is not guarantee and Amanda should never had emailed us with this and so on and so on, words started and Abby got very "nasty" with my daughter, and I mean disrespecful it was terrible in front of all these customers. I was embarassed by this woman ABBY and how she talked and handled the situation. I then took medication and hardly slept all night. Customer service is not on her list, nor does she know how to treat people. She should not be in the position she is in. There is a way to be courteous to people who are paying your salary which she needs to be reminded. This hotel is very clean and nice. You cant beat Oceanfront views and those wonderful mattresses. Pool inside was a little dirty but other then outr"conflict" with the front desk ABBY we had a nice time and again the Hotel Room is VERY CLEAN. Its ashame they dont value there customers or keep their written email promises as other hotels. They could have added another couple customers to their list but we will now stay at the Hilton where eveyone is friendly and works hard to please there customers.

Reviews.Title: “Jersey Chic, But It Has Character!”
Reviews.Author: mikjenn
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were supposed to stay at the Princess Royale for a wedding we were going to in August. The weekend of the wedding a noreaster hit the entire area so we stayed in DC and didn't make it to the wedding (we weren't the only ones). We couldn't get a refund on the room so we used it in November once our busy work schedule allowed us some free time. We're both from Virginia Beach and used to huge resort hotels. All in all the Princess Royale was nice. It definitely tends to be more of a family hotel but we enjoyed it even as a couple. The front desk staff are very nice, the rates had changed from our original reservation in August so they did refund us the difference (came out to ~$100). We had a pool side room that was pretty cool. They don't do that in Va Beach so it was unexpected. I thought that the kids playing in the pool during the day would be annoying because of the glass doors that lead to the balcony but we never heard a sound with them closed. There was a nice flatscreen TV in the bedroom area with lots of movie channels. Plenty of hot water with good pressure in the shower. They even had the little knob on the shower head to turn off water flow to conserve water while lathering up. It might have been november but we still got in the outdoor hot tubs that overlook the beach. It was pretty cool. There was some sort of convention going on in the hotel so we got to go use our "one free drink at the hotel bar" coupon and laugh at all the drunk older guys trying to pickup the younger ladies. good times! All in all, the Princess Royale was enjoyable. Its nothing fancy, but it has that "Jersey Chic" feeling to it that makes you feel right at home. Other hotels sometimes try to hard and are overbearing with their attempts to make you feel at home. Which in turn make you feel the opposite. The princess just does it without trying. On another note, if you get the chance, eat at Waterman's down across the Route 50 bridge. It's on your right just about a mile after the bridge. It was recommended by a local guy we talked to and it was GREAT! It you're in the mood for some quick burgers check our "Big Peckers". You can't miss the sign driving around the Princess Royale area.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: flog1223
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay online for September 2008. We did all of the work by doing it online with no contact with the hotel. A HURRICANE was due to hit the Ocean City area the time we were scheduled to go with projected high winds, rain and flooding. We were driving 5 hours to get to Ocean City and decided to cancel for safety reasons. The hotel kept our security deposit ($160.00) stating it was in the online information. We could not control the hurricane or weather conditions. I called the hotel but they refused to refund our money. I intend to write to the BBB and hope no one else gets the same treatment. I will never say at any of their properties in Ocean City and let all of my friends and family know what happened.

Reviews.Title: “Wow is it still the 70's”
Reviews.Author: Jerry_357
Reviews.Content: This resort is pretty nice but the decor is straight out of the 1970's. The suites have partially been updated with a 42" +/- flat t.v. in the bed room but a smaller box in the living room. The telephones are straight out of the 80's with the old push button desk phones and to order movies there is a sort of credit card maching in the living room. The bathroom is smal and the upgrade to a jacuzzi tub would do wonders to the room. The colors are awful but nothing any man can't deal with.The staff is courteous but the front desk is a little slow. The young man that checked me in was very helpful and responsive but the "supervisor" that assisted with checkout was incompetent, slow and rude. The resort does not offer full service laundry and the nearest dry cleaning is down the road a few miles.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: RAGDOLLNewYork
Reviews.Content: Nice place room had kitchenette range top microwave and full refridge,with dishwasher. Nice to have when you just dont want to go out.' Room was very clean and comfortable, ask for a room near the beach if you want an ocean view room , otherwise you get a veiw of rooftops and the street. Ocean front rooms are very nice. Pool was large ,heated but not really warm but clean. Nice area around pool to hang out. Video games and pool table and ping pong tables in there also. Little store inside for cookies,drinks and snack items no real food, but there is a grocery store within walking distance. Bus service was great right outside hotel on st $2.00 ride all day wherever you want to go on the route (goes to boardwalk leave your car at hotel, parking very expensive even off season). Only complaint was the resturaunt. Food was terrible, my wife had pasta with veggies and sauce. Sauce tasted like medicine, and the veggies looked like the weeks leftovers. I had "primerib" grizzle steak would have been a better name for it. Overall a nice clean comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: tripmonkey19
Reviews.Content: Just got home yesterday from a great overnite in OCMD & the Princess. I choose them for the indoor pool & 2 room suite since we have young children. When they went to bed we could hang out in the living room. Check in/out were quick & easy, parking was right out the front door in a covered garage and the lay out of the hotel was easy. The kids loved the huge indoor pool & we even played tennis on the rooftop. And the beach and ocean were right out the front door. The lobby, pool area, hallways, elevators, and our room were all clean & the Temp bed, as everyone has mentioned, was great. (Now we want on ourselves!) We came in contact with numerous staff in our short stay (front desk, hallways, elevators, etc.) and all were nice & professional. Overall we had a great experience at the Princess and would not hesistate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service Stay AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: obelle2
Reviews.Content: I have vacationed at the Princess Royale on Tuesday July 15, 2008 through Sunday July 20, 2008. During my stay there was a major power outage at the hotel. On Tuesday there was no power in our room…no electricity, stove, microwave and no air conditioner. There was very little water pressure and no hot water at all. I chose this hotel from not only being a repeat guest from years ago, but also for the kitchen area. We were traveling with my son who is 1 year. We had to give him an ice cold bath, all his food in the refrigerator had to be thrown out because it was spoiled and he spent the night very overheated due to no air conditioner. The staff at the front desk were nice enough to credit us for the night and gave us hope that this situation would be resolved in the morning. The next morning, Thursday, the staff had informed us that the problems should be resolved that day. However the elevators were not working properly so we needed to walk up and down carrying our 1 year old and stroller throughout the day until the elevators were working. We also did not have use of the pool due to this outage and hotel was unable to provide us with any feeding needs for our son. Finally late in the afternoon we started to get back some of the power. At 9pm we spoke to the front desk about our air conditioner still not work and they then informed us that it had to be reset. However our room did not cool off until the next day and we spent another night with our infant sweating. Thank god by Friday everything was in working order again. This was a huge inconvenience for us especially with having an infant. Not only did he have to sleep in the heat but we had to repurchase food for him, and not having hot water to bath him or heat his bottles was a big problem as well as no lights! I am currently disputing it with my credit card b/c they keep claiming it was from 2pm Wed till 2pm on Thursday. that is not the case at all. They only want to credit for 1 night when we were terribly inconvenienced for 2 nights. Oh and they office a free night from September till March! and travel 5 hours for 1 night or give you more of my money? I don't think so! I will never return to the hotel. the rooms are sort of nice and upated. the couch is alittle gross and the bathrooms are not that great but the room overall is good. the rest of the hotel smells and is in need of desperate updating. the restaurant was okay and crab fest was terrible and a waste of money. customer service is terrible and most of the employees are not friendly at all. The indoor pool smells but if you like the beach the beach is beautiful but you can get that at any hotel. I would spend the extra money and stay at the Holiday Inn or Hilton we saw them and they are beautiful! Feel free to e-mail me travelers for more info and I would stay away! What a shame I use to come here every year with my parents and now i come back with my own family and it turned into a dump! good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - Stay far away !!!”
Reviews.Author: annfg2
Reviews.Content: The pictures online are nothing what you see when you get there, they are very deceiving, as the person talking to you on the telephone. We stayed for a week and during that time we had no hot water because the circulating pump was broken since mid summer. Our room was a 2 bedroom condo. The Master had only 1 be in it and they told us it would have 2, the second bedroom was ( as we called it ) the "bat cave". The balcony on the side was very tiny and scary, with these ridiculous hard metal seats, as you would fine in the lawn ornament department at LOWES. Couldn't put your butt on those. Glass mirror doors were falling off and screen had tears in them. The upkeep in the room we stayed (904)was terrible One of the beds broke during the night, the frame was broken. We were very dissappointed and the manager did't do anything to get the problems taken care of and basically accused us of complaining too much for a free ride. BEWARE BEWARE and stay away!!! of the condos

Reviews.Title: “Renovations?? Are you kidding me??”
Reviews.Author: baltimorelife
Reviews.Content: I love to read the manager's response that they "renovated" some of their rooms. We were in one of the "renovated" suites, #371. Great sized room, great view, free parking, so so beds but you have to be kidding me... Putting granite tops on everything in the room (dresser, bathroom, kitchen, end tables, coffee tables) is not renovation...Okay I'll give them there is a nice new TV in the bedroom too and a new lamp with a strangely colored light bulb, but What about fixing the toilet paper holder coming out of the wall? What about replacing that horribly dirty carpet in the hallways and on the elevator? What about actually updating the curtains, carpet, bedspreads in the room? What about that nasty couch that has seen better days? And don't get me started on the strange smells in the hallway.... This resort has a long way to go before they can claim it's "renovated". It's a shame that this hotel hasn't kept up with the times... it was so nice , in the early 90s when mirrors on the wall and tube lights on the ceiling were fancy.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: CentralPa_CoffeeMan
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel. Beautiful. I've stayed there many times and this year was outstanding. Room upgrades are just right. The staff is outstanding. I didn't make it to the Princess last summer and I forgot how much I like staying there. A perfect end to our summer.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the 90's”
Reviews.Author: TheseTwoEyes
Reviews.Content: While searching for accomodations in OCMD for a girl-friend getaway, we were looking for something affordable, with a good location (close to beach and some evening hot-spots) but wanted to stray from the boardwalk and all it's chaos. The Princess Royale had mixed reviews, but appeared to be getting better and better as the season bore on. Walking into the hotel I was immediatley welcomed back to 1992. The carpets were worn and fadded, icicle-like gold chandelier's hung from the ceilings and the typical luxaries of even a motel 6 I didn't find evident. As a business traveler I've seen a fair trade of various accomdations, but the Princess really did not play up to my expectations. Then again, this is a hotel in a seasonal town. The locals love OCMD and all it has to offer. I, personally, find it a mix between family and children, too many all you can eat buffett's, and a crowd that perhaps would be perfectly content with the dangerously slow and shifty elevator at the Princess, the warm indoor poor you just KNOW is filthy with children's pee, and service that does not make any acceptions to making your stay as pleasurable as possible. The highlights: Great temperpedic beds, an outdoor bar that has live music around 1 in the afternoon that you can hear on the beach, a decent location (across from bus stop!) and although not great, probably beats out half the motel-ish dives lining main drag offering small dirty rooms for the same price. The Princess offers all Suites which are all decently sized many of which have balconies (do not recommend staying in the rooms who's balconies face indoors - toward the pool. You will be awakened by children playing in pool and videogames). Would I recommend or stay again, NO, but was it soooo terrible, not in the least.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!! Kudos to Diane Anderson!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Buggin0108
Reviews.Content: GREAT PLACE!!! Kids had a BLAST and wife loved the location. Didn't need to carry cooler, chairs, umbrella, ect. across busy Costal Hwy. like we did last year (to the beach). Ocean view room was perfect. We have a great pic of my daughter (5) and I sitting in the same chair and lovingly looking into the moon light ocean......Room was huge, big enough for the 5 of us and beds were super comfy. 2 huge TV's in the room were perfect for kids and parents. Reception desk staff are freindly and housekeeping staff on the floors are VERY responsive. Kids LOVED the indoor pool...so did this Dad....LOL One last thing I certainly need to say...DIANE ANDERSON you are the best!!! You helped us soooo much before we arrived and even went above and beyond our expectations during our stay. Management should certainly ensure the Board knows how valuable you are to the Princess Royale and their guests. Sorry we didn't get a chance to meet but I just wanted to take this moment to thank you on behalf of my entire family....IT WAS A GREAT VACATION!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better...”
Reviews.Author: FiveStarFavorite
Reviews.Content: 4 adults and 2 kids stayed in 2-bedroom condo unit #1006 for 7 days. Our first time in OC, Maryland and would return to this great family vacation spot but will likely pick another hotel or try to rent a house. The hotel's website seemed to exaggerate the summer of 2008 renovations the resort has undergone. The furniture in the unit was definitely not new (think 1980's décor). The sofa and couch upholstery was so stained and worn-out; I had to cover them up with bed sheets so I can tolerate to sit down on them. The Temper- Pedic mattresses were present but I've slept on better beds. Micro-gel pillows, granite counters, tables, vanities - not in this unit. The plates, utensils, cups, etc. had to be re-washed as some were still dirty despite being in the cabinets. Resort conveniences were large indoor pool with recreational and video games abound, direct access to beach, restaurant and a supermarket (a block away). The hotel’s location was a bit away from the boardwalk but peaceful evenings are comforting. In the unit, the positives were a working washer and dryer, fairly spacious bathrooms and the wireless internet connection. Everything in the unit was functional except a coffee-maker and a foul-smelling garbage disposal. Despite the comments from other guests about the non-English speaking staff, I did not encounter such level of poor service. Service was not exceptional but requests/expectations were handled within a reasonable time period. Never tried the crab buffet, in-suite dining or Schooners – there were many good restaurants nearby. The tennis courts need repairing.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Maulers40
Reviews.Content: Just return from the Princess Royale and our stay was not a very pleasant one. It started out very promising. The front desk personnel were very friendly checking us in and were very surprised that our room was ready at 3:30. Went out to unload our car and could not find a luggage cart or bell hop. When a few showed up outside the hotel I and another guest had to approach them for help and felt we were putting them out. Our first night we stayed in a two room oceanfront suite. The room was nicely furnished and appeared clean. As other reviews stated the beds were very comfortable and linens were nice. However, the bathroom was another story. It was clean, but the towels were very rough and thin. The soap “bit” was not usable, the only one in the room was one inch square so be sure and take your own. The physical condition was tired, no remodeling in here. The balcony furniture is the cheap plastic type, felt like it was going to break at any minute. The rest of our stay was to be spent in a condo. Once again the front desk was very helpful in the move and the condo was ready around 1 pm. This time the bell hop was very friendly in helping us move our gear. Once we arrived at the condo, we first noticed that no balcony was visible. We move a certain and there was a 5X6 (est.) balcony looking over the deck and the side looking over the ocean. When I booked this condo I was told there would be a wrap around balcony like the one on the virtual tour on their website. Just like other reviews noted we did not get what we reserved. The furniture was dirty and the living room’s only tv was a small 17 inch and the remote’s back kept falling off. The flat screen was in one of the bedrooms. The fridge’s handle was loose and felt like it would fall off at anytime and the ice maker did not work. When we went into the first bedroom we could not believe what we saw, a window looking out onto the hallway and elevator!!! It was “covered” with Venetian blinds set into the widow’s opening and did not fully cover the window. In other word you could see into the bedroom!!! We pinned up a towel to cover the window. That night we washed our clothes and the washer worked fine but the drier did not dry our cloths after 12 hours and multiple settings. There was no change in the bathroom then the suite (small soap cheap towels). In the morning I woke up with a plastic strip from a cig. Packet stuck to my side!!! That was the last straw, I wanted to go down to the front desk and discuss our options (no vacancies at other hotels). I had to wait two elevators because the staff had them filled up with maid charts then maintenance. Only one elevator services the condos. I talked to the front desk supervisor and was told no other condo available, but we could move to a room like we had the first night. We move to this room and it was ok with the same issues as the first. As mentioned in other reviews the carpets are very worn. In this room the carpet from the bedroom to the kitchen was so worn that the tacks from the tack strip was worn through so badly I punctured my foot. When I informed clerk at checkout on inquiry in to my condition. I would stay at this hotel again only as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful and romantic”
Reviews.Author: SteveEF
Reviews.Content: Just want readers to know that my wife and I have visited the Princess Royale nearly every year since our son was three. He's fifteen now and we still make a visit to the PR an annual event. In fact, this year we're on schedule for two trips; one we took last March and one we're taking Columbus Day. During the off-season we find the oceanfront condos to be exceptionally good deals. Where else can you find an oceanfront three bedroom suite with mirrored walls, a huge jacuzzi tub, dining room, kitchen, TWO bathrooms, balcony AND laundry facilities for $200 (plus tax)? We've always found the staff to be friendly and courteous. Admittedly the hotel is not young, but lately great efforts have been made to renovate the place. This coming winter, for example, we've been told the aforementioned condos will be receiving a facelift. If there's any downside it's that the restaurant food (like much of the food in Ocean City) is subpar. The restaurant staff makes up for matters though. For example, last March my wife and I were the only ones present at the hotel's "Schooner's Oceanfront Lounge and Restaurant" on a particularly cold and rainy Sunday night. The chef treated us like a King and Queen! It was one of the most romantic experiences of our 21 year marriage! I have no idea why some reviewers give the place a thumbs down. After 12 years of visiting the place my wife and I still find the PR to be a wonderfully romantic hotel. Relative to get-away places on the East Coast (e.g., the Poconos or Atlantic City) the place is an absolute steal during the Fall, Winter and early Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Overall "Ok"”
Reviews.Author: cruzans
Reviews.Content: Have not been to the Princess in a few years. Was satisfied with it back in 2005/2006, and saw their ads that Hotel was remodeled, upgraded, smoke free, etc., and decided to give it a try. Overall, it was "ok" at best. You can tell the Hotel is being hit with high costs and poor help - maintenance seemed to be the largest opportunity. When we arrived, the parking garage elevator was broken, was finally fixed a day later. Door to beach from pool area was also broken with taped sign "do not use" - seemed like simple fix, but took another day to fix. Signs/plaques in elevators saying which floor to use for beach/etc. was torn off and never replaced during stay. Rooms didn't look like they had been remodeled recently, torn carpet, safe in closet not secured to floor, etc., although the countertops were newer as mentioned in ads ! Beds were nice, tempurpedic, sheets and towels were mentioned in their ads as "top notch", but were basic hotel linens and towels. 32" tv's on wall were nice, but basic. Overall, as mentioned, it was "ok" - but if you know Ocean City at all, you know there are really no "great" hotels, they are all your run of the mill middle class beach hotels, unless you want to drop $500 a night for the new Hilton - I haven't stayed there yet, but I'm sure it's nice. I guess the biggest disappointment was their ads and website making it sound like the Hotel was totally remodeled and georgous - which it is not, pretty much the same it's been for years - "ok".

Reviews.Title: “Price does not equal value”
Reviews.Author: wonderOC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great potential but does not put emphasis on customer service. The new temper-pedic beds are magnificent. The hotel is in need of a complete overhaul. The suite we had was expensive and the portion that we slept in was very nice. When I unrolled the pull out sofa and saw the sheets that I had to use for my child I was less than happy. The bed was worn and the sheets old. They need to focus on cleanliness of entire rooms. Each day the room was not replenished with enough towels and coffee. One day the sheets for the pull out were missing. When I called to get some I was told they would be sent right up. After 30 minutes I got a call from someone asking if the sheets were in the closet. They were not and we waited another several minutes for the sheets to arrive. I witnessed the staff working hard to clean about the hotel but the price for the rooms and the service was too much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room! - Good Location! - Nice Family Vacation!~ :-)”
Reviews.Author: dolphinlover95
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival -- (7/27) we arrived around 5pm (an hour later then our checkin time)...there was quite a wait to get checked-in as there was mostly one person behind the counter but fortunately another woman came to the rescue of helping get people checked in. She was great in answering any questions we had and made us feel welcome:) The lobby is nice and is exactly as portrayed in the pics of their website. Nice floors, deco and cremey white leather furniture w/palm trees surrounding. To the left of the lobby is a small store where you can do a quick pick-me-up of some suits, coverups, bags etc. If you go up a bit further you will see around the corner an exercise room. We did not unfortunately have time to use that as we had too much fun with beach and pool. There is a small convenience store nearby the check-in where you can pick up necessities on a whim..there is also a Super Fresh just across the street adjacent to the hotel. Bathrooms are located near the small convenience store, just around the corner so that was convenient in the case you needed to go before heading up to your room. Elevators were a bit warm inside but nothing to complain about. We were on the 5th floor with an ocean view. They were great in getting us the closest view from the side they could get and we were very happy with what we got:)) Walking into the room we were pleased with the layout...you walk thru the small living room which has a couch, chair w/end tables and coffee table as well as a tv. You also see the kitchen and small connected table w/two chairs. Having a kitchen, especially full size fridge was a must for our vacation! Also a two burner stove stop -- dishwasher was on the smaller scale (we didnt use it -- I brought my own stuf and hand washed). Heck, I didnt even realize there was a dishwasher till the last day! lol They do provide you with dishwashing liquid for dishwasher, I brought my own dish soap). To the left of the kitchen was the bathroom....new granite counters, nice to spread your toiletries out and not feel cramped....everything was provided as well as very clean...another BIG plus in our book!!! In the back was the bedroom w/two queens, dresser, and a chair over in the corner. You also have a flat screen tv in the bedroom which was nice!:)On the floor, in the closet, was a safe, which was nice. You make up your own code to use which makes one feel good. Balcony was slightly smaller then expected (more angled) but no complaint here whatsoever...it is to step out on, appreciate great views, there's room to sit, watch, and listen to the ocean waves, or whatever...just relaxxxxx!~....ahhh the life!:) The hotel is on the beach -- very convenient as well as being a nice bigger sized pool then I've seen -- compared to other places -- the kids loved swimming and making new friends:) The pool is an indoor atrium with big glass which brings the outdoors' feeling inside -- this is a nice touch!! On either sides of the pool, it starts out at 3foot and progresses to 4ft and then to 5ft being the direct center of the pool. I do wish there was more area of the 5ft but I've seen smaller pools and this was fine. The pool area also has a sauna (I didnt use but hubby did) as well as a sit- in small pool which was in an area off to the side of the pool that looked to go maybe 4 ft? I didn't use that as it was pretty full the days we were there. There is a poolside bar for hot dogs, drinks and such. The white lanterns standing up around the outside of the pool area are another nice pretty touch to the atrium area!!! There are bathrooms on each side of the pool area so this makes it convenient and "clean" then running up and down hotel hallways getting sand everywhere to go to the bathroom. Another convenience and smart move was having elevators right next to the both sides of the bathrooms for the pool so that you are not tracking sand and all up thru the hotel hallways and into the main elevators...this was a good, smart choice to keep things more contained as far as sand etc. The atrium also has two pool tables, ping pong table (sons said their friends learned you need your own paddle and ball to play though? Im not sure?) as well as other fun arcade games...I had fun with the Lord of the Rings pin ball machine myself! (smile)* Outside of the atrium was a nice HUGE deck with hot tubs on each side (and gated so small children wouldnt get in or get hurt)....lines of chairs overlooking the beautiful palm trees and sand and beach. If you weren't too late being on the deck you'd get to hear the great music from just below where they had the outside area where you could be served food/drinks etc. After awhile it was really getting much easier to get to know which elevators went the easiest or what was more convenient for whatever our purpose was for going and coming. I was taken back on one of the elevators and all I do is laugh now....this is my problem/issue though, Im not great with heights and especially some reason not great with glass elevators...this wasnt too bad though and I actually used the elevator to help do my own therapy! HAHA! Since we were on the 5th floor (top floor) I used it to "come down" -- as going "up" was more difficult and gave me anxiety (dizzy)...ok stop laughing but true...but Im so proud of myself....as many times I needed to take one or the other kid back up or cool off or grab a bite to eat and need to go to the room from the beach or whatnot...that elevator has brought me back to my home feeling accomplished. Silly sounding I know but I "DID IT!" YAYYY! Thanks Princess Royale! You didnt realize you helped someone with a fear huh? TeeHee! :-) I now can go UP as well as go down with less dizziness. :-) I love the fact the hotel is also on the beach....everything is so convenient especially for families .....I know it would be costly but it would be nice to see ALL of Ocean City hotels possibly consider putting small restroom buildings outside -- just as they do down around 1st streets and so on....(so many buildings every few streets -- maybe right as you step on the sand to the side by the fence maybe? This would alleviate strolling into the hotel each time you have a young one that needs to go potty or perhaps yourself....BUT I do have to say Im very pleased that there are at least bathrooms in the atrium...or else I'd have to say it just wouldnt work. You can rent umbrellas, chairs, boogie boards etc till 5pm each day...they just come and pick them up. We just left our stuff out there except our bags with personal items we would bring back with us when we wanted to go swim or grab some quick lunch etc. We had a great stay....I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends....and yes the majority of workers there are foreign but I must say whoever hired these young people did a great job and I told my husband they must seriously put them through good customer service training because even if language might have been a slight barrier they were all VERY courteous, mannerable, polite and respectful not to mention making sure we had any toiletries needed at all times etc. I would be very proud if I were the one who hired them..they seem to be hard workers and do a very good job. Even the last day...leaving.....the hallways were actually filled with many of the maids and the carts etc...but like I told my husband...thats their job and dont WE want them to do their job? Certainly we do..or else....it'd be a quick dirty job and thats not how this place is ....our visit was clean and fun and we'll be coming back again!:)) Only one complaint -- if I had anything negative to say -- and that would have to be the hesitation I had for awhile on getting from the parking garage back to the hotel room and visa versa. The parking garage looks to be that it might have possibly been a hotel before(?) (I could be wrong)...nothing wrong with that but upon realizing you only had one option of getting back to the hotel was to use the "one hot, very slow" elevator back down to the ground level to cross the street to go thru lobby to get in elevator to go back up to the 5th floor for your room...and visa versa....BUT...its "doable"..... this was the only reason I gave 4 stars then 5. I would like to suggest (but not sure it's possible?) but maybe in the future(?)...there could at least be a walk-over of some sort, from one of the garage floors on over to the "inside of the hotel"...this might lessen "time" for awaiting elevator for others not to mention more convenient -- OR...at the very least/worst maybe install one more elevator in the garage(?) Thanks for your hospitality....we enjoyed our much needed family vacation! Will be back again:))) PS** I would really LOVE to know the exact name of the TempurPedic mattress you have as I would LOVE to get one for our home!!! My back has been aching ever since I got home but I slept so much better the 4 night at the Princess Royale!! :-) Feel free to email me this information if you could -- I would most appreciate it!!~Thank you!:))

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Room, Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: berns63
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this property on many websites. I was a little worried after booking based upon some of the comments but was more than impressed with this hotel. My wife and i brought our 8 month old son on our first family vacation. This was the perfect place as it was quiet in September and still warm on the beaches and in the ocean. The room was kept clean and the beds were fantastic. The front desk service was prompt and we had an amazing inside view of the pool and ocean. The inside rooms are great because you get the view without the crazy wind and extreme heat. We saw another couple that was staying next to us with another small child and did not hear a noise from the next room. The building and soundproofing must be decent. Due to a new home and dog, we are wating until 2009 to return and I was pleased to find out that entire hotel went smoke free. Good for them! I would highly recommend. We did run into a few issues with the cleaning people not responding to our requests for additional items even with a decent tip. Thefront desk accomadated our request quickly. The Bernsteins

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JohnFromEssex
Reviews.Content: Our overall vacation was great. The bedroom was very spacious but the living room, doubling as the sleeping area was on the small side. My kids loved the game area and the pool although the snack bar by the pool was closed on weekdays. Also the tiles around the pool was extremely slippery, we had a small wipe-out. The beach was located right outside of the hotel. The hotel décor was quite dated -maybe 80’s- although nice. The elevators had a dated feel as well and the garage elevator was painfully slow. For Ocean City the hotel was pretty nice, but the competition sets the bar low. I hope on returning to Ocean City again this season. I would not hesitate to stay here, assuming I don’t discover a better venue.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: beachboys3
Reviews.Content: Harrisburg Pa: Princess Royale-Great Stay! We stayed at the Princess Royale for five nights and I really have nothing negative to say. The rooms were nice. The new mattresses were great, housekeeping did a great job etc.... With the help of Martesha (not spelled correctly), we made our reservations and had a big spacious room. We even asked to stay an extra night and were moved to the first floor with no problem. The outside cabana and daily entertainment was great, the environment was that of being on an island vacation. I am not sure what other people are expecting, as most hotels are basically all the same. Same design, same decor, etc...The person that had to leave early because of a family emergency and could prove it, i felt should have been reimbusred, but other than that i cant believe anyone would write anything negative. I am a big customer service person and I really didnt see anything negative. Our bell captain from Jordan, was nice, the girl in the conveinance store was friendly, etc....Over the phone making reservations, no one except Martesha sounded friendly, but once we were there it was great. I dont think there is one hotel out there that is perfect and will meet every single persons expectations, but this one tried and they will keep on trying and they are interested in making changes to help make it the best hotel in Ocean City Md.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MissyBreonna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a joke. Apparently if you do not have your exact number of guests while making the reservation (even though it says 4 max) they can just give switch the room with the number of beds that you reserved and the hotel says that there is a disclaimer somewhere that says you are not guaranteed the room that you reserve AND paid for! Not sure why I would even make a reservation at that point! Then on top of that the girl at the front desk said there was NOTHING that could be done. Fortunately, I spoke with a manager that did help us, unfortunately it was a few hours later that we moved into the room that was originally reserved. Apparently the A/C was broken. I agree with previous reviews the hotel was not very clean, in fact I found a baby roach in my cooler which I left under the sink over night. Too bad, I really had high hopes for this hotel even though the reviews were not as great as they could have been.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice but the staff is not”
Reviews.Author: s62529
Reviews.Content: afternoon. Our room was ready early, a plus. However, when we entered our suite we noticed that it was not what we reserved. We reserved a room with two queen beds, and a view of the ocean. Our room had one king bed, and a view of the indoor pool. My traveling companion called the front desk and asked what happened. The man who answered said that there was some sort of electrical problem and that they moved us to a different room. My companion asked if the room rate was the same, and asked why no one had informed us of the change upon check in. We were not angry over the change, but were quite surprised. We thought we would be getting what we reserved. No one told us we would be getting a room with a different view or a different number of beds. Then man said yes the rate is the same but I will give you a discount for your trouble. We thought that was nice of him. However, he was apparently confused, uninformed, or had no authority to make the decision to give someone any kind of discount. When we went to check out on Wednesday morning, a young man quoted us a total bill. We asked if that reflected any kind of discount and the man behind the counter politely said no, and asked a female manager to assist him. This manager was less than polite. The problem was not what she said. The problem was how she said it. She looked at us and said, "I have no record of a call from your suite. Besides, I do not know why anyone would tell you that you could have a discount for that. We do not give discounts for that. You only have two people. Of course you would be moved to that room.” I could not believe the tone of voice she used with us. There was no "I'm sorry someone told you that, he must have been confused" or polite explanation of some sort of hotel policy. She was angry, impatient, and rude. She acted as if we had lied to her about what one of her co-workers had said. She also seemed to think that it should be obvious to us that we had to move because of the number of people we had staying in our room. I am an adult woman. The person I was traveling with is an adult woman. We are not in an intimate relationship. We did not wish to share a bed. Neither of us particularly felt like sleeping on a pull out sofa either. If I thought I would be sleeping on a sofa, I would have stayed somewhere cheaper than $275 a night. I will never stay at the Princess Royale again. It is not because I know it is quite possible that what I reserve is not what I will get. Problems happen and sometimes you have to move. I will not stay again for two reasons. The first reason is that we should have been informed of the change when we checked in, not discovered it for ourselves in a confused state. The second reason is how incredibly rude and unapologetic the female manager was upon our check out. I will also certainly tell everyone I know not to stay at the Princess Royale, unless of course my friends consider surprise room changes and nasty staff a neat traveling adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and fun”
Reviews.Author: sasiki1
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome, and when say awesome I mean that 11 people could fit in a 2 bedroom pretty comfortably. I decided to go here because I didn't want to be in the part of the beach where all the drunks were located, and easy enough to watch my 3 year old nephew. The jacuzzi's do get filled pretty quickly, and pool wasn't as big as they show it on the website. Rooms were clean, and beds were comfortable as a posturepedic can be. The only downfall was that we were far from beach food, but on the other hand we did have a kitchen. The price for this place is pretty high, but considering the time we went it was expected. Overall I enjoyed myself, and so did my family. I would totally go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: debmomto4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2 day stay at the Princess Royale Resort. We were not disappointed. Rooms were reasonably priced, clean and big. We were a big group 12 in all and both our rooms were nice and the mattress were soooo comfortable. After the first night did have to call about the mattress on the pull out couch but they took care of the problem with no problem. The staff was very nice and helpful. Check-in was a breeze both rooms were ready early. We were able to rent an umbrella and chairs on the beach with no problem. The full-size refrigerator was also very nice-a whole case of water fit in just fine. Not impressed with the breakfast there but there are other options walking distance away and the supermarket is across the street. Definitely will stay there again! Looking forward to next year and a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach35
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, but is well maintained and clean. The staff was extemely friendly and helpful. The beds were awesome, as well as the view. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Princess Royale”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Beach
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable two night stay at the Princess Royale. from the start, I enjoyed the garage parking although the garage elevator was a little slow, but it is so nice to park in the shade when the weather is 90 degrees and over! Checking in was simple. The rooms are very comfortable, spacious, AND clean, We had a room overlooking the pool and you could see the ocean through the very large floor to ceiling windows. I likrd having a kitchen in our suite. The deck overlooking the pool was nice and relaxing to enjoy your morning coffee and to read the paper. The beds were very comfortable. I worked out in the gym and give it a fair rating for the weights but the room was cooled down, towels were supplied and I only work out for an hour a day so it was sufficient. The food at the restaurat was great, especially the breakfast buffet. The pool was perfect to cool off in after a day on the beach, It is an indoor pool, so if it did rainm we had a safe place to have fun in without worrying about lightening. My 5 year old son especially enjoyed the pool. Getting to the beach was very convenient. All in all, I give it 4 out of 5 stars and I would most definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: brihar73
Reviews.Content: A lot of the negative reviews are based on parts of the hotel that haven't been remodeled yet. The part I stayed in was remodeled with no problems. The DreamSpa bed was the best part! The indoor pool is big and warm. The only bad parts I experienced include some of the not-so-friendly staff that barely spoke English and the entertainment section by the pool where only half of the machines were working (Probably a bad idea to mix electronics with humidity!). Overall, not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ttoothfary
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Large hotel. Large attached parking garage. good service. Great location. Great pool and activities. Great outdoor oceanfront tiki bar and lounge chairs. Large rooms a little outdated, but not a big deal. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but could use some minor adjustments..”
Reviews.Author: MBS25
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went on our annual girls only trip this June & decided to stay at the Princess Royale. The hotel was fabulous. We had a partial view suite, but the view was anything but partial. You could see the ocean & the beach perfectly. Our room had a living room, kitchenette, and bedroom, which was more than enough room for 4 people. The room was extremely clean & the maid even washed our cups in the sink for us. The towels & sheets were extremely clean & soft. The beds were temper-pedic mattresses which made me wish I had one at home! The downside was the pool, which was indoors. But, I understand why since the beach is literally right next to the hotel, barely any walking distance from door to sand. The bar near the beach was open with live music and one of the best strawberry daquiris I've ever had. Another problem was the people that worked there barely spoke english and couldn't count american money. The guy at the pool bar had to ask me how to make change and didn't know what a dime was. My friend asked for chapstick with SPF in it for the beach and the woman in the store didn't know what SPF was. Also, skip the breakfast in the hotel, it was awful. There are plenty of other places near the hotel that would offer better breakfast. I only ate there for breakfast so I am not sure how lunch/dinner was. It is also far from the main strip of bars/restaurants and extremely far from the boardwalk. Anywhere you want to go you must take a taxi. Taxis only cost about $15 each way, but still definitely not in the most convenient location. However, this did make the beach extremely peaceful since most of the college crowd stays near the boardwalk & motels over there. I didn't mind the $5 each of my girlfriends paid to get near the boardwalk for the serenity of the not-so-crowded beach. Overall I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Apes77
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 month old son and I just returned home yesterday after a 3 night stay at the Princess Royale. I gotta say, I was a bit hesitant after reading some of these reviews, but considering the price, the new renovations, and the fact that we like to be in this area, we went for it. I was really very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was very clean...from the lobby which had a very clean smell to the room itself. I should say I'm a bit OCD when it comes to hotel rooms and cleanliness. I really examine the toilets and shower before going near them, and no problems here. The best part is the convenience of the amenities, especially with a little one. We started everyday with the breakfast buffet at schooner's restaurant (very good and reasonably priced), had lunch each day at the cafe on the green which is very beautiful, and loved being able to buy milk and other things at the conveniece store in the lobby without being way overcharged. We had a room facing the pool/atrium area and you could see the ocean through the atrium windows, My son loved hanging out on the balcony and watching the action. We did not use the pool but it looked clean from where we were. Also the remodeling is very evident and they did a great job. Furniture looked new, the mattress was comfortable and the lcd tv in the bedroom was a nice touch. If i had to pick on something i would say the dishwashers need an upgrade (though i didn't have a need for one) and the bathtub faucet was a bit loose. The staff, who was knocked on here for communication problems, were very nice. You can tell they are mostly foreign students but they were sooo nice and helpful and we did not have any problems understanding them. I would take them anyday over snotty american kids i can understand clearly. :) Overall, good rates, clean, many conveniences for families... we will definitely will be back and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: kimbawildcat
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Princess Royale. The accommodations are great for families. They have a private bedroom, kitchen area and living room with pull out couch. The ocean front location is fantastic. There was live entertainment outside near the beach bar and a wonderful grassy area with tables and umbrellas for those who didn't want to venture on to the sand. The beach bar served food which was good and the frozen drinks were great. There were many families there but the facilities are so large, it didn't seem like anyone was there but us. Overall, it was a great experience and I would recommend the Princess Royale to anyone traveling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Globe_travel
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Princess Royale for 2nights/June 2008. It was 2adults and a 5yr old. We had a room that faced the indoor pool. The king bed was very very comfortable. The room had the balcony that faced the pool, small kitchenette with full size frig/stove top/small dishwasher/microwave/small table with 2 chairs. They had just installed flat screens in the bedroom area but also in the living area you have a chair with sofa and another tv. The only thing we were not crazy about was the resetaurant. We had 1 dinner there and 1 breakfast and they were just ok. Not great. We will come back to the hotel. Next time we will get the same room but on the ground floor so you have easier access to the pool but we wont be eating in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: missyolivia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few times with my relatives. We stayed about four different times, in 2002, 2004, 2005, and 2006. The hotel was in nice of some updating, but everything was clean. I see on their website they did some updating this year which is great! Our rooms were cleaned daily and the housekeeping staff was very helpful when we needed extra towels or blankets. The locations is perfect! You are right on the beach! The hotel was nice a quiet at night! Very relaxing! There is also a deck which overlooks the ocean its sooo nice! And there are two hottubs on the deck. There are also chairs so you can layout. The staff was alot of students from another country so there was a bit of a language barrier, but it was never a problem. They were all friendly and helpful! ( I give them props! ) Over all this is a good hotel, its a bit expensive BUT for the size of the rooms and what all comes in them its a good value! Me and my fiance are coming next week, its just the two of us so we are staying at a smaller place. But if we were coming with other people we would have def. stayed at the princess royale! I recommend this place for families!!! Next year if we come back down the beach with our family we will def. stay here! I look forward to seeing the updates!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good value!”
Reviews.Author: Fredneck
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for the first time last year, and I have to say we enjoyed our stay. Our room was always clean, we had fresh towels, and linens daily. Yes the decor was a little outdated, but overall in good repair. For a family staying here was a good investment as the kitchenette really helps with your budget!! We were able to have breakfast, and lunch in our room, and at night I got a break and we were able to go out to dinner everynight. The hotel is near good restaraunts, and shopping, better yet it is far away from the boardwalk, which is what we were looking for. The only complaint we had was that the staff was rude, during the summer months they hire exchange students, who were not helpful, with regards to questions or problems. Our A/C in the room was not working properly, but not one was able to assist. We have booked another stay for this year for a week, and are looking forward to getting away. I think the hotel has a lot to offer families. A little something for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: VideoWolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel charged each resident of each room $1.00 per day for the use of the in room safe, whether or not it was used. A large area of the parking lot was filled with dumpsters, reducing the parking area and distroying any view. Coffee was available for the rooms two cup pot, but you had to travel to the guest shop to get it. We were there as part of a group. No chairs were provided in the assembly rooms for those who wished to use them

Reviews.Title: “Quite a nice place!”
Reviews.Author: bobsz27
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Ocean City before, we picked the Princess Royale based upon reviews and it's pool. When we arrived, all was ready for us. The ocean front room was great and the Tempur-Pedic bed was quite comfortable. Since it was off season, we basically had the hotel/beach /pool to ourselves - very nice! The staff was great as well as the daily room cleanup. We'd go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “BAD-BAD-BAD-BAD”
Reviews.Author: ButchDundalkMd
Reviews.Content: On the weekend of March 8th,2008 my familty and I stayed here ! Never again. They didn't have face towels or wash clothes in the rooms (we had two rooms). the cups and glasses in the rooms were dirty and sticky. When we complained we were ignored .We were told there is no manager ,I don't take care of that. It was two days of misery I wrote the corparate office to explain and complain and even that has been ignored. For the money take some GOOD advice and go else where We had a miserable weekend

Reviews.Title: “A good value at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonbeam720
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Princess Royale from 9/14 - 9/17. It was bike week so it was a wonderful sight to see all the bikes parading around the area. Unfortunately it was after labor day so most of the shops at the board walk were empty. It was warm but not beach warm. It would have been better if we came during summer time. The area is lovely and we had fun exploring the board walk, outlet, and beach. The hotel room was decently priced and came with a living room area, kitchenette, and a large bedroom. Our balcony faced the indoor swimming pool so we kept smelling chlorine. However, we did enjoy the pool. We were quite satisfied for the price we paid at this hotel. The rooms were a little outdated along with the furniture but everything was in order and tidy. I wouldn't mind staying here again when we go during the summer months, though I expect we wouldn't find such a good deal because it's peak season.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every year”
Reviews.Author: trappi
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Princess Royale during Presidents' weekend for the past several years. We have stayed in the suites as well as the condos. We keep coming back because the overall experience is very enjoyable, and you have everything under one roof: pool, restaurant, bar, even a little gift shop as well as convenience and jewelry stores. Only thing missing is a spa for massages etc.! ;) The view of the ocean is absolutely breathtaking. A few years, the property was a little "off," meaning that we felt like things were rundown and the service was not up to par. We credited that with the fact that we were staying in the off-season. But it seems like the hotel has become much more popular during that weekend (and that may be due to conventions - I believe the boat show is that weekend too) and so we've seen an increase in the attentiveness of the staff, upkeep of the property, etc. It could also be a result of a change in management since we first started staying at the hotel. If so, great job!! One thing we're disappointed about is the outdoor hot tubs. Yes, we do like to get into them even in February! One year we had a most enjoyable soak in the hot water on a brilliantly sunny cold winter's day. But now the water is usually lukewarm (brrr) and the tubs are frequently occupied by children. The same is true for the indoor hot tub. I'd like to see management police that a little more. We have always enjoyed Schooners - especially the breakfast buffet! - and have made it a tradition to play pool and have a drink by the bar. During the weekend of our stay, my elderly mother celebrates her birthday which makes our stay even more special. We always stay in an oceanfront suite or condo because that's the reason we come to the beach - to see the ocean. I wouldn't want to stay in one of the pool view rooms, but that's just my preference. We are booked to stay this Presidents' weekend and are looking forward to it! We only wish we could have gotten one of the three-bedroom condos, but could only get a two-bedroom one this time. Keep up the good work, Princess Royale! And we'll keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Foriegn Students”
Reviews.Author: LeannR
Reviews.Content: I have enclosed the e-mail that I sent to the hotelIt reads as follows: Dear Staff and Management: First let me say how wonderful our stay was from the moment we walked up to the Front Desk and were greeted by Hamza until we checked out and Jan helped us with our bags. I can not Begin to tell you how nice everything there was. We had heard a lot of negative things about the hotel but were pleasantly surprised at the lovely hotel (could use a little decorating update) but over all wonderful. I am sorry it has taken me all summer to get around to writing to you to compliment you on your staff.I was impressed at how may exchange students you employed and made a trip to your Personnel office to congratulate you on your decision to use the foreign students. I wish more people in the US understood the program and what these students do. I spoke with your Personnel Director and she informed me about the hiring of the students and the whole process of events take place before the students even arrive. And the fat that you house your students is also wonderful. My husband and I really enjoyed talking to the students. I know I heard a lot of comments from other guest that they were having trouble understanding some of the employees. But I think if they realized that these students choose to leave their families and their cultures behind and come to a strange country alone to work for 3 months and that it cost them to even do this that may be just maybe they would be a little more understanding. And now for the most wonderful of all the people that I met there was Shreen. What a pure joy she was. My children loved her and begged to go to the sore on more then one occasion to play with her. It was hard for me to make them understand that she was working and couldn't play with them. We ran into her on the beach one morning and she spent an hour just playing with them and telling us about her country and family. What an Ambassador she would make and if everyone got a chance to talk to her I think the world would be a better place. What a truly wonderful young women. She says she is studying to biology and wants to be a teacher. I wish my kids yowled have her for a teacher. Your staff made our vacation a lovely one and I want them to know. I am just sorry that it took me so long to sit down and write this and I truly hope you will share it with them. Your Personnel staff and I believe Joanne said the Security Director should be commended on the staff they hired for you summer season. I hope that when we return next summer that some of the same students will be there but if not I look forward to meeting new ones and talking to them about their countries and culture. Thanks again for a wonderful vacation and we look forward to seeing you next June. Sincerely LeAnn Rayne

Reviews.Title: “cheap smelly princess”
Reviews.Author: elrae
Reviews.Content: Where to start ... the smell. The whole joint smells sickly sweet like a urinal cake ... or mildewy ... or like the pool. Rooms surround the pool in a fashion reminescent of a prison yard. Everything is dated pink, like frosting on a funky cake. They nickle and dime you to death ... want a little pack of coffee for your little coffee maker? Use your coupon for a free one -- the first day...buy the rest. Buy internet ...then it doesn't work. Want to buy a movie? Oops, that doesn't work. Now ....spend your time writing your long reply, mr. management. Read it, tripadvisor readers -- then stay elsewhere. This princess ain't royale.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great view, needs updating/renovation.”
Reviews.Author: Jeff2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at hotel for nearby conference. The staff was helpful and friendly. We are able to check in early without any problems (probably because off season). Stayed in an ocean front room, 2 beds and a sofa. The room was narrow but had full size refrigerator, stove, microwave and dish washer. The t.v. was only 20 inch in the bedroom. Unfortunately the pool water looked cloudy with a ring on the tile. The saunas needed replacement, they didn't heat up to the correct temperature because of age and leaks. They were turned off at lunch time one day. The spa/hot tubs outside had a considerable amount of bubbles/foam (which is not a good sign). The water was in need of changing, and the sides had a thick ring of film. The water didn't even look clean. The beach was great, as was the view from the room. The room required you to slide the room card in the wall to activate lights. Strange way to save energy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place!”
Reviews.Author: Ravishing9
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews on this hotel, I was almost ready to cancel my reservation. Thank goodness I didn't. I was traveling with my husband, two year old son, and my parents, so we wanted a three bedroom condo. No where in Ocean City could you find this for $199. a night with daily maid service. Then I came across the Pricess Royale. We like to travel the week of Labor Day since prices are cheaper. Upon our arrival, the bell staff immediatly came to our cars and quickly unloaded our bags. We had a lot since a two year old requires many toys. The bell man was friendly and very helpful. He waited patiently for about 10 minutes while my husband disconnected the DVD player from the car. I then checked in, where I was greeted by a young friendly girl with reddish hair who was more than happy to help me. I had advised her that we were having a crib delivered from a crib rental company. Some hotels don't like that, but they didn't mind. (my son is just to big for the pack and plays they offer)Later on when the crib was delivered, the bell staff even assisted the lady from the company bringing it up to our condo. When we arrived to our condo, which was HUGE, we were more than impressed. We had three huge bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a dining room, living room, full kitchen, huge ocean front balcony and a washer/dryer. Not to mention the huge jacuzzi in our master bedroom. Which did work nicely and didn't leak. The condo was clean and in full working order. Yes, the towels were mismatched in our condo, but since they were clean, we really didn't care. And yes, the furniture is old and the carpets are stained in areas, but that's really with any older hotel you stay in. The main thing was, everything was clean. The exchange students were all friendly and helpful,and yes, they did speak English. We even asked the young girl at the front desk if we could have our condo made up by 1pm, so my son can take a nap, and it was done. As it was everyday, usually by 11am. We didn't get an attitude or anything. While walking through the hotel, I don't recall an odor. But who knows. My parents ate at Schooners and enjoyed it. My husband and I ordered room service and it came quick and was good. The pool was great, my son loved it! Even when we checked out, the bell staff was there to help and the young girl at the front desk was friendly. We plan to come back again next year and stay in the 3 bedroom condo and would recommend it to anyone with a big family. For $199., you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great kitchen, horrible linens - passable for families”
Reviews.Author: NJNJperson
Reviews.Content: I was torn between rating this TERRIBLE, but finally decided on OKAY, but then after thinking of how disgusting some things were I went back to TERRIBLE. I noticed that this hotel has somebody monitoring and responding to all the negative comments here on trip advisor. If they spent just half that energy fixing our room and giving us clean linens, we'd give this place 4 or 5 stars. I'll start with the bad and then finish with the good stuff. ====Disgusting Linens - Unforgivable Lodging Sin=== When we pulled back the bed covers on both beds, we were literally stunned to see mismatched pillow covers, some gray, some white, some in a wretched off white. In all my travels, I had never seen such a thing. The sheets were wrinkled and not white. This pattern also carried over to the bathroom towels. Very odd and not very clean looking. I had a distinct feeling that things were crawling on that pillow. I thought i was psychological, but I couldn't stand it anymore, so I microwaved the pillows for 15 seconds....yes microwaved. After that I slept just fine. Now that I'm home and I've read another traveler's comments about bedbugs, I'm confident I that I was accurate in my assessment of the linens. ====Pool Linens- 20 thread count?==== If you have a strange curiosity to see what towels look like after 20 years of use, check out the linens at the pool side. After getting out of a cold pool, you're not greeted by soft lush towels. You instead get towels where all the soft cloth fiber has long since abandoned ship, leaving underlying thread base. It has all the sensory feel of low pile commercial office carpet. It literally takes 2 towels to dry off and I'm only 150 pounds, 5'8". ====General Facilities==== The hotel has a very old feel to it. The place must have looked fantastic 20 years ago, but this place has a distinctly old musty feel with a tinge of moldy odor.. When we got up into the room areas, my kids immediately asked "Why does it smell so bad up here?". My daughter occasionally took to walking the halls pinching her nose. ====Bathroom - Locker Room Quality Cleanliness==== Where do I start on this one? The floor tiles and tile grout were filthy and stained. Slightly more difficult areas of the bathroom to reach, i.e. sides & back of toilet, corners, were even dirtier. It was so dirty, it made your toes curl up in fear. The toilet seat had permanent scuff marks on them. ====Shower & Bath Follies==== When I pulled up on the tab to send water to the shower head, the entire bath spout pulled out of the wall! All in all, we were quite happy to escape a 5 day stay there without athlete's foot. The shower head "featured" one of those water saving spouts from the 1980's. Just to refresh your memory, these are the type that have the roar of a jet engine punctuated by the needling of your skin with a pressure washer. It was impossible for the kids to take a shower, because by the time the water reached them it misted into the air. Painful. None of us relished the end-of-the-day shower. ====Beach Access - Passable==== Any of the beachfront hotels have decent beach access. Unfortunately, you have to navigate a maze of hallways to get to the beach. When we finally found a shortcut, it got us down to beach level, but then required a strange ascent of stairs a traverse of the sun-deck and finally a flight of stairs back down to beach level. With kids, and beach gear, this felt like a thousand mile march each time to and from the beach. ====Minor Annoyances==== -The room had two televisions, but only one remote control. -Aside from one voucher for a free packet of coffee, this was an additional charge item. ====Other Room Comments==== If you look in upper corners of the room, there seems to be a history of mold and mildew. I couldn't be certain, but there was some funky colored stuff going on there. ====Pool - Passable==== Looks great in the pictures on the web, but beware that by 4pm, so much crap has made its way into the pool that you can't even see your feet. Even at 10am, your feet are barely visible. It's the kind of pool where you cringe each time you accidentally swallow water. ====Full Kitchen - Nice==== The full kitchen is great for families. It was the highlight of the hotel. It's sad to say, but that was the best feature of the place. -Full size microwave -Full size refrigerator -Electric stovetop -Garbage ====Minor Niceties==== The full size safe was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Letter sent to Princess Royale Hotel after our stay”
Reviews.Author: DCskadoodle
Reviews.Content: Here is a letter that I sent to the management of the Princess Royale after an offseason stay. If prior reviews are any indication, my closing argument seems particularly insightful. Dear Sir/Madam, During a recent getaway from the Baltimore-Washington area to Ocean City, Maryland, my fiancée and I decided to stay at the Princess Royale Hotel. This was not our first stay at your establishment, and previous trips to your hotel have produced at least moderate levels of satisfaction; simply put, your hotel is always a viable option for our weekend stays in Ocean City. However, with our most recent stay at your hotel, occurring on the 3rd weekend of January 2007; our experience was so unsatisfactory that, with the sheer number of other options for accommodation in Ocean City, we have more than likely booked our last room at the Princess Royale Hotel. Housekeepers aimlessly roamed the hallways at all hours of the day and night, speaking loudly amongst themselves, hardly the morning wake-up call we requested. In fact, they spent the better part of the morning coalesced right outside of our door, which seemed to serve as the proverbial "water cooler," where the gossip mill turned, but it is safe to say, no work was getting done. Later in the day, just when my fiancée and I settled down to a relaxing night of reading and conversation over coffees, the housekeeper's vacuums roared to life, piercing the evening's ambiance. Eleven at night is a completely ridiculous time to catch up on the chores, don't you think? A little respect for your paid customers would certainly be appreciated from time to time. Your Jacuzzi had about as many bubbles as a can of Sprite left in the hot sun for several days, turning the hot tub into a communal bath tub, with water warm and stagnant, a memorable experience to be sure, but by no means refreshing. Maybe if we had remembered to bring our candles and loofa pads, our time in the "hot tub" would have been more enjoyable. But for the purposes of this letter, you could almost see the urine rising to the surface. We enjoyed the company of hundreds of seemingly unaccompanied children wandering at high speeds throughout the hotel. While we certainly understand that large groups need a place to stay, the hotel should make clear to all adults who bring children that the hotel and its facilities are not their personal playground and that the adults will be held accountable for their children's failure to behave in a manor fitting a hotel that dares to call itself a "fantastic resort." A laundry list of other shortcomings in our stay at the Princess Royale could be attached, but I will include just these few: our toilet was in a constant "state of flush," requiring an equally constant "state of fill," the noise of the water ripping us from our gentle slumber as if the great falls of Niagara were upon us. The bathroom door left much to be desired, including such basic articles of "doorness" as a knob and lock. The elevators seemed to be in the same state of reluctant duty as the housekeepers, and hundreds of immature children with a lifelong zeal for mindless button-pushing didn't help matters much, either. When we left the room to venture into the pool, I am pretty sure it was winter. By the time the elevator landed on the pool level, a balmy spring thaw had set in. The games by the pool are supposed to be closed at 11pm, but along with the vacuum, they sang their merry electronic tunes long into the night, and of course were accompanied by the delighted screams of the children who had found new buttons to push. The Princess Royale was a fine hotel ten to fifteen years ago when I first came through your doors. In that time, your facilities have aged, the distinct smell of mustiness has permeated the place, and your hotel has generally taken a turn towards mediocrity. In a town with as many options as Ocean City, a hotel as slip-shod as yours is surely not long for this world. Sincerely, An Unhappy Couple

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper for a reason...”
Reviews.Author: citygirl310
Reviews.Content: I should have realized that the rate was reduced for a reason. This place is a dump. I woke up after my first night and had bites on my lower body from you've guessed it -- bed bugs. I complained and we were moved to another room. After being ate up, I had a hard time resting comfortably and ended up leaving 2 days early. The bed linens are the pits. The comforters and blankets were clearly soiled in both rooms. The sheets are green or brown versus white. All of the sheets had seen better days and had holes or spots that were attempted to be washed away but remained. The towels were brown and you just didn't get a sense of cleanliness. None of them had the sterile, freshly bleached smell that is comforting when staying away from home. A lamp or two in each room didnt work properly. The guest services line would go unanswered after several attempts to call. On Saturday, the hotel ran out of washclothes and didn't replenish room during room service. It took 2 c alls and 6-8 hours before washclothes finally made it up. How can you run out of washclothes during the busiest part of the season?! I had enough at this point and ended our stay and vacation early. This place is not a bargain -- spend the extra couple of dollars for better service, fresh linen and hopefully be pest free or at least having management be decent enough to not charge you for the night's inconvinience.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from a wonderful family vacation at Princess Royale!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyFamilyofFour
Reviews.Content: Last year (2006) was our first visit to Princess Royale and we loved it then. We just returned from our 8/07 5-night stay and I can tell you that our experience was excellent, AGAIN. Right from the moment we arrived, the front desk staff was very helpful in getting us checked in as quickly as possible -- even before the quoted 4pm time (we got lucky). Our Oceanfront Suite was exactly what we requested - upper floor, non-smoking. Now, the thing that's key here is that the non-smoking rooms smell fresh and clean and there's no trace of smoke. That's not the case in other resort hotels from my experience. We had great weather ! Avg temps high 80's and plenty of sunshine. Princess Royale has a great beach with the best waves for the kids to boogie board. We took advantage of the beach side "snack bar" for some Margaritas (very well done!). Even the bar staff is highly attentive. The rave review has to be for Schooners restaurant. Schooners at the Princess Royale has the best breakfast in Ocean City -- without a doubt. We always order off the menu rather than the buffet. My son loves their fluffy large stack of pancakes and my daughter is a fan of their Texas French Toast. Personally, my wife and I like their omelettes and eggs etc. With an avg cost of about $ 35 for 4 for a really nice breakfast, you have to try Schooners for the food -- and the service. The waitstaff are primarily exchange students and they are the nicest and most interesting people. We met a delightful waitress from Russia and I can tell you it's fascinating to speak with someone who is seeing our Country for the first time. Some of these students had never even seen an Ocean! (I like the fact that the Hotel gets involved in this program -- yes, they benefit however the Students do to. My read was that this is a win-win and as the customer, I benefit too.) Hotel parking was abundant. I managed to get the same spot in the garage the whole trip.
