Other places you MUST visit in Ocean City while staying at the Princess Royale include: - Ocean City Amusement Pier and Boardwalk. - Olive Tree Restaurant (for family Italian Food) - Lombardi's (across street) for best pizza in Ocean City - Atlantic Stand and Thrashers fries for a casual lite dinner. - JR's for bbq ribs and chicken (get the full rack !) We are going back next year, again! See you there.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not a premier hotel as was advertised by website”
Reviews.Author: SAMNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Ocean City Md and the Princess Royale Hotel. While we found the hotel be adequate there are several issues they need to address. First, no guest should have to request clean pillows. Ours we all stained and very very warn and flat. Second, the bedspread was also stained and was never replaced. Third, the bathtub showerhead was fine if you liked to be sand blasted every day. It was very old and had not been repaired in years. Fourth, our final night there we had no hot water. We paid plenty for a jacuzzi room and could not use it that night. Fifth, DO NOT be fooled by the video of their jacuzzi room. It seemed as though they just decided to pull the extra bed from the room and throw in a heart-shaped jacuzzi. We had to actually climb on the jacuzzi to get to the air conditioner controls! What a pain and how dangerous is that!!! Sixth, we found the font desk employees to be very unfriendly. While we realize they see hundreds of people in a season, it just seems to us that a friendly hello and enjoy your stay with us would be in order. Also, upon leaving they could not care less that you even were there. How about a friendly "how was your stay and hope to see you again" attitude. Maybe they need better training in the hotel industry. Now that we have said all that, let us tell you some things we did like. The Hotel is very convenient to the beach and has and very nice pool area. We did notice that they kept our room fairly clean and the grounds in general were maintained. The oceanfront view was nice and we enjoyed having a balcony were we could have our morning coffee and view the ocean also. Having a kitchenette was nice too. All in all, I would say if you stayed in one of their oceanfront king suites you would not be to disappointed but just be aware this is not a moden hotel and deperately needs a total up-grade. T&J From Up State NY

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: jfpb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day 5 night stay. Once again, we were really lucky that the weather cooperated and we spent most of our time on the beach. This year, we decided that since we found most of the food in the area to be lousy and overpriced, we would make use of the kitchen in our suite. It was great to get up eat some cereal and then find our perfect spot on the beach, all before 10am. It was even better to just run up to the room for a quick lunch. My hubby and kids mastered the microwave for their tv dinners. We ate dinner our first night at the Schooner Restaurant, we opted for the regular menu rather than the buffet. Dinner for 4 cost about $40, for hamburgers, fried shrimp and a philly cheesteak sandwich. The service was quick and the food was good. We even were able to make use of the bar in the hotel one evening. Again, the service was quick and friendly and the drinks were priced accordingly. The indoor pool was great, and all the games were working. The kids enjoyed the pool and ping pong tables. One complaint, the rooftop mini golf is no longer in use. I couldn't get a reason for this, no one seemed to know, but we wound up going to another place. Our rooms were very clean and well maintained. The towels could be updated to ensure that all sets matched. Again, a small complaint, since we usually take at least two showers on a beach vacation, it would have been nice to have two sets of towels. Since the hotel was at full capacity, it was a bit of a challenge to get all we needed, but the housekeeping staff always came through. We had a poolview room, and it was nice to have a balcony, though we didn't use it often since it was very small. Another nice feature offered by the hotel is the changing room. We always arrive in the early morning. Check in is not until at least 4pm, so we bring a beach bag with bathing suits and towels, change in the changing room, and then spend the day at the beach until our room is ready. In fact, this year our room was ready by 2:30 and we were having such a great time at the beach, we didn't check in until about 4! All in all, I find the staff to be very concered about their guests and making sure that all are happy and feel safe. We are already looking into putting together our stay for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz - But Not Bad - August 17-19, 2007”
Reviews.Author: ffamilyof4
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel out of sheer desperation while trying to find a place to stay for a trip planned on very short notice. It was extremely hard to find anywhere to stay in OC, but I did find an ocean front room at the Princess Royale. After booking (and within less than 7-days from arrival, meaning the deposit would have been non-refundable), I started reading the reviews here. Given how unfavorable many of the comments are, I was NERVOUS! I am a very picky traveler when it comes to where I stay, with cleanliness at the very top of the list of things I need out of a place in order to enjoy it. Based on what I was reading, I really didn't know what to expect. Our stay at the Princess Royale got off to a bit of a rocky start when we attempted to check in. The agent I booked with on the phone told me that check-in was at noon. But when we arrived at noon, we were told that check-in is not, and never has been anything but, 4:00. That is clearly posted in the lobby, so nobody could explain why anyone would have told me noon. They did offer the use of changing rooms so that we could get ready and go to the beach, which is what we would have been doing anyway. Not a huge deal. It would have just been nice to have known this ahead of time so that I could have packed one bag with our beach gear, rather than everyone having to dig through suitcases in the car to find this stuff. The other point of contention upon check-in was the availability of a non-smoking room. The agent who booked us did not ask a smoking preference (which should be a standard question, in my opinion), and in my desperation to just find a place at all, I didn't think to mention it. (That shouldn't be the responsibility of the guest, though.) We did think of it on the trip in, and asked at check-in. It turns out that we were indeed booked in a smoking room, but they offered to add an air purifer/ionizer, and open the balcony doors and ocean front screens to air it out while they prepared it for us. I was very doubtful about this making any difference as any non-smoker knows how smoke permeates EVERYTHING in a room, but I must say it worked to my satisfaction. In fact, we have stayed in "non-smoking" places that smelled of smoke more than this room did. The whole place is obviously not new, and while the appointments in the room were nothing to write home about, it was definitely clean. It's saying a lot when I say that, because I know I'm not the easiest to please when it comes to this stuff. Again, things are not new. The towels and linens did look tattered at times, but they were always clean. So not the luxury you might expect for the price you pay here, but at least it's clean! The one thing that IS nice enough to specifically mention is the wonderful bed! I see that a lot of other reviewers have mentioned the same thing, so I won't go into great detail, but the rave reviews the beds are getting are definitely warranted. The comfort of my sleep made up for a lot of small details that I found not so impressive. One other person did mention how LOUD the air conditioning unit right beside the bed is. This is TOTALLY true! I slept with cotton balls in my ears, which had all of us laughing hysterically, but it did help! The public areas of the hotel - aside from the front lobby - were not particularly spotless, but I don't really hold this against the place. That many people and that much sand and water would make keeping many of these areas totally clean a really ongoing battle. Housekeepers were always visible working everywhere, so I definitely don't think any shortcomings are from lack of effort. Small things could use more attention, though. For instance: Cleaning the fingerprints on the glass of the front doors, every hour if need be, would require very little effort and make a much more inviting entrance, and just a little more TLC when it comes to things like a coat of paint here or rubbing off a scuff mark there would make the huge difference. Then again, management might feel those things are not important if they stay full, at the going rate, with things exactly as they are. But attention to these details could make all the difference between me calling this an "OK" place, or a "really nice" place when recommending it to others or deciding whether to return myself. The hotel is on a nice stretch of beach, and the view from our room and balcony was great. The outdoor area near the beach (i.e. sundeck, lawn area, live entertainment, outdoor bar, etc.) made for a fun-feeling atmosphere. The drinks at the bar are EXPENSIVE and not very good, though! No complaints about the staff. They met our needs just fine, and most were friendly. The only thing about the place that we found flat out unappealing was the indoor pool/hot tub area. The water was an off color and very cloudy. I'm sure the person who writes back and defends the place when any negative comments are made will disagree with this, but that won't change the fact that it was very uninviting to us. I'm sure all of the sand that must get tracked into it has a lot to do with it, but it was sure nothing we cared to get into. The hot tub was even worse looking, but then again I'm not a fan of public ones in even the best kept places. I must say that both the pool and the hot tub were always full, so obviously a lot of people were not bothered by the appearance. I guess it's all in your tastes, but this just didn't look good to us. With the beach right outside, though, I can't imagine wanting to be in an indoor pool anyway! So while this is not by far the nicest place we've ever stayed, it was OK in all of the areas that mean the most to us on a trip like this. I can't say we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED THIS TIME”
Reviews.Author: summer0408
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this hotel. Needless to say, we will not ever return to the Princess Royale nor ever recommend this hotel to any of our family or friends. We booked our room in March 2007. We booked a 3 night stay for August 2007. If we booked our August stay in March, then we could use our 10% discount we received for being previous guests of the hotel. We did not realize that our room would be smaller by 10%. Our room was located behind the hotel's trash receptacle which was located in our living room. Therefore, our living room was quite small. Not our biggest problem though. We were not in the room often. Our biggest problem, was the room was not clean. The bathroom and kitchen floors were dirty. The sink in the bathroom was rust stained and the bath tub had cracks and rust. The bathroom towels were stained. When we opened the dresser drawers to put our clothes away, there were stains in them also so we just kept our clothes in our suitcase for our stay. I wrote a wonderful review last year, but this hotel has gone downhill within a year! Neither my husband nor I complained to anyone during our stay. We were only there for 3 nights with our young child and really did not want to waste our time. Upon checkout, I would have voiced my opinion, but was not asked how our stay was. I did mention to the bellhop that we were unsatisfied. He was the only one who asked when he came up to retrieve our luggage for check out. We were really disappointed this year and will not ever return.

Reviews.Title: “It's back!”
Reviews.Author: janehm
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our annual (since 1992) vacation in a one-bedroom suite at the Princess, and this 8-night stay restored our faith in the hotel. The huge difference was the quality of the international staff. In addition to being incredibly friendly and polite, their English comprehension was superb. Not once did they get a room service order (which we ordered every day) incorrect, and there were no struggles in making myself understood. This was also true of the housekeeping staff. Although their ability to *speak* English wasn't quite as good, their comprehension was fine. (We can't speak for the restaurant wait staff, as we don't eat there anymore. For some unknown reason, the room service menu is actually more varied than in the restaurant. It's always been that way. If you want a sandwich for dinner, you call room service or walk next door to Layton's Diner.) The Princess will no longer guarantee smoking rooms. However, I called the Friday before we arrived to ask if I could call on Monday as we were leaving to ask that they block us a smoking room. Martisha agreed, and although she wasn't available on Monday, Brandy blocked one for us a few hours before we arrived. As one of the 20% of Americans who still smoke, this was VERY much appreciated. Kudos to Martisha and Brandy. We encountered two minor problems during our stay: 1) no remote for the living room TV and, 2) toilet overflowed. They were resolved promptly and professionally. However, what really impressed us was their handling of my complaint about the mattress on the sofa bed. While you're never going to get a great mattress on any sofa bed, sometimes you get a really old, squished up one. In no time, housekeeping (or maintenance, not sure which dept.) brought in a much better replacement. They seemed to genuinely want to make me more comfortable and apologized for the bad mattress. The king mattress in the bedroom is amazing. The downside: The Princess needs a fair amount of cosmetic work in the rooms. We don't understand why the hotel doesn't do a few of what we think are less expensive upgrades, such as replacing all the mismatched towel sets, the creaky pedestal TV stands (from 1992) in the bedrooms, or the straight shower curtain rods with the outwardly curved ones that give the feeling of much more room in the shower. It's been a long time since we've seen a simple toaster in the kitchen area of our suite. I'd chalk that up to a potential fire hazard and having been banished for insurance reasons, but other suite hotels provide them. The last time I requested one, I was told that they're no longer available. Tech-wise, the hotel isn't exactly in the 21st century: 1) This is the first year we could access their hi-speed $10/day Internet, and the first screen you got was a huge warning notice about not warranting anything (including viruses and the ability to connect). Well, yeah, that's SOP in hotels . . . but it's another one of those things that makes the Princess look a bit cheesy For any guest who's stayed in other suite hotels, you know that (generally speaking) you're likely to pay a $10/day fee with no guarantee. Hotels that say it's free have actually built some-or-all of the fee into the room rate. But sheesh, this notice was over-the-top. As we still sub to AOL, we used dial-up. Not a great solution, but there's a minuscule connection fee for local calls, and this year my husband didn't have to do much business work while on vacation. 2) When they remodeled in 2003, they finally got new TVs, but then they kept the smaller-screen TVs in the bedroom. Unless you're propped up into a full sitting position, you can't see the TV from the bed. The cable system is great, but the TVs can't get channels above channel 58, AMC. That eliminates the very popular A&E and History Channels, plus a few more. Not sure why the hotel techs can't make adjustments to receive all channels, but I've been told by them that they can't. Needless to say, there's no ability to check (via the TV) your bill. 3) The telephones are ancient. The one in our living room didn't have the index printed on it, so we had to use the bedroom phone to call room service, etc. Having said all of the above, now that they once again have a terrific staff, the hotel gives you good value for your money. All the gadgets and cosmetics in the world don't compare with having a staff that goes out of its way to make your stay enjoyable. Honestly, we plan on staying there again next year. Instead of this being our last year and our swan song, we're looking forward to summer 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: Airbornewwiiol
Reviews.Content: Initially this was a three page review. My wife told me I should whittle it down because no one will care about the details. So here it is. 2007 Princess Royale - Class 101 . . . We made reservations for an ocean front, non-smoking, single king size with a pull-out couch, and a balcony. We also made it very clear it would be a late check-in.). It was at this point things started to go wrong. The reservation “specialist” cut her off and said “Oh yes, there will be someone here to check you in.” Well that was not the point, but apparently the point was lost on the reservation “specialist”. After a couple hours drive we arrived and as always, in the summer, the valet staff is mainly comprised eastern Europeans, and new for this year, kids from the Middle East which is great because it gives me a chance to talk to kids from across the pond which I always enjoy. However, waiting ten minutes for a valet to even acknowledge us was, to put it mildly, frustrating. Finally we got a valet, and after some finagling we got a bellman as well. While I supervised the unloading of the luggage my wife went to check in. Arriving at the front desk I find my wife trying to explain to the attendant that we had reserved a non-smoking room. He, however, is in the process of telling her the only room available is a smoking room on a smoking floor and that “reservations” are not guaranteed. That’s when I broke in. “Excuse me but you are you telling me reservations are not guaranteed?” He quickly corrected himself and said “Room Requests are not guaranteed”. Being baffled, I asked him what “a room request” actually was. Suddenly the desk clerk educated me on Princess Royale policy and I was told requesting a certain size bed (as in a king size), ocean front/ocean view, or smoking or non-smoking counted as a “simple request” and not a reservation. So there we are . . . begging the desk attending to fill our reservation. The desk manager came out and offered to help the attendant find us a non-smoking room. Oh, and if there is a corporate officer from the Princess Royale reading this, do everyone a favor and make sure your desk manager speaks fluent English okay thanks. It was at this point the manager told us again the only room they had was on a smoking floor, but that it was okay because it wouldn’t smell like smoke. They offered to give my wife a key to go “check out” the room. She took them up on that offer and came right back down stairs saying the whole floor was thick with smoke. This went on for at least a half hour, all the while the other attendants are checking people in and I am thinking . . .why don’t you tell them their reservation is not guaranteed and give us their room and let them deal with this crap. Finally they found us a king size bed in a non-smoking room. Unfortunately it was a pool view. “Fine” we said, “We’ll take it”. I didn’t realize haggling was part of the reservation process in Ocean City but apparently it is at the Princess Royale. We got our keys and headed upstairs. Upon arriving at our hole in the wall we found the room they stuck us in was at one corner of the pool with no balcony. We took the room because it was all they would give us so we went off to the elevators. Elevators at the Princess Royale are a big deal because they only have two for each side of the hotel and it takes forever to get one and once you do it is almost guaranteed to stop on every single floor on the way down. Not only that but the house keeping crew uses the same elevators as the guests so you’ll have to be prepared to move over when the cleaning crew gets on. Not a big deal but defiantly annoyance. Now on to the room, did I mention the lack of balcony? After taking the room we decided we wanted to switch hotels (go figure) and started looking through the phonebook and hitting the net to find one which was more family friendly (more on the family friendly aspect later). As I was on the phone my wife informed me that if we checked out at this point (fifteen minutes into the stay) they were going to charge us for the entire time we had reserved (sorry requested) anyway. Well crap, I guess we are stuck, so we tried to make ourselves at home. At about 10:30pm the phone rings. It’s a Princess Royale quality assurance person calling to make sure everything is all right. My wife took the call because I am sure she didn’t want me picking up that phone. She told her that everything was not fine and that we had major issues. The quality assurance person said in her best Russian accent “Oh.” After a few more “oh’s” the line went dead and we never head from the quality assurance people again. Off to the bathroom, ant infestation anyone? Mold by the toilet anyone? Cleaning crew staging in the hallway screaming at each other at 6:00am in the morning? Up until this point I have been giving you first hand information. Now let me relay some of the other things I heard while talking to others who were staying there at the same time. Smoke detectors going off in rooms multiple times in a single night. Water main breaks which flooded the seafood buffet and people not being refunded their money, and no air conditioning in several rooms. In the end I have to say, I do have some fond memories of the Princess Royale, but I will never ever EVER again stay there again. Finally, I will never recommend it to any of my coworkers, friends, or family. If you choose to stay there remember the Latin axiom . . . Caveat Emptor.

Reviews.Title: “If the staff at the front desk changed theirattitudeeverything would have been d”
Reviews.Author: StarfireXO
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Princess Royale for our one and only vacation of the year and it was a bomb! What started out as a pleasant stay except for uneven temperaturs in the suite(bedroom ice cold and living room hot,hot,hot) turned rapidly into a vacation from hell. A water main break on the middle of the second day with no AC lasted for 15 hours. With our Parentsi n their 80's we were quite concerned for their health and repeatedly asked the front desk when we would resume air conditionning and useof the water only to be told an hour or two over and over.Weasked ifwe could be placed somewhere elseaswe were worriedforour parents health and were told-"then just leave".The front desk was not willing to help or be politein any wayand actedasif it were our fault for the breakdown in water,air and electricity.It turned into15 hours which completely ruined one whole day and n trying to catch some sleep finally at 5am when everything came on,we missed the beach for the next day as well. What a fiasco.No showers and air conditionning for the entire time. We asked the front desk if they could do anthing for us and received a major attitude with an offer of 50% off of one day.We Most everyone else received a whole day off which is the least they could have done.lost . When we went back to ask for the same the front desk help copped a still bigger attitude and threatened to call the police.They were rude,unaccomodatinga nd downright obnoxious. We couldn't wait to leave and will never return. If they were smart they would have treated us with respecta nd empathy and we would have thanked them and returned over and over and told all of our friends to do the same.Itcould have been an easy fix-we weren't asking for our trip t o be free-just perhaps somenice words,an offer of another room for our parents to stay in until the air came back on.(even temporarily in another hotel asthis was a health hazzard for our parents.) The front desk manager refused to talk with us and the young woman who did talk with us did sowithout any heart at all.Rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Please think twice before you book a room at the Princess Royale. The front desk will ruin your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: traydiggs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and will be returning in July. It has always been clean and the staff was helpful. The pool was great for my little one, although a lot of the games didn't work at the time of my stay. The hotel does have a bit of a smell to it - not sure if it's from the pool - but I often find that most hotels do. Just bring along a travel candle for your room if you think it might bother you. The suites are nice and roomy and the kitchenette is nice to have, if only for the fridge! All in all, we have found our stays to be great here, in season and off season.

Reviews.Title: “Our Getaway..”
Reviews.Author: NicoleNDan
Reviews.Content: Overall the trip was pleasent, we enjoyed the hotub and indoor pool. Rooms were ok decor outdated had a decent ocean view. The heater/ac was very old and very loud when you were trying to sleep. By reading the other reviews this hotel is NOT that bad as they seem it to be. The front desk people were nice and not rude as some people have said. I would stay here again only in march or so where the room rates aren't crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: mrswaves
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel during a food show this week and found it very inviting and comfortable. The room had an ocean view, a kitchen, 2 televisions, and nice living room. The front desk was friendly and very polite. The bed was one of the nicest we've slept in (They are using the new Tempurpedic Dream Spa beds, only 4 hotels in Maryland are using them - anti-dust mite and great for people with allergies like me!). It's currently still off-season in Ocean City and the hotel was very peaceful and quiet. They have washers & dryers on some of the levels which is very convenient. I also like how they have little envelopes you can leave a tip in for your house keeper. We travel often and I hate leaving cash just siting around the room. The parking was plentiful as well. I've been going to Ocean City all my life and have stayed in every sort of motel/hotel available there. I say The Princess Royale is a very accommodating hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Dissappointment”
Reviews.Author: imoran
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to Va Beach from Northeast PA and deceided not to drive straight through,so we opted to stay at the Princess Royale. Since it was late(10:00 PM) Thursday in March, I expected to see reasonable rates. What I saw was a "range of rates" $59.00-$129.00 in the brochure. I was quoted $79.00 plus the usual tax and was told that the hotel was near capacity, and that they could not give me the $59.00 rate because there were no $59.00 rooms available!!! Judging from the emptiness of the parking lot, I figured there must be several missing Greyhound busses!!!! Judging from the "CLOSED" bar, I knew they were taking advantage of a late check in. Our family travels to Ocean City on vacation every other year, so we are not new to this hotel. We have eaten some fine meals in this hotel. and the pool/hot tub atmosphere is beyond compare The rooms were clean and the temperpedic mattress was a nice touch The next morning . I fought the crowds to the exercise room (lol). The hotel help was getting in his two miles on one of the few machines that worked. This staff better get off the treadmill and unblock the ptraps, fix the gym equipment, and be fair to the weary traveler, before the summer tourist season arrives, or this hotel will be further down on the Trip Advisor's list. BIG DISSAPPOINTMENT

Reviews.Title: “Staff very rude”
Reviews.Author: kahbe30
Reviews.Content: I just came back from there and it was awful!!!! It had an awful odor and was very dirty. I complained to management and they told me there was nothing they could do. I asked for a refund and they refused. I walked up to the room and went right back downstairs. I also booked a room for March 2007 prior to this trip. I called today to cancel the reservation and they told me there would a $20 administrative fee. I guess it takes a lot to push that button. I asked to have it waived due to the fact the reservation is over 2 months away and of course they refused. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. It is awful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lousy and filthy”
Reviews.Author: luv2too
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Premium Hotel I have ever stayed in. The front desk personnel were rude and unhelpful. We made our reservation in Dec of 2005 and requested a high level balcony room and they did not have it when we arrived. Which was 4:08pm and check-in is at 4:00pm. We had a jacuzzi in our room which we could not even get into because the jets were cruddy and moldy. We asked them to be cleaned - but that never happened. I do not recommend anyone to stay here. For the price (expensive) it is defineitly not worth it. There are a lot of hotels in OC please find somewhere else to stay it will be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Less than Accomodating...”
Reviews.Author: WorldTour'79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week for a work-related conference. I have had very positive experiences with this conference in the past, but the facility that it was held in this year almost ruined it for me. From the moment I arrived at the hotel, the staff acted as if they could care less about their jobs, and treated you the same. The furniture in the hotel is dated and stained, along with the carpet. Many of the lower floors (where the conference was held) smelled awful. Apparently a sewer pipe had burst a few weeks before. They tried to cover the smell with this awful citrus smelling stuff. One staff member, Bonnie I believe her name was, was very nice and attempted to help us when there was a booking error (not the fault of the hotel). After some time, she informed us that there were no available rooms to move into (meaning that people either had to share beds or sleep on the pull-out sofa). Yet, each night, the "Vacancy" sign was lit up outside. I will say that the TemperPedic mattresses made for the most comfortable hotel sleep ever. The cleaning staff were also friendly and prompt in bringing clean towels when requested. Basically, this is an old hotel, with old decor and old facilities. Keep that in mind when paying $200+ a night to stay here. Oh, and don't get fooled by all the mirrors in the place. It's really not as big as it looks...especially the "fitness room."

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: I am not sure whether I'd go back to this place or not. We spent a long weekend visiting relatives in the area, and booked it as a place to shower and sleep, period. It met those needs, period. We had no problems with the personnel, but we had no reason to make any special requests, either. The reservation was honored when we arrived, and the checkout folio was found under our door early on the morning of our checkout. The room was clean. The place had a musty/stuffy/fake air freshener smell, and I could not wait to get a breath of fresh air in the morning. I woke up every hour the second night and thought "I can't wait to get out of here". At 7 a.m., I said "everybody up!" The suite was a small living area with no windows, a peninsula counter as a table that would seat two, a galley kitchen near the bathroom, and a bedroom with one slider and two queen beds. The galley had a full refrigerator (a relatively small one), a two burner cooktop, a tiny dishwasher, a microwave, no oven. The decor of the whole place is dominated by dusty rose and glitz and mirrors, probably from the early 1980s. The balconies have resin chairs, the stacking kind that you can buy in a discount store or large supermarket for $10 each. The bedroom TV is visibly bolted to a metal stand. They have a notice in the bathroom that the towels (nothing luxurious) contain metal filament and an alarm will go off if you try to swipe them. The beach towels available in the pool area were the cheapest of cheap, and very well worn. The pool was cloudy. Not sandy; cloudy, to the extent that it impaired visibility at the bottom, and as if they need to adjust their chemicals or infuse a lot of fresh water. You are your own lifeguard, but in a properly lifeguarded pool, you don't let people swim if you can't see the bottom. The pool is surrounded on one side by coin-operated video game machines, so when you are in the pool, you look up and see the black backs of the machines. The elevator jolts and lurches a bit. They are situated on a nice stretch of beach. All we needed was a place to shower and sleep, so it met those very limited needs, but I did not find it enjoyable to be there and I would not relish a vacation there. Personal preferences and budgets vary greatly, but If you are accustomed to high end hotels, this certainly isn't one. Nor is it a solid business-class hotel, like a Marriott or a Sheraton. Nor is it a fresh, modern Hampton or Hilton Garden Inn. Ocean City is not a year-round vacation area. They have a few very busy months where I suppose they make most of their money from a semi-captive market -- the DC and Philadelphia area vacationers who want a reasonably short drive to a nice beach -- and the properties in that area seem to get away with very high rates and temporary help during that time. The rest of the year is very quiet there, and some properties are open, but I suppose the economics of trying to maintain a nice, updated property are limited when you don't have twelve months of solid bookings. They also seem to nickel and dime you -- a dollar for every phone call, and they wanted $18 to receive a ten page fax. I have noticed that their management seems to respond to every TripAdvisor review, and I guess it's nice that they're interested, but it also seems as if they want to argue with guests and have the last word in a forum where travelers are sharing personal opinions with other travelers. Not everybody can love every hotel. This one has a nice location and a tired, downmarket feel, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Princess Royale Ocean Front”
Reviews.Author: deedee3370
Reviews.Content: Just came back from OC for the Weekend. This hotel is just awful. I reserved an ocean front suite on an upper floor. They gave me a 1st floor unit. When I complained to the night Manager, he said that there was nothing he could do. He was very rude and unhelpful. The entire hotel smells like mildew. I complained Saturday morning to the day Manager, who once again said that there was nothing he could do. He proceeded to tell me that he had been in every room on the first floor and that I had a nice view. I told him I had a nice view if I like looking at a bush. The staff is very unfriendly. To get to our room, we had to take the elevator up to the 2nd floor, get off walk this winding corridor that zigzagged, to get on another elevator to go back down to the first floor. It took 15 minutes to get from the lobby to our room everytime we wanted to go somewhere. Now imagine doing this while carrying your luggage. This hotel is by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Do yourself a favor and not stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Terrible would be a compliment”
Reviews.Author: mderin
Reviews.Content: OK folks....just look at all of the reviews and then you will realize that this property is a definite NO GO. First, they charge 1st class prices and then give 4th class service. Couldn't get linens for the pullout until we called the front desk 4 times. We were awoke one morning at 6:00 AM to loud noises coming from the unit above . We called the front desk and they did NOTHING! Everything is extra at this dump (local phone calls, Internet access, $7.00 mixed drinks) Now I know why they constantly have vacancies. No outdoor pool and the indoor one is filthy. There are plenty of hotels in OC to stay at but this one should not be on your list! Adios Princess Royale!

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: LeightonNZ
Reviews.Content: We are overseas travellers living in the US for two years. We arrived in Ocean City without accommodation to stay one night. As the Princess Royale was noted as being popular we were able to secure a booking. We found the property to be dated, unclean and certainly not what you would expect for a three star property. The pool area was dirty, the lifts creaky, the noisy air conditioning unit positioned on the wall right next to your bed and apart from the front desk area which was tidy, the rest of the resort is shabby. You were even expected to leave a tip for the cleaner after paying a large rate for the nights stay. I would certainly not stay here on an extended holiday and was most disappointed. Needless to say we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good for first timers”
Reviews.Author: mrslafair
Reviews.Content: Our first family vacation was wonderful and the princess royale played a huge part. We arrived around 7:00 pm on friday 08/04/06. Check-in was smooth. The room was ready and clean. Since this was our first trip to OC we didn't know what to expect. while the hotel isn't the most modern in decor, the location and amenities are perfect for families with young children. We loved the indoor pool, our ocean view balcony and the fact that the beach is just steps away. The food was comparable in price to other eateries and having a restaurant on the premises made things easier for us. The sofa bed was old and HORRIBLE, but fortunately our children our young (5 yrs and 6months), so they bunk with us anyway. I loved the tempurpedic mattress and had been wanting to try one. All-in-all we were extremely pleased with our stay and can't wait to return. Hopefully the room furnishings will be updated when we do. Thanks to everyone for making our trip a blast!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: plucker001
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to write a review since most of the reviews I have read have been so negative and I had very low expectations of this hotel before my recent stay there. However, after just returning from a 4 night stay I must say that we had a great time and will definitely return again. We had a 2 bedroom condo in the North tower. It was clean, quiet, and had a fabulous oceanfront view. Everyone we encountered was friendly and courteous and we encountered noone who had problems speaking English. We did the breakfast buffet which was OK. We liked going to Layton's next door better. We also did the seafood buffet in the ballroom which was OK as well. My only minor complaint is that on the weekends there is a guy providing musical entertainment outside by the beach bar and the sound really carries especially when you have young children who are trying to nap. The Tempur-Pedic bed was wonderful. My husband who has a bad back loved it. We will probably be buying one soon.

Reviews.Title: “Arghhhhhhhhh!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that my family and I are accustomed to luxury hotels. Given the price of the Princess Royale, one would assume that it would be a pretty good hotel. We walked into the hotel, and had no problem with check-in. Little did we know what was waiting for us in our room: the strongest smell of mold and mildew. Ladies and gentlemen, this smell was strong enough to make your eyes WATER. Second, we booked a suite. Apparently a suite at this hotel was the equivalent of a standard room at any other. Its okay, we can put up with the room not being up to par. Thats perfectly fine. Originally, we had booked a one week stay at the hotel. The first night of our stay, a relative called to tell us that my grandmother had died. Ofcourse, we realized that we would have to cut the vacation short and go home as soon as possible. I went downstairs to inform the hotel staff that we would be checking out early because of an emergency situation. Keep in mind that I was grieving at this time, and did not need some one to be as rude to me as she was. She informed me that we could not check out the next day unless we agreed to pay for our full weekly stay. I went on to inform her that my grandmother had died and it would be impossible to stay. She was completley stoic, and offered absolutely no sympathy to our situation. She said, that in order for us to pay for only the night that we stayed at the hotel, we would have to bring in my grandma's death certificate. COME ON!!! We lived four hours away, and trust me, we would be very busy in the upcoming weeks with funeral arrangements as well as with dealing with the loss of a loved one. She requested the original copy of the death certificate as well. We go on a beach vacation every year and this experience is the reason we will NEVER come back to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for the past four summers as we get booked there with a convention we attend. The service and furnishings are deteriorating over time. This year for the first time we had extra guests who used the sofa bed -- be warned! -- it is awful!! The thinnest possible mattress. So uncomfortable. The room was only marginally clean when we arrived and was not cleaned well during our stay. Is it a hotel policy not to change sheets each day? I'm all for saving water and resources, but when the sheets are visibly not clean (we had kids with us) -- they should be changed!! The temperpedic bed wasn't that comfortable for me. The pool was filthy and the bottom was covered with sand. The sauna wasn't hot enough. When we called room service there was no answer. The dresser drawers were dirty inside. The whole place, including our room, smelled musty and moldy. Employees need more training in customer service -- not the worst I have ever experienced, but need some work. Now that there are so many nicer and newer hotels in Ocean City, we will likely opt for one of those instead.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Far Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awful!!! 1st bad experience - Restroom off lobby toilet was overflowing when we walked in. Told attendant at desk who did not understand more than the basics of English - after physically showing her, she ignored problem went back to check in. Toilet was not fixed until next day. Room was dirty, had not even been vacuumed for quite a while - lights did not work. Pool area was joke - broken ping pong table, broken air hockey, broken basketball net hanging over pool. Miniature golf course on roof was bigger joke - (7) 2" x 8" sandboxes with hole and there was a charge to play - there was, in fact, an extra charge for everything - towels for the pool; safe and bar even if they were not used . I read a review that said read back of contract carefully - very good advice. Almost everything was broken. We ordered pay-for-view and waited 2 hours before a maintenance man came to our room (he told us he was one of the few employee who spoke English) and said there was a problem with the connection. We were still charged and they refused to refund the money even though he confirmed we never received service. There was a huge communication/language problem. Apparently this is a Russian owned establishment. There was tolal disregard for the comfort of the guests. We booked online and the photos and description are completely misleading. Really wish we had the benefit of 1st person reviews like these.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Voltai
Reviews.Content: Allow me to clear up any misconceptions that you might have about this hotel. It's policy of dealing with customer complaints is atrocious to say the least. They have what is called the executive commitee. Which is a board composed of the hotel's general manager, it's comptroller and the administrative assistant Diane Anderson whose name appears here as a representative of the hotel. Don't let this hotel lie to you about who sees the complaints. It's simply that they don't care what we as customers think. If you have a problem, expect to be told no. Don't kid yourself that they will do anything else but that. Read the back of your confirmation letter very carefully as those rules will be applied without mercy. And if after speaking to a manager you cannot have your problem resolved....you will be given a business card with a fax number and an address. Feel free to write or fax, like I'll even get an answer What sort of barbarism is this? I don't want to stay at the hotel again, all I wanted was my money back. I'll go stay somewhere where I'm treated better and they actually care about customer service. For the price I paid it's over priced The only upside to the hotel, is the wonderful indoor pool and game area. The food from the restuarant was ok. But they really do need to hire more americans, I could barely understand any of the staff there due to their accents.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't have a problem”
Reviews.Author: randrea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Princess Royale over Easter weekend. I have to say I was alittle nervous after reading some of the horrible reviews it recieved. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms weren't bad at all. My only complaint was the sofa bed was horrible. My daughter and her girlfriend (13) were sleeping in there. It was so uncomfortable that we ended up just taking out the thin mattress and putting it right on the floor for them to sleep on. Luckily I brought a sleeping bag to put on top after hearing some reviews of the sofabed. I thought the staff was friendly. The breakfast was good, although it was pretty expensive. My kids loved the pool, spent most of their time in there. We all had a great time and for the money it was fine. I don't know if I'd stay there in-season when the rates go up though. If you're looking for a quick family getaway off-season, I would highly recommend it. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: TootieRed
Reviews.Content: I travel alot with business and have always stayed at the newer Holiday Inn but my company changed our travel booking company and it is no longer available as a choice. I stayed twice at this hotel and I do not think I will be back. I bet this was a nice place to visit in the 1980's as the decor is dated and "worn". Each time I had breakfast I experienced the same waitress who did not even act like she enjoyed her job. The last time we stayed it took an hour for breakfast from start to finish and it was not even busy. You get what you pay for in OC. Being from out of town, I find the whole City to be overpriced. Most people who travel to OC probably have not seen real beaches or 5 star hotels. Anyway to make this short, service was beyond average. Rooms were mediocre at best. The only thing that stands out are the beds. They have upgraded to the Temperpedics. I did enjoy them. Service levels do not have to be high at most of these hotels since almost all rooms everywhere are sold out during peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Took care of us”
Reviews.Author: TonyBBaldwin
Reviews.Content: We had our Easter weekend plans turned upside down by an unexpected and unfortunate event in our family. Without going into detail the management staff at the Princess went above and beyond to accommodate us. Thanks Diane Sincerely, A.J. Brown Baldwin MD

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst place I have stayed. Don't waste your money . It all looks good on the internet or in the front lobby , but the rooms are not worth the money. No coffee , small TV's in rooms, all the stores , pools, restaurants, closed during March. The lobbys smell like mildew. What a waste of money , should have stayed at the Holiday Inn. I tried to send in a letter of complaint only to hear BS. See for yourself all the other reviews !! Not too good !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel deterioated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a second time we stayed at Princess Royal. The first time was in 2003. We were disappointed, this time. 1. Our room was so so, not great, not that clean. 2. The carpet on the hall way faded, stinked. 3. The pool was not cleaned. The game equipments around the pool area were old. 4. Price was not cheap. The quality of the hotel drops. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Princess Royale in 1996.1997.2000,and 2006..I felt that the price was fine, but the room was not to the standards that it used to be.The lamp in both rooms were broken by the bed...I forgot to mention that we had relatives come with us that trip and we booked 3 rooms. The bathroom sink was cracked and stained. the kitchen chairs fabric was dirty... The dinning was very very slowwwwwww.......on a sun evening...it was a large party of 10 or 11 people... the lunch order was messed up the next day, however the grilling and pizza was fast and convient... the front desk was not friendly but the valet parking was good and so was the gift shop in the lobby . house keeping was also slowwwwww..... need to be at higher standard..In Aug. 2006 we returned to Ocean City...and stayed some where else...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location was great at the hotel and the views awsome. Room was a little small and dated. The food for lunch and dinner not so good(however, the breakfast buffet is great). We really wished there was an outdoor pool. Will not stay there again, because for the price I'm sure there are ones that offer better ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced -- Poor Service -- Unfriendly Staff -- Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my two adult daughters to the Princess Royale for a weekend shopping getaway. I made the reservations directly w/the front desk clerk and was never 'warned' that the hotel had 500 teenagers booked for a rock convention. Upon arrival we were greeted w/profanity and verbal sexual harassment in the Lobby and hallways! I inquired about the large number of teens and was told that our Oceanfront suite was "far from the group." This was a bold lie as they were ALL OVER! They were sitting in large groups in the hallways and stairwells playing cards, etc. It was impossible to use the elevator due to overcrowding and profanity used. I complained about their supervision, unsafe atmosphere, etc. to no avail. When I tried to transfer to a different hotel I was told I would NOT get any of my money back nor would they compensate me for all of the inconvenience and poor service. The morning Front Desk Manager even tried to embarrass me by speaking very loudly while groups of teens were standing nearby. It was a nightmare and I will NEVER go back!

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My trip started ok until I ordered from the hotel resturant. The food was prepared wrong and was terrible, we had called for carry out once they had our money they refused to refund or replace the food. When I reported it to the hotel manager the next morning, he had already spoken to the resturant manager, and sad it was our problem. That is no way to treat paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: Smoothtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nites, December 26-27, 2005, and paid $59 a nite. The one bdrm ocean view unit IS long and narrow, but that seems to be the norm in hotels these days. The beds were comfortable, but the bottom sheet wasn't fitted, and constantly came off. The full size fridge was nice. The angled balcony is quite small and just fits two chairs; it is not private. The pool was working; the hot tub had to be repaired that morning. I saw no bugs, and I was looking. I was not informed 'over the phone' of the $.99 safe fee, but it was clearly listed on the form I initialed at check in. (It was NOT brought to my attention, I just knew from Trip Advisor to look for it.) I've read most of the other reviews and my guess is they paid full inseason summer rates, or very high off season rates. The rates listed on the Royale's website shows the 1 bdrm ocv unit I stayed in rents for as high as $279 a nite, in season. Honestly, if I had paid that much, I would have been dissapointed in the balcony size, and for that kind of money, complimentary coffee/sugar/creamer should have been provided, one roll of papertowels and dish soap, a couple of bottled waters, and some high end shampoos and soaps---something to make one feel good about spending that kind of money in season. (Of course, they want you to purchase all that from their store.) And that, I think is the problem. The reviewers spend so much, and get so little as far as extras, they're quite disappointed. I also find it quite interesting to read management's response. It seems VERY defensive, which is telling. It defends itself after every bad reveiw, and basically, blames the guest for being unhappy. I would think that management would have been far better off "comping" the room and making happy customers, than arguing with an unhappy guest only to offer them 10% off a future stay. When I commented (at checkout) about the a/c unit in our room causing the carpet to get quite wet, the male check out person said "Oh, that shouldn't happen." He, however, didn't even apologise, and honestly, I felt Like he blamed me for the problem. (And no, I didn't complain or ask for compensation. We didn't even notice until the second nite, as the A/c unit is against the wall near the bed) The bottom line: the rooms are fine, but you will not get anything special for the price you're paying. And in season, this place is expensive-- but so is Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “No Rats, Mice, 80's Decor or Peeling Wallpaper, But...”
Reviews.Author: mark91178
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at the Princess Royale. I really hate to defend the place, but most of what people are saying is simply not true. We only stayed two nights, but we found no rats or mice anywhere. We did not find the decor outdated. Compared to most OC hotels this place is quite modern. There was no peeling wallpaper or delapadated rooms either. Our room was quite immaculate. There are employees here that speak with an accent, but none that we encountered had any trouble speaking english. If you consider an speaking with an accent not "english", perhaps you should get out more. However... Starting from the outside in: The parking garage is a fiasco; steep inclines and declines from level to level. If you're driving a low rider, or even a lower sportscar you won't get out of it from above the ground floor, you'll bottom out for sure. I nearly did. The spots are tiny, but that's to be expected in most hotel parking garages, no big deal. The lobby is great, sure it is of a slightly higher class than the rest of the hotel, but aren't most hotel lobbies? Now the real problems started. We were in a ground floor 100 level room (the reservation promised a room between levels 2 and 5, but i let i would let it slide as long as the room was nice). After scanning the room keys the person at the desk gave me directions to the room, but when i followed those directions i could not find it. You would think that you would be able to get to a ground floor room directly from the lobby. No such luck. There are signs on the walls, "To suites xxx-xxx", but they were little help. We're not stupid people either, as there were others there in the same situation. To get to 100 level rooms you have to take the main lobby elevator to the second floor, walk to the other end of the second floor and take that elevator back to the first level, THEN, you're there. After roaming the hallways for about 15 minutes we finally stumbled across our room...only to find the keys did not work. I wondered back in the direction we came and eventually found the lobby. The receptionist rescanned the keys and said she'd send security up to make sure we got in. Again, i wondered around looking for the room. When i finally found it the keys again did not work. The Security person was only a few minutes behind me and was able to open the door with his master key. He did something to the inside of door and was finally able to get the other keys working. The point is that this would not have been such a task had the room not been located in west-hell. If you go to this hotel, please, don't get a 100 level room, ESPECIALLY if someone in your party has mobility issues. The room itself was very nice, clean and decent sized. The room was a dual queen with kitchenette and sitting area, ground floor patio. I don't see this as a small room as someone else said. It is narrow, but deep. Looking in some of the other rooms when housekeeping was in, it looks like the king rooms have a bigger sitting area and a larger room overall. The hallway outside the room was a different story. I don't know if we were directly above the kitchen or what, but from when we arrived to when we left there was an overpowering smell that was hard to differentiate whether it was fish, or garbage. Atrium: If you're looking for a quiet, romantic vacation i wouldn't reccomend the Princess Royale. The pool area/atrium/game room is packed with kids. The pool is large, but very little room to enjoy it with all the kids playing basketball, throwing the football, etc. There is also a hot tub in the atrium, which was packed, and two saunas. There are two hottubs outside the atrium, one was in use and the other seemed to be shut down for the season. It's cool to have some sort of recreation in the hotel, but here is where they really need improvement. The games are dated and barely working, and at least two of them took our money. There are two pool tables that barely work, some balls wouldn't come out, playing 8-ball short one ball. At one point the table ate the cue ball and didn't return it for about 15 minutes. One of the cue sticks was broken at the end, could've lead to a nice splinter for someone. The ping-pong table was nice, everyone loves some ping-pong. The only problem was that you had to find your way to the lobby again to RENT the paddles and balls from the convenience store. It's only $2 to rent, but the attendant there will be sure to remind you to "Chase after the balls, if you lose one it's $1"...NICE. You'll also be asked whether you want to leave a drivers license or a $10 deposit for the "equipment", DOUBLE NICE! In our case, we checked the table to make sure it was empty before renting. We rented, only to find upon getting back to the atrium that someone was already on the table. It was already after 10 when we rented, with the atrium games closing at 11pm. It would have been nice if the lady told us that someone was already using the table. The pool/game area is definately one of the weak points of the hotel. Also, regarding the rooms that are advertised as "ocean-view/pool-view, view the ocean through the windows of our atrium"....not a chance. The atrium windows are constantly fogged from the humidity of the pool room, you'll never catch a glimpse of the ocean in there. I do agree with what one reviewer said of the feeling of being Nickeled and Dimed. You pay alot and don't get much in return. The convenience store was average priced, but it's a neccesity. There is a coffee maker in the room, but no complimentary coffee in the rooms, something you find even at 2 star hotels. You want coffee, you BUY @ 95 cents a cup from the store. There IS a 99 cent charge for the safe in each room, something i did read on the reciept, but something i had no code to, and something i never even even saw. It's ridiculous to charge for amenities in your hotel such as the ping-pong table...if it's listed on your website, offer it free. There was one small bottle of shampoo/conditioner in the room. Other hotels normally give you enough for your stay. You're kinda screwed if more than one person needs it to wash their hair. The vending machines are few and far between in the hotel, and are overpriced as most vending machines are. This again leads you to the "convenience" store if you need a snack or drink. There is a sign in the bathroom that tells you bath towels should not leave the room, towels are available in the atrium. We honestly expected to be charged for towel rentals when we got there. There is room service in the hotel, but there is an 18% gratuity fee, a X% other fee, and another X% fee if you order. I'm pretty sure this is standard in many hotels now, but i'd really like to have the option to stiff the guy if i get bad service. Alot of writing for a two-night trip...Overall I think the Con's outweigh the Pro's here. Sure, you get a nice hotel on a decent beach, but you really do feel as if you're being pressured to spend, spend, spend. Which could be understandable, it is a business after all. But never in my travels have a experienced that feeling the way I do here. Only if i were presented with an amazing special would I return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “October 2005 Bad Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write and let you know how very disappointed we were when we stayed at the Princess Royale in Ocean City, Maryland, October 26-30,2005. We had several issues about our room and when we checked out, the manager at the front desk was demeaning when we addressed our complaints. We arrived on Wednesday, October 26th about 4:00pm. We were told we had been upgraded to a suite, room 703. Upon entering the rooms, we were disappointed that we did not have a front sliding door view of the ocean, but a side view. We always pick a hotel with the slider on the front as we love waking up to the view of the ocean. We had asked for an ocean front, non-smoking room with our reservation. However, rather than go back to the front desk and complain, we decided we could live with this, even though it was not what we had asked for. We put our things away in the closet and drawers and then went out for supper. We were tired as we had a ten hour trip to get to Ocean City from North Carolina where we live. When we returned from supper we sat down to watch some TV and I said to my husband that I was going to put a little heat on as the room was chilly. When I turned the heat on nothing happened. My husband looked at the furnace in the closet and there was ice all over the coils, so we assumed the unit was froze up. We called the front desk and they said they had no one to repair the unit that night, but they could move us to another room. Because of the long day we had, we were not thrilled, but packed everything up from the closet, drawers and bathroom and were moved to room 803, which was a smoking room and was very dirty looking. Upon entering room 803, the heat was running at over 80 degrees, the carpet had spots on it and the kitchen floor was sticky. It was now about 9:30pm or so and again rather than complain that late at night, we were tired and wanted to get ready for bed, so decided to stay, but would talk to the front desk in the morning. The main bedroom corner wall where my husband slept that night was wet and smelled moldy. Thursday morning when we were leaving the hotel, we talked to the front desk about the room, that we were not happy, it was dirty, a smoking room, smelled moldy in the bedroom and would rather move back to 703 if they could get the heat fixed. We told them we were going to be out for the day and would check with them when we came back to see if room 703 heat was fixed. When we got back and stopped at the front desk, they said the heat was fixed and gave us new keys to move back to 703. So again, we went up to 803, packed up all our things and moved back to 703. When we got to the room the fan was running so we assumed the heat was working. Unpacked our things and went out for supper. Again upon returning around 7:30pm, I said the room doesn’t feel very warm. We looked at the thermostat and it hadn’t warmed up past the 65 it was on when we moved back to the room earlier. At this point we are getting quite annoyed. If they said the heat was fixed, they should have at least made sure it was working. We called the front desk and they again said they would move us to another room. They moved us to room 603. This also was a smoking room and smelled awful of smoke. The kitchen floor was definitely dirty and sticky. When you walked on it you shoes stuck each step you took. Called the front desk about the smell and they said they would send up someone to spray the room for the smell. When I went to take a shower we did not have hot water, it was barely lukewarm. At this point it is close to 9:00pm, so we decided to wait till morning to call the front desk, it was getting late and we did not want to have to sit and wait for someone to come and check the water. SO IN A LITTLE OVER 24 HOURS WE HAD MOVED FOUR TIMES AND STILL DID NOT HAVE AN ACCEPTABLE ROOM FOR WHAT WE WERE PAYING – NOT WHAT WE WERE LOOKING FOR IN A RELAXING GETAWAY. AND AS MENTIONED ABOVE TWO OF THE ROOMS WERE NOT CLEAN. Friday when we went out we left a note for the kitchen floor to be washed and they did do that. They checked the water and said there was nothing wrong with it, but it was never hot. On Saturday two of our granddaughters came down to stay overnight with us. When we woke Sunday morning to leave, the younger girl had ants in her bed. Now we are on the 6th floor, where did the ants come from? When we were checking out, we talked to the manager about our stay and asked for some kind of discount for all the inconveniences we had. He was very condescending and actually inferred that we we lying about the ants, even though our Daughter-in-Law brought the sheet down with the ants in it. His comment was ants don’t go on beds. He said this not only once, but twice. I asked him what he was saying, that we were lying and at that point he never answered me, so I can only assume that is exactly what he was saying, that we were lying. His comment to us on checking out is, that they took care of each item we complained about. My comments are that we had to put up with way too many inconveniences for the money we were paying. Again we asked for some kind of discount and he said no, that we had been upgraded already. But, that was the hotels choice, we never asked for an upgrade, we would have been happier in our original requested room, non-smoking, ocean front.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The 2BR Oceanfront was worth every penny + more! From the formal dining room to the 2 bathrooms to the fantastic private-balcony-ocean-view...we will be back. Oh, by the way, no mice!

Reviews.Title: “Suiites are really effeciencies - Rooms are cramped - Internet Extra $$”
Reviews.Author: SteveDvrcd
Reviews.Content: The room we had was a "pool view". A single King Size Bed and a pull out sofa. We called reservations and asked what the rooms looked like because the web sites virtual tour was not working. The gave a detailed description and said "all rooms are suites". I asked if the had Internet and the said, only "pool view rooms have internet". We arrived and I was shocked to see the room. It was very narrow, long and the kithchen was the smallest we'd ever seen. The stove was only 2 burners. Anyway, when I connected my laptop to their network, the Hotel proxy displayed a "service charge of $10 per day will be billed to my room" Pros: At least there are other hotels to choose from! Cons: Terrible parking and has only four handicap spots! Internet is not free and is $10 per day! Holds the world record for the slowest elevators! U shaped building with elevators only at the front makes it hard to access the beach. Our rooms was probably 9 X 25 "Ask them" Smallest kitchen ever!

Reviews.Title: “a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We too were nervous about our stay (Sept. 6-8) after reading such negative reviews. However, we were happily surprised. Check in was quick and easy. We reserved an oceanfront suite and were upgraded to an oceanfront, two bedroom condo. It was wonderful! The balcony and oceanview were tops! Yes, the furniture was a little worn and wallpaper peeling in some spots but the room was spacious and clean with no sign of mice, bugs, or droppings. The pool was large and a lot of fun for our two small children since it had shallow ends on both sides. Overall, a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “No mice or roaches. Did not hear a peep from the neighbors”
Reviews.Author: treki999
Reviews.Content: Reading previous reviews, I was paranoid about mice and bugs. As soon as I checked in, I checked the cabinets around corners and in drawers for mouse droppings. Found absolutely nothing. Thank goodness. Hopefully, any previous problems have been cleared up. I had a room overlooking the pool. The hotel room was nice. Two 20" cable TVs w/ remotes, armoire in the living room and dresser in the bedroom, large closet w/ safe. A balcony that two people can sit on IF you are given a room directly facing the ocean. I had room 535, but for other rooms on the side of the U only one person can sit on the balcony comfortably. The swimming pool was of good size. Outside on the hotel porch there were two jacuzzis. I have only two complaints about the hotel: 1. If you spend $ 200 a night, you should at least get a fitted bed sheet along w/ regular bed sheet. All I received was two regular bed sheets.; 2. The bathroom and kitchen are pretty dated i.e. 1980 feeling. Speed a little money on new counter tops and floor tile.

Reviews.Title: “A matter of opinion”
Reviews.Author: Sandyd77
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Princess Royale. I was concerned after reading the horror stories about the mice. I contacted the hotel and stated my concerns, regarding the mice and statements about mold. I advised the hotel I had allergies and would have to cancel if I could not receive reassurance. They promptly responded to my e-mail and provided me with contact names. They were very responsive. When I arrived - the filter had just had been changed in my room a/c. That was a nice touch. Customer service at the front desk, bellhop and housekeeping was very good. My suite was clean, although the furniture, etc. is in serious need of replacement. Of course, this is a very heavily used resort and let's be realistic - it is the end of the season. Hopefully - they will do some repairs and remodeling during the winter. I do think the prices are a bit high for the quality of the surroundings. I also was very disappointed to find out that high-speed internet access was no longer available in all suites (as it has been when I stayed in the past). There was no indication of this until I tried to connect. I then found out they have changed to wireless and it is not available in oceanfront suites - only in poolside suites, in the atrium and the front lobby - cost of $9.95 per day. I left a day early because I needed to connect for business reasons and going to the atrium was no always convenient for me and the weather was not all that great. I do think the mousescapades are exaggerated and I also think the staff is trying to show more customer focus. There is only one great hotel in OC and it had no vacancies. Princess Royale has potential - give it a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible? That's an understatement.”
Reviews.Author: facciabella
Reviews.Content: I am presently at this hotel. It is nasty, dirty and smelly. At present, my room smells like something has died in it. I went to the front desk and compalined and they offered to send housekeeping with some air freshener. So what, they want to try to cover up the dead rat smell rather than take care of the problem? Yesterday, I spoke to the manager Ruby, aka Ms. Personality. I told her that I was dissatisfied with the room. It was nonmaintained, filthy, the quality of the furniture is disgusting. She said the price we paid for the room, $249, was already a discount, and would do nothing for us. The furniture is so disgusting I don't even want to sit on it. The staff members I spoke to were lovely, but unfortunately, they are stressed because they have to go through Atilla the Hun. Don't let the gorgeous lobby fool you. They put money into that, and did nothing for the rooms! This is a one star hotel at a four star price! And I feel bad for the one star hotels when I say that. I'm sure Motel 6 is better maintained than the Princess Royale. At least there they leave the light on for you. If Ruby were to do that for you, she'd charge you $100 and yell at you for not being grateful. Wonder if she's going to charge me extra for the dead animal smell?

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel should mention it has Wildlife”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at the hotel. Some major changes will probably never make me book again. Hotel desk people were rude and unhelpful. When asked to speak to the Manager he is always busy or not at the hotel. There is a language barrier now. I felt I was back in Moscow. The staff have a hard time hearing complaints let alone helping you if they don't speak English. I felt I was in a foreign country. The halls were never really cold like a hotel should be. It smelled musty and dank. Food that was delivered to the rooms, and finished were left in a pile for hours by the candy machines smelling up the whole hallway. The room was full of cigar smoke when we arrived and had to be aired out for hours. The sight of towels hanging of the terraces reminded me of the old country, very tacky. The air conditioning was noisey and very hard to regulate and at time made the room smell worse. The Atrium was nice except for the evening hours when the mice would run by the rooms. You would always know when that happens because you would hear screaming and the rustling of the metal chairs scattering. that to me was the worst the hotel had to offer and could possibly be the cause of disease, especially to all the kids walking bare footed. Everytime I went downstairs by the desk, someone is always arguing with the hotel desk people with ligitimate gripes, and there are plenty, but they don't care and seemed very rude. This hotel doesn't know the meaning of customer service. This is hotel has compromised its reputation. I would not recommended this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mickey & Minnie -- Stay Away !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay Away, Mice all over the place. Rooms are dirty and the non smoking room requested, spelled like a bar. Hotel staff were rude to my complaints. If you like mouses go to Disney Land !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deffinitely not elegant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was deffinitely not worth the money. Hotel service was very rude and could not speak english very well. Also, the rooms were dirty, liveable but dirty. The bathroom was especally the worst part of it all. Also, they say this is a newly renovated hotel...but then why does all the furniture and decorations look like they are from the 70s? Another complaint that i have about the room is that the balcony only holds one person, it was so tiny. If you need to use the internet then you have to go down to the pool area. They say that all the rooms have access, but only some of the rooms do and it cost $10 a day. As you probably have read from other reviews the elevators take so long. When I first read that before going to the hotel I just thought people were being picky but I didnt realize they had chairs located by the elevators for your long wait. Once you get on the elevator you are overcome by an annoying voice telling you how great the hotel is and of course who could forget about their annoying and cheesy theme song. Oh by the way...I wouldnt trust the glass elevator in my own oppion, it looked very old and delapitadated. If you decided to go out at night then make sure you come back to the hotel early because there isnt enough parking. It took me a half hour to find a parking space. If you are planing to go during the summer months please keep in mind...that the boardwalk and other attractions are not minutes away like they advertise..in fact 1hour! This hotel is diffently not a resort by any means. They have pool..correct. Although it seemed small for the amount of people, cold, and dirty. Didnt use the sauna in fear of catching a disease. The hot tubs were always taken and Full of sand. As for the other attractions such as the minture golf course dont even waste your time going all the way up to the roof because its pretty much destroyed and vacant. This also includes the tennis courts and the video games are usually out of order. The "Cafe on the green" highly priced..but i guess that is to be expected with any hotel. The green well thats grass and mud with plastic lawn chairs on them. They did have a person singing though that was pretty nice. Although the same person came back the next day singing the same old songs. When you leave for check out make sure you look at your bill closely because i got charged with someone's $48 lunch...although after i got home i called and they took care of the whole ordeal. I didnt even want to go the the buffet because the byt the time i got there i was sick from the smelly hallway and deicded to eat outside of the hotel. Well i guess you can tell i was not at all happy with this hotel and deffinitely for the price. Not only was i unpleased but many of the other guest you could here complaining from.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ocean, hated the hotel”
Reviews.Author: gogbgo
Reviews.Content: My parents booked an 8 night trip to Ocean City at the Princess Royale. We knew what we were in for and were well aware it wasn't the most upper class hotel, but we did not expect things to start off badly within the first 10 minutes. We had clearly requested a non smoking room and were not only put in a smoking room, but our whole floor was smoking rooms. When my mom called the front desk trying to switch out, explaining how sensitive we all are to smoke, they told my mom there were no rooms available and the hotel was completely booked. The next morning we noticed that the room right beside us was non smoking and that no one was staying in it. My mom called the front desk and told them that we were switching. The man told my mom that we couldn't because the family that was checking in that afternoon had clearly requested a non smoking room, even though he had told us they didn't honour requests. The staff at the princess royale were so rude we couldn't believe it. The manager, Ruby, refused to talk to my mom, lied to her, and even walked away from the desk and into her office.
