Once, while my family was eating lunch, a man that worked at the pool came to our table and started yelling at my dad because he took pool towels. He even called him a liar! The trip wasnt everthing that we had planned but we were trying to make the best out of it, which was really hard with all the un welcoming staff. I've stayed at tons of hotels and never had I seen this..there was not ONE helpful staff, they didn't care at all. Aside from all of that, the beach was beautiful! That was what kept us from leaving. I suggest you buy cheap beach towels and chairs though. We rented about 5 towels, 2 umbrellas and 5 chairs a day, which costed 60$! It was a shame because the guys from the rental take everything away at 5, which is usually our favourite time of the day. The city is extremely busy and not the classiest. We couldn't find many places to dine in the evenings except for 2 great places. I recommend Fresco's and the Tokyo Steakhouse, unless you like all you can eat buffets. If you're planning a trip to Ocean City, check the Clarion or the Holiday Inn. I don't suggest going to Princess Royale, it was worn down and the staff were horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: elbojbb
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, not exceptional, but appealing. Rooms were well appointed, but showing signs of wear even though the place was supposedly recently rennovated. My primary complaint was the pre-disposition to nickle & dime guests already paying $200+/night. $0.95 - Local and toll free phone calls/each $9.95 - Wireless access/day $0.99 - Daily safe rental $9.99 - In-room movies/each $0.53 - Local paper $5.00 - Beach towel $6.00 - Beach chair $15.00 - Umbrella $1.75 - Bevarage refills By the time you leave, you'll amass quite a bill. I'd recommend somewhere off the beach, and save a chunk of change.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. My husband had trouble with his room key and was sent back 3 times, each time told that it would work. Eventually he had to wake me up to let him in and I happened to not be feeling well, so this was a BIG imposition. The large indoor pool inside the atrium was nice and my son and his friend enjoyed it, but they had a hard time elbowing their way into several of the other poolside games that were available to guests. Some of the guests could have used etiquette lessons. There was a showerhead conveniently placed at the entrance of the pool area, presumably so beach bathers could de-sand themselves without contaminating the pool area. Unfortunately, many of the guests appeared to be in need of remediation for this rather mundane task, as there was wet sand streaked way into the pool area. If you wanted to avoid the sand, you'd have to be sure you kept your sandals on, even around the pool! The pool area could have been better maintained, too. We arrived at the end of the day and had to remove used wet towels left behind by lazy pool swimmers, and drinks with cigarette butts floating in them, too. The towels provided by the pool staff were near sandpaper quality, which explains why so many who stay here bring their own. Speaking of towels, many of the guests hung their own wet towels on the railings of their very tiny balconies, making the atrium a real eye-sore. In spite of a sticker on the sliding glass door that led to each balcony clearly asking all hotel guests to refrain from such practice, this was not enforced, so the result was a slum-like setting. Yuck! The balconies were just slivers of real-estate. Enough for two resin chairs and one small round resin table. Not enough for humans to sit in them, so the balcony never got used. Lousy view of other peoples' towels, anyway. The hotel hallways were NOT air-conditioned which made it feel like a sauna every time you got off of the elevator. This may not seem like a big deal, but the heat was oppressive. There was a lot of self-promotion throughout the hotel, too. The elevators even had a small screen advertising the hotel restaurant's happy hour, etc. The rooms: Although the bedroom was big, we could have done with a much larger TV screen. We had a king-size mattress which was great, but it wasn't very comfortable. Even worse was the pull-out sofa that my son and his friend shared. It really could have used a much better quality mattress. Housekeeping could make more of an effort to clean around the beds, too. When my husband moved the bed a tad to plug in our phone charger, we discovered discarded Trojan wrappers, hair clips, etc. from previous guests. The bathrooms were adequate, although my husband had to tweak the showerhead to get the water to come out in a full stream. Originally, we were getting just the tiniest trickle. The towels were not very plush but were restocked by housekeeping, which is the least you should expect. There was also what I believe was supposed to be a laundry line in our bathroom -- a clothing line that was supposed to stretch across from one side of the tub to the other and actually clip on to the opposite side. A great idea for drying wet bathing suits, if only ours hadn't been a foot too short for the task. It was really very funny, but totally in keeping with how shoddy the rest of the hotel appeared to be. There is a safe in each room and you get charged .99/day whether you use it or not, which I though was laughable. The suite's air conditioning condenser unit was in the bedroom, very close to the bed. It was extremely noisy and took a lot of getting used to in order to fall asleep. According to one other guest we spoke to, this hotel is supposed to be among the nicest, but that's not saying much since many of them seemed rather seedy. The next time we vacation in this area, we'll stay farther north away from the commercial strip. That was probably our mistake. Condominiums, hotels, etc. farther north with beaches just as beautiful seemed much more tasteful and to our liking. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone accustomed to luxury. This hotel charged MUCH more than Embassy Suites and couldn't begin to compete with it. I have to believe that there were other hotels in the surrounding area, on par with this one, but for less money. Major disappointment....

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: oc dude
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the hotel with my wife and 5 year old son.We were pleasantly surprised with how great our experience was.The pool area was spectacular and very clean my son just loved it as we did too.Everyone at the hotel was pretty friendy and helpful.We enjoyed the room alot,the bedroom was very big and the bed was sooo comfortable.The close proximity of the beach was also a definite plus.The outside cafes were a great idea, great to be able to catch a quick bite and get right back to the beach. Seems to be a really family oriented place,alot of kids seemed really happy to be there with their parents. The Princess was a great time and i highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for something special.

Reviews.Title: “Was Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Ocean city usually every year and this was my first time staying in a hotel instead of beach house. Didnt really know where to stay and researching online the Princess seemed or "claimed" to be one of the nicest beach resorts. We stayed in an oceanview suite on the 5th floor. The room was average. The bathrooms were very old and outdated and the beds contained no mattress pads. The sheets just layed over top of the bed. Since Im a 25 year College grad and former Fraternity member, it wouldnt have been a problem, but something with spending $259 a night just doesnt jive. I also was not impressed with the spell of puke in the hallways. If I wanted to stay at a fraternity house, I would have went 3 years back in time. My biggest complaint was the parking. The parking garage was too small to accomadate all the guest staying there. On saturday night, during heavy rain and lighting I returned to the hotel to find no parking. I parked out front and asked the night manager for suggestions. I Could barely understand him because he was foreign. I addressed the issue and he told me "There is nothing I can do, You'll have find something somewhere else!" Unbelievable. the best part was that there were two workers chatting with him up front at the time and snickering. I felt like I was interupting their conversation. What a joke! Bottom line. Ocean city is still a good time but Princess Royale Resort is not all its cracked up to be.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel from july 17th to the 21st,at first like other people i was concerned about some of the other reviews,but don't be! We stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the pool,this was great for our 2 kids who had a great time playing in the clean pool,or playing arcade games or playing pool. Our room was clean, and although not the biggest I have ever seen, it was big enough, our maid service was always there when we needed them,and our room was cleaned every night(including our dirty dishes that were left in the sink by our kids) Having the beach just steps outside the pool area was GREAT!!, we were used to walking a mile to get to the beach in Wildwood. The hotel has restaurants on the first floor in case you want to eat in. The only thing I could complain about was the shower head was loud and would shoot water everywhere,also to fit under the shower you better be 5ft or smaller(we did not call the front desk on this,we just lived with it). All in all it was great, my wife who is very picky is already making plans for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: Zeldie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Princess Royale. When reserving the room we requested an oceanfront. We had no difficulty with check-in (at 5:00). Found a bellhop pretty quickly to help move baggage up to our room. The room was clean with 2 queen size beds and a pull-out sofa (which we never used, but the bedding was in the closet). Rooms were cleaned every day with new towels. Soap was in short supply by the end of the week. Basic utensils, pots, and plates were available in the suites. Coffee pot is a 4-cup and you need to bring your own liners. Fridge with ice maker was great as we had ice each day for our cooler. The atrium was nice with the indoor pool and lots of seating both around the pool and in the atrium area. Outdoor and indoor hot tubs did not look the cleanest. We got pizza the first night and ate in the atrium which we saw several other families do throughout the week. The indoor pool was open every day and was great for both the cloudy days and evenings when the kids wanted to swim after dinner. It also had a basketball net at one end of the pool which was great for the older kids. Towels were sometimes in short supply and didn't do a great job of drying, but it was nice not to have to bring our own. A small arcade was also available in the pool area consisting of 1 ping pong table, 2 pool tables and several video games with a change machine. Most of the video games were not working the last several days of our stay. Elevators were sometimes hard to get during check-out times, but were also clean. A tennis court, deck tennis and miniature golf were also available on the roof for a $2/hour fee. Had breakfast 2 mornings at the Schooners buffet. Food was good for a buffet. Basic variety of scrambled eggs, pancakes, french toast. Cereal was also available as well as some fresh fruit. Coffee was somewhat bitter both days. Never had supper at the hotel. There is also a comedy club on the premises which we never saw. Beach access was right outside the hotel. Beach was cleaned each night by the town so it was always clean. Umbrella and chair rentals were also available at the beach access by a private vendor. Food was available at both the beach and pool areas. We only purchased large pretzels so can't comment on the food quality there. Check-out was also very quick and easy. No line, found bell-hop to take baggage out and they had the bill very quickly. Overall the Princess Royale was a good place for our family to stay for a week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Princess and had a terrific time. I usually stay at the Holiday Inn Suites on 17th street. (Which might be the best hotel in OC) but they were booked.I read some of the few bad reviews about this place so I was a little worried about going there. But I have to say everything was perfect. Had a room on the 4th floor, pool view because I have 3 kids. Room was comfortable and clean which to me is the most important thing. Cleaning service was great, would have been better if I spoke Rusian but asking for extra towels is the same in any language. Staff was very helpful and kind. Location is perfect and I loved the burgers at the beach side bar. 2 negatives: 1. Small balcony over looking the pool. It fits , at most, 2 adults on slim fast. 2. Charging 99 cents for the Mr. Coffee packs is just a bad managing decision. Paying $300 a night should get you free morning coffee. Stay here.... You love it. Buy your coffee at Laytons acroos the street. Just for principal....

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this resort, and we had a great stay! The Customer Service was excellent - they even called our room on our first night to confirm that everything was OK! This was something that we have never experienced at other hotels, and we were very impressed. The rooms were large and very clean - the housekeeping staff did a fantastic job the entire time that we were there. I read some of the previous reviews the day before that we were leaving, and was a little nervous about my choice, but we had an awesome time, and would definitely recommend this resort to anyone that is considering it!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh What a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bellanoches
Reviews.Content: We visited The Princess Royale and had an Ocean front suite on the fifth floor. Day one. We get in the room only to find a closet door leaning up against the wall. The maintenance man commented that the cleaning lady should have reported that. He fixed it immediately, but it kept coming off the track so it remain against the wall. One teaspoon and only four towels for a family of five. They however fixed that problem. Day two. No cleaning services at all. I was not a happy camper. Even when I called in the morning for fresh towels and told them what had happened, they did not get to our room until late afternoon. Day three. I needed to do wash. Well after the (what seemed like) two mile walk and only ONE washer and ONE dryer it wasn't easy. You better have quarters on you because there is no change machine in any of the vending areas. However, you will certainly find dirty dishes in there with you. I am talking about six plates and utensils glasses, etc... and I have to stand in there and fold clothes. These were not morning dishes. They were from the night before. This was all the time. Day five. Time to leave. Well, the false fire alarm that woke everyone up at 6:40 am wasn't even annoying to me because that can not be helped. However, seeing a beach rental charge on my bill and having to tell the girl repeatedly that I did not rent anything was. The day it was rented, we didn't check in until late afternoon, she finally took it off. She then commented that she would find out who did this. The room itself was clean. Except for the leaky ceiling and peeling away of the wallpaper. The blankets had holes in them. No fitted sheet for the pull out couch, which by the way is facing the wrong way. You have to turn your head completely to the right to see the T.V. The corridor was dirty, smelled of mildew. Always dirty dishes in the vending area and the laundry area. You were lucky to find an English speaking person. You need a map to find anything. If I were staying in a less expensive hotel, then I would not be complaining. That is not the case. When I am spending $319.00 a night, I expect certain things. They give you nothing. Not even a packet of sugar without purchasing a cup of coffee. We will never stay here again. In my opinion this hotel is way overpriced for what you get. Where is the multi million dollar renovated hotel they did in 2003? Things got that bad in only two years? I think at one time The Princess Royale was the place to stay, not now. One final note. I am use to at check-out to be asked "How was my stay?" or "Was everything okay"? Nothing, just the bill and a coupon for staying in September or something. I threw it out. Still waiting for the Supervisor, Ruby, to call me back in a couple of minutes. That was three hours ago.

Reviews.Title: “Back from OCean CIty”
Reviews.Author: chris516
Reviews.Content: Back from a 5 night stay at the Princess Royale,. This is the one on the ocan, there is another on the bayside. The staff was very friendly, the rooms clean. the hotel itself was clean. Big rooms. Nothing to complain except that it is far from the boardwalk. However, it seems that the hotels closer to the boardwalk are more run down and geared toward singles and not family.

Reviews.Title: “A true resort in old town Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? My wife, Louisa, and I just returned from a 5 day/4 night stay at the Princess Royale and we were delighted. The room, hotel and beach are all Excellent. We arrived June 22, 2005, 2:30pm but couldnt check-in early since our room was not ready. We returned at 4:05pm and we were greeted with a prompt check in. Our vehicle was parked in the garage by courteous valet personnel and also had our bags brought to our room by the bellhop. I usually tip a few dollars (here-and-there) on all vacation as we have learned, service seems to be better. We did tip at the Royale, although not necessary but appreciated when we did. Room: All rooms are Suites. Did you hear me? All Suites... Not a box room like other comparable hotels. We requested a King size bed and non smoking (top floor); both were granted. The room was HUGE, with balcony overlooking swimming pool. It had two TV's, Iron w/ bd, Full kitchen & Livingroom and a very nice shower. I am actually in the process of replacing our showing head at our home after using the Royals. The OxyGenics shower is really relaxing and saves water. The hot water during dinner time doesnt last forever, but is sufficient. Room: A+ Pool: Really nice but crowded with plenty of kids. It is Olympic size with 3 Jacuzzi (1 inside, 2 outside) and 2-Suana's (one didnt work that well). But over all nice atmosphere. The pool area also has pool tables, ping pong table and video games. This is the area when you will defiantly realize it is a Family Resort. Do note: There is no life guard on duty and I personally feel that hotel should double think this as there is alot action happening. Pool: B Restaurant: There are 2-4 restaurants located on the premises but not all open until July 1, so we were not able to experience all. Schooner Restaurant though is very nice. The food is GOOD and the portions are even BETTER. Most workers were International and very respectful. The service was prompt. We ate there for Brunch and had a late drink. It did seem late light, Mgrment could not be found and workers waiting to serve. The bar had cold drinks and great service. There is also a grill on the Beach, but I'll get to that later. Restaurant: A Personnel: Respective and Courteous. From waiter(s), bellhop, valet guys and even house cleaning. One day we ran back to our room a few minutes after the room was cleaned and a housekeeper, asked if there was anything she can do to make it better or something she missed to simply let her know. Impressive! The Valet guys are really kool. I actually have a $1000+ stereo in my car and forgot my cell phone + digital camera a few times and nothing got stolen. Trustworthy. Personnel: A+ Beach: Nice. The past few years we have gone to Outer Banks, Jamaica and Mexico but wanted to give old O.C. a whirl. The beach was a tad crowded as I think we caught the tail end of senior week, but the youngsters were fine. Everyone is simply working on his or her tan. They had beach volleyball activity. There is also Beach chairs and umbrellas for rent per day, but we had our own so we didnt get. There is Live entertainment (one man band) everyday. We didnt catch his name, but does cover songs. He plays for a few hrs in the afternoon and is a delight to hear while basking in the sun! There are two "Huts" set up one-minute off the beach. Food, Drinks and Ice cream stocked. Very nice addition. Beach Atmosphere: A Other things to note: Roof top mini golf available, but the course is ancient. No biggy. Fun to do! Overall our experience was really Great. Sometimes we get away for a day or two at the Castle and the Stand, but we think those days are over. Short or Long get-aways will now be spent at the Princess Royale. I highly recommend this hotel as long as you dont mind kids. Ohhh I forgot, I got the best deal. It was actually a lot cheaper than booking directly with the Hotel. You ask, where can you find this better price? "If I told ya, I may hafta kill ya". Joking. Go hither at the Royale, it will be a Blast! Adam & Louisa

Reviews.Title: “Marrige disater”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I bboked the hotel for the wedding and reception and was told that if I reserved up to twenty rooms my guest could rent them for a reduced rate and with the wedding oackage the honeymmon sweet would be free for one night. No one of my guest were given their discounts and I had to fight with the manager to comp my one night in the honeymoon sweet. I had booked a outside location from the hotel for the wedding, on the day of the wedding I had to fight with the hotel to have them set up chairs that were promised. Next was the reception i had in the hotel for 74 people. they had only one waiter serving the obderves, I had to go to the director to get extra waitstaff to help out. They did not serve the4 correct obderves. The meal was acceptable but not the quality to what they promised. The service sucked royaly. I expected to have a memorable wedding full of good memories. The only memory I will reatin of the hotel is that i will never set foot in the hotel again in my life and I will do everything I can to let people know how bad the hotel is. No one should have to go through what I went through ever.

Reviews.Title: “After reading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I will not be taking my family here. I have called a and tried to get a week but they will not or at least the people i have talked to will not give a discount to the military and after spending a year overseas and 25 years in the military we get some support from what is to be a family place to stay i think i would rather stay at the Days in at least there they know how to treat people.

Reviews.Title: “Missing Pajama bottoms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 7:00 for check in ! the looks of the hotel seemed very nice .My wife and I proceded to check in. We were behind a woman extremely upset about overcharges to her credit card , who was getting very loud ! We checked in . The staff at the desk seemed to be helpfull and we proceded to our room ! We walked in and were happy by the appearance of the room . We stayed in #368- Room W/Balcony and Jacuzzi! However, the floor was wet near jacuzzi & the room had a musty smell.We opened up the door to the balcony and that helped.We were out mostly everyday of our 4 night stay.The housekeepers seemed to do a very good job at giving us towels ,making bed etc. The last night in the hotel we packed and noticed my grey sweats/pajama bottems were missing.We called the font desk and the manager and they said they would try & find them and get back to us but that never happened. Other than this we found our stay enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say our rooms were not very clean, we complained politely and their response time was horrible. My daughter came home from the hotel with head lice. We told them we didnt think the rooms were cleaned from the previous visitors, I think we were right. Will not be staying there ever again. By the way, the management still has not even called me back and I have called twice about the head lice and for them to throw away the pillows to save another little girl from this gross situation. Very poor customer service at least say you are sorry for the mishap, don't ignore that it happened to us and the family we went with. Very unsatified.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversay Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We go to the Princess Royale every November for our wedding anniversary. We have such a relaxing and wonderful time every year we go. The staff is friendly, the food is delicious, the views are breathtaking and the suite is not only fairly priced but extremely comfortable and clean. We get to swim, order in room service, sleep and really just relax. Of course, we also love the nearby shops and outlets, which is where we kick off Christmas shopping for our five children. It is the perfect place to get-away once a year from the kids and give each other our undivided attention without any problems - the staff sees to it that our stay is a pleasurable one every time.

Reviews.Title: “"our home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel83
Reviews.Content: We have been regular guests of the Princess Royale Resort for a number of years and have always been treated to a wonderful vacation experience. We have stayed in both the two bedroom condominiums and also the oceanfront suites, and have enjoyed both the accommodations and amenities. In fact, for our most recent visit, we were upgraded to one of the two bedroom condominiums, and were very impressed with the decor and cleanliness of the rooms, not to mention the amazing oceanfront and bay views from the balcony. Also, the front desk/reception area staff was extremely accommodating and helpful, especially Karolina. She was extremely professional and cordial in handling any questions that we had with regard to our stay at the resort. Also, the students from Poland, who were part of the Housekeeping department, were very efficient and very pleasant. I would highly recommend this wonderful resort to anyone who can appreciate a grand beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the attention”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from ocean city, and we had a wonderful stay!!! No detail was overlooked, from our prompt service at check in to the housekeeper who took care of us through our stay!! The resturant offered prompt service and great food!! Will definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “Warning - do not stay at this property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from one of the worst travel experiences I've had at a stay at the Princess Royale from August 27 – August 29. We checked in and went up to our room only to find that the key card didn’t work. While standing outside the door, I heard noises coming from inside so I decided to check back at the front desk. The women behind the counter called the room and somebody answered. Apparently the room had been given to somebody else. We were then assigned another room. When we get up to the room, we find that it is not the correct type of room. I had reserved a side ocean view and was given a pool view. (Note: If you’re dumb enough to stay at this place after reading this review and you plan on sitting on your balcony with some peace and quiet, don’t get a pool view room.) I again go down to the front desk and after 20 minutes am told that there are no more rooms available for which my reservation was made. (Unbelievably, during this wait, a woman behind me was turned away with a reservation due to the overbooking.) I was told to come back the next morning to speak to the room supervisor (Joy) for a reduction in my rate. At this time, I also pointed out an error that was made on my check-in sheet that stated I was staying 3 nights. In fact, my reservation was for 2 nights and I had a confirmation to prove it. The woman crossed out the error by hand and said everything would be alright. It took over an hour before we were even checked in and settled in our room. The next morning, I find Joy and I’m told that the pool view rooms are the same rate as the side ocean view so there is no rate reduction. Not a big deal, I’m not out trying to scam anybody. I just basically wanted what I reserved. We get moved to a side ocean view room. On the final day, I check out and the counter person (Karolina) tells me that I will have to pay for the 3rd night, even though I didn’t reserve it. This wouldn’t have been so bad were it not for her smug attitude. The employees at this place are just salivating to invoke the no refund for early departure clause that is prominently displayed in various places. I’m then asked to step aside and wait yet again for another manager who couldn’t be located. I refuse to step aside and the error is eventually corrected by another employee who was a little nicer. Long story short, the service is horrible at this place. They will look to rip you off if possible. Also, the other reviews about the elevators (slow), pool (not close to olympic size) and smells in the room (moldy) are correct. Add to this the fire alarm at 8:30 am on Saturday morning and the noisy air conditioning units, and you can see why you should look to stay somewhere else. Believe it or not, they handed me a coupon for a future stay when I left. Needless to say, I told them I wouldn’t be needing it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condominiums”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reserved a condominium for a 1 week stay and would return next year! Staff (including bell hops and valet) friendly and helpful. Accomodations were clean and maid service was prompt and thorough. No complaints.

HotelInfo.Name: Princess Royale Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Oceanfront at 91st St., Ocean City, MD 21842
